description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Aug. 1 Prime Minister John Vorster announced the re tirement of five Government ministers today, including some who have been involved in re cent public controversy and criticism.

title: Chargers Acquire Thomas, Rossovich
description: IRVINE, Calif., Aug. 1 (AP) The San Diego Chargers have acquired two of pro football's most talented and troublesome playersDuane Thomas, a run ning back, and Tim Rossovich, a linebacker.

title: Sylvester P. Di Stasio, 50, Consulting Engineer Here
description: NEPTUNE, N.J., Aug. 1 Sylvester P. Di Stasio, a senior member of Di Stasio & Van Buren, consulting engineers in New York, died today at the Jersey Shore Medical Center. He was 50 years old and lived at 40 First Avenue in Avon.

title: Bounty for Helping to Catch DrugPushers Is Established on Staten Island
description: An antidrug program prom ising anonymity and a cash re ward to anyone with informa tion leading to the conviction of a pusher was opened on Staten Island yesterday by the borough's Chamber of Com merce.

title: U.N. Aide Gets New Post
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 (AP) President Nixon has elevated. Robert W. Kitchen Jr. to deputy United States representative on the United Nations Economic and Social Council, the White House said today.

title: Improper Cab Inspections Called Peril
description: Charging that improperly inspected, malfunctioning taxi cabs pose a serious threat to the safety of all New Yorkers,, the city's Taxi and Limousine Commission disclosed yester day that 68 persons were killed last year in accidents involv ing taxis.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1The Pentagon said today that that a James W. Lieblang of Tren ton had served as a captain the Third Infantry Division in Wurzburg, West Germany, until last March. Because of a continuing commitment to the reserves, Captain Lieblang re mained in Europe where he worked in the Army Reserve Control Group, which keeps track of manpower availability among American reservists in Europe.

title: Peterson in Warsaw
description: WARSAW, Aug. 1 (UPI)  Mr. Peterson arrived today to begin two days of talks on pospects for creation of a joint PolishAmerican trade commis sion.

title: Closes at $70 Record
description: LONDON, Aug. 1 (UPI)A new surge of gold buying or ders from international specu lators pushed its price today to the highest levels ever on some. European free markets.

title: Chinese Killed, Hanoi Says
description: HONG KONG, Wednesday, Aug. 2 (Reuters)A large num ber of North Vietnamese and Chinese were killed or wound ed during a United States air raid on a Haiphong residential area on Monday, the North Vietnam press agency said to day.

title: Suspects Practiced Mystical Religion At House That They Shared in Detroit
description: DETROIT, Aug. 1The al leged hijackers who forced a Delta Air Lines jet to fly to Algeria yesterday apparently practiced their own religion in a small frame house on De troit's East Side while they lived here.

title: EGYPT, LIBYA SEEN NEARING ACCORD
description: CAIRO, Aug. 1  President Anwar elSadat of Egypt and Col. Muammar elQaddafi, the Libyan leader, appeared to be reaching agreement today on a declaration of unity between their two countries.

title: Advertising:
description: The longawaited word on which of Schieffelin & Co.'s two agencies is getting the Teacher's Highland Cream Scotch Whisky business came down yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Much has been written in recent weeks about the Democratic party abandoning its historical constituency the voters whose primary political objective has been more jobs, higher wages, better working conditions, etc., and who, together, have generally con stituted a majority of the American voters.

title: 3 CHILDREN SLAIN L.I. MOTHER ACCUSED
description: WANTAGH, L. I., Aug. 1 A 31yearold housewife, Mrs. Kara McDonnell, who re portedly had a history of men tal illness, was accused today of asphyxiating her three small children, apparently with plastic bag, according to the Nassau County police.

title: PLATINUM RISES; WHEAT ADVANCES
description: Platinum futures showed some strength yesterday in moderate trading of 515 con tracts on the New York Mer cantile Exchange. The January delivery, for example, closed at $148.20 an ounce, up from $144.40 the previous day, re acting to the statement by En gelhard Industries supporting the advanced readiness of its device for controlling auto emissions,

title: Mrs. Isobel Walker Soule, 74, Author and Labor Leader, Dies
description: STONINGTON, Conn., Aug. 1 Mrs. Isobel Walker Soule, an author, editor and labor leader, died yesterday at her home, 37 Water Street. She was 74 years old.

title: 2 U.S. Planes Downed
description: SAIGON, Wednesday, Aug. 2, (Reuters)Two more American fighterbombers have been shot down over North Vietnam with all four crewmen listed as miss ing, the United States Command said today.

title: Early Clues Reported
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Aug. (UPI)Children who will be come problem drinkers in later life can be identified by their personality traits in junior high school, a Univeersity of Califor nia researcher said today.

title: Boy Prom Mars Wins On Mets' Banner Night
description: A 3yearold boy's patience during an 18inning game was rewarded at Shea Stadium last night when he won the grand prize in the Mets' an nual banner parade.

title: Truly European Deal
description: LONDON; Aug. 1 (Reuters) A $520million plan to merge the European tobacco interests of South Africa's Anton Rupert with Britain's Guards and Roth mans cigarette chain was an nounced today by the London Stock Exchange.

title: State Aide Chides Paterson Officials In Bakery Case
description: PATERSON, N. J., Aug. 1 (AP)  William J. Dougherty, state deputy health commis sioner, has questioned the judgment of local officials who paved the way for the granting of to new state operating license to a bakery here that has been cited over the last two years for repeated health violations.

title: DR. ANTHONY SALYS
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 1Dr. Anthony Salys, professor of Slavic and Baltic languages at the University of Pennsylvania, died here yesterday. He was 70 years old and lived in Spring field, Pa.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: THE PRESIDENT

title: Music: Double Roles
description: Audiences derive an inno cent pleasure from watching pianists double as conductors in 18thcentury concertos, and it is true that many of the earlier works chiefly re quire that someone establish a good tempo and then get out of the way. Historical arguments may certainly be marshaled in the concertos of Bach and Mozart, both of whom directed from the key board.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: Open Road Industries, Inc., a Redondo Beach, Calif., com pany that manufactures motor homes and truck campers, yes terday offered 517,189 shares of common stock at $31.75 a share through an underwriting group managed by Wertheim & Co. Of the total, 300,000 shares were sold for the company it self and 217,189 for seven stockholders.

title: Credit Markets
description: Underwriters continued yes terday to nudge interest rates down on new corporate and taxexempt issues but the re sponse from investors was mixed.

title: 1 Dead, 8 Hurt in Berlin Blast
description: BERLIN, Aug. 1 (UPI)An explosion Tuesday in a wax factory at Amsdorf, near Halle, killed one person and injured a number of other workers, eight seriously, the East Ger man press service said.

title: Tupamaro Guerrilla Slain
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 1 (Reuters) One Tupa maro urban guerilla was killed and another was captured dur ing an unsuccessful attempt to kidnap for the third time the head of the state power and telephone company, it was an nounced today. The kidnapping attempt was foiled by body guards of the official, Ulysses Periera Reverbel, who at one time was held captive by Tupa maros for more than a year.

title: Conners, Miss Goolagong Gain
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 1 (AP) Jimmy Dan Conners and Aus tralia's Evonne Goolaagong, heavy favorites in their divi sions, swept past firstround opponents tonight in the $42, 500 Western tennis tournament at the Queen City Racquet Club.

title: 3 Soviet Cancer Drugs To Undergo Tests in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1  Federal health officials disclosed today that three experimentall, cancer drugs developed in the Soviet Union would be given trials of effectiveness on Ameri can patients starting early next year.

title: The Newark Boys Chorus Fun Times and a Lot of Work
description: Mankind Is yearning for a human equation.

title: Mets Defeat Phils, 3 to 2, in 18th
description: The New York Mets, who thought July was long, turned into August last night by play ing 4 hours before defeating the Philadelphia Phillies, 32, in 18 innings.

title: JERSEY RACE WON BY I FOUND GOLD
description: OCEANPORT, N.J., Aug. 1 (AP)  Carsar P. Kimmel's I Found Gold scored a 2length victory today over Judith, by winning the feature event at Monmouth Park.

title: Playwrights Get a Taste Of Criticism
description: WATERFORD, Conn.  The O'Neill experience, four weeks of frenetic sum mer madness that pits young playwrights against the rig orous criticism of actors, critics, other playwrights and, perhaps most cruelly, a live audience, has descended on Waterford again.

title: Exile's Return
description: There's more than meets the winking eye in the agree ment by the Columbia Broadcasting System to put on a series of dramatic specials produced by Joseph Papp's New York Shakespeare Festival Public Theater.

title: Igesz Will Stage Carmen For Met's Opener Sept. 19
description: Bodo Igesz yesterday was named stage director of the new production of Carmen that will open the Metropolitan Op era's 88th season Sept. 19. Mr. Igesz, who has been on the Metropolitan's directing staff since 1963, worked with Goeran Gentele on the production from the time the late general mana ger decided to stage the Bizet opera as the first event of his inaugural season.

title: Postage and Profits
description: WASHINGTONWe read a great deal today about unnamed magazines and newspapers facing what is asserted to be a catastrophic situation allegedly caused by recently authorized postal rate increases. Much of the outcry smacks of a carefully contrived cam paign by corporate publishers to inject their own business interests into their editorial columns  identical rhetoric keeps cropping up in independent publications across the country.

title: Roundup: Colbert Bats In 13 Runs in Two Games
description: Nate Colbert, in one of the greatest hitting performances in baseball history, drove in a record 13 runs with five home runs, one of which was a grand slam, as the San Diego Padres battered the Braves last night, 90 and 11 7, in a twilightnight double header in Atlanta.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1It almost seems that this Presidential election of 1972 is fated to be decided by human accident, blunder and caprice by things unplanned, unforeseen and untold that leave the actors and spec tators alike stunned with disbelief.

title: Oil Company Fined $3,050 In Jersey as Air Polluter
description: WOODBRIDGE, N. J., Aug. (UPI)The Amerada Hess Cor poration, which operates a big refinery in this New Jersey port, was fined $3,050 yester day after pleading guilty to seven charges of violating the local Air Pollution Code. The town dropped six other charges against the company.

title: Stamford Tenants Plan a Rent Strike For Better Housing
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Aug. 1 Representatives of 100 tenants in seven apartment buildings here announced today that the tenants would withhold all or part of their rent payments because, they charge, their land lords failed to provide them with habitable housing.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Are Chinese Preparing Big Leap in Chemicals?
description: A few weeks ago a leading American polymer chemist tour ing a laboratory in China ex claimed: My God, why do you work on graphite fibers?

title: No Early Step Indicated
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1Sec retary of the Treasury George P. Shultz said today that a pro posal that the Treasury sell some of its monetary gold to domestic industrial users would be fully considered, but he did not indicate any early ac tion.

title: Official Says He Warned Prison Before Shootings
description: BOSTON, Aug. 1 (AP)Pris on officials had been warned of a probable escape attempt by a convicted murderer who, killed two prison employes and shot two other persons before taking his own life, a district attorney says.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: DETROIT, Aug. 1 (UPI)The Detroit Pistons traded Jimmy Walker to the Houston Rockets today for Stu Lantz in a straight oneforone deal. The Piston general man ager, Ed Coil, said the 6foot 3inch Lantz, 26 years old, a former star at Nebraska, was a potential superstar.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: IF YOU'RE NOT DRINKING WILLIAM LAWSON'S SCOTCH DRINK DEWAR'S William Lawson's 68.8 Proof Blended Scotch Whiskies. Imported by Palmer & Lord. Ltd., Syosset, N. Y.Advt.

title: Books of The Times
description: The only people who didn't have a good time at Fiddler on the Roof knew too much about shtetl life, pogroms and the hardships of emigration. Historian types. There's material in Terry Coleman's Going to America for an ethnic musical to please them.

title: Letters to the Editor;Root for a Fischer Win
description: To the Editor:

title: PURGED ARMY MEN ATFETE IN PEKING
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 1A number of purged Chinese mili tary leaders, some of whom had dropped out of sight for five years, reappeared last night at the reception held in Peking to mark the 45th anniversary of the Chinese Communist armed forces.

title: ROSEWALL UPSET IN U.S. PRO TENNIS
description: CHESTNUT HILL, Mass., Aug. 1 (UPI)Marty Riessen toppled the defending champion Ken Rosewall, and Bob Lutz elimin ated topseeded John New combe in threeset upsets to night in the opening round of the $50,000 United States pro tennis championships.

title: U.S. Reports Raid in Haiphong On Yard for Small Supply Boats
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Aug. 2  United States Navy pilots have bombed, a shipyard in Haiphong that builds and repairs the kind of shallowdraft boats used to shuttle supplies ashore from freighters standing off the coast of North Vietnam, an American spokesman said yes terday.

title: Rollie Hemsley Is Dead at 65; Catcher Played for Seven Clubs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1  Rollie Hemsley, a catcher who spent 18 years in the major leagues with seven clubs, died of a heart attack yesterday. He was 65 years old.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1  The panoply of prestige that distinguishes a national politi cal candidate slipped swiftly away from Senator Thomas F. Eagleton today less than three weeks after it had been thrust upon him.

title: Failure of a Mission
description: Secretary of Commerce Peterson issued a contradictory set of signals when he arrived in Moscow last week begin his economic negotiations with Soviet officials. In his formal opening remarks at the airport he quoted old Russian proverb, new life, new laws, seemingly im plying that a new era in SovietAmerican economic relations had begun. But in a press conference immedi ately afterward, he reverted to extreme caution and sought to discourage any hopes of quick results from his talks.

title: U.S. Offers Business Loans To VietnamEra Veterans
description: WASHINGTON, Aug, 1 (AP)  The Government announced today that it was offering low interest business loans of up to $50,000 and counseling to low income Vietnamera veterans.

title: 500,000 Steelworkers Get Rise in Pay and Benefits
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 1About 500,000 members of the United Steelworkers of America, em ployed in the basic steel in dustry, received today a new round of wage increases and fringe benefits in the second year of a threeyear contract.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: HORACE R. MAHER
description: Horace R. Maher, who for many years operated with his wife the Meadowmar Riding School at Peekskill, N. Y., died yesterday at Doctors Hospital. He was 78 years old and lived at 404 East 66th Street.

title: Filipino Boat Disaster Kills 11
description: MANILA, Aug. 1 (UPI)A 70ton boat carrying about 100 passengers caught fire and sank today off Basilan Strait in the southern Philippines, the Philippine News Service said. At least 11 persons were re ported killed and several others, mostly women and chil dren, were injured and mis sing.

title: David H. Beetle, 64, Dies; Upstate Reporter, Editor
description: David H. Beetle, retired reporter for the Gannett News Service and a former editor of Albany's Knickerbocker News, died Sun day at the age of 64.

title: House Rules Committee Forces Antibusing Amendment Out of judiciary Panel for a Vote
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 The House Rules Committee bypassed the Judiciary Com mittee today and sent to the floor for a vote a proposed constitutional amendment pro hibiting busing to desegregate the schools. The vote was 9 to 6.

title: GOVERNMENT PAY UP 88% IN DECADE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1  The growing membership and militancy of government em ploye unions contributed to an 88 per cent rise in govern ment payrolls during the sixties, according to a private research study.

title: Moose Told to Serve Blacks Or Bar Lodge to Nonmembers
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 1 (AP)  Pennsylvania's Supreme Court says a Moose Lodge must serve blacks if it allows nonmembers in.

title: MUSKIE FAVORED IN PARTY'S SEARCH FOR RIMING MATE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1The name of Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine figured prom inently in discussions here to day as Senator George Mc Govern, the Democratic Presi dential nominee, began the search for a substitute running mate.

title: HOUSE HOLDS UP WAGE BASE RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1  Legislation to increase the Fed eral minimum wage ran into an unprecedented snag in the House of Representatives to day.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1The Federal Reserve Board again pronounced its opposition today to a proposal Congress, strongly backed by the savings and loan indus try, that would provide 100 per cent insurance for deposits of Federal, state and local governments in all insured financial institutions.

title: Hackensack Plan For a Sports Area Cited on Pollution
description: HACKENSACK, N. J., Aug. 1 (AP)  Air pollution at the proposed sports complex in the Hackensack Meadowlands would constitute a serious health hazard to its patrons, a former New York City Ai Resources Commissioner testi field yesterday.

title: Red Smith
description: CHILMARK, Martha's Vineyard, Mass., Aug. 1Every body in the car had binoculars and as the Banker drove past the airport, the Ballet Master said: Let's go by way of Katama. Maybe we'll see shorteared owls flying. He turned to the others. This, he said, is where we had one of the biggest concentrations of golden plover on the Atlantic coast. As a rule, they migrate nonstop from Nova Scotia to Bermuda and only come down in a storm. But one year we counted 250 and the next year 125.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 1 (UPI)The Cleveland Indians announced today a tentative home schedule for next season that eliminates most night games. Instead of playing night on Monday through Thursday, the team will play at 12:30 P.M., according to the team president, Nick Mileti.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 (Reuters)Spending on new construction rose by $900 million in June to a $123.3 billion seasonally adjusted annual rate following an up ward revised $1.8billion gain in May to $122.4billion, according to preliminary Commerce Department esti mates today.

title: Graduates Find Salaries Up a Bit From Levels of 1971
description: Starting salaries for June college graduates improved only slightly over last year's levels, according to a newly released survey of colleges and universities.

title: ELECTIONS AGENCY AND FRI. EXAMINE G.O.P. UNIT FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1  Two Federal agencies are in specting the financial records of the major Republican cam paign organization, the Com mittee for the ReElection of the President.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Sports News in Brief
description: BOSTON, Aug. 1 (AP)The Boston Bruins defense man, Carol Vadnais, signed a multiyear contract with the National Hockey League's Stanley Cup champions, General Manager Milt Schmidt announced today. Vadnais joined the Bruins last February in a swap with the California Seals for Rick Smith, Bob Stewart and Reg Leach.

title: Korean Red Cross Parley Expected to Be Delayed
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 1  The fulldress Red Cross talks to arrange contacts and visits by member of separated families in North Korea and South Korea appear likely to be delayed.

title: About Motor Sports
description: Dan Gurney puts it simply: I'm trying to bring the orld together. Gurney, who as achieved world renown, irst as a race driver and now ??s a car builder and owner, s one of the rare men in acing who are thinking hard bout the future. He is ap raising the decision racing faces in the next few years sim plified structure, common formu las, international competition, eco nomics, ecology.

title: Psychiatrists Call Bremer Sane At Time of Shooting of Wallace
description: UPPER MARLBORO, Md., Aug. 1Arthur H. Bremer, ac cused of shooting George C. Wallace, was legally sane on May 15 when the Alabama Gov ernor was wounded at a polit ical rally in Laurel, Md., three psychiatrists testified today.

title: Bridge: Becker's Team Is Leader In Finals of Spingold Cup
description: DENVER, Aug. 1  B. Jay Becker's fourman New York team, playing faultless bridge, took a commanding lead at the halfway mark in the fi nals of the Spingold Cup knockout team championship tonight in the Summer Na tionals of the American Con tract Bridge League.

title: MISS ROST SCORES PONY CLASS SWEEP
description: MIDDLETOWN, N. Y., Aug. 1Robin Ann Rost of Branch ville, N. J., dominated the large pony division of the Orange County Horse Show to night by riding both the cham pion and reserve champion.

title: Tunis Opens an Airport Built With American Aid
description: TUNIS, Aug. 1  President Habib Bourguiba officially opened the new TunisCarth age Airport today and thanked the United States for contri buting to the realization of this project, helping us to overcome our underdevelop ment.

title: ERNST FISCHER, MARXIST WRITER
description: VIENNA, Aug. 1 (Reuters) Ernst Fischer, an Austrian in tellectual, critic and poet who was a leader of the Communist party in his country after World War II, died today of a heart attack while vacationing in the Styrian village of Deutsch Feistritz. He was 73 years old.

title: Four Prisoners Die in Fire
description: STUART, Fla., Aug. 1 (AP) Four youthful inmates were killed when fire swept through a maximum security cellblock at Martin County Jail late last night, trapping the victims inside their locked cells, the au thorities reported today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Economic Analysia
description: The job of reforming the world monetary system is about to begin. The board of governors of the International Monetary Fund has formally approved a new Group of 20 to negotiate a new monetary system for the 120nation body that includes the whole of the nonCommunist world. The most difficult and im portant issue the top financial brains of G20 will face, when they meet for first time in Washington in late September during the annual World Bank and monetary fund meetings, will be how to devise an order ly procedure for preventing na tions from getting into deep deficits or heavy surpluses in their balances of payments.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Aug. 1 (AP)Freehold Raceway an nounced today cancellation of tomorrow's races. The tracks 100day meeting, scheduled to open yesterday, has been delayed pending settlement of a contract between the track owners and the Standardbred Breeders and Own ers Association of New Jersey.

title: A.E.C. Nominee Approved
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 (AP) President Nixon's nomination of Dr. Dixie Lee Ray to be a member of the Atomic Energy Commission was approved to day by the Senate members of the Joint Committee on Atomic Energy.

title: India Parliament Backs Pact
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 1After a twoday debate, Parliament expressed overwhelming sup port today for the peace agree ment signed by Prime Minister Indira Gandhi of India and President Zulfikar Ali Bhutto of Pakistan. The only significant opposition came from the Jan Sangh, a rightwing Hindu na tionalist party whose 17 mem bers called the agreement a sellout.

title: Handling of Murder Case Arouses Storm in France
description: BRUAYENARTOIS, France, July 25A sordid but scarcely unusual murder in a provincial town in northern France has become a legal cause clbre throughout the country. It has provoked a national contro versy, stripping off layers of civility to reveal class hostil ities and has opened to vehe ment public argument judicial customs accepted for almost two centuries.

title: AMERICAN CHARGED IN ITALY AS A SPY
description: ROME, Aug. 1The Police have charged a United States citizen with possession of se cret information on NATO in stallations in northeastern Italy, diplomatic authorities said to day.

title: Price Sticker Bill Signed
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 (AP) President Nixon signed a bill today that requires new passen ger cars sold in United States possessions to carry the same price stickers required for cars sold domestically.

title: Ballet Theater Is a Magnet for Stars
description: When Paolo Bortoluzzi, the Italian star of Maurice B jart's Ballet of the 20th Cen tury here last year, left the Belgian company to join American Ballet Theater this season, he said he did so in order to show off a range he could not in a company dom mated by one choreographer.

title: ALGERIANS SEIZE 1MILLION RANSOM
description: Algerian officials yesterday confiscated the $1million ran som extorted by three Ameri can men who hijacked a Delta Air Lines DC8 jet over Florida Monday and forced it to fly to Algeria.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: MILWAUKEE, Aug, 1 (AP) About 80 per cent of the mem ber unions of the American Federation of Labor and Con gress of Industrial Organiza tions will adopt the same neu tral position in the 1972 Presidential race as the na tional organization, George Meany, president of the labor federation, said today.

title: China's Trade Minister Begins Trip to Canada
description: PEKING, Aug. 1 China's Foreign Trade Minister, Pai Hsiangkuo, left Peking today for a threeweek trip to Peru, Chile and Canada.

title: KENNEDY DENOUNCES JAILING IN I.R.A. CASE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 (AP) Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, ac cused the Justice Department today of abusing the grand jury process in, an investiga tion into the smuggling of guns to the Irish Republican Army in Northern Ireland.

title: Lynch Accepts British Step
description: DUBLIN, Aug. 1 Premier John Lynch said today that the Irish Government was ready to accept the reasons for the British Army's invasion of Northern Ireland's no go areas, providing it saved lives.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISThe interesting thing about Chairman Mao Tsetung's recent con versation with French Foreign Minister Maurice Schumann was not the Chi nese leader's open disclosure that Lin Piao, once his designated successor, had mounted a conspiracy against him, had unsuccessfully attempted to flee to Moscow and was therefore consid ered a traitor.

title: Housing in Fresh Meadows Is Sold by New York Life
description: The New York Life Insurance Company has sold the sprawling, 140building Fresh Meadows apartment complex in Queens to Harry B. Helmsley, one of the nation's largest real estate operators, for a price reported to be more than $50 million.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Police and Gunmen Battle in Harlem Two gunmen exchanged fire with two policemen in Harlem yesterday, and the only casualty was a passerby who received a slight wound when a bullet ricocheted.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: KANSAS CITY, Kan., Aug. 1 (UPI)Morris Kay, who used a barrage of billboards and tele vision spots to present himself as Kansas' new leader, won the Republican nomination for Governor today over three op ponents, including former Gov. John Anderson Jr.

title: 4 Seeking to Leave Soviet Strike at Canadian Embassy
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 1 (Reuters) Four people, including two Canadianborn Ukrainians, set tied down tonight for their second night of a hunger strike in the Canadian Embassy, in formed sources said.

title: Dexter Hanover Is Out Of Rich Yonkers Pace
Brel to Be Alive and Well For 6 Weeks on Broadway
description: Jacques Brel is Alive and Well and Living in Paris, which closed last month at the Village Gate after its 1,847th performance, will be hoard from again. It will reopen on Broad way next month for a sixweek run.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 (AP)Senator Jacob K. Javits, Republican of New York, sug gested today that one pos sible means of upgrading the VicePresidency might be to elect the President and Vice President separately.

title: VAL H. MARTIN
description: Val H. Martin, assistant vice president for mortgage invest ments of the East River Savings Bank, died Saturday in New Rochelle (N. Y.) Hospital. He was 62 years old and lived at 185 Clove Road in New Ro chelle.

title: RollCall Vote in Senate On McGovern's Proposal
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 (ANFollowing is the 59 to33 rollcall vote by which the Senate rejected today a militaryweaponsbill amend ment by Senator George Mc Govern to cut future Penta gon spending:

title: Hartford Experiment Lags
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 1 (UPI) A report on a Bust the push er campaign here shows the effort itself might have been a bust.

title: AMEX PRICES RISE AS VOLUME GROWS
description: Yesterday's trading session on the American Stock Ex change saw the Index move up to 26,77, a rise of 0.08, after five sessions of declining prices.

title: Democrats Begin Anew
description: The way is now open for the American people to con centrate on what kind of leadership, policies and priori ties they want for the next four years. With the wise decision of Senator Eagleton to withdraw from the Democratic national ticket, the tragic sideshow that kept his party from beginning its campaign to regain the White House is over.

title: Ailing Knees Threaten Wottle's Hopes
description: OSLO, Norway, Aug. 1The honeymoon is still on for Dave Wottle, but his hopes for an Olympic gold medal may be over.

title: Grumman Lays Off 300 After Failing to Win Contract for the Space Shuttle
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., Aug. 1 The Grumman Corporation dis closed today a layoff of 300 employes, a move that the com pany said was a direct result of its failure to win the con tract for the Government's space shuttle.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 2 Disaster Areas Declared
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 (Reu ters)President Nixon declared Minnesota and New Mexico major disaster areas today, making the two states eligible for special Government relief funds in the wake of recent severe storms and torrential rains.

title: Guyana Line Gets Permit
description: WASHINGTON, Aug, 1 (AP) With the approval of Presi dent Nixon, the Civil Aeronau tics Board granted a fiveyear permit to Guyana Airways to day to carry cargo and mail between Guyana and Miami.

title: Miss Natalie Janvrin Is Married
description: OLD LYME, Conn., Aug. 1 Miss Natalie Janvrin, daughter of Dr. Edmund R. P. Janvrin of New York and the late Mrs. Elizabeth Train Janvrin, was married this afternoon to Col. Grafton Wiggins, U.S.A.F., retired. The Rev. W. Dixon Hoag per formed the ceremony in the Old Lyme Congregational Church.

title: Bulgaria Bus Plunge Kills 40
description: VIENNA. Aug. 1 (AP)A bus returning from the Black Sea coast with Bulgarians on va cation plunged into a river at Burgas, Bulgaria, killing 40 per sons and injuring 9, it was re ported today. The accident oc curred last Friday.

title: Emerson Announces Record Sales and Net
Advertising:
description: The most unflappable and indestructible person in Amer ican advertising has got to be that fellow who has been sitting calmly through those Colt 45 Malt Liquor commer cials since 1964.

title: Jersey Law Aide Asks Inquiry Into Office
description: TRENTON, Aug. 1Attorney General George F. Kugler Jr. today directed the State Com mission of Investigation to in vestigate his own office.

title: PUBLIC VOICE URGED ON NUCLEAR REACTOR
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1A coalition of seven organizations proposed today the expansion, of the boards of directors of the Breeder Reactor Corpora tion and the Project Manage ment Corporation, which wilt oversee the development of a fastbreeder nuclear power re actor, and the seating on the boards of six public represent atives.

title: Student Pilot Flew Plane In Crash Fatal to Reventlow
description: ASPEN, Colo., Aug. 1 (UPI) A student pilot was at thecontrols of a plane that crashed in the Colorado Rockies last week, killing Lance Reventlow, the multimillionaire, and three other persons, a Federal offi cial said yesterday.

title: Security Plan Stands For G.O.P. Convention
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Aug. 1 (UPI)Police Chief Rocky Pomerance said yesterday that he had the same secur ity plan for the Republican National Convention as he had for the Democratic con vention last month.

title: Dealer Reports Train Robbers Stole $50,000 Gems From Him at Newark
description: A New York diamond dealer, has reported that two robbers accosted him on a train pulling into Newark and stole 40 dia monds worth $150,000 from a pouch hidden under his clothing.

title: U.N. Council Votes to Pursue Effort on SouthWest Africa
description: UNITED NATIONS. N. Y.,1 Aug. 1  The Security Coun cil approved a resolution today asking Secretary General Waldheim to pursue his efforts aimed at obtaining indepen dence for SouthWest Africa.

title: Britain Plans Remedies for Health Service Failings
description: LONDON, Aug. 1The Gov ernment today proposed sweep ing administrative reforms in Britain's system of socialized medicine to meet growing criti cism of bureaucracy and short comings in the service.

title: New Moyers TV Series Begins in Fall
description: Bill D. Moyers will return to public television this fall with a new Tuesday night half hour series tentatively titled One Nation, it was an nounced yesterday. The pro gram will be seen locally on WNET/Channel 13.

title: Paper Appeals Ad Ruling
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 1 (AP)  The Pittsburgh Press has appealed to the United States Supreme Court a ruling halting the use of separate male and female want ads in its classi fied act section.

title: Personalities: A Bruin Defects
description: Bubbling over with good cheer, Derek Sanderson boasted from his Boston home yesterday: I'm the highest paid player in the world. He just might be. The Philadelphia Blazers of the World Hockey Association have called a news confer ence for tomorrow to an nounce that Sanderson, the Boston Bruins' nervy little center, will be jumping from the National Hockey League. It was like the Godfather, said Sanderson. They made me an offer I couldn't re fuse. The offer is for $2.65 million. It is a complicated deal, and not strictly for five years, as has been reported. But even if Sanderson elects not to continue after five years, he will pocket the money  which is more than $500,000 a year. All things considered, said Sanderson, I'd rather be in Philadel phia. Sanderson is the fourth Bruin to jump to the new league.

title: Namath Gets Record Pact Of $500,000 for Two Years
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Aug. 1  The president smiled broadly amid a cluster of microphones as he faced the televison cameras today and said:

title: Catholics Denounce British Move Into I.R.A. Areas
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 1 Roman Catholic poli ticians today denounced Brit ain's decision to smash the bar ricades in Catholic neighbor hoods and impose a vast pres ence in the areas.

title: Senate Rebuffs McGovern Over Defense Curb, 5933
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1Sen ator George McGovern, beset by Democratic defections, was overwhelmingly defeated on the Senate floor today in an at tempt to put a ceiling on the defense budget.

title: Soul at the Center Resounds With M'Boom and Betty Carter
description: After a weekend of wellat tended performances, Soul at the Center reverted to a small attendance last night at Alice Tully Hall and both the per formers and those who came to hear them might have been happier if it had been even smaller. A young and obvious ly bored segment of the au dience spent much of the eve ning snickering, shrieking and making loud obstreperous comments during the perform ances of both M'Boom, a six man percussion group, and Betty Carter, a singer.

title: WOMEN'S GROUP SETS REGISTRATION DRIVE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 (UPI) The League of Women Voters Education Fund, estimating that more than 50 million eligible voters may not cast ballots in the Presidential election this year, announced today a spe cial campaign to help get out the vote.

title: Chess Game Drawn
description: The ninth game of the world championship chess match ended in a draw after 29 moves yesterday. The score is now Bobby Fischer 5, Boris Spassky 3. De tails on Page 35.

title: Brazil's Policies Shaped at War College
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, July 31  A small, slightly antique building on a discreet beach directly below Sugar Loaf mountain here houses the na tional war college. That body, for a decade, has done prac tically all the policy thinking for Brazil, the largest nation in Latin America.

title: Environment Group Agrees To Moderate Solicitation
description: Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz announced yesterday that an Illinois nonprofit organ izationCitizens for a Better Environment, Inc.had agreed to refrain from soliciting funds in a manner that harassed or intimidated the public.

title: SADAT SAID TO ASK CONDITIONAL TALKS
description: PARIS, Aug. 1President Anwar elSadat of Egypt told a group of French members of Parliament last week that he would meet with Israelis in the presence of representatives of the United States, Britain, France and the Soviet Union, but only on condition that the Big Four participated as more than mere observers.

title: Behind Eagleton's Withdrawal: A T ale of Confusion and Division
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1  Last Tuesday morning, Senator George McGovern and Senator Thomas F. Eagleton sat with their wives and four close ad visers in a rustic cabin in the Black Hills and apparently con vinced themselves that the dis closures that Mr. Eagleton was about to make at a news con ference would not make very big waves.

title: Riding, Walking and Pedaling, Dance Troupe Roves a Campus
description: NEW LONDON, Conn Cur rently, Rudy Perez collects scraps of movement and like brilliant collagist gives a fresh, meaningful order to hitherto unrelated bits of motion. On a recent afternoon the choreog rapher presented a fourpart work called Salute to the 25th at Connecticut College's silver anniversary, using stu dents, cars and even a march ing band.

title: Harlemites Celebrate Birthday of Marcus Garvey
description: Harlem residents celebrated the birthday of Marcus Garvey, the black nationalist leader, yesterday with a special pro gram of songs and speeches and the coronation of Miss Af rica, 1972.

title: Bus Plunge Kills 24 in Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 1 (UP1)A bus carrying about 40 people to a resort swerved to avoid an oncoming vehicle and fell into 30 feet of water at the base of a dam near Seoul today the police said. They said 24 people were killed in the acci dent at Chunchon, 45 miles northeast of Seoul. Rescuers were expected to find more bodies in the water.

title: BEATEN THIEVES PUT ON EXHIBIT IN BANGUI
description: BANGUI, Central African Re public, Aug. 1 (Agence France Presse)  The 42 thieves who survived a savage beating in prison yesterday sprawled be side the corpses of three others in central Bangui under a blaz ing sun for five hours today as thousands of people filed past.

title: BIG ISSUES BLOCK U.S.SOVIET TRADE
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 1Secretary of Commerce Peter G. Peterson said today it would take top level decisions to break the deadlock on major issues block, ing a SovietAmerican trade, agreement and implied that So viet help in easing tension in such areas as Vietnam would influence Washington.

title: Westchester Towns Win a Moratorium On U.D.C. Housing
description: PEEKSKILL, N.Y., Aug. 1 The State Urban Development Corporation has agreed to defer any further action in five West chester County towns where its plan to override local zoning and build lowincome and mod erateincome apartments has aroused intense local opposition.

title: Mali Imprisons ExPremier For Life in Attempted Coup
description: BAMAKO, Mali, Aug 1. (Agence FrancePress)  Mali's state security court has sen tenced the former Premier, Yoro Diakit, to life imprisonment at hard labor for attempting a coup in March, 1971, the Mali radio reported today. He had been an army captain.

title: BUILDER GROUPS DEFEND TRAINING
description: The socalled New York Plan for training minority members in the building trades was stoutly defended as successful yesterday by prominent labor and management officials con nected with the citystatein dustry venture.

title: PENNZOIL TO BUILD $280MILLION PLANT
description: PASCAGOULA, Miss., Aug 1 (AP)  Pennzoil United, Inc., announced plans today for a $280million refinery here to make synthetic natural gas and fuel oil from foreign crude.

title: A.T.E T. Contends Government Exaggerates Job Discrimination Charges
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1The American Telephone and Tele graph Company said today that the charges of discrimination in employment that were made against it by a Government agency constituted hyperbole of monstrous proportions.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 Senator Thomas F. Eagleton is the third man in American his tory to decline the VicePresi dential nomination after it had been voted by a national con vention. In both previous cases, the revamped ticket went on to win the election.

title: NEWSWEEK NAMES KEY EXECUTIVE, 35
description: One month after he resumed editorial control of Newsweek, Osborn Elliott has begun to implement a plan to bring younger members of the staff into executive positions.

title: Top Four Giant Rookies Are Impressing Coaches
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, N. J., Aug. 1Having failed to make a trade before the interconfer ence trading deadline passed midnight Monday, New York Giants settled down today to examine some of their own new assets.

title: Brazil GasPlant Expansion
description: The Union Carbide Corpora tion said yesterday that one of its affiliates in Brazil planned a $10.5million expansion of industrial gas facilities at a plant in Capuava, Sao Paulo.

title: George Dyott, Explorer, Dies; Filmed Roosevelt Jungle Route
description: George Miller Dyott, who led exploration parties among head hunters in the Upper Amazon River and into ancient Inca lands in Peru, died yesterday at his home in Babylon, L. I. His age was 89.

title: LIGHT TERM GIVEN TO SOVIET ACTIVIST
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 2A 24 yearold Jewish dentist trying to emigrate to Israel was sen tenced today to one year of correctional work on charges that he evaded a military call up as a reserve officer earlier this summer.

title: NEW SCHOOL PLAN ORDERED IN TEXAS
description: NEW ORLEANS, Aug. 2 (AP) A Federal appeals court or dered today a new desegrega tion plan for public schools in Austin, Tex. It also ordered re visions in the plan that had been approved for schools in Corpus Christi, Tex.

title: Aide of Mackell Estimates Scheme's Victims at 1,000
description: The alleged swindle that vic timized nine persons in the of fice of Queens District Attor ney Thomas J. Mackell probably ran into millions of dollars.

title: I.B.M. Unveils New Computers
description: The International Business Machines Corporation yester day officially announced its new computer systems incor porating the highly touted concept of virtual storage.

title: NEWARK POLICEMAN SHOT, GUNMAN FLEES
description: A Newark Policeman was shot and seriously wounded late last night while responding to a report of a man with gun.

title: Organized Crime Foe
description: In Brooklyn organized crime circles, Denis E. Dil lon, director of the Federal Strike Force Against Organ ized Crime for the Eastern District of New York, is public enemy No. 1.

title: Ellsberg Defense Explains Stand Against Plea to End Trial Delay
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 2 Lawyers for Dr. Daniel Ells berg and Anthony J. Russo Jr. told the Supreme Court today that its image as a measured deliberative body would be eroded if it convened a special summer session to consider overturning Justice William O. Douglas's order delaying a Pen tagon papers trial.

title: Senators Seek to Bolster U.S. ArmsPact Position
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2  A group of Democratic and Re publican senators, with Admin istration support, plans to in troduce a resolution containing a number of reservations about the accords with the Soviet Union on offensive and defen sive missiles.

title: 3 Ecological Groups Won't Contest U.S. On Offshore Leases
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 Three environmental groups have decided not to renew legal challenge to a Govern ment sale of new oildrilling rights in the Gulf of Mexico.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: GENEVA, Aug. 2The Inter national commission of Jurists today denounced the use in Czechoslovakia of legal pro ceedings as a cover for political purge.

title: Farewell Party for Russians
description: CAIRO, Thursday, Aug. 3 (AP)Topranking Soviet mili tary advisers were given a cere monial sendoff party yesterday by War Minister Mohammed Sadek, the official Middle East News Agency reported today. The agency did not say whether all Russian military advisers have departed, although this was the implication.

title: RUDOLPH GANZ, 95, PIANISTCOMPOSER
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 2 (AP) Rudolph Ganz, pianist, com poser and president emeritus of Chicago Musical College, now affiliated with Roosevelt Uni versity, died today at the age of 95.

title: FASHION TALK
description: The sequins look better at Norman Norell's place than they do anywhere else in the world. So do the great, big wide coats and the wool jackets over the slender evening dresses. And if everybody's going to run around in their bathrobes next wintervelvet or satin ones to be sureblame it on Norell.

title: GEORGE W. CRAWFORD
description: NEW HAVEN, Aug. 2  George W. Crawford, who served four terms as this city's corporation counsel, from 1954 to 1962, died yesterday at the age of 94.

title: FOE'S GUNS POUND QUANGTRI TARGETS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Aug. 3North Viet namese gunners poured about 2,000 rounds onto South Viet namese marines fighting to retake the devastated city of Quangtri yesterday.

title: Chess Expert Says Spassky Isn't Out
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Aug. 2  Like most grandmasters watching the Boris Spassky Bobby Fischer world champion ship chess match, Bent Larsen believes that the champion is not playing up to his real stand ard. Unlike most grandmasters, the Danish player believes it is still too early to count Spas sky out.

title: BLACKS FOR NIXON SHARPLY REBUKED
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 2  In one of the sharpest attacks to date on black supporters of President Nixon, State Rep resentative Julian Bond of Geor gia today termed black Repub licans political prostitutes.

title: Peterson Expects U.S.Polish Trade To Show Increase
description: WARSAW, Aug. 2Secre tary of Commerce Peter G. Peterson said today there was solid reason to anticipate substantial expansion of United StatesPolish trade, co ordinated in part through new joint trade commission.

title: 9 New Orleans Hospitals Will Provide Charity Care
description: NEW ORLEANS, Aug. 2 Nine hospitals here agreed to day to provide $983,000 over the next year in either free or lowcost medical care to the poor and nearly poor.

title: EARLIEST OPENER FOR KNICKS: OCT.10
description: The New York Knickerbock ers announced yesterday they would open their season on Oct. 10, an earliestever geta way that will probably enable them to beat baseball's World Series out of the starting gate.

title: Suspect Is Slain As Police Uncover Jersey Gun Cache
description: PALISADES PARK, N. J., Aug. 2 (UPI)Two longhaired, cas ually dressed undercover police men shot and fatally wounded a suspect last night when he fired on them after a meeting ar ranged to purchase illegal weap ons, the police said.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2  Representative John G. Schmitz, an ultraconservative California Republican, announced today that he would seek the Presi dential nomination of the Amer ican Independent party.

title: Sebrell Wins Predicted Log, Stamford to Fishers Island
description: MYSTIC, Conn., Aug. 2A predictedlog contest from Stamford to Fishers Island was won today by Dr. Henry Sebrell in his 45foot Matthews cruser, Seago II.

title: Yanks Top Red Sox, 51
description: BOSTON, Aug. 2An aroused; Red Sox team finally caught up with the Yankees tonight and beat them, 74, after losing to them in the afternoon, 51.

title: 1,200 Fight to Get Big Stir Forest Fire Under Control
description: BIG SUR, Calif., Aug. 2 (AP) More than 1,000 per sons were evacuated today as a forest fire raged out of control in the Big Sur area, charring redwood groves and blackening miles of coastal wilderness.

title: OBSERVER
description: We all went on a summer vacation. At the start of the second day every one else had begun a program of selfimprovement.

title: Ukrainian Dance Company Target of Protesters Here
description: The performance of the Ukrainian Dance Company at the Metropolitan Opera House was interrupted last night when two young men rushed to the front of the auditorium and threw onto the stage plastic bags apparently containing mixture of blood and vinegar.

title: NIXON WAS TARGET IN BREMER'S DIARY
description: UPPER MARLBORO, Md., Aug. 2In his diary, Arthur H. Bremer told how he pursued a plan to assassinate President Nixon, it was disclosed today at his trial on charges of shoot ing Gov. George C. Wallace on May 15.

title: Roundup: Orioles' Palmer Still Stopping Them Cold
description: Jim Palmer has become the stopper of the Baltimore Orioles' losing streaks this season.

title: Arabs' Lawyers in Israel Accept Points on Hijacking
description: LYDDA, Israel, Aug. 2 (AP) Defense attorneys for two Arab women accused of participation in a hijacking on May 8 today accepted the prosecution's con tention that they had been aboard the Sabena airliner, had been linked to a guerrilla group, and had carried explosives that could have blown the plane up.

title: Personal Finance: G.I.'s Insurance
description: Nearly 6.5 million World War II veterans who held on to their G.I. insurance have been getting letters from the ??terans Administration ??ely.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN

title: Preiontaine Loses Impressively in Oslo With His Fastest 1,500
description: OSLO, Norway, Aug. 2  Steve Prefontaine finally lost a race tonight but won another chunk of confidence on his road to the Olympics.

title: Washington: For the Record Aug. 2, 1972
description: THE PRESIDENT

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 President Nixon's political strategists have been fretting for months over how to use the Republican National Con vention to put Mr. Nixon's best foot forward without putting the country to sleep.

title: U.S. Refuses Comment
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 (Reu ters)The State Department said it had no comment on the decision by Egypt and Libya to establish a union.

title: NEW HEARING ASKED ON QUEENS HOUSING
description: A compromise plan to halve the size of the controversial lowincome housing project in Forest Hills, Queens, should be submitted for consideration to the Board of Estimate, Borough President Donald R. Manes of Queens said yesterday.

title: French Reserves Rise
description: PARIS, Aug. 2 (Reuters) France's gold and foreign cur rency reserves rose 2.104bil lion francs ($422million) in July to 44.918billion ($8.78bil lion), the Finance Ministry said today.

title: Pilots and Northwest Silent
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Aug. 2 (UPI) Both Northwest Airlines and the Air Line Pilots Association refused today to discuss wheth er any progress had been made toward settlement of the pilots' strike that began June 30.

title: Danang Base Attacked
description: SAIGON, Thursday, Aug. 3 (UPI)Enemy gunners fired 27 rockets into the United States air base at Danang at dawn to day, killing one American and wounding 13, field reports said. It was the first rocket attack on the base since July 13 and the largest bombardment since 28 rounds struck the base last Feb. 9, spokesmen said.

title: Poison Kills Wife Of Alleged Mafioso
description: DOVER TOWNSHIP, N. J., Aug. 2Mrs. Carolyn S. Lar diere, the wife of an organized crime figure imprisoned for re fusing to testify before the State Commission of Investiga tion, has been killed by poison, the police said today.

title: Heavy Smog Blights Life in Riverside, Calif.
description: RIVERSIDE, Calif.,Smog almost accomplished here re cently what snow, rain, heat and gloom of night have never donestopped the mailmen from the swift com pletion of their appointed rounds.

title: PHILLIPS DENIES SMITH IS VICTIM
description: Patrolman William R. Phillips conceded yesterday that he had inscribed Case of Smith as his entry in his police daily me morandum book for Dec. 24, 1968  the day he is accused of killing James Smith, a pimp, and Sharon Stango, a prosti tute, because Smith failed to give him a $1,000 payoff.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: TORONTO, Aug. 2 (AP)Hockey Canada, after a day long meeting of the board of directors, announced today that no player who had defected to the World Hockey Association from the National Hockey League would play for Team Canada in the September series against the Soviet Union.

title: Seoul Takes Steps To Help Economy; Interest Rates Cut
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Thurs day, Aug. 3South Korean President Park Chung Hee pro claimed last night a threeyear moratorium on all usurious private loans to business estab lishments in a series of drastic financial measures aimed at shoring up the nation's reces sionary economy.

title: JESSIE G. WILLING
description: Jessie Gillespie Willing, mag azine and book illustrator who was an honorary life member of the National Arts Club, died yesterday in Mountainside Hos pital, Glen Ridge, N.J. She was 84 years old.

title: Dude Rehearsal Heralds A New Broadway Season
description: The earliest visible outlines of the new Broadway season may be perceived this week, at the risk of a 15volt shock of nonrecognition, in rehears als for the new musical com edy Dude.

title: 4 Rails Plead for U.S. Disaster Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2The presidents of four financially troubled railroad companies pleaded before the Senate Com merce Committee today for swift enactment of Administra tionhacked legislation that would provide them with up to $10million in longterm loans to repair damage caused by natural disasters last June.

title: SOYBEAN PRICES SHOW ADVANCES
description: In the threering arena for grain and soybean futures trad ing on the Chicago Board of Trade, soybeans took the spot light away from wheat yester day. Corn, though actively traded, showed very little change in price.

title: Garbage Strike Ends
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Aug. 2 (AP)  Settlement of a 21  day city employee strike, which idled 400 persons and left streets lined with garbage, has been announced by negotiators for the City Council. Members of three striking unions began to return to their jobs yesterday and most were expected to work today.

title: GRUMMAN GROOMS FOR SHUTTLE DEAL
description: The top managements of the North American Rockwell Cor poration, awarded the prime contract for the space shuttle last week, and the Grumman Corporation, an unsuccessful bidder, will meet today to dis cuss Grumman's role as a sub contractor on the project.

title: MERRILL LYNCH SUED ON ADVISORY AGAIN
description: A second suit against Mer rill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith and its buy recommen dation for the Scientific Con trol Corporation was filed yes terday in Southern District Court.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 (Reuters)The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation said today it would not oppose legislation to guarantee 100 per cent insurance on public deposits in banks although the plan could have a dis ruptive impact on the market for state and municipal obligations. The F.D,I.C.'s chairman, Frank Wille, told the Senate Banking Committee that the corporation had changed its earlier opposition to a position of neutrality.

title: AMEX UP BY 0.09 AS VOLUME RISES
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthe counter market advanced yes terday for the second consecu tive session in steppedup trad ing.

title: $704Million for Science
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 (AP) A $704million authorization bill for the National Science Foundation, the largest in the 22year history of the agency, was sent to President Nixon today. By voice vote, the House completed Congressional action by accepting a Senateapproved compromise bill.

title: ANTIWAR VETERANS ASK AID FOR ADDICTS
description: A panel of Vietnam veterans, all former drug addicts, made an impassioned plea yesterday for huge Federal subsidies to communitybased, drugfree antinarcotics programs in the city.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: As a Canadian, I was particularly interested in your July 19 news story concerning unemployment in my coun try, which may bring Ottawa to curb immigration, although for its size Can ada is drastically underpopulated for the development of its full potential.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: The Rochester Gas & Electric Corporation announced yester day that it is offering holders of its common stock the right to subscribe for 825,000 addi tional shares at a price of $19 a share on the basis of one new share for each nine held of rec ord Aug. 2, The offering will expire Aug. 21.

title: N.B.C. to Cover the Vote On Eagleton's Replacement
description: The National Broadcasting Company will provide live cov erage next Tuesday of what spokesman called the Demo cratic miniconvention, the meeting the Democratic Nation al Committee called to vote on Senator George McGovern's choice of a new Vice Presiden tial running mate.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your editorial of July 13 (Down From the Bottom) makes several in correct and unjust accusations and radically misconstrues the New York State farm labor bill of which I was cosponsor.

title: Inventories and Credit Advance
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 Manufacturers' inventories rose $695million in June, the Com merce Department reported to day.

title: SENATE, BY 4947, ADOPTS PROPOSAL FOR ENDING WAR
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2The Senate, over the strenuous op position of the White House, narrowly adopted today an amendment requiring the with drawal of all American forces from Indochina in four months, subject to the concurrent re lease of prisoners of war.

title: Expendable Mystery
description: Things keep getting murkier in the case of the five men arrested June 17 on charges of breaking into Demo cratic National Committee headquarters In Washington with electronic bugging devices, photographic copying equipment and a substantial amount of money. It now appears that the money came from the bank account of one of the arrested suspectsan account in which. he had previously deposited a $25,000 check ostensibly intended for the Republican election campaign. Kenneth H. Dahlberg, a Republican party regional finance chair man, reports that he delivered the check to Maurice H. Stans, the party's chief fundraiser, to cover cash con tributions collected for President Nixon's reelection.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: Two minority party Presi dential candidates  Dr. Ben jamin Spock and Mrs. Linda Jennesswere in town yes terday, drumming up local or ganizational support but look ing more to the longterm ef fects of their campaigns than to the possibility of winning, the White House this fall.

title: La Prevoyante Captures Sixth Race in Row
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 2  JeanLouis Levesque owns an insurance company in Canada named La Prevoy ante, the French word for provident. He also owns a filly by the name of La Prevoyante, a filly that promises to accumu late a pretty good cash reserve for the wealthy Montreal in vestment executive.

title: Leon Hess Takes The Reins Again At Amerada Hess
description: The Amerada Hess Corpora tion announced a major shake up of its top management yes terday, Leon Hess, 58, founder of Hess Oil, again will take over as chairman and chief ex ecutive officer, effective Sept. 1.

title: Guild Unit Asks Referendum
description: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN

title: Birth Decline Linked to 3 Methods of Contraception
description: The plummeting national birth rate and the decline in unwanted births have been linked in new findings to a dramatic increase in American married couples' use of the three most effective methods of contraceptionthe pill, steri lization and the intrauterine device.

title: Martinon Leads Philharmonic in Park Candide
description: With its luck still holding, the New York Philharmonic had another evening of clear weather for the opening in Central Park on Tuesday of its second week of concerts in the city's parks. The audience, not quite as large as the one for the pre vious Tuesday in the same place, was estimated at 50,000.

title: Firm Declines Comment
description: A spokesman for Middendorf, Colgate & Co. in New York de clined to make any immediate comments on the charges made by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Surrealism of House Unit Stirs Busing Bill Gossip
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 The talk in the back offices of the Rayburn House Office Building this week was of sur realism on the Education and labor Committee: Represent ative Edith Green, Democrat of Oregon, who boasts of a liberal record, tormenting the Rev. Theodore M. Hesburgh, chairman of the United States Commission on Civil Rights; Representative William D. Ford, Democrat of suburban Detroit, who has a 78 per cent voting record as judged by Americans for Dem ocratic Action, declaring in an exchange with civil rights wit messes that he was tired of be ing compared to Southern segregationists; Representative Roman C. Pucinski, Democrat of Chicago, using the commit tee as a platform to align him self with President Nixon on busing for his forthcoming Sen ate race against Senator Charles H. Percy, a Republican.

title: NoProfit Hijack
description: The diversion to Algeria this week of a Delta Air Lines jet bound from Detroit to Miami makes it plain that neither governments nor airlines are yet doing enough to provide dependable defense against hijackings.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Five years ago the earnings limita tions was raised to $1,680 for those receiving Social Security benefits. Since then Congress has passed five increases in benefits, yet there has been no change in the earnings lim itation nor have other badly needed corrections been made.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Savings Inflow Tapers; Remains at June High
description: The flow of funds into the nation's savings and loan asso ciations slackened during Juneo but still remained at a record high for the month, the Fed eral Home Loan Bank Board an nounced yesterday.

title: American Motors to Give 1973 Buyers Free Lodging While Awaiting Repairs
description: LAKE GENEVA, Wis., Aug. The American Motors Corpo ration said today that it would reimburse new car buyers up to $150 for food and lodging if a 1973 car is kept overnight for guaranteed repairs and the owner is more than 100 miles from home.

title: Brothers Make the U.S. Mat Team
Canadians Rally to Save the Niagara Escarpment from Quarrying
description: QUEENSTON, Ontario  The Niagara Escarpmenta 430mile stretch of dramatic cliffs and outcropping rocks is at last being recognized as one of Canada's great na tural assets, but it may be too late to save it.

title: 200 at Spaak's Funeral
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 1 (AP)  PaulHenri Spaak, the Belgian statesman who was an early pioneer of European unity and the North Atlantic Treaty Or ganization, was buried today at a private family ceremony in suburban Braille l'Alleude. About 200 persons, including Prince Albert, Foreign Minister Pierre Harmel and representa tives of the diplomatic corps attended the funeral at the hos pital where Mr. Spaak died Monday of kidney failure. He was 73 years old.

title: Lowenstein, in Court, Asks New Primary Election
description: An attorney for former Rep resentative Allard K. Lowen stein charged yesterday that thousands of Brooklynites voted illegally or were pre vented from voting in the June 20 primary in which Repre sentative John J. Rooney was renominated by the Democrats.

title: Financier Seeks Control Of Kings Lafayette Corp.
description: Edmond J. Safra, the interna tional financier who controls the fastgrowing Republic National Bank on Fifth Avenue here, an nounced yesterday a bid for control of the Kings Lafayette Corporation, the parent company of the $240  million Kings Lafayette Bank in Brooklyn. At the same time, Mr. Safra told the Securities and Exchange Commission that he already held 43.8 per cent of King Lafayette's shares, up sharply from the 23 per cent ownership that he had previous ly disclosed. Theodore H. Sil bert, the chairman of the Stand ard Prudential Corporation, which also is bidding for con trol of Kings Lafayette, had no comment on Mr. Safra's dis closure, which he said had amazed him, and was news to me.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: While memories of water, mud and devastation are still fresh maybe each of us will join in planning for the rebirth of the valley.

title: Frederick Warner Brown, Psychologist, Dead at 79
description: Frederick Warner Brown, psychologist who was director of information and statistics for the National Committee for Mental Hygiene from 1927 to 1937, died last night in Mercy Hospital. Rockville Centre, L.I. He was 79 years old and lived at 6 Madison Lane, Carle Place, L.I.

title: Arthur Rickerby, Photographer For Life and U.P.I., Dies at 51
description: Arthur B. Rickerby, a free lance photographer formerly on the staffs of United Press In ternational and Life magazine, died yesterday in Danbury (Conn.) Hospital. He was 51 years old and lived in Bethel, Conn.

title: Maribeth Is Dog Show Pro at 15
description: Youth is stepping into the show ring with knowhow and assurance. It wasn't many years ago that Charles A.T. O'Neill was winning the accolades for the Philadelphia family with his Doberman pinschers. Now it is his 15 yearold daughter, Marie Eliz abeth, who makes the news with her Man chester terriers. In June, her toy Manchester, Ch. Renreh Lorelei of Charmaron, won the national specialty for the fourth year and her Ch. Chatham's Engelbert took the United States event for the standard variety a second successive time.

title: Labor Unit Backs McGovern
description: NORFOLK, Va., Aug. 2 (UN) The Virginia unit has become the third state chapter of the labor federation to ask the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Or ganization leadership to change its mind and endorse Senator George McGovern for the Presi dency. Texas and Maine have previously asked the executive council to reconvene.

title: Marijuana Farm Burned
description: HARRISBURG JUNCTION, Utah, Aug. 2 (UPI)  Sheriff's deputies said they burned down a $1million marijuana farm on the banks of the Virgin River yesterday. Two persons were arrested at a shack on the farm.

title: Unofficial Vietnamese Contacts In Paris Clarify Political Issues
description: PARIS I Aug. 2A series of unofficial contacts is taking place here among Communist and nonCommunist Vietnam ese, alongside the sterile offi cial negotiations.

title: U. S. Judge Voids Approval of Con Ed Astoria Project
description: Approval by the Army Corps of Engineers for Consolidated Edison to build a vital part of an 800,000kilowatt generating plant in Queens has been ruled invalid by Judge Morris E. Las ker in Federal Court here.

title: French Offer to Egypt Expected On a Role in Middle East Talks
description: PARIS, Aug. 2Foreign Min ister Murad Ghaleb of Egypt is coming to Paris next week on what is styled a private visit. But it is expected that a proposal will be put to him for France to act as intermediary in negotiations between Israel and the Arab countries.

title: Dollar Makes Gains
description: LONDON, Aug. 2 (Reuters)  The dollar had its best day in more than a month today on European foreignexchange markets, while the freemarket price of gold in London, Paris and Zurich remained at the level of $70 an ounce. But there was much less buying of gold than during the last few clays.

title: F.P.C. TO RECONSIDER GAS IMPORTS STAND
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2Re sponding to a wave of protests, the Federal Power Commission agreed today to reconsider the conditions it attached to its approval of a largescale impor tation of liquefied natural gas from Algeria by the El Paso Natural Gas Company.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: NORTHPORT, L. I., Aug. 2Mrs. W. Perry (Mimi) Neff of the Seawanhaka Corinthian Yacht Club earned the right today to represent the Northeast in the Adams Cup series. The regatta, for the women's North American sailing cham pionship, starts Aug. 28 at Cleveland.

title: LAVER, ASHE GAIN IN U.S. PRO TENNIS
description: CHESTNUT FULL, Mass., Aug. 2 (UPI)Rod Laver, five time winner of the tournament, and Arthur Ashe, the hottest player on the tour, scored im pressive victories today to move into the quarterfinals of the $50,000 United States pro fessional tennis championships.

title: Carolina Mestizos Seeking Ethnic Identity as Indians
description: ESSEX, N. C.One recent morning in a field near this hamlet, the heat was ascend ing in withering waves and from time to time the little girl with the coalblack hair would straighten herself from the long green rows of cu cumber plants and wipe her moist forehead with the back of her hand.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: Buddy Gilmour's harnessracing license was suspended yesterday by Robert A. Glasser, the chairman of the New York State Harness Racing Commission, pending the dis position of a seconddegree burglary charge against the Canadianborn, 40yearold reinsman from Westbury, L. I. Gilmour, the nation's top driver in 1959, was arrested yesterday by state troopers after he allegedly broke into a mobile home in Batavia, N. Y.

title: Traits of Plaza Robbers Linked to Holdup in Boston
description: The Plaza Hotel jewel rob ??ery was apparently executed, by a gang known as the Par, ker House Five, which stole more than $100,000 worth of jewelry from the Parker House, Hotel in Boston in April, high ly placed investigators said yesterday.

title: U.S. Investigation of Mackell's Office Branches Out to Scrutiny of His Home
description: Federal investigators who have announced that they are questioning members of the Queens prosecutor's office about alleged criminal viola tions are looking into the cir cumstances surrounding the construction of the house owned by District Attorney Thomas J. Mackell, according to several law enforcement officials.

title: SEARS SETS MARK FOR SALES IN HALF
description: Favorable shopping weather helped push July sales of Sears, Roebuck & Co., the country's largest merchandising organi zation, to $871,745,000, or 12 per cent above the level in July 1971.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 (AP)Vice President Agnew said last night that he saw no reason to change the way VicePresidential candidates were selected.

title: Rumanian Tie Seems Improved By BrezhnevCeausescu Talks
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 2President Nicolae Ceausescu's brief but prominently publicized meeting with the Soviet party leader, Leonid I Brezhnev, was inter preted by Western diplomats today as a sign of a major im provement in SovietRumanian relations.

title: Texas Book Depository Reverts to Original Owner
description: DALLAS, Aug. 2 (UPI)The Texas School Book Depository reverted to its original owner yesterday when the Republic National Bank foreclosed on Nashville businesman who had planned to turn the historic building into a Kennedy mu seum.

title: Aides Picking Up Pieces
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 With the Eagleton affair behind them and a new running mate ahead, members of Senator George McGovern's staff are trying to forget about Vice Presidents and put the pieces of their campaign for the Presi dency back together.

title: Chevrolet Sets a Record, 1 Million Sales in 100 Days
description: DETROIT, Aug. 2 (UPI)The Chevrolet Motor Division of the General Motors Corporation said today it had sold more than one million cars and trucks in the past 100 days, setting an industry record.

title: Waldheim Will Travel To Peking Next Week
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 2Secretary General Waldheim will make a five day visit to China beginning Aug. 11 at the invitation of Peking.

title: Newsweek's Staff Realignment Detailed
description: Edward Kosner has been appointed assistant managing editor of Newsweek magazine, not executive editor as was reported in an article in the first edition of The New York Times yesterday.

title: Teamsters Plan Merger With Brewery Workers
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 (AP)  Plans for a merger of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters and the United Brewery Workers were an nounced today.

title: Audience at Soul Festival Digs 2 Rock Groups and Vice Versa
description: One of the most fascinating aspects of a musical series like Soul at the Center is the view it provides of the many grada tions of style within black popu lar music. Blues, jazz, rock, folk, gospelvirtually all bases are being touched in the series' 15 programs.

title: A TeenAge Bank Bandit Shoots Teller and Flees
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Aug. (AP)A search is under way for a teenager who wounded a woman teller during his un successful attempt to hold up the Bridgeport Savings and Loan Association, the police said.

title: Market Place: The Trip Offers No Destination
description: The public be damned, said William H. Vanderbilt in a reply to a newspaper re porter in 1883.

title: HOSPITAL TALKS CONTINUING HERE
description: Negotiators for private hos pitals here and their em ployes worked into the early morning hours today in an ef fort to resolve a contract dispute and avert a strike that could affect 35 institutions and more than 5,000 patients.

title: Arthur Daley
description: REAR MOUNTAIN, N. Y., Aug. 2Duane Bobick is quartermaster third class in the United States Navy and his seafaring adventures have failed to match those of other naval notables such as John Paul Jones, Christopher Columbus and Eric the Red. While in the Netherlands for an international boxing tournament not long ago, Bobick spent a delightful afternoon aboard an excursion boat that was touring the Rotterdam harbor. It was a novel experi ence for the quartermaster third class, because it was the first time he ever had been aboard a ship that, was riding even gently over the bound ing deep. The only other vessels he ever visited were lashed so firmly to piers that they barely had enough slack to respond to the tides. But Duane Bobick figures to be making big waves at the Olympic Games in Munich within the next six weeks, He is a heavyweight boxer from the bustling metropolis of Bowlus, Minn., and the experts are of the opinion that he is a very good one. They agree that he is already at a much more advanced stage than was George Foreman before he won the Olympic heavyweight championship at Mexico City in 1968. They also see Bobick as some day becoming the top man in the fisticuffing in dustry, joining such previous Olympic winners as Joe Frazier, Cassius Clay and Floyd Patterson.

title: Professor Weds Louise Killander
description: Miss Louise Ingrid Killand cr and Stephen M. Schwebcl, professor of international law at the School of Advanced International Studies of Johns Hopkins University, were married yesterday in Adams berg, Sweden. The civil cere mony was performed at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Lennart Kil lander, by Edvin Johnson North, a former city official.

title: Jersey's Inquiry on Kugler Appears Headed for Delay
description: TRENTON, Aug. 2The New Jersey State Commission of In vestigation said today it would carry out in orderly and ex peditious fashion a thorough and complete inquiry of the office of Attorney General George F. Kugler.

title: Jerseyans Taking to Camping in Increasing Numbers
description: HIGH POINT, N.J., Aug. 2  Despite the rains and inordinate clouds of mosqui toes, New Jersey campers are turning out in full force this summer with backpacks, tents, trailers, mobile homes and converted buses  if not to return to nature, at least to get back on speak ing terms.

title: EGYPT AND LIBYA REACH AN ACCORD TO PURSUE UNITY
description: CAIRO, Aug. 2 President Anwar etSadat of Egypt and Col. Muammar elQaddafi of Libya agreed today to set up a unified political leadership to work out the unification of the two countries in such fields as finance, education and political and constitutional organization.

title: Text of the LibyanEgyptian Statement
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 2 (Reuters)  Following, as translated from the Arabic by Reuters, is the text of the joint statement broadcast by the Egyptian and Libyan ra dios tonight on the pro posed unification of the two countries:

title: Taking a Closer Look at One of China's Most Obscure Cuisines
description: All the fabled regional cuisines of China are now available in New York. Suddenly, instead of just Cantonese, restaurants serve the food of Peking, of Szechuan, of Hunan and of Fukien. For the Chinese food fan, it is a kind of paradise, but a puzzling paradise. There is almost too much to explore all at once.

title: MRS. DAVID ALEXANDER
description: Mrs. Flora Silverstein Alex ander, widow of Dr. David Alexander, who was selected in 1958 as Doctor of the Year by the Medical Society of the County of New York, died Tues day in a nursing home in Livingston, N. J. She was 92 years old.

title: Keep Em Moving
