title: Downtown Company Moves Up and Out  to Brooklyn
description: These are busy days in the corporate life of Forward In dustries, Inc.

title: Miss Sweeney Wed
description: Miss Barbara Jean Sweeney, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Francis J. Sweeney of Bethpage, L.I., was married here yester day afternoon to William Deuel Mustain, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Mustain of Gretna, Va. The Rev. Eugene Lynch performed the ceremony in the Ro man Catholic Church of Our Saviour.

title: Son to the Michael Pearls
description: A son was born July 22 to Mr. and Mrs. Michael R. Pearl of Mount Vernon, N.Y., at the Albert Einstein Medi cal Center in the Bronx. The child has been named Steven Joseph. Mr. Pearl is an as sistant corporation counsel of New York.

title: DRAINAGE PROJECT STIRS ARKANSAS
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Aug. 5 Objections by environmental ists and a protest by Gov. Dale L. Bumpers have failed to stop bulldozers along the banks of the Cache River in east Arkan sas, where the Army Corps of Engineers has begun a $60 million drainage project.

title: World News Briefs
description: MANILA, Aug. 5Food riots were reported in flooddev astated areas on the Philippine island of Luzon today. Presi dent Ferdinand E. Marcos said in a nationwide radio and tele vision broadcast that large areas of Luzon remained in the grip of a natural calamity which is one of the worst we've ever known.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: The further adventures of Pippa, the female cheetah from Mrs. Adamson'sThe Spotted Sphinx. Now free, Pippa is raising a litter of four cubs, whose coming of age Mrs. Adamson has described with love and care. There were in terruptions  most dramatic was the visit of a snake expert who got himself bitten by a puff adder and almost died of it. Mrs. Adamson has a great talent for communicating her fondness for animals and, with out anthropomorphism, for re vealing their personalities. The book contains striking color photographs.

title: SHRIVER PRAISED AS A GOOD CHOICE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5The reaction of a crosssection of Senate Democrats tonight to the selection of Sargent Shriver as the Democratic VicePresi dential candidate was that he would add energy, strength and appeal to the party's national ticket.

title: IOWA WOMEN JOIN IN DRIVE ON RAPE
description: IOWA CITY, Iowa, Aug. 5  Three rapes, two attempted rapes and three assaults on women here in less than month have led to the forma tion of a group called Women Against Rape or WAR, in this city of 27,000 people that is the home of the University of Iowa.

title: A Village Bookshop Benefits Everybody
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I. Our system works beauti fully, said Mrs. Roma Martin, cochairman of the Ladies Village Improvement Society's Bargain Bookshop down the alley at 16A Newtown Lane. Contributors get a tax credit, we get the books and the donors turn right around and buy the books someone else has brought in. You can't beat something like this.

title: Movies
description: DIRECTOR Norman Jewison, who will soon start jumping with Universal's ver sion of Jesus Christ Super star in Israel, has decided to settle down there long enough to produce a movie set in the Old West. The American West. It will be called Billy Two Hats, and will star Gregory Peck and Desi Arnaz Jr. under the di rection of Ted Kotcheff. Alan Sharp wrote the screenplay, and Jewison will coproduce the film with Patrick Palmer for United Artists release.

title: Carol Albert Plans Bridal
description: RYE, N.Y., Aug. 5Mr. and Mrs. John H. Albert of Rye and Harwich Port, Mass., have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Carol Jane Albert, to Gerald Joseph Harlin. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Hav lin of Yonkers.

title: Muskie Puts Family First In His Decision Not to Run
description: KENNEBUNK BEACH, Me., Aug. 5Senator Edmund S. Muskie, bowing to family duties and the interests my growing children, rejected today Senator George McGovern's offer to be the Democratic Vice  Presidential nominee.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: SCIENTISTS DISCOVER LARGEST DINOSAUR
description: PROVO, Utah, Aug. 5 (UPI) Paleontologists at Brigham Young University announced yesterday they had discovered bones of what they believed to be the largest dinosaur ever found.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Mrs. Court in Final
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 5 (UPI) Mrs. Margaret Court gets chance for revenge in finals of the 85th Western tennis cham pionships tomorrow.

title: Martha M. Stewart Married to Lawyer
description: SELMA, Ma., Aug 5 Miss Martha Mallory Stewart and Edward Burton Crosland Jr son of Mr. and Mrs. Cros land of Potomac, Md., and New York, were married to night in the Church Street United Methodist Church of Selma. The Rev. Robert Col lins and the Rev. Everett Barnes officiated.

title: Movies
description: EVERYTHING YOU ALWAYS WANTED TO KNOW ABOUT SEX BUT WERE AFRAID TO ASKWoody Allen, a captive writer, watches Res Sanchez, a sex researcher's houseboy, as he prepares an unwilling Heather MacRae for an experiment in the comedy due today at the Coronet and Little Carnegie. In the interview below, Allen tells you still more about sex.

title: Blue Jay Series Begins
description: RYE, N. Y., Aug. 5Patrick Fay of Lorchmont Yacht Club led in one division and David Pritchard of Sea Cliff Y.C. in the other on Long Island Sound off American Yacht Club in the threerace qualifying series of the national championship of the Blue Jay Class.

title: Fines Await Puffers in No Smoking Cars and Buses
description: CHATHAMThe nonsmok er who seeks out a no smoking commuter car, but whose air is fouled there by an invading puffer who ignores the ban, can take heart in New Jersey.

title: Derek Notman And Miss Vlak Are Betrothed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Dominicus Vlak of Windhoek, South West Africa, have announced here the engagement of their daughter, Miss Johanna Vlak, to Derek Neale Howard Not man. He is a son of John H. Notman, vice president and general manager of the Trenton Times Newspapers, and Mrs. Notman of Prince ton, N. J., and Clinton, Iowa. A late spring wedding is planned.

title: Will the Dow Ever Break the Magic Mark?
description: Dow 1000 is the elusive Everest of the stock market. Craggy and commandeering, its slope icy and its crevices treacherous, this peak has yet to be scaled.

title: Women in Taverns Decried
description: BOSTON, Aug. 5 (AP)  A state law taking effect next January will allow women to patronize Massachusetts tav erns, which have been a pre serve for men. The Retail Liquor Dealers' Board of Trade is opposed to the change. We'll file a bill to bar them perma nently, said Robert S. Lufkin, the 76yearold president of the board.

title: Blacks Play A Key Role For Housing In BedStuy
description: Four neighborhood organ izations nave joined with a housing  consultant concern to plan and develop three moderateincome projects in the BedfordStuyvesant sec tion of Brooklyn. The con sulting company is black owned, as are the three archi tectural firms Involved in the undertaking, and preference is being given to minority contractors and subcontract ors. Total cost of the projects is nearly $14million.

title: The dash of the Duke of Windsor
description: OPPOSITE PAGE, TOP: The man sets the moodcane and all in his beige cashmere coat by Daniel Hechter. It's $145 at the Peacock Boutique, 33 Greenwich Avenue. Her camel's hair and wool polo coat is by Jaeger, and it's $180 at (where else?) Jaeger International, 818 Madison Avenue. Their tweed hats came from the Irish Pavilion. The checked bal macaan is dark green and blue and worn over a glen plaid jacket in the same colors. Both are by Daniel Hechter. The coat, $140, and the jacket, $115, are at Bloomingdale's.

title: Theodore Metzger, 76, Dies; Former A.P. News Executive
description: OXNARD, Calif., Aug. 5 (AP) Theodore M. Metzger, former Associated Press war corre spondent and newspaper execu tive, died yesterday after a long illness. He was 76 years old.

title: To View Art in New England, Visit Galleries, Barns...
description: YOU walk through the Williams College campus toward Law rence Hall and are stopped short by an enormous wall relief con sisting of colorful and unrelated objects assembled in a slotted white frame.. You wonder who the artist might be.

title: Arms Control:
description: WASHINGTONThe ABM I treaty undoubtedly the most significant arms control agreement of the nuclear age was approved by the Senate last week. But an accompanying agreement im posing a temporary freeze on offensive weapons suddenly became snarled in White House politics.

title: The Government Playing With Its Subpoenas
description: They are a hind of Tac Squad for Western Civilization; a mighty highway patrol assigned to protect the pilgrims en route to the Holy Land from attack by infidels and robbers. . . . They were bully boys who justified their exist ence by harassing sacriligers adulterers and others in the name of the Cross. (As usual they left themselves to be the judges of who was guilty of these vaguely defined crimes.) Ishmael Reed, Mumbo Jumbo.

title: New Inner and Outer Rings in Europe
description: Two weeks ago, on July 22, the representatives of 16 European countries met in Brussels to sign a complex set of trade treaties. The treaties laid down the rules for a huge new freetrade area in industrial goods and, for the countries concerned, they marked a new phase in the long and slow process of unification in Western Europe.

title: Boston University Names Dean of Education School
description: Dr. Robert A. Dentler, direc tor of the Center for Urban Education here, has been named dean of the School of Education at Boston University.

title: Movies
description: WELL bless my soul, the Rev erend Marjoe Gortner, evan gelism's answer to Mick Jag ger, is not a figment of some gcreenwriters Imagination. He is re Cliiting in a neoViotorian armchair, sweating handsomely in his nonaircon ditioned Gramercy Park duplex, with the Stones blaring from the stereo and an Elvis banner next to the crucifix candleholders on the mantel, talking about karma and mescaline like no other preacher you've ever seen.

title: Television
description: consultant for in ternational distribution to the Children's Television Workshop

title: J. K. Weber Fiance Of Amelia G.Wood
description: Miss Amelia Gaillard Wood and James Karl Weber plan to be married in November. Mrs. Louise G. Wood and Dr. John A. Wood, both of Tena fly, N. J., have announced the engagement of their daughter to the son of Dr. and Mrs. Mortimer W. Weber of New York.

title: the traveler's world
description: FORTYTHREE years in commer cial aviation covers practically the whole history of modern pas senger flying, so when a man who spent the past 43 years immersed in the aviation business retires, a back ward glance over his shoulder and a penetrating look into the future through his eyes is warranted. This aviation veteran is Robert E. Johnson, who last week retired as vice president of ex ternal affairs of United Air Lines.

title: Law
description: WASHINGTONCan an employe of the Federal Government make a speech at a rally held by a political party? Can he participate in voter registration drives? Can he put a political sticker on his car? Can he become actively involved in such local issues as civil rights and taxes?

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: Further signs that the nation's economic expansion was proceeding vigorously helped propel the stock market its strongest gains of the year in slightly more active trading.

title: South Africa Fire Kills 22
description: UTRECHT, South Africa, Aug. 5 (Reuters)At least 22 blacks, including 13 children, died in a bush fire that raced through a northern section of the province of Natal last night, destroying huts, cattle pens and livestock. Eighteen other persons were taken to hospitals with serious burns and scores of families were homeless.

title: INDICTMENTS CITE 5 AT MONTANA U.
description: MISSOULA, Mont., Aug. 5 Five University of Montana of ficials face arraignment in Fed eral District Court Monday on a 32count Federal indictment charging that members of the athletic department conspired illegally to use Federal student aid funds.

title: Italy Explained: It Is Just One Colossal Italian Neighborhood
description: ON May 14 the Travel Section published a piece entitled When the European Trip Is Over, What Impressions Have Americans Left Behind? It catalogued the gentle despair of various minor Italian funzionaria concierge, a taxi driver and a waiter with the foibles, frenzies and faux pas of the various turisti. Predictably, the comments on the ItalianAmericans were the harshest of all: They are more demanding . . . the most distrustful . . . more suspicious . . . criticize more than other Americans . . . And the ultimate putdown: . . . they speak badly . . . haven't learned either Italian or Eng lish ...

title: A Sort of Monastic Supermarket
description: CAMBRIDGE, N.Y.Nestled on the slopes of Two Top Mountain, about two miles east of this rural village, is a small monastery called New Skete inhabited by 10 young Brothers of St. Francis. What makes New Skete unusual is that it is a sort of monastic supermarket offering the pub lic not only church services but a large selection of meats, myriad art objects, custommade furniture and even care fully raised championship quality dogs.

title: WIDENED THERAPY URGED IN SOVIET
description: MOSCOW, July 29  Two Soviet psychologists have called for a drastic restructuring of the nation's mental health fa cilities by creating a broad net work of consulting offices that would help people cope with everyday problems.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: THIEU ANNOUNCES HARSH NEW RULES FOR NEWSPAPERS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 5President Nguyen Van Thieu today issued a stringent decree, aimed at controlling the press, that seems certain to close down many and perhaps most of the daily newspapers in South Vietnam. The move was viewed by South Vietnamese newsmen and diplomatic ob servers as an attempt to eliminate all opposition com ment and criticism.

title: David Young and Miss Garfield, Descendant of President,Marry
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Aug. 5Miss Christine Henriques Garfield, a greatgreatgrand daughter of President James A. Garfield, was married here this afternoon to David Wal lace Young.

title: Westport Nuptials For Sarah Anstett
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Aug. 5 Miss Sarah McLaughlin Anstett, daughter of Judge and Mrs. Robert M. Anstett of Greens Farms, was mar ried here this afternoon to Patrick James Barry, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward J. Barry of Rochester. The ceremony was performed in St. Luke's Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Cornelius J. Looney, the pastor.

title: Like oily rags waiting for the spark
description: The dust jacket of John B. Boles's The Great Revival, 17871805, rep resents a camp meeting in New England about 1830. It evokes the atmosphere of the study as a whole, with a forest setting, an improvised preaching platform, with one preach er in action and others seated ready to assist him or to take his place, a background of tents, and a large gathering of attentive listeners.

title: The World
description: LONDONDERRYIt was a virtual invasion, the largest British armored operation since the Suez campaign of 1956. Dozens of armored, cars, bull dozers and tanks moved off the docks into the bombshattered streets of Londonderry shortly after midnight last Monday. Hundreds of soldiers, their faces smeared with charcoal, packed the vehicles that lined up be hind the concrete and barbed wire barricades of the Catholic enclaves, the Bogside and Creggan.

title: Letter From Home: Even Michelangelo Got Them
description: A TYPICAL communicationeven Michelangelo got themfrom the folks back home in Italy to you, the rich but remote relative, will remind you that nothing has been heard from you despite the fact that you were notified four months earlier that Armanda (not yet re covered from serious surgery) was to marry Pierino. Pierino, who has just lost his father and must take care of a senile grandfather, has taken the exami nation for the Postal Service and with the help some friends may soon be working steadily. Per haps God will assist them, poor creatures, to make a figura which will not disgrace a family known to have relatives of good position in America. The pressure mounts: As you know, my husband, may he rest in peace, named Armanda after your mother who was his beloved sister and was, as result; cut off from inheriting Zio Domenico's land, which was taken by Salvatore. Salvatore continues to find good fortune everywhere, needs none of the packages he receives from the United States America, and we leave him for God to judge!

title: Many Jersey Colleges Still Lack Full Enrollment
description: TRENTON  In keeping with a nationwide trend, more Now Jersey colleges and universities have enroll ment vacancies than full rolls for the 197273 school year.

title: Music: In Roslyn, Accent Is on Youth
description: ROSLYN, L. I. There is a building on Bryant Avenue that has served as a garage, a Village Court, an undertak ing parlor, a manufacturing plant and a bowling alley. Then, in 1965, Jay Linehan, a big, burly Irishman who has been a bartender for 43 years, threw out the bowlers in order to transform the structure into a country music club.

title: Cox Takes Tempest Lead
description: NOROTON, Conn., Aug. 5 William S Cox Jr. of the host club, an alternate International Tempest Class skipper for the Olympic Games in Germany, took a 2.3point lead, under the Olympic scoring system for the Long Island Sound Tempest championship today by placing third and first in two races off Noroton Yacht Club.

title: Stargell's ThreeRun Belt Leads Pirates to a 7to4 Victory Over Expos
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 5 (AP) Willie Stargell's threerun homer, a towering shot over, the rightfield scoreboard, high lighted a four run rally in the sixth inning today that carried the Pittsburgh Pirates to a 74 victory over the Montreal Expos.

title: WASHINGTON
description: FIERY RUN, Va., Aug. 5In this lovely hilly corner of Virginia most of the old eighteenth and nineteenthcen tury houses have changed hands since the last war, some of them several times, and there has been a steady migration, which illustrates a much larger national problem.

title: Czech Hostility Lingers 4 Years After Invasion
description: PRAGUE, Aug. 1An atmosphere of hostility and pro test lingers in Prague these days, four years after Soviet tanks arrived here to end the experiment in Communist reform. It is considered far short of a threat to the au thorities, but they worry any way and move quickly, some times sharply, to control any indication of dissent.

title: 4 Sent Into Kitchen And Are Shot Dead In Chicago Suburb
description: BARRINGTON HILLS, Ill., Aug. 5  One or two gunmen herded a retired businessman, his wife and two other mem bers of his family into the kitchen of their suburban Chi cago home last night and mur dered them, the police reported. The $100,000 home was ran sacked.

title: Music
description: THE Rolling Stones' recent tour affected American journalism like a direct hit on an ammo dump, and the air is still not quite clear of flaming and flut tering copy. Moreover, and oddly enough, nearly all the detonated verbal ordnance seems to have been of pretty much the same caliber. The standard review, en countered again and again, assured us that the Stones were exciting, and their beat was driving, that Mick Jagger strutted as he teased an audience that leaped to its feet, and that pandemonium, in a word, reigned. An occasional grump from some massreadership sourpuss to the contrary, our rock writers have celebrated the 1972model Stones in one bedazed, fulsome voice.

title: MINE AGENCY SAID TO LAG ON SAFETY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5The General Accounting Office to day accused the United States Bureau of Mines of failing to vigorously assess and collect fines against mine operators for safety violations.

title: Gracemarie Neville Is Bride Of Lieut. Christopher Bonwit
description: HACKENSACK, N. J., Aug. 5Miss Gracemarie Neville was married here this after noon to Lieut. Christopher C. Bonwit, U.S.N.

title: MINE AGENCY SAID TO LAG ON SAFETY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5The General Accounting Office to day accused the United States Bureau of Mines of failing to vigorously assess and collect fines against mine operators for safety violations.

title: 2 FLEE, ONE SEIZED IN JERSEY JAILBREAK
description: TRENTON, Aug. 5 (AP) Three men escaped from the maximum security unit for in corrigible state prison inmates at Trenton State Psychiatric Hospital tonight, but one was captured on the grounds a short time later.

title: Television
description: YOU can probably thank 'or rible Henry VIII and Good Queen Bess for the fact that you'll be able to invite the pretty young lady at the right into your living room this Satur day night and for three nights thereafter. Of course the lady, whose name is Ludmila Savilyeva, won't be coming alone. As one of the stars of the monumental Russianmade film version of Tol stoy's classic War and Peace, Miss Savilyeva she acts the heartbreaking and heartbroken Natashawill be accompanied by a cast of thundering thousands and a host of superlatives.

title: Goalie Says It Helps to Be Crazy
description: If an athlete took a boa constrictor to practice sessions, ate glass, took a Harvard sociology test in a hotel room in Guadalajara, Mexico, with his coach as proctor, and convinced the Crimson to hire a friend as an assistant coach, he would be no ordinary athlete.

title: He Was a Golden, Loving Child
description: I just felt when I knew he was gone that I had to tell him this again. I don't know why we feel compelled to reach out this way. What does it mean if people read what I feel about Brandon I don't know! But now we have to remember him. And he was such a gifted actor and we who loved him were so proud of the things he did...

title: Chou Croute Posts 8Length Victory in $55,350 Susquehanna at Liberty Bell
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 5  Emanuel V. Benjamin 3d's Chou Croute outran the field to win the $55,350 Susquehanna Han dicap today by eight lengths from Grafitti at Liberty Bell race track.

title: Education
description: STANFORD, Calif.No so many years ago, New Math was a new mystery suddenly come upon the academic scene. Many teachers were perplexed by the unfamiliar approach to numbers, and parents of the old school lost face as they had to admit that they could not cope with secondgrade arithmetic homework. In fact, there was a 50cent primer called A Very Short Course in Mathematics for Parents designed to help end domestic battles stirred up by the New Math.

title: Photography
description: AN ongoing series of classes in photog raphy is being offered at the Mombaccus Art Center in Accord, N. Y. (about 30 miles south of Woodstock), as well as an advanced seminar in photo graphic criticism,These will be taught by Dan McCormack.

title: Bridge
description: Some of the wonders of nature have their parallels at the bridge table. A bridge ex pert must on occasion be a master of disguise in the same manner as the leaf insects and the chameleons. On one brilliant deal from the World Team Olympiad this year, both South and West indulged in some protective coloration  with the result that South snatched a trick out of thin air but then lost it back again.

title: Packers Stop Bengals, 2414
description: GREEN BAY, Wis., Aug. 5 (AP)Dave Hampton and Scott Hunter sparked Green Bay to a 213 halftime lead tonight and the defense held on for a 2414 victory over the Cincinnati Ben gals in the teams preseason opener.

title: Mrs. Haines Has Son
description: A son was born July 29 to Mr. and Mrs. William L. Haines of 242 East 72d Street in Doctors Hospital.

title: OTB Handle at Spa Sets $1Million Mark
description: For the first time since it went into operation on April 8, 1971, New York's Off track Betting Corporation yesterday accepted more than $1million of wagers for single race track.

title: Mrs. Beadle Has Son
description: SYRACUSE, Aug. 5  A son was born to Dr. and Mrs. Gordon Beadle on July 20 in the CrouseIrving Hospital here. Mrs. Beadle is the for mer Miss Carole Corwin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Seymour Corwin of East Wil liston, L. I. Dr. Beadle is a professor at the State Uni versity College at Cortland. The child has been named Michael Andrew.

title: Pop
description: PATTI LaBELLE and the Blue Bellesa name to conjur up the marvelously energetic rhythm and blues music of the early and midsixties. It was only one of many black groups that were breaking through into the prominence of the larger pop market, but it was surely one of the best. Hits like Junkman, Take Me For A Little While, and their chargedup version of You'll Never Walk Alone are part of pop history now, but the group survives, and has gone through a major metamorphosis.

title: JAPANESE TO ASSIST ATOM VICTIMS IN U.S.
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 5 (Reu ter)  The Japanese will mark the 27th anniversary of the dropping of the atomic bomb on HiroshimaAug. 6, 1945 by sending a medical mission this year to the United States to aid victims of atomic bomb ings.

title: How to Avoid a Senior Slump
description: MANHASSET, L.I.  A program designed to help bright students avoid the senior slump by allowing them to work at outside jobs for half a tlay has won praise from Manhasset High School officials.

title: Man Arrested in Newark Called Prime Suspect in Killings Here
description: A 22yearold man arrested in Newark was described by the police yesterday as a prime suspect in the killing of two policemen on the Lower East Side last Jan. 27 and in the shooting of two other police men in Harlem.

title: A Retirement Community Where the Residents Refuse to Act Their Age
description: SUN CITY CENTER, Fla. (AP)  Pat Healy, who is 81 years old and was a professional baseball player in the World War I era, plays 18 holes of golf every day. Except when it rains.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: DRIVE FOR VOTERS IS CALLED LAGGING
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 5. The most heated political dis pute in Westchester County, so far this year, is not between two candidates, but between the County Board of Elections and the McGovern Democrats, who charge the board with failing to seek out Westchester's large bloc of unregistered voters.

title: The World
description: WARSAWTrade is too important to be left to commercial ministers, Secretary of Commerce Peter G. Peter son told a Moscow press conference last Tuesday before leaving the Soviet capital for Warsaw. In those few words he appeared to explain why almost two weeks of negotiations between him and his opposite numbers in the Soviet commerce ministry failed to produce a single substantive agree ment.

title: SemiStrip Mining
description: Both houses of Congress have before them bills which purport to mitigate the evils of strip mining. Unless these measures, especially the one in the Senate, are greatly strengthened the mitigation will be negligible.

title: Carol A. Clare And S. L. Brown Plan Marriage
description: WESTFIELD, N.J., Aug. 5 The engagement of Miss Carol Anne Clare, a senior at Smith College, to Steven Lathrop Brown, a Dartmouth College senior, has been an nounced by Mr. and Mrs. David Ross Clare, parents of the bride. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Russell W. Brown.

title: C.B.'s Jimmy Wins by a Neck in Speedy Rodney Trot at Yonkers
description: YONKERS, Aug. 5A Holly wood scenario writer one day might write a script based on tonight's $25,000 Speedy Rod ney Trot at Yonkers Raceway. Surely, the onemile open handicap event, won in 2:02 by C.B.S.'s Jimmy, the wrong half of the George Phalen stable entry, had all the in gredients for a movie or a tele vision special.

title: BOERS TRIUMPH ON 11HIT ATTACK
description: MILWAUKEE, Aug. 5Man ager Del Crandall of the Brew ers called on Bill Parsons, his most effective pitcher in re cent games, to face the Yankees today and the gangling right hander had the answers. He tossed a fivehitter for a 40 victory.

title: Mrs. Norman Wed To Walter Farnham
description: RIVERSIDE, Conn., Aug. 5Mrs. Alice Browning Nor man, an editor with the Con overMast Industrial Purchas ing Directory in Stamford. was married here at noon today to Waller Farnham, a widower and real estate con sultant, of Bronxville, N. Y. The Rev. Dr. Howard Stone Anderson of the Second Con gregational Church in Green wich performed the ceremony at the bride's home.

title: VAN BLOM'S TEAM VICTOR IN SCULLS
The World
description: Mrs. Aristotle Onassis, the widow of President Kennedy, and her chil dren, Caroline and John Jr., often spend their summers on the Greek island of Skorpios, owned by Mrs. Onassis's husband. According to the Greek Government, their summer pres ence led to the hatching of a plot by opponents of the military junta in Athens. The scenario as laid out by the Government (and denied as a fabri cation by the defendants): The Ken nedy boy would be kidnapped and held for ransom, and the ransom money would be used to finance antiGovern ment activities.

title: Farewell to The South
description: Robert Coles says, in this collection of his essays and articles about the South, not one farewell but two. The first we have heard before from many sources: a farewell to the Old South of racial division and sectional alienation. The second is person al: after more than a dozen years of studying the Southor, to be more precise, Southerners  Coles is de claring through this book that his preoccupation with this subject is over; he is going on to other matters.

title: Dentist's Assailant in Court
description: VAN NUYS, Calif., Aug. 5 (AP)Tommy Watts Jr., 28 years old, convicted of at tempting to shoot his dentist after a shot of Novocain failed to relieve an aching tooth, re ceived a oneyear suspended jail sentence yesterday and was ordered to undergo psy chiatric treatment.

title: Time to Break the Silence Surrounding Paul Robeson?
description: playwright who is now teaching drama at the State University of New York at Binghamton.

title: A FROZEN KIDNEY RESTORED TO DOG
description: A team of Minnesota scientists has removed the kidney of a dog, frozen it for a short time, thawed it and returned it to the dog's body, where it sus tained the animal's life.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: WASHINGTON  Almost daily some militant environ mentalist or aggrieved indus trialist lobs what lie conceives to be a devastating charge: the allegation that the actions of the Environ mental Protection Agency and its administrator, Wil liam Doyle Ruckelshaus, are political in character.

title: Son to S. Mark Fines
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. S. Mark Fine of New Rochelle, N. Y., on July 6 in Doctors Hospital. Mrs. Fine is the former Miss Emily Alber, daughter of Mrs. David O. Alber of Hollywood, Fla.,

title: Science/ Medicine
description: Britain's system of government med ical care, the National Health Service, has been in existence for 24 years and has been regarded widely as one of the finest examples of socialized medicine. It is used by the rich as well as the poor, and it is generally true that everyone is accorded equal treatment No one is denied even the most costly treatment or operation because he lacks the means to pay for it.

title: He must be himself and also an impersonator
description: The American theater has never produced a complex theoretician or visionary mind on the order of Stanislayski, Artaud, Brecht or Gro towski, nor until recently any stage company with a distinctive, internal ly evolved style and artistic philoso phy. Joseph Chaikin may not be of the stature of the prophetic Euro peans I have mentioned but his ideas and example have done as much to bring maturity to the stage here during the last 10 years or so as those of anyone else I know, just as his group, the Open Theatre, has come closer than any of our other companies to the spirit of the great, principled, risk taking European ensembles.

title: Man With a Vowel Shortage
description: Sports of The Times

title: Designed for easy living Retirement dream house
description: Libraries, family rooms, split levels and all the other enticements spelled out in real estate ads couldn't tempt the owners of this new house in West chester County. A mature couple, they planned their retirement residence on the experience of years of living in one inconvenient house after another. A few goodsized rooms all on one level that could be easily maintained this was all they cared about. And they got it (and more, too) in this elegant house with restrained modern lines designed by architects Kroeger Perfido. It's a rectangle linked to an octagonal pavilion with windows that open on a panorama of upper Man hattan and the Hudson River. The house sits in the midst of woods. The manicured lawn is only 40 by 60 feet, deliberately limited to keep it manage able so that keeping up the grounds would be a pleasure, not a chore. No stairs to climb was a must to the clients so the architects placed the living room, dining area, kitchen and master bedroom off the spacious hall way linked to the front entrance. Grown children weren't forgotten, however. At the back, the house is twostories high; the lower level con tains a garage, three guest rooms, each with bath, for visiting children and grandchildren. That level can be closed off; the upper living floor is a selfsufficient unit. To heighten the feeling of spaciousness, the same materials are used throughout the up per level. The slate floor of the entry (above) continues into the dining area (top left) and kitchen (center). The redwood paneling of ceiling and walls also covers the kitchen cabinets. In the living room (left) lounge chairs on casters circle a cocktail table in the windowed octagon, which offers a superb view of the city and the George Washington Bridge in the distance.

title: It Took Tons of Work to Get Guerin Into Racing's Hall of Fame
description: Many great jockeys have ridden their way into the National Museum of Racing Hall of Fame on historic Union Ave in Saratoga. But Eric Guerin, one of this year's inductees to the shrine, diet ed as well as rode his way in

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 (UPI)Senator Robert J. Dole of Kansas, Republican National Chairman, said to day the party would demand free television time to re spond to Senator George McGovern's 15minute broad cast address announcing he had chosen Sargent Shriver as his VicePresidential run ning mate.

title: Criminals At Large
description: As mysteries go, there is nu great mystery in Nicolas Free ling's AUPRES DE MA BLONDE (Harper & Row, $5.95). Early on, the criminal(s) and crime(s) are made clear, and the only question is how retribution is going to be made. But Freeling can always be depended upon for something different, some thing that puts his books into a special class, and he does not disappoint in Aupres de Ma Blonde. Indeed, there is a stunning surprise here, involv ing his popular Inspector (now Commissaris) Van der Valk of Ams'erdam.

title: Suburban Population of Foreign Stock Grows 150,000 in Decade
description: There was an increase of nearly 150,000 residents of foreign birth or parentage chiefly Italiansin Nassau, Suffolk, Westchester and Rock land counties during the nine teensixties.

title: HAZEL ANDERSON
description: LYNN, Mass., Aug. 5 (UPI) Hazel Anderson, woman's edi tor for The Daily Evening Item for more than 30 years, died late yesterday at the age of 63.

title: Podgorny Optimistic on Ties
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 5 (Reuters)1 President Nikolai V. Podgorny told a group of visiting Egyptian legislators today he was con fident that friendly relations between the Soviet Union and Egypt would continue. It was the first such public remark by a Soviet leader since President Anwar elSadat called for the withdrawal of Soviet advisers last month.

title: Greece Denies U.S. Statements That Bases Help Protect Israel
description: ATHENS, Aug. 5The mil itarybacked Government con tradicted today official state ments from Washington, that Greece was a United States outpost for the protection of Israel and reaffirmed its friend ship with the Arabs.

title: Fire Rules for Office Buildings Will Go Into Effect Tomorrow
description: New fire safety regulations that will require periodic fire drills and other protective ineas ures in about 1,000 highrise office buildings in the city will go into effect tomorrow.

title: Police Patrol on Bicycles Sharply Cuts Crime in Baltimore Alleys
description: BALTIMORE  These are halcyon days in East Balti more, according to the local police. Drunks no longer drape the marble stoops. Crap shooters no longer kneel in alleys. Young hood lums and pimps rarely loiter near corner saloons. Along a sixblock beat of East Lom bard Street, a stretch usu ally entered with foreboding, there has been only one fel ony so far this year  a purse snatching.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONThe joke was al most a week old before real life caught up with it. Ed, I'd like you to be my running mate, the imaginary phone conversation began. George, came the reply, I'm flabbergasted. Before you change your mind, let me think about it a while.

title: Third Woman in Jersey Named to Head Schools
description: MONTVALE  In 1965, when Joan Abrams was studying for her doctorate in educational administra tion at New York University, her professor told her that the school had placed only one woman as a school superintendent.

title: Harvard Vacancy Filled
description: David B. Matthews, 29 years old, assistant director of sports information at Harvard for the last three years, will become the university's director of sports information on Sept. 1. Matthews succeeds Ron Can tera, who resigned to pursue a career in broadcasting and public relations.

title: World News Briefs
description: SANTIAGO Chile, Aug. 5 Chile's opposition parties have told the leftist Government coalition that they will support a single slate in congressional elections next March.

title: . . . The Hidden War
description: The shift from ground to air in the focus of American military activities in Indochina has meant a shift from units based in South Vietnam to combat groups operating from air bases in Thailand and carriers at sea. The result has been a drastic cut in the visibility of the war to the American people, who must still bear the moral arid financial burdens of this interminable conflict.

title: 5 Miles of Wire Stolen Along Tracks in Maine
description: BANGOR, Me., Aug. 5 (AP) The Bangor and Aroostock Railroad has been victimized by the theft of almost five miles of communications wires strung alongside its tracks, a spokesman said Tuesday.

title: Yacht Watchers to Get Olympic Eyeful
description: News of Boating

title: Anne G. Manice Engaged to Wed Edmond Jousselin
description: The engagement of Miss Anne Guestier Manice to Edmond de La Haye Jous selin has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Hayward F. Manice of New York. Her fiance is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Bertrand de La Haye Jousselin of Paris.

title: Miss Toussaint Qualifies For Munich 800 Meters
description: CHAMPAIGN, III,, Aug. 5 Cheryl Toussaint of Brooklyn's Atoms Track Club ran in a spe cial Olympic training camp race today and officially qualified to represent the United States in Munich at 800 meters by beat ing the Olympic qualifying time. Miss Toussaint also is a mem ber of the United States 1,600 meter relay team.

title: Mrs. Goldin Has Son
description: A son was born July 24 to State Senator and Mrs. Harrison J. Goldin of the Bronx in Mount Sinai Hos pital. Mrs. Goldin is the former Miss Diana C. Stern of Brooklyn. The child, the couple's second son, has been named Matthew Nicholas.

title: Katherine Lucile Barney Wed To William P. Holmes, Banker
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR, L. I., Aug. 5Miss Katherine Lucile Barney and William Paul Holmes were married here this afternoon. The Rev. T. Carleton Lee performed the ceremony in St. John's Episcopal Church, The Rev. James Trimble, chaplain at Episcopal Academy, where the bridge taught for three years, assisted.

title: CHINA IS JUBILANT OVER SADAT MOVE
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 5 China is jubilant over President Anwar el Sadat's decision to expel Soviet military advisers from Egypt.

title: Says Andr Malraux:
description: VERRIERESLEBUISSON, France: Tall atop the green hill over ColombeyIesdeuxEglises, a great stone Cross of Lorraine has been raised, just as Charles de Gaulle told Andre Malraux it would be adding that, since nobody would see it, it would incite the rabbits to resist. The cross was dedicated on June 18, the anniversary of de Gaulle's 1940 appeal to the defeated French. It was a subdued affair; the de Gaulle family and a few Companions of the Liberation stood on one side, all but ignoring the notables, including President Georges Pompidou, a nonresistant.

title: LEGAL IMMUNITY ATTACKED IN ITALY
description: ROME, Aug. 5Parliamen tary immunity, provided by the Italian Constitution, has come increasingly under attack here by members of various politi cal groups.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5We went to Washington. It was August. The air was like glue. In the evenings we sat in houses that reeked of moss and talked about power, death, seniority and traffic. There was a lot of hyste ria about the VicePresidency of the United States.

title: Battle Rages Over Shuttering of Famous Irving Hotel
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I. This village hopes to resolve this month a zoning battle that has shuttered the cen turyold, Irving Hotel for its first summer season in 62 years.

title: That Old Devil Moon
description: THERE seems to be a new policy in effect at the New York Shake speare Festival. For the second summer in a row, the second of the Festival's three productions In Central Park is a musicala musical, moreover, not entirely devoid of refer ences to black peoplea musical which is scheduled to tour the five boroughs on the Festival's Mobile Theater after Its run in the park. Last summer there was the famous superintegrated musical version of Two Gentlemen of Verona; but whereas Two Gentlemen was at least ostensibly by Shakespeare, this year's show is a Folk Fable with an allblack cast, entitled TiJean and His Brothers, by the Trinidadian play wright Derek Walcott.(Especially when its narra tor is a frog, who passes the time of day with a cricket, a bird and a firefly.) But simplicity, in this world, can be very hard to come by especially for sophisticated literary persons.

title: Son to Mrs. Peck 3d
description: A son was born July 27 to Dr. and Mrs. Robert Gray Peck 3d at the New York LyingIn Hospital. Dr. Peck is assistant professor of Eng lish literature at Union Col lege. The child, the couple's second son, has been named Matthew Canfield Roberts. Mrs. Peck, the former Anne Elliott Roberts of Scarsdale, N. Y., has four sons by her first marriage.

title: A New Church Formed For Ousted Minister
description: ATHENS, Ala., Aug. 5(AP) A Church of Christ minis ter who was dismissed be cause his daughter had worn a bathing suit in a beauty contest has been named Min ister of a church established by his supporters.

title: U.S. QUINTET WINS IN PARALYMPICS
description: HEIDELBERG, Germany, Aug. (UPI)Denver Branum of Wayne, Mich., scored 12 points today to lead the American basketball team to a 6335 victory over France in the Paralympics at the University of Heidelberg.

title: G.O.P. Leaders Look for Pizzazz
description: The Brooklyn and Queens Republican organizations have had a reputation in recent years of going down like the Titanic every Elec tion Day.

title: CARLTON WINS 17TH FOR PHILS, 5 TO 0
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 5 (UPI) Tworun home runs by Bill. Robinson and Greg Luzinski gave the Philadelphia Phillies a 5.0 victory tonight as Steve) Carlton stopped his former St. Louis Cardinal teammates on five hits.

title: The World
description: LONDONIt looked like a gettough move against labor. Yet the declara tion of a state of emergency in Britain last Thursday, giving the Government sweeping powers to break the 10day old national dock strike, was really way of avoiding a confrontation.

title: Date Set for Navy Shift
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 (AP) Adm. Noel A. M. Gaylor will replace Adm. John S. McCain Jr. as commanderinchief, Pa cific, on Sept. 1, the Pentagon said this week. No date had been given when the shift was 1first announced in March.

title: Yemeni Leader Denies Report
description: CAIRO, Aug. 5 (UPI)The Premier of Yemen, Moshen al Aini, today denied that his Gov ernment had asked the Soviet Union to close strategic bases and withdraw military advisers and experts from his country.

title: Town Hearing Is a Step to Stop Busing
description: MONTCLAIR  As part of a strategy to eventually stop the busing of elementary school children, the recently elected Montclair Town Commission will hold a pub lic hearing Tuesday in Town Hall on its proposal to in crease from five to seven members the size of the Board of Education, which set up the busing plan.

title: So Far, U. S. Olympic Team Looks Good, Feels Good and Sounds Good
description: OSLO, Aug. 5  A group of Italian journalists, curious over having spotted a few American athletes socializing in a local pub, wondered whether discipline problems had set in on the United States olympic track and field team.

title: Kathy Whitworth's 68 Ties Knoxville Record and Gains Her 4Stroke Lead
description: KNOXVILLE, Term., Aug. 5 (AP)Kathy Whitworth tied the Deane Hill course record to day with a 3underpar 68 and grabbed a commanding 4stroke lead in the Knoxville Ladies golf tourney with a 36hole total of 139.

title: ElectricViolin Concerto Shocks Some
description: LENOX, Mass., Aug. 5  The very idea of writing a violin concerto in which the solo in strument is electronically am plified is a natural bloodpres sure raiser. Outrageous on the face of it to many listeners and musicians, it seems a vul gar denial of at least the last 300 years of Western music.

title: Reapportionment Snag Perils Connecticut Election
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 5  Poli ticians and constitutional ex perts in Connecticut share a growing feeling that elections for the General Assembly may not take place on schedule in November because of a pro tracted fight over reapportion ment of legislative districts.

title: Holzman Refuses to Say RikerKnick Pact Is Near
description: Red Holzman, the general manager and coach of the New York Knicks, yesterday re fused to confirm a report that the Knicks were ready to sign a contract with Tom Riker of the University of South Caro lina, New York's first pick in the National Basketball Asso ciation's college draft.

title: Vikings' Gilliam Injured
description: MANKATO, Minn., Aug. 5 (AP)John Gilliam, a wide re ceiver, dislocated a finger to night in a warmup drill prior to the Minnesota Vikings' annual intrasquad game, which drew more than 10,000 fans to Man kato State's Blakesley Stadium.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  A kind of dialogue of the deaf is going on between the Nixon Administration and the Democratic Congress over steeply rising Govern ment spending and deficits. Part of the reason is polit ical. But a major part of the reason is that a large number of Congressmen, per haps a majority, apparently do not understand how they add to the Government's budget totals.

title: Business At Schools For Drivers In Reverse
description: Owners of automobile driving schools in Queens and Brooklyn are complain ing about poor business this summer. It has fallen off about 15 to 30 per cent, they say, and in some areas the figure is put as high as 40 to 50 per cent, as compared with last year.

title: American and Israeli Jews Reappraise Their Ties to the Left and Find They Are Now Tenuous
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 5Israeli and American Jewish scholars this week conducted what onel of them described as an ago nizing reappraisal of the re lationship between the Jewish people and the political left.

title: Priscilla Scofield McNeary Is Married
description: NEWFANE, Vt., Aug. 5 Miss Priscilla Scofield Mc Neary, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William G. McNeary of Laurel Hollow, L. I., and Newfane, was married here this afternoon to Barrett Farley Welch Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Welch of New York and Oyster Bay, L. I.

title: Denise Griffin Fiancee of Philip Walker
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Aug. 5The engagement of Miss Denise Marie Griffin to Philip Nelson Walker has been an nounced by Dr. and Mrs. William R. Griffin, parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Mrs. Al bert Baldwin Walker of West Hartford, Conn., and the late Mr. Walker.

title: War, Economy Top Issues in Poll Backing Democrats
description: The Vietnam war and eco nomic problems are the princi pal concerns of American voters, according to a Gallup Poll based on interviews con ducted in midJuly.

title: DR. REUBEN J. HOLLAND
description: LINDEN, N. J., Aug. 5Dr. Reuben J. Holland, a physician here for almost 50 years, died yesterday at a nursing home in Union. He was 75 years old and lived at 2015 North Wood Avenue.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A series of public hearings on corruption in the build ing industry is scheduled to begin tomorrow at City Hall. State Senator Roy M. Goodman, chairman of the Senate Committee on Housing and Urban Development, said his committee would call city officials, contractors, architects, inspectors and others over a period of several weeks in an effort to find ways to reduce graft.

title: The World
description: SAIGONOn the evening of May 20, Communist cadres assembled about 500 people in the hamlet of Binh chuong in northern Binhdinh province and recited a list of crimes they said had been committed by Nguyen Xuan Phong, the Social Affairs Commission er of Hoaiduc village. As Mr. Phong, his arms tied behind him, knelt on the road that runs through Binh chuong, the chairman of the Hoaiduc People's Revolutionary Committee asked the crowd: Is this man worthy of being shot dead?

title: RESIDENTS ENJOY PREVIEW OF FALL
description: Blankets and gooseflesh were the order of the dawn yester day as a Canadian cold front dipped temperatures to 59 de grees, within touching dis tance of a record low for midsummer's morning.

title: Barbara Koch Is Bride
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Aug. 5The marriage of Miss Barbara Jean Koch, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Warren H. Koch, to Jeffrey Cole Hickok, son of Mr. and Mrs. Fred crick C. Hickok of Keene, N. H., took place here this afternoon in the Episcopal Cathedral of the Incarnation. The Rev. Daniel Miner per formed the ceremony.

title: Twins Defeat Blue And the A's, 4 to 0
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Aug 5  Dick Woodson shut out the Oakland A's 40 on five hits. today as the Minnesota Twins took their second straight game from the American League Western Division leaders.

title: COWBOYS RALLY TO BEAT OILERS
description: DALLAS, Aug. 5 (AP)Toni Fritsch kicked four field goals tonight to give the Dallas Cow boys a 2624 preseason victory over the Houston Oilers tonight) in a National Football League preseason game.

title: Christine Almy Becomes Bride
description: HANOVER, N. H., Aug. 5 The marriage of Miss Chris tine Pattison Almy, a 1972 graduate of Radcliffe College, to George Jameson Bachrach, who graduated last year from Harvard, took place here this afternoon. The Rev. Park P. Dickerson performed the ceremony in the Church of Christ, Congregational.

title: Miss Nelson Married To Robert M. Bullock
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., Aug. 5Miss Lenore Marie Nel son, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Edward Nelson of Ridgewood, was married here at noon today to Robert Michael Bullock of Arlington, Va. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Everett Bullock of McLean and Glebe Harbor, Va.

title: U. S. Officials Oppose Penalties On Thailand to Stem Drug Flow
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5Of ficials of the State Department and Bureau of Narcotics and Dangerous Drugs are telling all who will listen that the way to persuade the Government of Thailand to halp stein the flow of narcotics from Southeast Asia is by cooperating with the Thaisnot by imposing penal ties.

title: Economics Make City Turn to Foreign Sources for Equipment Purchases
description: The city's Department of Water Supply needed butterfly valves and was looking around for a manufacturer to supply, them. The lowest American bidder, Westinghouse, asked $11million. A Japanese com pany said it could do the job for $10million. The contract went to Japan.

title: McGovern Forces Appoint Coordinator in This State
description: Joseph Grandmaison of New Hampshire has been named co ordinator of Senator George McGovern's New York State campaign. Mr. Grandmaison, who is 29, will be aided by Ed ward Rogoff, who was coordi nator for the McGovern pri mary campaign in the state.

title: OldeTime GlassBlowing Born Anew at Flemington
description: FLEMINGTON  Long famed as a citadel of the glassmaker's exacting craft, this Hunterdon County seat will soon offer visitors an un usual chance to see glass blown much as it was in Co lonial times.

title: Anne Adams Fiancee Of Robert Rabbino Jr.
description: BRUNSWICK, Ga., Aug. 5 Miss Anne Douglas Adams and Robert Andre Rabbino Jr., graduates of Brown Uni versity, plan to be married Aug. 26. Miss Adams works for the Chase Manhattan Bank in New York, and Mr. Rab bino with the First National City Bank.

title: Rams Top Browns, 133
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 5 (AP) Isiah Robertson's 36yard run with a teammate's fumble led the Los Angeles Rams to a 13.3 victory over the Cleveland Browns last night in the first season exhibition for both Na tional Football League teams.

title: Miss McCabe Has Nuptials
description: HAVERSTRAW, N.Y., Aug. 5  Miss Joan Mercedes McCabe was married here this afternoon in St. Peter's Roman Catholic Church to Kevin Vincent Carey. Msgr. William Dennen performed the ceremony assisted by Msgr. William Flannery.

title: Huntington Is Offering Class In Windsurfing
description: CENTERPORT, L. ICom bine a 13yearold boy with a surfboard, a mast and an attached sail, and they equal a new summer sport here: windsurfing.

title: The Levi Lifestyle
description: SAN FRANCISCOWhen Levi Strauss, a Bavarian Jewish immigrant, came here in 1850 to join the California Gold Rush, he didnt exactly discover gold. But he did come up with an idea that has proved to be golden both to the corporation bearing his name and the relatives who have succeeded him at its helm.

title: Everything but the real news
description: The American newsreel was an unhappy creature, caught midway be tween journalism and sideshow, never able to decide whether to in form or to entertain. Newsreels en joyed great popularity in the 1930's and 1940's, becoming as much a part of the moviegoing experience as popcorn or Spencer Tracy. The eight or ten minutes of war, sports, fashion and novelties were something the audience expected, knew how to handle and regretted in its absence. It was a foolhardy theater owner or distributor who omitted the newsreel from his program and only the small est studios failed to establish a news reel operation of some nature.

title: Airplane Kit Planned At Price of New Car
description: DAYTON, Ohio, Aug. 5 (UPI)An engineering com pany has announced it planned to sell a doityour self airplane kit for about the price of a new automo bile.

title: Reds Beat Braves, 42
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 5 (AP) Pete Rose tripled and raced home with the goahead run on an error and Johnny Bench fol lowed with a home run in the eighth inning, lifting the Cin cinnati Reds to a 42 victory over the Atlanta Braves to night.

title: The World
description: PRAGUEA group of about 25 per sons stood silently in one of the nar row, gloomy corridors of Prague's central courthouse. They had gathered there in the early morning to lend support to three friends whose trial for subversion was to begin at 8 A.M. The trial last Monday, though techni cally open to the public, was in effect closed to sympathizers of the defend ants (and to the Western press). But the group in the corridor had been per mitted to spend the day outside the courtroom during earlier subversion trials, and they were set for another long vigil.

title: Mrs. King Upset in Georgia
description: COLUMBUS, Ga., Aug. 5 (AP)  Fifthseeded Francoise Durr of France dropped the first set but rallied today to upset topseeded Mrs. Billie Jean King in the semifinals of the $25,000 Virginia Slims ten nis tournament. The scores were 26, 62, 62.

title: Turned Off By Appliances
description: Why can't the big manu facturers make it big with small appliances?

title: Ingraham Captures Lead
description: AMITYVILLE, L.I., Aug. 5 Talbott. Ingraham, a twotime national class champion, took the lead today in the Comet Class competition for the Long Island Bowl. Ingraham, who sails for the Shrewsbury. (N.J.) Yacht Club, posted a first and a second.

title: CHINESE POPULATION IS BELOW ESTIMATES
description: PEKING, Aug. 5 (Agence FrancePresse)  China's popu lation in 1970 was 697,260,000, according to the first overall official population figures re leased here in several years.

title: RUMANIA TRYING TO MOLD NEW MAN
description: BUCHARESTA new per sonality emerged the other day at Rumania'ss Communist party conference in Bucharest. He was the New Socialist Man, or President Nicolae Ceausescu'ss vision of tomor row'ss Communist citizen.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: The first successful English colony in what eventually be came part of the United States was founded not by priest nor nobleman nor conquistador but by a business company. Busi ness interests have dominated our society ever since. As Cal vin Coolidge put it, with unac customed profundity, The busi ness of America is business. Because historians have fa vored other activities (usually politics) for their central themes, this book by the presi dent of the American Historical Association is innovative and important.

title: The Nation
description: UPPER MARLBORO, Md.Cana dians make the lousyest apple pie, so dry, you ever tasted, Arthur Herman Bremer told his frequently misspelled diary as he drove to Ottawa last April with the intention of shooting Presi dent Nixon.

title: Draft AbortionReform Plank Being Written at White House
description: The question of abortion re form, on which the Democrats rejected a strong position at their national convention last month, is apparently in the hands of White House strate gists as well as the feminists in these days before the Republi can National Convention in Mi ami Beach.

title: Okker, Lutz Triumph and Gain Final of $50,000 U.S. Pro Tennis
description: CHESTNUT HILL, Mass., Aug. 5Tom Okker saved 4 set points and won two tiebreaker games to beat Arthur Ashe, 76, 76, 63 today and advance to the final of the $50,000 United States professional tennis cham pionship.

title: Social Announcements
description: Births

title: Mumbo Jumbo
description: The Norton Anthology of Poetry spans the centuries from Chaucer to Reed. Whether he likes it or not, Ishmael Reed has for some time now occupied a black outpost in a white landscape. To judge from his new book, he doesn't like it much. His latest work, written with black humor, is a satire on the unfinished race between the races in America and throughout history. It is a book of deliberate unruliness and sophis ticated incongruity, a dazzling maze of blackandwhite history and fantasy, injokes and outrage, erudi tion and superstition. Not only to white readers like myself wilt the way into and out of this maze be puzzling. For though it's a novel, the author's method is not novelistic. Wholly original, his book is an un holy cross between the craft of fiction and witchcraft.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: During his long tenure as The Times's Sunday editor, Lester Markel devised and honed the format for its Review of the Week, a summaryplusinter pretation of developments around the world; it has proved highly popular and use ful for several generations of readers. In this large paper bound book, Mr. Markel ap plies the same technique to the state of the world at mid1972. The emphasis is on politics the rivalries of the U.S.A., U.S.S.R. and China; trouble spots in Latin America, the Middle East, Africa and Asia but there are crisp, informative looks at the space program, population growth and its con sequences, jobs and trade, com munications, even religion. The three dozen contributors, all Times correspondents and edi tors, include Harrison Salis bury, Max Frankel, Drew Mid dleton, Seymour Topping, An thony Lewis and Tillman Dur din. As befits a work created in collaboration with that leading atlas publisher, Rand McNally, there is a profusion of color maps, cartoons, graphs and photographs that illuminate the text and in some cases merit study in themselves. A good book to keep beside the TV set for those times when the little screen raises more questions than it answers.

title: JOHN S. WILSON'S Music
description: NORTH ARLINGTON After two years of traipsing around northern New Jersey, the Wild Colonial Boys, a quartet that sings Irish songs with a difference, has settled into a home of their own, the Jug o' Punch, a club owned jointly by two, members of the quartet.

title: New Way to Fly: By Kite or Chute Towed by a Boat
description: NORTHPORT, L. I.  A speedboat roared forward. Behind it, a weird kite con traption with a man in front lurched, skimmed the surface and then became airborne. Leo Kopsachilis was flying again.

title: KEY TO THE MINT SARATOGA VICTOR
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 5Key to the Mint again showed his disdain for older rivals as he romped to success in the $57,250 Whitney Stakes today.

title: Doubles Play Rained Out
description: BUCHAREST, Rumania, Aug. 5 (AP)The doubles match of the interzone Davis Cup semi final between Australia and Rumania was postponed today because of heavy rain.

title: Physical for Mazeroski
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 5 (AP) Bill Mazeroski has returned here to undergo examination of a shoulder injury suffered on the club's current road trip, the Pittsburgh Pirates announced. The 35yearold second base man was injured Wednesday night in St. Louis when he wade a diving attempt to pre vent a base hit.

title: KENNEDY BENEFIT TO AID MEMORIAL
description: A daylong tennis tournament involving a mixed bag of stars  both political and theatrical  and professional tennis players, will be the first fundraising event for the Robert F. Kennedy Memorial Foundation.

title: Workers Accept Pay Cut
description: MENTOR, Ohio, Aug. 5 (AP) Faced with a threatened loss of their jobs, members of United Auto Workers Local 483, who are employed at the National Screw and Manufacturing Com pany here, have voted to ac cept a 4.5 per cent pay cut. The workers' base pay has been $4.22 an hour. Company and union officials said that the workers would actually have greater earning potential under a new contract because of the removal of a ceiling on incen tive pay.

title: JOINT FORCE RAIDS COAST DRUG CULT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5  Fiftyseven persons connected with Timothy Leary's sex and drug sect, the Brotherhood of Eternal Love, were arrested or indicted and large quantities of LSD, hashish, hashish oil, cocaine, mescaline and mari juana were seized in dawn raids in California, Oregon and Ha waii today, the Bureau of Narcotics and Dangerous Drugs announced.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: The sorcery's in the sauce
description: This version of a classic steak prepa ration may look daunting, but in truth it only takes minutes if you have veal stock on hand. Time, of course, will have to be found to make veal stock in advance (practical people will make more than they need and freeze the remainder for future use).

title: New Lift for OldFashioned Femininity
description: Stand before a mirror in the privacy of your room and say to yourself, I am just a helpless woman at the mercy of you big, strong men. . . . Stand before the mirror and say to yourself, I expect you to pamper and humor me. With this thought in mind, try a pretty pout, stick out your lower lip as much as to say, I thought you liked me. Or stamp your feet daintily, saucily, and shake your curls as much as to say, I am furious, but what can a little girl like me do with a big, strong man like you? After per fecting this before the mirror, practice this exercise upon practice this exercise upon man you meet.

title: TAX DEBATE DUE IN WESTCHESTER
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 5 Westchester County's first sales tax goes into effect on Sept. 1, and the county's cities, towns and school districts are squab bling over how to apportion the $60million or more a year the county is expected to take in.

title: ROCKLAND WEIGHS COUNTY ASSESSING
description: NEW CITY, N. Y. Aug. 5 Rockland County is considering removing the propertyassess ment function from its five towns and 13 villages and han dling all assessment at the county level.

title: Lynn Wiskari Is Bride of Derek Reid
description: Miss Lynn Eleanor Wis kari, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Werner Wiskari of Flushing, Queens, and Charlestown, R.I., was mar ried here yesterday to Derek Jackson Reid, son of Mr. and Mrs. C. Jackson Reid of Chal font, Pa. The Rev. Ronald Fink performed the ceremony in the Lutheran Church of the Resurrection in Flushing.

title: Spitz Wins His Fourth Event In U.S. Olympic Swim Trials
Radial Tires Stir Battle in U.S. Rubber Industry
description: The rubber industry at the moment appears to agree on only one thing: The radial tire is the tire of the future.

title: Iroquios to Rebury Indian Bones Unearthed by Students Upstate
description: A Grand Council meeting of the Iroquis Confederacy decid ed yesterday that ancestral bones taken from an Indian burial ground by a Pennsylva nia professor of archaeology and 18 students out on a dig should be interred at the Onon daga reservation in Nedrow, N.Y.

title: Social Announcements
description: Weddings

title: The War Against the Good in Art
description: ASERIOUS commitment to serious art is a difficult position to hold today. Several years ago I took part in a symposium to discuss Is Painting Dead? Barbara Rose was moderator, and with me at the inquest were Robert Rauschenberg, Don Judd and Larry Poons. Suddenly, in the middle of it all, a man jumped up, ran to the front of the balcony and abused us hysterically for not talking about things more important, more real. It was immoral, he screamed, to go on about mere art with the horrors of Vietnam in headline.

title: Dodgers Beat Padres, 10. On Valentine's Hit in 8th
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 5 (AP) Bobby Valentine singled with two out in the eighth inning to drive in the only run as the Los Angeles Dodgers recorded a 10 victory over the San Diego Padres tonight.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: The Federal Government has criticized the franchise and regulatory systems in many American cities that limit free competition among taxicabs and jitneys and has suggested that the systems be abolished or modified to help meet urban transit needs.

title: The World
description: Use of marijuana, particularly among young people, has increased in Cana da about as much as in the United States in recent years, and has led to a widespread feeling that Canadian laws on marijuana are as outdated as American ones. In May, 1969, the Government of Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau established a special commission to investigate the problem. Last May the commission made its report. Estimating that at least one of every 18 Canadians had at least tried marijuana or its stronger derivative, hashish, the commission urged that use of both drugs be legalized.

title: Women as Police Must Stand Tall
description: TRENTON  Women who want to fill the shoes of patrolmen and firemen in New Jersey's 567 municipal ities will have to stand tall to get the jobs.

title: Stones and Southern
description: To the Editor:

title: Inside in East African Crater, The Drama of Life and Death
description: NGORONGORO CRATER, Tanza niaNgorongoro, the cone of a dead volcano, rises high above the plains of equatorial Africa. Several lodges are perched on its rim. Down in the crater itself, below the early morning clouds, down thousands of feet of green, steep, flowered slopes, live more than 25,000 magnificent animals.

title: Why Sadat packed off the Russians
description: CAIRO: President Anwar elSadat's expulsion Russian military advisers from Egypt is probably the most severe defeat the Soviet Union has suf fered since it began to buy friends and influence nations in the nonCommunist Third World. happened because the Soviets could no longer camouflage the basic ambivalence of their policy their posture as Egypt's stanchest advocate against Israel and their simultaneous quest for more salu brious relations with the United States.

title: Music
description: IT'S hard to imagine, from the outside, just what a music director's role is. His functions seem mys terious, ranging from the omnipotence of a dictator to the frivolousness or even the inconsequentiality of the artiste. He is a performer, but he makes choices that com mit more than the part of him that is a performer. He is not an administrator, but his undertakings require a sure sense of administra tion. When results are good they are accepted as more or less naturalthe product of good general manage ment. When they are not they are linked directly to the director's personality. So that the music director might make us think of what used to be said about film music: It is good when no one no tices it! Should anonymity therefore, be a music direc tor's goal?

title: Alessandroni, in Annina, Wins PredictedLog Test
description: The 19th annual Captain Bil lop predictedlog contest, con ducted by the Richmond ounty Yacht Club, was won by Hugh Alessandroni in his 35foot Annina today.

title: Music
description: UNITIL a few years ago, composers and other creative artists were expressing concern over reaching different kinds of audiences. They got ex posure in a metropolitan center such as New York City where they probably lived and worked. They oc casionally toured campuses, where they came into con tact with students and facul ty, The large, adult unspe cialized audiences in outlying communities seemed beyond the pale, yet these were people that they hoped to relate to. Local concert man agers who might be idealis tic enough to want to pre sent such creative artists did not have information about them or anyone to get it from.

title: BigMoney Winners in the State Lottery Find LifeStyles Mainly Unchanged
description: The New York State Lot tery Commission, trying to drum up business for the summer special drawing next month that offers a min imum top prize of $1million, is putting a lot of promotional effort behind a simple mes sage.

title: Miss Andrews, Fredrick Miley To Wed Sept. 9
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Aug. 5Miss Carole Andrews and Fredrick L. Miley plan to be married in the Round Hill Community Church here on Sept. 9.

title: The white poppy: the source of heroin.
Kittiwake Takes Matron
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 5 (AP) Kittiwake, carrying high weight of 122 pounds, closed strongly to win the $55,700 Matron Handicap by 11 lengths today before a crowd of 23,225 at Arlington Park. Blade 0 War, 401 shot, edged Barely Even for second in the 11mile grass race for fillies and mares. The winner paid $6, $3.80 and $2.80.

title: Nazi Wins Right to Rally
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 5 (UPI) Frank Collin, head of Chicago's Nazis, has been given permis sion to hold a rally in Mar quette Park. United States Dis trict Court Judge Hubert L. Will yesterday ordered the Chicago Park District to grant Mr. Collin's application for a rally permit in the Southwest Side Park on Aug. 27.

title: Nancy Whitaker, Allan L. Keysor, Lawyer, Marry
description: BARRINGTON, R. I., Aug. 5Miss Nancy Dyke Whit aker, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Anthony Whit aker of West Barrington, was married here this afternoon to Allan Lawrence Keysor, son of Mr. and Mrs. Darwin L. Keysor of Plattsburgh, N. Y. The ceremony in St. John's Episcopal Church was performed by the Rev. W. Owings Stone, assisted by the Rev. James Prest.
