description: The State Narcotic Addiction Control Commission has out standing warrants seeking to pick up 6,600 people, or 30 per cent of the 21,600 who have been admitted to its care since its start April 1, 1967.

title: Music: A Bach Travesty
description: If Lincoln Center officials in charge of the Mostly Mo zart Festival actually attend the concerts and read the pro gram notes, they must have been embarrassed about the Friday and Saturday concerts, which featured the New York Chamber Orchestra playing under the direction of Lukas Fuss.

title: Mine Kills 2 Soldiers
description: BELFAST, Monday, Aug. 7 (UPI)A landmine blasted a British army vehicle patrolling the countryside near the border town of Lisnaskea early today, killing two soldiers and injur ing two others. the countryside near the border town of Lisnaskea early today, killing two soldiers and injur ing two others.

title: RABBI WACHTFOGEL
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 6 Rabbi David Wachtfogel, spirit ual director of Congregation Ohel Jacob for 37 years, died yesterday of cancer in Einstein Hospital, His age was 59.

title: Suspect Held After Drugs Found in Airline Terminal
description: A 24yearold man was arrested last night after 80 pounds of unidentified pills and nine and a half pounds of marijuana were found in three lockers at the East Side Air lines Terminal, 39th Street and First Avenue, the police said. The suspect, Phillip Allen, of 5 Tudor City, was charged with possession of three marijuana cigarettes, pending further charges. He was seized after a threeblock chase when authori ties saw him approaching the lockers where the drugs had been found. The police said they believed the lockers were being used as a drop for couriers dealing in drugs.

title: CHILEAN BUSINESS THINKS DOLLARS
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 6 How can one buy a suit from a manufacturer for $20, sell it to a retailer for $15 and still make a profit of $6?

title: NameTag Suggestion Is Certain to Irk Police
description: One Knapp Commission recommendation certain to stir controversy within the Police Department is that all New York policemen be re quired to wear name tags on the outside of their uniforms.

title: Healthier Hospitals
description: Of all the lugubriously hilarious scenes in the movie Hospital, none was more macabre than the episode which a harried billing clerk kept impaling the maimed and dying in an emergency ward with demands for Blue Cross, Medicare or Medicaid numbers.

title: GEORGE YOUNG, 63, SWIMMER, IS DEAD
description: NIAGARA FALLS, Ontario, Aug. 6George Young, who made headlines as a 17year old in 1927 as the only swimmer in a field of 102 to complete a 22mile competition from Catalina Island to the Califor nia mainland, died today. He was 63 years old.

title: Inquiry Into Corruption in City Proves History Often Repeats
description: The worst dream of the mem bers of the Knapp Commission is that sometime around 1990 a group very much like them will hold a dramatic series of hearings, declare that police corruption in the city is wide spread and standardized, and recommend basic reforms to eliminate it.

title: Gary Player Regains P.G.A. Crown, Carding 72 for 281 and 2Shot Edge
description: BIRMINGHAM, Mich., Aug. 6 Gary Player, garbed in black as usual, regained the Profes sional Golfer's Association title today by two strokes over the course he claimed was the toughest in America. With a concluding twooverpar 72 for 281, the little South African who is the only foreign resident to win the event, beat the homebreds for the second time.

title: Zurich: Frisch's BestSelling Diary
description: Arts Abroad

title: Sports News in Brief
description: TALLADEGA, Ala., Aug. 6 (UPI)Leading by only inches through the final 100 miles, James Hylton of Inman, S.C., a Ford driver, won the Talladega 500 today for his first super speedway victory in eight years on the grand national circuit of the National Association for Stock Car Auto Racing.

title: Revenge for Mrs. Court
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 6 (AP) Mrs. Margaret Court, forecast ing a return to the form that made her the dominant figure in women's tennis in the 1960's, registered a 36, 62, 7.5 victory over Evonne Goola gong today in the final of the $42,500 Western tournament.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your recent editorial (Oil in Canadian Waters) covers two sub jects lightly and fumbles around with another, namely the Alaska oil pipe line.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: BUCHAREST, Aug. 6 (AP) Rumania moved into a 21 lead over Australia in the inter zone Davis Cup tennis semi finals today with a victory in the doubles. Ion Tiriac and Ilie Nastase beat Colin Dibley and Mal Anderson, 62, 62, 62, in a 75minute match.

title: MARIME0N SALE AT DESIGN RESEARCH 57th STREET.ADVT.
description: MARIME0N SALE AT DESIGN RESEARCH 57th STREET.ADVT.

title: Roundup: Aaron's 2d Homer of Day Beats Reds
Yellow Unmonster
description: The city taxicab, as every New Yorker knows, is a capricious yellow vehicle that swarms along the streets, clogging them on sunny days when walking is a pleasure and disappearing in times of rain, snow or sleet. At night and in certain sections of the city, the taxicab is also a vanishing species.

title: SCOTT UNIT AIDE SCORES CITY WASTE
description: The executive director of the Scott Commission said yester day that the state's investiga tion of city government had found widespread inefficiency rather than corruption. He esti mated that the inefficiency cost the city $100million a year.

title: Driver Is Held in Shooting Of 2 After Traffic Mishap
description: BEDFORD HILLS, N.Y., Aug. 6 (AP)One man was shot and killed and another was wounded early today by a man who ar gued with them about a traf fic accident he was involved in, the Bedford town police re ported.

title: Publishing Appointment
description: RICHMOND, Aug. 6 (UPI) Media General announced to day that Charles W. Crowder, business manager of Richmond Newspapers, had been ap pointed vice president and general manager of the Pied mont Publishing Company in WinstonSalem, N. C. The 53 yearold executive will suc ceed Donald J. Chipman, who is retiring at the end of the year.

title: INVENTORY GAINS SLOWED BY AGNES
description: The impact of Tropical Storm Agnes on production and in venlories was evident in July, according to a survey of the National Association of Pur chasing Agents released over the weekend.

title: CHURCHES ASSAILED IN SOUTH AFRICA
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Aug. 6  A report on apartheid and the churches in South Africa is to be pub lished this week, outlining the conflict between the state and what are known as the Eng lish churches in this country.

title: Miss Diane Wassman Is Bride Of David M. Darst in Suburb
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Aug. 6The Larchmont Avenue Presbyterian Church was the setting here this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Diane Elizabeth Wassman, daughter of Mr, and nics. Ed ward Robert Wassman of Larchmont and Brant Lake, to David Martin Darst, son of Mr. and Mrs. Guy Bewley Darst of Nashville. The Rev, Calvin De Vries performed the ceremony.

title: Spassky Wins and Trims Fischer's Lead to 2 Points
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Aug. 6 Gallantly fighting back, de termined to win a game he needed more than any in his career, Boris Spassky of the Soviet Union won the 11th game of the world champion ship chess match today.

title: A History of Commission
description: The Knapp Commission was created by Mayor Lindsay on May 21, 1970, to investigate the extent of police corruption and to recommend further efforts to combat corruption.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COUNCIL

title: Jets' Star Plays One Quarter as 49ers Lose, 17 to 10
description: Unlike last year, Joe Na math was alive and well after making his preseason debut in the Gator Bowl Saturday night against the San Fran cisco 49ers. But as usual the Jets' star was concerned about his knees.

title: Four Climb Mountain at Rio
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 6 (AP)Three Austrians and a West German reached the sum mit of Rio's Sugar Loaf Moun tain today and stated they were the first to climb the north face

title: Meredith Leads Shooting
description: CAMP PERRY, Ohio, Aug. 6 (AP)Bruce Meredith of Spar tanburg, S. C., took the first day lead in the smallbore prone of the national rifle championships today with a perfect 1,600 score.

title: Hess ShakeUp: Less Than Meets Eye
description: It doesn't make much dif ference, Leon always runs the show, whether his title is chief executive officer or chief office boy.

title: By Land and Sea, They Came for Music and a Colonial Picnic
description: JAMESTOWN, R.I., Aug. 6 Nothing, well almost nothing, went as planned but, accord ing to Mrs. Sydney L. Wright, many of the original ideas were a lot of baloney, so it didn't matter.

title: U.S. Profit Curb Forces Garfinckel to Cut Prices
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7  A retail conglomerate based here has instituted price reductions that will save consumers at least $284,000 by Oct. 31 in order to comply with profit restrictions under Phase Two guidelines.

title: TRANSPORT STOCK ADDED BY EASTERN
description: Eastern Freight Ways, Inc. announced yesterday that it had purchased an additional 98,400 shares of the common stock of Associated Transport, Inc. at an average price of about $13.385.

title: STOP THE MUSIC TRIUMPHS Al SPA
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 7  The Greentree Stable silks were on display in the winner's circle today to signal ize that outfit's first stakes vic tory of the current campaign, after Stop the Music won the $28.575 Saratoga Special. The event, run for the 70th time, attracted a field of nine 2 yearolds, and Jacinto Vasquez guided Stop the Music to suc cess by a neck over the Ho beau Farm's Step Nicely.

title: Decker Accused of Shifting Philadelphia Bank's Money
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 7 (AP) Martin M. Decker, the bank rupt real estate developer, was accused today of putting money belonging to his own City Bank of Philadelphia into his ac counts in other banks. He was taking money out of the bank's pocket and putting it in his own, Assistant United States District Attorney Oliver Burt 3d told a District Court jury here.

title: CULTURAL OFFICE IN STATE SOUGHT
description: A proposal for a major con solidation of many state offices and functions into a single Office of Cultural Affairs was put forward publicly yester day, in a strictly preliminary fashion, by the New York State Commission on Cultural Resources.

title: Addicts' Defender Charged as a Fake
description: A 36yearold avowed heroine addict posed as a member of the bar and won acquittals for four fellow addicts in Brook lyn Criminal Court, the Fed eral Government charged yes terday.

title: Sony Cassettes Planned
description: The Sony Corporation of America said yesterday that it would supply nearly 4,000 UMatic color video cassette players for a new video tape system that the Ford Motor Company plans to use to up grade communications with Ford and LincolnMercury dealership personnel and cus tomers in North America.

title: ASPIN ACCUSES NAVY OF HASTE ON CLAIMS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (UPI) Representative Les Aspin said today that the Navy, fearful of cuts in its fund requests for the fiscal year 1973 if it did not spend $400million left in its old budget, rushed through millions of dollars of claims payments to defense contractors in June.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: The General Electric Com pany has been awarded a total of $209.9million in Navy con tracts, the company announced yesterday. Included in the total is $203.5million for re search, development and pro duction of nuclear ship reactor components. The remaining $6.4million will go for modi fication of jet aircraft engines.

title: Salomon Brothers to Assist Reading in Reorganization
description: Salomon Brothers, a leading investment banking firm, has been appointed as financial consultants to the Reading Company, a bankrupt railroad being reorganized.

title: TopRated Players Gain in Pro Tennis
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 7 (Reu ters)Seeded players performed according to form today in the first round of the Cleveland Classic tournament.

title: Bergen Planners Reject a Proposal On Road Widening
description: HACKENSACK, N. J., Aug. Bowing to widespread pub lic opposition, the Bergen Coun ty Planning Board tonight rejected a controversial amend ment to the county master plan that would have required the widening of county roads front ing new developments to 70 feet.

title: INCREASE SOUGHT IN GASOLINE PRICE
description: Price Changes

title: Detective Wounds Narcotics Suspect After Knife Threat
description: An undercover narcotics de tective shot and seriously wounded one man and cap tured a second last night after the two threatened him with butcher knives during a nar cotics transaction that the de tective had arranged in the East Village, the police said.

title: Car Blast in Jersey Kills Star Witness In a Narcotics Case
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., Aug. 7 A key witness in a $1million international narcotics smug gling case was killed here today when a bomb exploded in his car.

title: AIRLINE IN BRITAIN SEEKING TRISTARS
description: LONDON, Aug. 7Michael Heseltine, Britain's Aerospace Minister, announced today that British European Airways would buy six Lockheed Tristar jet liners and take an option on six more if Lockheed went ahead with plans to develop an extendedrange Tristar.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: MIDLAND, Tex., Aug. 7 (AP)A horde of grass hoppers, numbering in the millions, invaded the Texas League baseball park last night, causing umpires to suspend the second game of a doubleheader between Amarillo and Midland after a half inning.

title: Music: 2 One Act Operas at Berkshire
description: LENOX, Mass., Aug. 7 Tanglewood's newest baby, the Music Theater Project directed by Ian Strasfogel, is only in its second summer, but well beyond the crawl ing stage. Last night at the West Barn of the Berkshire Music Center, it offered two oneact operas of fairly mod est pretensions, but the young group will close its season next week with noth ing less than Monteverdi's The Coronation of Poppea, which is growing up in a hurry, operatically speaking.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: The Whirlpool Corporation yesterday announced plans to file later this week a registra tion statement with the Secu rities and Exchange Commis sion for a proposed secondary offering of 1.15 million com mon shares to be sold by un derwriters by Sears Roebuck & Co. and certain Sears affiliates. Sears has informed Whirlpool that the shares will be sold to diversify investment and to re duce its holdings of stock which can only be sold to the public after S.E.C. registration. After the sale Sears and its affiliates will retain ownership of 1,690, 238 Whirlpool shares. Whirlpool common closed yesterday on the New York Stock Exchange at 32, down 2.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Anyone who knows American his tory is aware that there have been land gyps in our country. One of the earliest may have been Peter Minuit's purchase of Manhattan from the In dians for sixty guilders in 1626.

title: Iran and West Talking
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Aug. 7 (AP) Iran and the Western oil con sortium are now engaged in se cret talks on the proposed con struction of a $500million oil refinery on Kharg Island in the Persian Gulf, national Iranian radio and television networks said today.

title: Yankee Fans Start to Scratch 8Year Itch
description: Pennant fever, a rather com mon American disease to which New York Yankee fans have been unhappily immune for eight years, will break out in mild form at Yankee Stadium the next few days. This after noon, the Yankees begin a fourgame series with the De troit Tigers and, for the first time since 1964, it is thoretical ly possible for them to wind up in first place by sweeping the series.

title: Report Finds Nation's Air Cleaner but Water Dirtier
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7The Council on Environmental Qual ity, in an expurgated edition of its third annual report on the state of the environment, said today that the nation's air was getting cleaner but that its water was growing dirtier.

title: UNITED AIRCRAFT RAISES EARNINGS
description: A better product mix and tighter cost controls enabled the United Aircraft Corpora tion to realize its best profit gains in the second quarter and half since 1965, the con cern said yesterday. Sales were lower in both periods, reflect ing the trend in the aerospace business.

title: FIVE ARE ACCUSED OF STOCK SWINDLE
description: A Federal indictment charged here yesterday that stock ma nipulators had paid almost $600,000 in bribes to two mu tualfund managers to buy al most $6million in securities for which the prices had been artificially inflated.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7  Sargent Shriver has a secret weapon and the Democratic Presidential campaign of Sen ator George McGovern is pre paring to employ it.

title: DR. JOHN T. BOWEN, AMF ENGINEER, 51
description: Dr. John T. Bowen, vice pres ident for engineering and sci ence of AMF, Inc., since 1970, died of cancer Saturday night in Doctors Hospital. He was 51 years old and lived at 340 West 22d Street.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7As all man kind knows by now, it was higher obligation to family that dissuaded Senators Kennedy and Muskie from accepting Senator McGovern's invita tion to become the Democratic candi date for Vice President. The reason others gave for rejecting it are not so well known, Here are a few:

title: COLTS GET DOMRES IN CHARGERS' TRADE
description: IRVINE, Calif., Aug, 7 (AP) The San Diego Chargers sent their backup quarterback, Marty Domres, to the Baltimore Colts today in exchange for a 1973 firstround draft choice and rookie tight end John Andrews, a team spokesman said.

title: The Eagleton Affair (cont.)
description: BOSTONThere are not many na tions on earth that launch with appar ent ease 1,000 sorties a day against a tiny Asian nation already blessed with the longest war of this century. That we condone such ritual slaughter with the regularity with which we pass the national budget might give a reasonable man cause to question our national sanity.

title: Stage AvantGarde At Horne in Lenox
description: LENOX, Mass., Aug. 7The Lenox Arts Center, located near Tanglewood on a 100 acre estate, has become a home away from New York for representatives of the American theatrical avant garde.

title: F. J. SCHAFFER JR.
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., Aug. 7 Frederick J. Schaffer Jr. of 4 Templeton Arms, retired assist ant treasurer in charge of mortgages at the Franklin So ciety Federal Savings Bank in New York City, died yesterday at the Elizabeth General Hos pital. His age was 67.

title: Steel Production Increased by 3.7% In the Aug. 5 Week
description: Steel production for the week ended Aug. 5 rose 3.7 per cent to 2,4444,000 net tons, the American Iron and Steel Insti tute reported yesterday. This compared with 2,356,000 tons poured in the preceding week, The steel production index rose to 100.2 from 96.6 a week ear lier. This was the first week since the June 24 week that the index had gone above 100.

title: Food Checks to Be Posted
description: TRENTON, Aug. 7 (AP) The New Jersey Health Depart ment announced today that it would require restaurants and food markets to conspicuously post inspection reports on sani tary conditions, starting by Oc tober.

title: U.S. SWIM TEAM IN RECORD SHAPE
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 7Thirteen world records were set and one tied as 28 women and 24 men won berths on the United States Olympic swimming team. The fiveday meet to select the squad closed yesterday at the Portage Park pool.

title: A Commercial Breeder Reactor To Be Built With Aid of T. V.A.
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Aug. (AP)  The nation's first com mercial type of fast breeder nuclear reactor power plant will be built near Oak Ridge, Tenn.

title: STOLport in Jersey Meadows Advised in U.S.Financed Study
description: TRENTON, Aug. 7A con fidential, federally financed study was reported here today to favor a Meadowlands site in Hudson County for a pro posed $100million shorttake offandlanding (STOL) airport to serve the New York metro politan region.

title: Australia Ousted by 41
description: BUCHAREST, Rumania, Aug. 7 (AP)Ion Tiriac and Ilie Nastase scored singles vic tories today as Rumania beat Australia, 41, and earned the right to meet the United States in the Davis Cup final.

title: PRESIDENT BACKS COMPROMISE MOVE ON ARMS ACCORD
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 The White House threw its public support today behind compromise proposal by Sena tor Henry M. Jackson to at tach Congressional understand ings to the interim agreement with the Soviet Union freezing the number of offensive mis siles.

title: Yacht RoundRobin Delayed
description: WESTHAMPTON, L. I., Aug. 7Start of the roundrobin se ries to determine the Great South Bay Yacht Racing Associ ation's Midget championship was postponed today because of winds out of the south which blew up to 25 knots. The com mittee will attempt to start the series tomorrow.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (AP)New United StatesChina trade relations point to no substantial market expansion for American farmers, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: KNAPP TO CARRY CASE TO ALBANY
description: Whitman Knapp and Gover nor Rockefeller's counsel are scheduled to meet in Albany this morning to discuss the Knapp Commission's proposal for the appointment of a special state prosecutor to deal with corruption in the criminal jus tice system in the city.

title: East Germany Retains Curb on Arts
description: EAST BERLIN  A young dropout who runs away from home and is killed in a freak ish accident figures as the unlikely hero in a new experi mental East. German theatri cal production.

title: I.R.A. SUPPORTERS LOSE COURT PLEA
description: The Irish Northern Aid Com mittee was ordered yesterday by a Federal judge to produce its books and records for in spection by the Justice Depart ment.

title: BULLISH MARKET ADVANCES AGAIN
description: Select glamour stocks, the mainstays of an erratic bull market that began two years ago, lived up to their billing again yesterday with some big gains.

title: Advertising:
description: The Bureau of Advertising of the American Newspaper Publishers Association, which recently completed a massive study of the working woman, has, not surprisingly, includ ed media exposure in its in vestigation. And, equally un surprisingly, it concluded that the big difference be tween the lady wage earner and the woman who stays at home can be summed up in five words: less television and more print.

title: Rotten Apples
description: We found corruption to be widespread.

title: Ohio Voting Rule Voided
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Aug. (AP)A Federal judge issued today a permanent restraining order striking down Ohio's six month residency requirement for voting. United States Dis trict Judge Carl Rubin enjoined eleection officials from enforc Ing the requirement.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Your July 29 editorial comment that Mario Cuomo's compromise proposal to halve the size of the Forest Hills housing project would cost New York City $2.4 million because of the inadequacy of existing Federal for mulas is more than a year behind the time.

title: Mrs. Remi Brooke Wed to John Coyle
description: Mrs. Remi Brooke, daugh ter of Senator Edward W. Brooke of Massachusetts and Mrs. Brooke, was married Saturday in St. Martin, French West Indies, to John Coyle, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Coyle of Watertown, Mass. About 50 relatives and friends of the couple at tended the ceremony, per formed by the Mayor of Marigot, on the terrace of the Brooke home near Marigot.

title: COURT BARS A SITIN AT MAGAZINE HERE
description: A temporary restraining order barring a group of young Puerto Ricans from taking over the offices and disrupting pub lication of New York Magazine was filed yesterday in State Supreme Court.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 President Nixon's campaign treasury took in more than $2.6million in individual con tributions during June and July, abotit half of it from small Idonors of $100 or less, a new Republican financial statement disclosed today.

title: U.S. Planes, in Cambodia, Said to Destroy 14 Tanks
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Aug 8 (AP)Amer ican jets wiped out 14 tanks supporting a new Communist, drive in Cambodia while, in the northern sector of South Vietnam, Government militia men repelled waves of enemy infantry that attacked their outposts, the allied commands reported yesterday.

title: Bremer Undergoing Tests
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 7 (UPI) Arthur Bremer, the convicted assailant of Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama, began series of psychiatric tests to day at the Maryland Peniten tiary. The tests will determine at which Maryland correctional facility the 21yearold Bremer will serve his 63year sentence.

title: NUCLEAR SHIFT SET BY WESTINGHOUSE
description: The Westinghouse Electric Corporation announced yester day what It called major changes in its nuclear energy systems organization. Theodore Stern, who was elected a vice president in the spring, was named to head the new water reactor divisions and will be assisted by E. W. Dubois as general manager for marketing. Dr. W. H. Arnold was chosen general manager of the pres surized water reactor division.

title: Communism: 125 Years Later
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil  Karl Marx thought that the proletariat was the class which was touched with the sense of the historical imperative the class which held the power to change the world. Does history con firm him?

title: Le Moyne Dean Named Head of Boston College
description: NEWTON, Mass., Aug. 7 (AP)Tne Rev. J. Donald Monan will assume duties as president of Boston College in the near future, college of ficials said today.

title: Special Containers Help Seatrain Ship Stewards
description: Port Notes

title: Arnin's Decision Broadened
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Aug. 7 (Reuters)President Idi Amin said tonight his decision to ex pel all Asians of British nation ality would be extended to cover all noncitizens who were sabotaging Uganda's economy.

title: Gerken Upsets Vilas
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 7 (AP) Guillermo Vilas of Argentina, who was seeded 16th, was eliminated today in the opening round of the $60,000 national clay court tennis champion ships. Most of the 30 scheduled matches were postponed be cause of wet courts from an overnight rain.

title: Ryun to Run Aug. 16
description: LAWRENCE, Kan., Aug. 7 (AP)The world mile record holder, Jim Ryan, will run Aug. 16 in the Jayhawk Twilight track meet, only 10 days be fore the Olympic Games begin.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7The board of governors of B'nai B'rith, a 500,000member Jew ish service organization, said here today that it would look with disfavor on attempts to make partisan political capital out of American relations with Israel.

title: Prisoner of the Vietcong for 23 Days, She Calls the Experience Rewarding
description: The world thought she was dead and cremated. But she was alive, a prisoner of the Vietcong in Cambodia. And she returned to read her own death notices.

title: Toronto Exchange Closed
description: Because of a civic holiday, the Toronto Stock Exchange and Winnipeg Grain Exchange were closed yesterday. The Sydney Exchange was also closed for a holiday there.

title: Advertising:
description: It's summertime and the gang at Marsteller, Inc., just started another of its yearly corporate seminars. And if this week's meetings turn out as well for the agency as some of the previous ses sions, then the time will be well spent for Bill Marsteller and his associates.

title: Ulster Party Chiefs Demand Internment Cease Before Talks
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 7Leaders of the main Opposition party representing. Northern Ireland's Roman Catholic minority today de manded an end to internment without trial as a condition for political talks with British of ficials.

title: Collegiate Stars Seek Honors in Westchester Classic
description: Jim Simons and Tom Kite, two of the eight members of the 1972 AllAmerica college golf team, will compete as professionals in the $250,000 Westchester Clasic, starting Thursday at the Westchester Country Club in Harrison, N. Y.

title: Trenton Prison Escapee Is Captured in Camden
description: CAMDEN, N.J., Aug 7 (UPI) A Trenton State Prison in mate who escaped with two others last Saturday from maximum security unit was captured today, officials said.

title: 2 Plead Not Guilty in Cases Involving Illegal Phone Use
description: Two lawyers accused of try ing to fix criminal cases plead ed not guilty yesterday to Fed eral charges of using the tele phone to further their schemes.

title: Dorothy Joan, $3, Wins
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 7 (UPI)After being overtaken by Likely Lady on the turn, the favored Dorothy Joan ral lied in the stretch to win the $S,500 Pine Forge Sprint today at Liberty Bell race track.

title: CONFESSION BARRED IN DETROIT RIOT CASE
description: DETROIT, Aug. 7The last pending criminal case against three white Detroit policemen, charged in the slayings of three black youths at the Algiers Motel in the 1967 riots here, was apparently ended today.

title: Doctor Says He Was Told Not to Treat Men in V.D. Experiment
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (AP)  A Government doctor said today that he had been instruc ted not to treat men involved in a Federal syphilis experi ment in Alabama and when he had insisted on treating them, the men never appeared again. Dr. Reginald G. James said he believed the men had been told not to take the syphilis treatment.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7In the opinion of some Republi can Senators, President Nixon contributed to his own defeat on the Vietnam issue in the Senate last week by presuming, in a letter, to lecture Congress on its responsibilities.

title: Notes on People
description: Taking the oath of office, Elaine Edwards of Louisiana became the 10th woman to bear the title of United States Senator. Then, Mrs. Ed wards, who was named to succeed the late Allen J. Ellen der by her husband, Gov. Edwin W. Edwards faced the press.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: KANSAS CITY, Aug. 7 (UPI)Two realignment plans and a proposal by Atlanta to include secondplace teams in the championship playoff series will be discussed at the annual twoday summer meeting of major league baseball teams starting Wednesday.

title: Experts in Chess See Spassky in New Light
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Aug. 7  Grandmasters yesterday watched with unbelieving eyes the 11th game of the world championship chess match be tween Bobby Fischer and Boris Spassky.

title: 13 SLATED TO MAKE CITY OPERA DEBUTS
description: Bruno Maderna, the Italian conductor, heads the list of musical artists who will make first appearances with the New York City Opera during the company's fall season at the New York State Theater, which will open on Aug 30.

title: Utilities Told of a Power Threat in Big Solar Flare
description: Public utility companies are being warned of possible over loads on their longdistance power lines as a result of major eruption on the sun yes terday.

title: $50,000 REWARD BID IN PLANE BOMBING
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (AP) The Air Transport Association offered rewards totaling $50, 000 today for information lead ing to the arrest and conviction of persons who placed bombs aboard two airliners last March.

title: West Side Story: Highway Repairs and Jams
description: City officials plan to close sections of the West Side Highway and the Henry Hud son Parkway for repairs this fall or in early spring, and they expect the work to cause some of the city's worst traffic tieups in years.

title: U.S SUES 2 CITIES ON BIAS IN HIRING
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 The Justice Department, in the first action of its kind, filed suits today charging public agencies in the cities of Mont gomery, Ala., and Los Angeles with discriminating against ra cial minorities in filling public jobs.

title: A.P. Party Ends China Tour
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 7 (UPI) A party of executives, news men and their wives from The Associated Press left for home today after a visit to China, Hsinhua, the Chi nese press agency reported. The party had visited factor ies, a rural commune, a uni versity, a hospital and his torical sites in Peking, Yenan, Sian, Nanking, Soochow, Shang hai and Canton, Hsinhua said.

title: House Votes Pension Rise For 6 Widows of Justices
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (UPI)  The House of Represent atives passed legislation today to increase pensions of six widows of Supreme Court Jus tices to $10,000 from $5,000 a year. Under a new contributory system, widows of Justices in the future could qualify for pensions up to $22,500.

title: Action on Building Bribes Delayed by Lack of Funds
description: Reforms that were proposed three years, ago to help reduce corruption in the city's Build ings Department were never implemented, principally be cause of a lack of funds a former Buildings Commissioner told a legislative committee yesterday.

title: Secrecy Shroud
description: When Richard M. Nixon was a Senator with a penchant for investigations he strongly defended the right of Gov ernment officials to testify frankly before Congressional committees. Unless military men and civilian employes have complete freedom from reprisal, he said in 1951, the scheduled hearings will amount to no more than a parade of yes men for Administration policies.

title: Bank Unit Elects Officers
description: Charles E. Woodruff, execu tive vice president of the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company, has been elected chairman of the Manufacturers Hanover Leasing Corporation, a subsidiary of the Manufac turers Hanover Corporation. Paul J. Hanna has been elected vice chairman and Karl M. Parrish has been elected presi dent of Manufacturers Hanover Leasing.

title: Personalities: A Family Affair
description: A battle of millionaire clans, harness racing variety, was staged on Saturday night at. Brandywine Raceway in Wilmington, Del. In what was billed as the World Family Harness Racing Champion ship, it was the Canadian Filions against the American Dancers. Herve Filion, who in 1971 established two rec ords543 victories and $1, 915,943 in earnings  led three of his seven brothers against four members of the Dancer clan. Stanley Dancer, who is the leading driver in Grand Circuit earnings and second in North American earnings, captured the indi vidual championship as the Dancers won, 41 to 31. Four members of each family com peted in the fifth and sixth races.

title: Bronx Boy Hurt In Fall
description: Nine  year  old Harold Brice, of 968 Morris Avenue, the Bronx, fell 50 fet into a hole atl the site of the new court build ing under construction at Sherman Avenue and East 161st Street, the Bronx, while trying to retrieve a ball. The police rescued the boy, who was taken to Morrisania Hospital suffering from cuts of the face and head.

title: 2 RADIOS IN EUROPE FUNDED BY CONGRESS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (Reu ters)Congress approved legi slation today authorizing United States funds for the operation of Radio Free Europe and Radio Liberty for another year.

title: 4 Mackell Aides Called Before jury in Inquiry Believed Linked to Alleged GetRich Scheme
description: Four persons on the staff of Queens District Attorney Thomas J. Mackell appeared yesterday before a Federal grand jury in Brooklyn that has been investigating alleged criminal violations by mem bers of the Queens prosecutor's office.

title: Credit Markets
description: Interest rates moved narrow ly in both directions yesterday as underwriters prepared to market this morning the first of the week's moderate cal endar of new issues.

title: Forests in Alaska Ablaze
description: FAIRBANKS, Alaska, Aug. 7 (UPI)More than 215,000 acres of timber have been destroyed by a series of forest fires that burned out of control today 200 miles northwest of here in the Brooks mountain range. A Bu reau of Land Management spokesman said that because of a lack of manpower only 24 of the 43 fires burning in the state were being fought.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: Three seeded playersincluding Vitas Gerulatis of Howard Beach, Queens, the topranked 18yearold de faulted in firstround matches yesterday as the Columbia tennis championships for juniors and boys began at Baker Field.

title: 18 ISRAELI ARABS SEIZED AT VILLAGE
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 7Eight een Israeli Arabs were arrested today as they tried to reoc cupy some of the ruined houses of the village of Berem on the Lebanese frontier, and a num ber of policemen and Arabs were slightly injured in the melee.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Give the people what they want, charge nothing and business will boom. The Transit Authority discovered this yesterday when it began to give away new pocket size subway maps and found that the demands of strap hangers quickly exhausted the supply of many token vending booths around the city.

title: BRITAIN TO RESIST UGANDAN DEMAND
description: LONDON, Aug. 7  Britain acknowledged today a special responsibility for an estimated total of 55,000 Asians threat ened with expulsion from Uganda, but made it plain that she would resist the demana from President Idi Amin that she accept them all here within three months.

title: Disaster Aid for Connecticut
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 7  Con necticut has been designated an agricultural disaster area by the Federal Government because of the widespread damage caused by Hurricane Agnes and other storms in June, the office of Gov. Thomas J. Meskill dis closed today. The designation means that Connecticut farmers whose produce was affected by the rainfall may apply to the United States Department of Agriculture's Farmers Home Ad I ministration for lowinterest emergency loans.

title: To Save America's Lost Children
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7The soft blond face, the dark glasses, the wide smileand behind them the terrifying, murderous fantasies. The face of Arthur Bremer, the wouldbe assassin of Governor Wallace, has become an other painful image flickering in the nation's memory. It takes its place alongside of Sirhan B. Sirhan scowling and darkly handsome and Lee Harvey Oswald wincing in pain as Jack Ruby gunned him down.

title: DOCTORS DIVIDED OVER EUTHANASIA
description: WASHINGTON, Aug, 7A group of physicians, including one who said he had allowed hundreds of terminally ill pa tients to die, disagreed at a Senate hearing today on whether terminally ill or in jured persons had a right to euthanasia.

title: Flame Reaches Istanbul
description: ISTANBUL, Aug. 7 (AP)The Olympic flame, lighted in Greece July 28, was carried into Istanbul by Turkish athletes to day.

title: 3Day, 39Hour Week Ordered For Some at OTB to Cut Costs
description: A work week of three days of 13 hours each is being intro duced for branch managers and security personnel of the New York City OffTrack Betting Corporation, aiming to elimi nate the need for 255 jobs in the next year.

title: Pakistanl Train Toll at 65
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Aug. 7The death toll in the train accident yesterday at Liaquat pur, 400 miles northwest of here, rose to 65 today, with the recovery by rescue teams of eight more bodies.

title: Hart, New Jet Guard, Adjusts Play to Their System Quickly
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Aug. 7 Since tomorrow is the day when the 26 clubs in the National Football League must cut their squads to 60 men, there are lots of football players walking around with worried looks.

title: Paris Ad Agency Maps EuropeWide Campaign
description: PARIS, Aug. 7While Euro pean diplomats and finance ministers haggle over each new step of the Common Market, European businessmen keep pushing ahead of the politicians.

title: SUIT OPPOSING WAR REJECTED BY JUDGES
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 7 (AP) A special threejudge Federal court turned down today a suit by peace activists who challenged the constitutionality of the Vietnam war and sought to cut off funding for it.

title: U. S. Wins, 32
description: BARCELONA, Spain, Aug. 7 Stan Smith, the emotion, drained out of him at the end, overcame Juan Gisbert, 7,000 Spanish partisans and some questionable line calls today and sent the United States into the Davis Cup final.

title: Executive Changes
description: Donald A. Graham, vice president and general manager of the Remington Rand Office Systems Division of the Sperry Rand Corporation has been appointed president of the Remington Rand Divi sion. Francis V. Bergren, vice president, has been named executive vice president of Remington Rand.

title: McGovern Gets $25,000 From Clothing Workers
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7Sen ator George McGovern, assem bling labor support piecemeal and more slowly than past Democratic Presidential nomi nees, accepted a $25,000 cam paign check from the Amalga mated Clothing Workers today.

title: JEWISH NEUTRALITY IN ELECTION URGED
description: Jewish leaders were urged yesterday by the head of the American Jewish Congress to refrain from endorsing or at tacking candidates in the Presi dential election.

title: JESSE ASINOF
description: Jesse Asinof, who retired several years ago as a vice president of the Palm Beach Company, apparel manufac turer, died yesterday in the Nursing Home and Extended Care Facility of White Plains. His age was 73.

title: DEMOCRATS PLAN TALLY ON SHRIVE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7The Democratic party prepared for the nomination of Sargent Shriver for Vice President tomor row night by recommending set tlement of disputes among party leaders from four states today as to who should be qualified to vote for him.

title: PLAN ON TRANSIT IS ASSAILED HERE
description: The State Transportation De partment's proposed $50billion master plan to streamline high way, waterway and masstransit facilities in New York State was strongly criticized by pub lic and private officials yester day for what they charged was its failure to grapple with the real issues.

title: COFFEEDEALERSHOLD MEETING IN GENEVA
description: GENEVA, Aug. 7 (Reuters) A meeting which could deter mine the future of the world's coffee trade began here today with the world's major coffee producers attempting to formu late strategy for their annual meeting with consumers in London a week later.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Shriver Praised by Lindsay
description: Mayor Lindsay sent a tele gram yesterday to Sargent Shriver, congratulating him on being chosen by Senator George McGovern as the Democratic VicePresidential candidate. In his telegram, the Mayor said: Your extensive experience in dealing with local government officials and with domestic problems brings important strength to the ticket. Please count on my full and enthu siastic support.

title: SENATE REJECTS STRONG ON CURBS BY 7841 MARGIN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7The Senate overwhelmingly, reject ed today strong curbs on the sale and possession of all types of firearms, including hand guns, rifles and shotguns.

title: Saigon Reports Enemy Releases 7 Frenchmen
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Aug. 8 (Reuters) Seven Frenchmen, under stood to he employes of rub ber plantations, have been released after two months of captivity by Communist troops north of Saigon, it was reported today.

title: Lottery Sells Multiple Ticket
description: NEWTON, Mass., Aug. 7 (AP) The Massachusetts State Lot tery announced today that tick ets would be sold for periods of 10 weeks. William E. Per rault, lottery director, said the 10week ticket would cost $5, the 20week ticket $10 and the 52week ticket $25. A single week ticket costs 50 cents.

title: TOM NEAL, ACTOR, 59; CAST IN WAR FILMS
description: HOLLYWOOD, Aug. 7 (UPI) Tom Neal, who appeared in 180 movies before his acting career collapsed in a scandal over a fist fight, was found dead today at his home at the age of 59.

title: Riverhead Hearing Is Set On Plan for Traffic Circle
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., Aug. 7 Suffolk County today took the first step toward eliminating the Riverhead Traffic Circle.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: The National Broadcasting Company and the Columbia Broadcasting System yester day turned down a request from Senator Robert J. Dole, chairman of the Republican National Committee, for free television and radio time to answer what Mr. Dole had called a campaign speech by Senator George McGovern.

title: Inquiry on Navajo Traders
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (UPI) The Federal Trade Commis sion announced today that it would hold joint hearings with the Bureau of Indian Affairs to investigate charges that traders on the Navajo Indian reserva tion had violated consumers' rights. Hearings will be held Aug. 2829 at Window Rock, Ariz., the Navajo nation's cap ital, and later throughout the reservation, the commission said.

title: Business Briefs
description: LONDON, Aug. 7 (AP)  The price of gold dropped more than a dollar an ounce in Europe's bullion markets today and the dollar weakened. Gold closed in London at $67.65, off $1,35.

title: ROBERT WILLIAMSON
description: PAWLING, N. Y., Aug. 7 Robert A. Williamson, finance commissioner of Dutchess County and former county treasurer, died today at his home here. He was 67 years old.

title: Japan's Premier Says He Plans A Visit to China in September
description: TOKYO, Aug. 7 (AP)Pre mier Kakuei Tanaka said today that he would visit, China in September for talks on estab lishing normal relations be tween Tokyo and Peking.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Up From WeekAgo Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7  Yields on United States Treasury bills rose in the Government's weekly com petitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: SAN DIEGO, Aug. 7 (AP)The nickname of Con quistadors was selected today for San Diego's new team in the American Basketball Association.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: GENEVA, Aug. 7 (AP)The International Committee of the Red Cross said today that the Pakistani decision on Indian civilians would affect 270 In dians arrested at the border during hostilities and 6,500 who entered Pakistan to visit rela tives before the war began, as well as all who entered the country illegally before Dec. 3, 1971.

title: Man Faces Murder Charge In Death of Girl Upstate
description: MAYFIELD, N. Y Aug. 7 (AP)Fulton County authori ties said today that Peter Mat tiola, 26 years old, of Glenville, would be arraigned here to morrow night on murder and sodomy charges in the death of a little girl who disappeared from her home last Thursday.

title: Gulf & Western Dividend
description: Gulf & Western Industries, Inc., announced yesterday that the previously declared special dividend of one common share of the Athena Communications Corporation for each 10 shares of Gulf & Western common would be payable Sept. 8 to shareholders of record Aug. 17. The special dividend will result in distributing about 1.64 mil lion shares of Athena common or about 82 per cent of the out standing shares. Gulf & West ern will continue to own about 360,000 shares or about 18 per cent.

title: Buckley Defends Police As Finest in the Nation
description: Senator James L. Buckley, Conservative  Republican of New York, prepared a taped telephone message yesterday defending the Police Depart ment in the face of Knapp Commission statements that corruption among policemen was widespread.

title: MATTHEWS LEADER IN MALLORY SAILING
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Aug, Dean Matthews of the home club took a 3point lead in the Area B semifinals of the North American sailing championship for the Clifford D. Mallory Trophy today after the first three races in the fiverace roundrobin series were com pleted off Riverside, Y.C.

title: Market Place: New Process In Profit Lag
description: Tightlipped corporate managements have always been the bane of Wall Street. They are regarded with al most as much suspicion as the blabbermouths.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Aug. 8, 1972 GENERAL ASSEMBLY Committee on Colonialism 10:30 A.M.

title: A Cure for Corruption?
description: News Analysis

title: Edward Barry Roberts, 71, Dramatist, Taught at Yale
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., Aug. (AP)Edward Barry Roberts, playwright and television writ er, who had taught television writing at the Yale School of Drama, died yesterday in Law rence and Memorial Hospital. He was 71 years old and lived at 30 West 60th Street in New York.

title: PHILLIPS LAWYER CHANGES HIS MIND
description: On the eve of beginning their deliberations in the trial of Pa trolman William R. Phillips, the jurors were offered yesterday yet another explanation of the 1968 murders of James Smith and Sharon Stango.

title: BLACK LABOR CHIEFS TO HELP M'GOVERN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (AP)  Some key black labor of ficials will meet in Miami Beach Wednesday to shape coalition for Senator George McGovern and counter the op position of some of labor's white leaders to the Democrat ic Presidential nominee.

title: PAKISTAN TO FREE STRANDED INDIANS
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, Aug. 7The Pakistani. Government announced today that it would release all Indian civilians in terned or stranded during the IndianPakistani war.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: Less than 24 hours before the Democratic National Com mittee was to meet to nominate a VicePresidential candidate, the last five members of New York's 12member delegation to the national committee were elected yesterday by the Demo cratic State Committee.

title: India Is Guiding Remote Tribesmen Toward Modern World
description: ZIRO, India  Under the tutelage of dedicated men in the young Indian Fron tier Administrative Service, mountain tribes are leapfrog ging the centuries in the wild, littleknown North East Frontier region where India fought a brief but bloody border war with China 10 years ago.

title: Sirhan Leaves Death Row
description: SAN QUENTIN, Calif., Aug. 7 (UPI)Sirhan B. Sirhan, the assassin of Senator Robert F. Kennedy, has been moved from death row, officials of San Quentin Prison announced to day. Sirhan, 28 years old, was moved to the prison's adjust ment center in the same build ing because of a decision by the California Supreme Court ban ning the death penalty in the state. Sirhan's sentence was reduced from execution to life imprisonment by the court on June 16. Sirhan was placed under special protective custody in the adjustment center.

title: Leary Refuses to Talk About Knapp Report
description: BRICK TOWNSHIP, N. J., Aug. 7Howard R. Leary, the former New York City Police Commissioner, said to day that he had not read the Knapp Commission re port on police corruption and he refused to discuss it.

title: What Price Power?
description: The House Interstate and Foreign Commerce Commit tee is moving this week to complete work on a bill commendably designed to bring some order into the existing chaotic system of siting and certifying electric power plants. The bill currently under consideration one introduced by Representative Macdonald of Massa chusettsis seriously deficient, however, in that it dras tically downgrades environmental considerations in its effort to speed new power plant construction.

title: Women's Army Corps to Grow With More Jobs and New Styles
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (AP)  The Army said today that it would nearly double the size of the Women's Army Corps by 1078, give Wacs almost any type of assignment except com bat and maybe put them in, pantsuits.

title: G.E. Listing Clarified
description: Due to a typographical error, the letter C appeared follow ing the last quote on the General Electric Company's common stock listing in the week's trading in Sunday's editions of The New York Times. The letter C stands for a liquidating dividend. The company is not involved in any such action, nor is any con templated. G.E. reported on July 6 a high in secondquarter net income of $121.5million, up 8 per cent, and a sales high of $2.56billion, up 10 per cent.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Louisiana Democrats Bar New Senatorial Candidates
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Aug. 7 (AP)The Louisiana Demo cratic State Central Commit tee voted today to conduct the Aug. 19 primary for the United States Senate seat left vacant by the death of Allen J. El lender as scheduled and not al low new candidates to enter the race.

title: Philippine Toll at 454; Cholera Adding to Deaths
description: MANILA, Aug. 7 (AP)The death toll in the Philippines' fiveweekold flood disaster soared to at least 454 today with reports of more cholera deaths, drownings and killings by gangs of looters. Flood waters were receding.

title: SindhiSpeaking Lecturer Killed at Pakistani School
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Aug. 7  A Sindhi  speaking lecturer at the Government polytechnic institute at Hyderabad, about 100 miles north of here, was beaten to death today by Urdu speaking students.

title: CONVENTION PLAN CHANGED BY P.B.S.
description: The Public Broadcasting Service will offer uninterrupted coverage of today's meeting of the Democratic National Com mittee and of the Republican National Convention beginning Aug. 21.

title: Nixon Sending Romney to Check FloodAid Snag at WilkesBarre
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 President Nixon, responding to news reports of some com plaints about relief programs for the victims of Tropical Storm Agnes, is sending George Romney, Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, to WilkesBarre, Pa., tomorrow to deal with what he termed the bureaucratic haggling.

title: Books of The Times
description: APPLE TO THE CORE. By Peter McCabe and Robert a Schonfeld. 200 Pages. Pocket Books. $1.25. Paper.

title: Phantom Cooks Who Cater Gourmet Dishes
State Economy Stable
description: New York State's economy was reported yesterday to have remained stable in the first half of 1972. State Commerce Department experts added that the state generally lagged bit behind the national recov ery just as recessions reached here later.

title: Superman Rescues Metropolis Again
description: METROPOLIS, Ill., Aug. 7  The glove plant here closed. Other firms laid off workers. Young people left town. Construction dropped. Retail sales declined. Metropolis seemed doomed!

title: Beauty Queens to Visit Bases
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 7 (AP)Miss America and six other beauty queens left today on a 21day entertainment tour of United States military bases) in Southeast Asia after a news conference at which they sup ported President Nixon's Viet nam policy. Laurie Lea Schaefer, Miss America of 1972, told newsmen last night that Mr. Nixon's policies have helped to retain the honor of the United States.

title: Portuguese Settlers in Africa Lead the Good Life
description: BANGUI, Central African RepublicIn the heart of in dependent black Africa, the Portuguese loyally consume codfish and heady green wine, listen to fado music and dream of Lisbon but are engaged in prosperous occu pations and have every inten tion to stay where they are.

title: Duran, Ortiz Matched On AliPatterson Card
description: As a semifinal to the heavyweight fight between Muhammad Ali and Floyd Patterson at Madison Square Garden on Sept. 20, Roberto Duran, the lightweight cham pion, will meet Carlos Ortiz in a 10round nontitle bout.

title: Phil Silvers's illness Threatens Forum Run
description: The illness of Phil Silvers has caused a tentative clos ing notice to be posted for A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum at the LuntFontanne Thea ter. Mr. Silvers has been out of the cast since he was stricken a week ago and hos pitalized.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: VINEYARD SOUND, Mass., Aug. 8A year ago, Charles Spanos of Claremont, N.H., was introduced to the de lights of surf casting for bluefish off Martha's Vine yard Island, A short time ago Spanos, who confessed he had been thinking about those first blues all winter long, came back for a re turn engagement.

title: Soviet Said to Ask Talks With Egypt on Better Ties
description: CAIRO, Aug. 7 (Reuters) The Soviet Union was reported today to be seeking a high level meeting with Egypt to improve their strained rela tions, but a top Egyptian of ficial said that the request was still under study.

title: Union Endorses McGovern
description: MILWAUKEE, Aug. 7 (AP) The executive board of the Allied Industrial Workers en dorsed Senator George McGov ern for President today. The union's nearly 100,000 members were urged to vote for Mr. McGovern, said Gilbert Jewell, the union's president.

title: The Screen: Russian 'Until Monday':Urban School Scene of Sentimental Film
description: Stanislav Rostotsky's "Until Monday," which opened last week at the Regency Theater, deals mainly with Thursday and Friday in a large urban Russian school. The school includes grades 1 through 12, but the film is mostly concerned with the students of one upper-class-home room, and with their teachers.Especially, it is concerned with the history teacher (Vyacheslav Tickhonov) and the pretty English teacher (Irina Pechernikova), who is probably in love with him as he is probably in love with her  but on both sides in a love so unspoken you can scarcely distinguish it from very sincere admiration.What does get spoken, by way of classroom confrontations and extracurricular interludes, is a series of moral positions mildly favoring: freedom over restraint, the individual over collective society, passionate historical failure over expedient historical success, poetic feeling over practical thought. This is a partial list and, of course, abstracted  but from a context, that rather invites abstractions.That context really has less to do with academic high school than with the academic traditions of Russian cinemato which "Until Monday" is a fairly orthodox, by no means unattractive, addition. I equate the orthodoxy not with the film's sentiments, which are largely libertarian, but with its dramatic methods, which determine that no generous desire shall go ungratified; every wayward impulse shall receive sympathetic recognition.Thus each of the film's crisesthe history teacher's crisis of conscience, a prize student's crisis in self expression, the English teacher's crisis in keeping discipline while maintaining rapport with her class, and many, many more  engenders its own solution and its own personal revelation. With epiphanies coming virtually at 10-minute intervals. "Until Monday" has a hard time keeping its spirits down. And yet it does. And a slightly depressed, slightly theatrical world-weariness, despite all the temptations to optimism, is really the film's happiest quality.I liked the history teacher and the young English teacher, and a middle-aged teacher of Russian literature (Nina Menshikova) who after 20 years in the profession gets a bouquet of three chrysanthemums and a brush-off from a class full of kids she doesn't understand. The kids are all uncredited, but some of them are fineas is the history teacher's old mother, who waits at home and cooks his meals and passionately watches him eat his soup.

title: Five Children, Three Adults Perish in Blaze in Boston Tenement
description: BOSTON, Aug. 7 (UPI) Eight persons, including five children, their mother and grandmother, died before dawn today when a fire swept their converted two family home in a ghetto sec tion of Boston.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: ShellEsso Finds North Sea Oilfield
description: LONDON, Aug. 7A rig dril ling in North Sea waters 100 miles northeast of the Shetland Islands has discovered a major new oilfield for a ShellEsso consortium.

title: A. T. FROITZHEIM, 66; LED LUGGAGE SHOP
description: Anthony T. Froitzheim, chair man of the board of T. An thony, Ltd., the luggage shop at 772 Madison Avenue, died Sunday aboard the Holland America ship Statendam on a North Capes cruise near Am sterdam. He was 66 years old and lived in Water Mill, L. I., and Pompano Beach, Fla.

title: Grant Rites Tomorrow
description: The funeral service for Wil liam T. Grant, founder of the W. T. Grant department store chain who died on Sunday at the age of 96, will be held at 3 P.M. tomorrow in the First Presbyterian Church, Green wich, Conn.

title: The Fuentes Case
description: The career of Luis Fuentes, newly appointed as com munity superintendent of Public School District 1 on the Lower East Side, has been surrounded by mystery and controversy. Recurrent questions have been raised about his personal and professional conduct. As an ele mentary school principal in Ocean HillBrownsville he replied to charges of having either introduced or con doned corporal punishment with a claim that parents favored this means of maintaining discipline.

title: Slumping Braves Drop Harris And Name Mathews as Manager
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 7 (UPI) Atlanta dismissed Manager ??uman Harris today and named a former Braves slugger, Eddie Mathews, to take his place.

title: QUANGTRI REFUGEES SHELLED, U.S. SAYS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7The State Department said today that North Vietnamese forces had deliberately poured shells into columns of South Vietnam ese civilian refugees last April 29 and 30, resulting in the deaths of 1,000 to 2,000 civil ians.

title: Texas Concern Takes Over Clyde Yard
description: GLASGOW, Scotland, Aug. (Reuters)A Texas concern's takeover of a bankrupt Glas gow shipyard was cleared to night when union opposition to a new labor agreement ended just an hour before the entire deal might have been called off.

title: Big Board in Turnaround As Revenues Top Costs
description: The New York Stock Ex change indicated yesterday that it had incurred a dramatic turn around in its financial opera tions in the first half of this year, mainly reflecting the sharply improved fortunes of the securities industry.

title: Jose Oreamuno Is Dead; Diplomat in Costa Rica
description: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, Aug. 7 (AP)Jose Rafael Oreamuno Flores, Costa Rican diplomat who lived for some time in the United States, died July 31 of a heart attack.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (AP)United States railroads expect to spend about $147million more on equipment and roadway and building during 1972 than they did a year ago, the Association of Railroads reported today.

title: CODE VIOLATIONS BY 11 FOOD PEACES
description: Gordon Chase, the city's Health Service Administrator, released yesterday the names of 11 more foodprocessing establishments cited for viola tions of the Health Code.

title: PRICES OF WHEAT REACH NEW HIGHS
description: Lifeofcontract highs were sod by all wheat futures de liveries yesterday as prices con tinued their steep climb.

title: Mystery in the Mines
description: A report by the General Accounting Office discloses that the Administration has been taking a strangely for bearing attitude toward collecting fines assessed against mine operators for violation of the Federal Coal Mine Health and Safety Act. Of $12.5 million in penalties levied under this landmark law to reduce the devastat ing toll of mine accidents, the Bureau of Mines has for given $2.7 million outright and actually collected only $1.4 million of the balance.

title: Printer Chose Order of Names On Lowenstein Primary Ballot
description: A Board of Elections official testified yesterday that because of lack of time the board had allowed a Brooklyn printer to determine the order of candi dates on the Democratic pri mary ballot in Brooklyn's 14th Congressional District.

title: African Chief Asks Merger Of Homelands and States
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Aug. 7 (Reuters)  A cortferalion of southern Afri lean black states, composed of African homelands in South Africa combined with neigh boring independent countries, has been proposed by Chief Kaiser Matanzima of the Tran skei homeland.

title: METSBEATEN,32, BY CARDS IN 13TH
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 7Fresh from the Hall of Fame, which saluted his achievements of the past, Yogi Berra returned to the realities of the present tonight and watched his New York Mets lose to the St. Louis Car dinals, 32, in 13 innings.

title: MOSCOW ASSAILS CHINESE ON ATLAS
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 7The So viet Government newspaper lz vestia today issued a lengthy, hardhitting attack on a new Chinese atlas, accusing Peking of making absurd demands on Moscow by laying claim to 600,000 square miles of Soviet territory.

title: Roundup: Morgan Keeps Reds Rolling
description: Joe Morgan, a crowd pleaser in his seven seasons with the Houston Astros, said his trade to the Cincin nati Reds this season, was maybe the best thing that has happened to me.

title: Nantucket Sail: Tradition Wins
description: NANTUCKET, Mass., Aug. 7  Six hundred contestants on the New York Yacht Club's an nual cruise tasted the raw green beauty of offshore sail ing today in a spraytossing sprint to this farout island.

title: N.B.C. Takes Convention
description: The National Broadcasting Company's ovreall Nielsen rat ing for the fourday coverage of the Democratic National Convention was 7.6, 12 per cent better than the Columbia Broadcasting System's 6.8 and 43 per cent higher than the American Broadcasting Com pany's 5.3. The Nielsen survey, made public yesterday, revealed that N.B.C. devoted 36 hours 10 minutes to convention cov erage, C. B. S. 36 hours 42 min utes, and A. B. C. 19 hours 25 minutes in the week of July 10.

title: STOCKS POST DROP ON AMEX AND 0TC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange finished slightly low er yesterday in slower trading, with the mobilehome issues the biggest losers.

title: Bridge: New Booklet Shows Power Of Precision Club Bidding
description: The majority of the partici pants in the recent World Team Olympiad used bidding methods that might be con sidered standard: all opening one bids natural and non forcing. Among the many nonstandard methods was one weird Swedish system in which the first two bids, and sometimes the first three, had highly artificial meanings.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 The Republican and Democrat ic Presidential campaign or ganizations are battling to see which one can get the most free exposure  in the form of tape recordings to be used as news  on the nation's 11,000 radio stations.

title: HANRAHAN DENIED  ACQUITTAL APPEAL
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 7  Judge Philip J. Romiti denied a de fense motion today for ac quittal of Edward V. Hanrahan, Cook County State's Attorney, and 13 other persons on trial on charges of conspiring to ob struct justice in the wake of police raid on the Black Pan thers here Dec. 4, 1969.

title: Kern, With 3,197, Takes Rifle Match at Camp Perry
description: CAMP PERRY, Ohio, Aug. 7 (UPI)  Army reserve Pfc. Steven Kern of Peoria, Ill., clinched the twoday metallic sight phase of the smallbore prone rifle matches of the Na tional rifle championships to day with 3,197 points out of a possible 3,200. Ronald E. Cole man of Decatur, Ga., was run nerup with 3,196.

title: The Attractive Face It May Be Better Not to Correct Teeth
description: BOSTON  What's in a face? What makes one profile attractive and anoth er not? Most of us know a pretty or handsome face when we see one, but we would be hardpressed to explain exactly what makes it so appealing.

title: TopSeeded Girls Lose
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 7 (AP) Four seeded California girls were upset in the opening round of the United States girls 18 and under grass court tennis championships today at the Philadelphia Cricket Club.

title: State Criticizes City Health Unit, Cites Lag in Promoting Citizen Participation
description: A state analysis of the city's Comprehensive Health Planning Agencya department estab lished to increase citizen par ticipation in shaping future hearth serviceshas criticized the agency as having atti tudes sufficient to threaten or irritate the average consumer, and silence the poor.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: THE PRESIDENT

title: CONNECTICUT POLICE OPPOSE HIRING PLAN
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 7 (UPI) The union representing a ma jority of Connecticut state po licemen strongly opposed today new proposals to reduce educa tion and age requirements for recruits.

title: ALEXANDER HAMILTON
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J., Aug. 7 Alexander Hamilton, a retired accountant with the Standard Company (New Jersey) and a bank consultant here, died of a heart attack Saturday while on vacation in Bennington, Vt. He was 61 years old.

title: SAINTS SET BACK EAGLES, 13 TO 10
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 7 (AP) Toni Linhart, an Austrian soccer player, booted a 9yard field goal with 9 seconds re maining to give the New Or leans Saints a 1310 victory over the Philadelphia Eagles to night in a National Football League exhibition game.

title: HAITI'S ARMS PLEA WEIGHED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7  A sevenman United States mili tary mission has just made an unpublicized weeklong visit to Haiti to weigh a Haitian re quest for American arms worth $5million to $10million.

title: Girl Killed in Van's Plunge
description: MALIBU, Calif., Aug. 7 (UPI) A large van carrying 25 teen agers from a Santa Monica Mountain summer camp to a beach outing plunged 100 feet down a boulderstrewn embank ment today, killing one girl and critically injuring six others.

title: Business Briefs
description: TOKYO, Aug. 7 (Reuters)  Prime Minister Kakuei Tanaka said today that Japan needed an annual economic growth rate of 6 to 7 per cent to cope with her social problems.

title: Anniversary Medals Voted
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (AP) The House passed today Senateapproved measure pro viding for the striking of med als commemorating the 175th anniversary of the launching of the United States frigate Con stellation Sept. 7, 1797.

title: Daley Praises Shriver As Boon for the Ticket
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 7 (UPI) Mayor Richard J. Daley said today that the selection of Sargent Shriver as VicePresi dential candidate was a great appointment that would help the ticket in Illinois.

title: Ray Brennan, Reporter, Dead; ExLeader of Chicago Guild, 64
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 7 (UPI) Ray Brennan, longtime report er of The Chicago SunTimes, died of cancer last night, at the age of 64.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: If the recently announced 127 per cent, fiveyear postal rate increases for secondclass mail stand or fall on the basis of the arguments made in Postmaster General Klassen's Aug. 2 OpEd article, then the Postal Service should revoke the increase immedi ately and reconsider its action.

title: Coerced Into Hijacking Role, Woman Again Says in Israel
description: LYDDA, Israel, Aug. 7 (AP) Rima Issa Tannous, one of two defendants on trial in con nection with the Arabguerrilla hijacking of a Belgian airliner ay 8, insisted today that she had told the truth in testifying that she had been coerced into taking part in it. Miss Tannous, who is 21 years old, said under crossexamination that she had been beaten, tricked and ca joled into participation.

title: Grumman Explains Loss on Shuttle
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., Aug. 7 The president of the Grum man Aerospace Corporation said today that Grumman had lost the $2.6billion space shuttle contract largely be cause its design had been somewhat more conserva tive than that of the win ner, the North American Rockwell Corporation.

title: Cleveland Promoter Sues Hunt's Pro Tennis Group
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 7 (AP) World Championship Tennis, the pro troupe run by Lamar Hunt, was sued in Federal court here today for alleged violation of antitrust laws.

title: LOG WATER PIPES FOUND IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, Aug. 7 (AP) Hol lowedout logs, which brought water to early settlers in this city when it was a Dutch colony, have been discovered beneath a busy downtown street here. Archaeologists say the logs may have been used for the first hydraulic engineer ing project in the United States.

title: Miss Henderson Bride in London
description: Miss Judith Bell Hender son, daughter of Mr, and Mrs. Robert Lloyd Hender son of Chestnut Hill, Mass., and granddaughter of the late Alvan Tufts Fuller, who was Governor of Massachu setts, was married in a civil ceremony at the Caxton Hall Registry Office in London yesterday to Michael E. S. Adda. The bridegroom, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jacques Adda of Paris, is with the London office of Touche Ross & Co., accountants.

title: 5 More Are Slain
description: BELFAST, Aug. 7 (UPI)  Gunmen shot to death a mem ber of the Ulster Defense Regi ment near the border with the Irish Republic late tonight, the army said. William Henry Creighton, a 40yearold Protes tant, was the 500th person to die in three years of violence in the province. Earlier in the day, three British soldiers and a 17 yearold Catholic youth were killed.

title: WESTCHESTER ACTS TO WIDEN VOTING
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 7 Hours after 100 demonstrators marched outside the County Board of Elections to protest lagging voter registration ef forts, the Westchester Board of Legislators authorized the board to deputize volunteer registrars and open additional offices where needed for the rest of the month.

title: Nixon Campaign Aide Named
description: Stephen D. Blum, 29 years old, of Manhattan, has been named by Governor Rockefeller as deputy campaign director of the New York Committee to Reelect President Nixon

title: Saigon Decree on Press Shuts 2 Opposition Papers
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Aug. 8 (Reuters) Two opposition Saigon dailies have folded because of a new government crackdown on the press requiring heavy financial deposits from all newspapers, it was reported today.

title: Three Democratic Mayors Back Nixon for Reelection
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (UPI) Three Democratic Mayors endorsed President Nixon's bid for reelection today. They said that Senator George McGovern, their own party's nominee, has not demonstrated the con cern with the everyday prob lems of urban and suburban governments which we believe is required.

title: EDDIE MACHEN, 40, EXBOXER, IS DEAD
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 7 (UPI)The body of Eddie Machen, a former heavyweight contender, was found today in the parking lot of his apart ment house.

title: Bold Place Wins by Six Lengths And Pays $12.40 at Monmouth
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., Aug. 7 (UPI)Bold Place led all the way today at Monmouth Park and romped home by six lengths to win the $9,000 allowance fea ture for 3yearold fillies.

title: 67 Law Is Giving States Windfall in Federal Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 Most of the states have be latedly discovered an obscure provision of Federal law that will probably enable them to obtain, virtually free, an es timated $4.8billion from the Federal Treasury in the current fiscal year.

title: Economic Analysis
description: In its massive report criti cizing 15 former officials of the Penn Central Company in connection with their sales of the railroad's stock, the Securi ties and Exchange Commission was clearly after bigger game.

title: Latest Vietnam Withdrawal Leaves 44,600 U.S. Troops
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 7 (AP)American troop strength in South Vietnam was reduced by 1,400 men last week, to a total of 44,600, the United States command an nounced today.

title: NEVIL SHOOTS A 65 IN HARRISON TRIALS
description: HARRISON, N.Y., Aug. 7 Dwight Nevi! of San Antonio, Tex., carded a 33, 3265 today over the 6,700yard, par36, 3672 West course of the Westchester Country Club dur ing the rainmarred qualifying round of the Westchester Classic.

title: PAYOUT OF 85 CENTS IS DECLARED BY G.M.
description: Directors of the General Mo tors Corporation declared an 85cent quarterly dividend yes terday on the outstanding com mon stock. Shareholders re ceived a similar amount in the third quarter last year. The stock closed yesterday at 78, up , on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Yogi in Hall: Hope I'll Put Something Back
description: COOPERSTOWN, N. Y., Aug.l 7In a perfectly appropriate blend of sentiment, humor and brevity, Yogi Berra, Sandy Kou fax, Lefty Gomez and five less glamorized figures were in ducted into baseball's Hall of, Fame, today.

title: CLIPPER BLUE WINS IN JUMPING CLASS
description: BRANCHVILLE, N. J., Aug. 7 Clipper Blue, from Mrs. Win ston Guest's Old Westbury, L. I., farm, won the first open jumper class today of the opening ses sion of the Sussex County Horse Show.

title: Scientists Find U.S. Periled By Lags in Physics Support
description: Since 1967 effective financial support of American physics has been reduced by about one fourth with potentially adverse effects on the American econ omy, national defense and na tional status in the world, ac cording to a threeyear study made public yesterday.

title: LOANS FOR OUTPUT URGED IN BRITAIN
description: LONDON, Aug. 8Sir Leslie O'Brien, Governor of the Bank of England, urged Britain's banks today to stop lending so much money to stock and prop erty speculators and to step up their loans to industrialists who could finance increased produc tion.

title: American Electric's Bid Gains For Columbus & Southern Ohio
description: Merger News

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: The Raytheon Company has awarded the Martin Marietta Corporation a contract totaling approximately $126million for engineering development of the Army's SAMD missile and its launcher and shippinglauncher canister. This is part of an over all prime contract of $588mil lion awarded Raytheon by the Army on March 31 for a 5year program.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: CONFERENCE PHONE: A practical bus iness aid can be yours, 8666653Advt.

title: Princess Aspasia, 75, Dies; Mother of a Yugoslav Queen
description: VENICE, Aug. 8  Princess Aspasia, an aunt of the exiled King Constantine of Greece and mother of exQueen Alexandra of Yugoslavia, died in Venice yesterday. She was 75 years old.

title: Environment Report . . .
description: It is no easy task to assess the quality of the nation's environment, diagnose the difficulties and make recom mendations for legislative and executive action. In a Presidential election year when the propaganda pollution rises and the pressure for good news intensifies, the task becomes measurably harder. Viewed in these real istic terms, the third annual report of the Council on Environmental Quality is an unsatisfactory document but its weaknesses are understandable.

title: Former Aide to Hoover Heads Narcotics Unit
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP)William C. Sullivan, who was forced to retire as assistant director of the Fed eral Bureau of Investigation last October after a feud with the late J. Edgar Hoover, its chief, has been named as di rector of the National Nar cotics Intelligence Center in the Justice Department.

title: SUBSIDIZED UNITS SET HOUSING MARK
description: Federally subsidized housing starts set a statewide record of 39,784 units, and a new high in New York City of 24, 617 for the year ended June 30, S. William Green, regional administrator of the Housing and Urban Development De partment, announced yesterday.

title: Business Briefs
