description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (UPI)Prices of soft drinks will go up more than $1billion if the Federal Trade Com mission strikes down the industry's present sales terri tories, the president of the National Soft Drink Association said today. Crawford Rainwater, who also is a CocaCola bottler from Pensacola, Fla., testified before the,, Senate antitrust and monopoly subcommittee in support of legis lation to preserve the softdrink franchise territories.

title: Earnings Surge 31.4% in Quarter as Sales Show 15% Advance
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation re ported yesterday record sales and earnings for both the sec ond quarter and first half.

title: 9 BERTHS FILLED IN $260,000 GOLF
description: HARRISON, N.Y., Aug. 8 Doug Olson of Medford, Ore., carded a 34, 3468 today on the 6,700yard par 36, 3672 course of the Westchester Country Club as the nine non exempt places were filled for the $250,000 Westchester Clas sic.

title: Yogi Wants His Checks Made Payable to Berra
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 8 (AP) Yogi Berra, the manager of the New York Mets, who is credited with such cracks as I want to thank everyone who made this night neces sary and Billy Dickey's learning me all his experi ences, was a guest on Jack Buck's radio show before to night's game against the St. Louis Cardinals.

title: Mrs. Meir Rejects Plea by Archbishop On Arab Villagers
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 8 (AP) Premier Golda Meir today re jected a personal appeal from the spiritual leader of the Greek Catholic community in Israel to permit the return of dispos sessed Christian Arabs to Ikrit and Berem, their villages on the Lebanese border.

title: AMEX AND 0TC OFF FOR 2D DAY
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and the overthe counter market finished lower yesterday for the second con secutive session in continued slow trading.

title: SleepWalking Is Believed Involved in Machen's Death
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 8 (UPI)  The police said today that Eddie Machen, onetime heavyweight boxer, might have fallen to his death while sleep walking. Machen was killed yesterday when he plunged from his secondstory apart ment.

title: Senate Votes to End Curb On .22 Ammunition Sales
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8The Senate voted today to repeal controls over the sale of .22 caliber rimfire ammunition,) which can be used in both sport ing rifles and cheap handguns.

title: Albatross Returns to Action In Friday's Pace at Yonkers
A SHIP RADIO UNION AGREES ON CONTRACT
description: The American Radio Associ ation announced tentative agreement yesterday on new threeyear contracts covering close to 1,000 radio officers on United States merchant ships.

title: Thai Official Is Expected to Meet Chou On Table Tennis Team's Trip to Peking
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8After contemplating a new China pol icy for many months, Thailand has announced that she would follow the United States' ex ample and send a table tennis team to Peking later this month. The team will be accompanied by a highranking Thai official who is expected to meet with Premier Chou Enlai.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Wilderness Area Established
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP) President Nixon signed a bill today to establish Cedar Keys Wilderness, an area of four small islands in the Gulf of Mexico about three miles off the coast of Florida. The is lands, which consist of about 375 acres, provide a yearround habitat for several threatened species, including the bald eagle, brown pelican and osprey.

title: New Spirit in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 8After days of gloom, Soviet grand masters and newspapers were exulting today over Spassky's conquest of Fischer in the 11th game Sunday, but no one dared call the victory a turning point.

title: Dose of Capitalism Prescribed in Soviet
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 8  The inability of the overstrained staterun service industry to keep pace with the rising ex pectations of Soviet consumers has fostered a rare public pro posal for experimenting with a limited restoration of private enterprise.

title: Peking Plans Geneva Office
description: GENEVA, Aug. 8The Unit organizations with headquar that China had given notice of her intention to establish a per manent diplomatic mission here. The mission will be accredited to the United Nations Geneva office and to other international organizations with headquart ers in Switzerland.

title: RollCall Vote in Senate On NoFault Insurance
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP)Following is the roll call vote by which the Senate today sent the nofault in surance bill to its Judiciary Committee.

title: Mezz Mezzrow, 73, Clarinetist Who Was a Titan of Jazz, Dead
description: PARIS, Aug. 8 (UPI)Mezz Mezzrow, the Chicago  born clarinetist who played a prom inent role in the history of American jazz, died Saturday at the American Hospital in Paris of arthritis of the spinal cord. He was 73 years old.

title: Florida Democrat Aids Nixon
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Aug. 8 (AP)Farris Bryant said today that he had accepted an invi tation of another former Dem ocratic Governor, John B. Con nally of Texas, to become vice chairman of the National Com mittee to Reelect President Nixon. Mr. Bryant said he would continue in the Demo cratic party and support its nominees except for the Presi dential ticket.

title: DiMaggio to Play Today
description: Joe DiMaggio and Glen Campbell are two of the ama teurs entered in today's 18hole proamateur tournament at the Westchester Country Club.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia1973 will be an exceptionally significant year for world history and, almost as soon as the fallout of the U.S. Presidential election lifts, serious preparations will begin for a kind of annus mirabilis intended to set the Western European coalition further along the global power road.

title: Jury Gets Phillips Case After Mistrial Is Denied
description: The case against Patrolman William R. Phillips went to the jury of 10 men and two women yesterday for a decision on whether he murdered James Smith, a pimp, and Sharon Stango, a prostitute, on Christ mas Eve of 1968.

title: New Soviet Chief in Prague
description: PRAGUE, Aug. 8 (Reuters) Lieut. Gen. Ivan Ivanovich Tyenischchev has been appoint ed commander of Soviet armed forces in Czechoslovakia, the Ceteka News Agency reported. He succeeds Col Gen. Alex ander Michailovich Mayorov.

title: More Blacks in Theater? Yes and No
description: Is there a boom of black artists in the NeW York thea ter? At first glance, the evi dence suggests there is.

title: Canadian Question: Should a Dairy Farm In Barrie, Ontario, Be Run from Chicago?
description: BARRIE, Ontario, Aug. 5 Willard L. Kinzie, a hearty and aggressive individualist who has made himself rich in the dairy business, is just the sort of man who might typify Canada's bold, inde pendent spirit.

title: Bridge:A Lucky Lie of Cards Needs Foresight for Appreciation
description: If you need a lucky lie of the cards to make your con tract, it is normally right to assume that the fates are with you, even if you risk in creasing the penalty, It may take some foresight to appre ciate this situation, and the diagramed deal illustrated the need to plan ahead before launching into the play. It was played in a duplicate game at Penny Point, Hamp ton Bays, L. I.

title: Live Lobsters Stolen
description: SANDWICH, Mass., Aug. 8 (AP)  Thieves stole 1,600 pounds of live lobsters today from the Lobster Mart, a whole sale concern on the Cape Cod Canal, the police said. They said the building was entered through a chute unused for sev eral years.

title: Knapp Proposal for Prosecutor Scored
description: The city's five District At torneys yesterday denounced the Knapp Commission's rec ommendation that Governor Rockefeller appoint a special deputy attorney general with sweeping powers to fight cor ruption among the city's police men, prosecutors and judges.

title: Harper Proceeding OnDrugTrade Book Despite C.I.A. View
description: After receiving a brief critique from the Central In telligence Agency, Harper & Row, Inc., has decided to pro ceed with the publication of a book by a 26yearold Yale graduate student that charges that the agency is involved in heroin trafficking in south east Asia.

title: STUDY LINKS POTATO TO 2 BIRTH DEFECTS
description: BAR HARBOR, Me., Aug. 8 (AP)A British scientist said today he believed, on the basis of a statistical study, that eat ing blighted potatoes during the first month of pregnancy might be associated with the incidence of two severe birth defects.

title: Californian, 18, Takes Lead In U.S. Archery Tourney
description: OXFORD, Ohio, Aug. 8 (UPI) Kevin Erlandson, 18 years old, of Elk Grove, Calif., and Ruth Rowe, 24, of Pittsburgh, led the senior men's and wom en's divisions today after the first day of shooting in the na tional archery tournament on the campus of Miami Univer sity.

title: Zinman and Dichter Lend Solid Touches To a Mostly Mozart
description: This week's Mostly Mozart Festiva, concerts at Philhar monic Hall began agreeably on Monday with the New York Chamber Orchestra playing un der the direction of David Zin man. The program consisted of Bach's Suite No. 1 in C and the Brandenburg Concerto No. 2 and Mozart's Piano Concerto No. 17 and Symphony No. 35.

title: CHEMICALARMS BAN IN 2 STAGES URGED
description: GENEVA, Aug. 8Britain, in an attempt today to advance the stalled disarmament talks here, suggested a twostage ap proach to the elimination of chemical weapons.

title: Fischer and Spassky Play Evenly to an Adjournment
Romney Reports 25 Ousted As Rude to Victims of Flood
description: WILKESBARRE, Pa. Aug. 8 (UPI)George Romney, the Secretary of Housing and Ur ban Development, said today that 25 temporary employees of his department had been dis missed for rudeness to vic tims of the June floods here.

title: Flexibility in Monetary Values Is Sought
description: Economic Analysis

title: MISS GOOLAGONG AN EASY VICTOR
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 8 (UPI)  Evonne Goolagong of Aus tralia and the United States' teenage sensation, Chris Evert, sailed to easy firstround vic tories in the National clay courts championships today, while the first major upset oc curred in men's play.

title: Fire Officers' Group Reports Approval of New Pact
description: The Uniformed Fire Officers Association announced yester day that its executive board had approved a 30month con tract with the city that would raise the annual base pay of fire lieutenants to $18,590 as of next Jan. 1.

title: Latino Caucus Pledged 2 Posts by Democrats
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP)Jean Westwood, the Democratic National Chair man, told the Latino caucus today that she would guar antee party policy positions to MexicanAmericans and Puerto Ricans.

title: Governor Approves York College Plan, Reversing Decision
description: Governor Rockefeller, revers ing his decision of last Decem ber, has approved plans for a 50acre campus for York Col lege, the youngest of the City University's nine senior col leges, in a blighted area of Jamaica, Queens.

title: RIGHTS UNITS CLEARS POST Of BIAS CHARGE
description: The State Human Rights Ap peal Board yesterday reversed a 1971 finding by the State Di vision of Human Rights that The New York Post used dis criminatory hiring practices. The board voted 2 to 1 for re versal.

title: Business Briefs
description: LONDON, Aug. 3 (UPI)The price of gold plumeted in London and Zurich today as speculative demand waned. Conditions in London Were Reported by dealers as busy.

title: Owners Say Taxes May Drive Knicks and Rangers From City
description: The Madison Square Garden Corporation has warned that it may be forced to move the Knicks and the Rangers out of New York City unless the city can provide a tax break or even take over the sports arena.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Aug. 8, 1972 THE PRESIDENT

title: Swidler Bids U. S. Charter A Company to Hunt for Oil
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 Joseph C. Swidler, chairman of the New York State Public Service Commission, told Con gress today that a federally chartered corporation was needed to explore for oil and gas where the private petro leum industry is unable or un willing to venture.

title: Waves Will Serve Aboard Warships Under Rights Law
description: WASHINGTON, Aug 8Adm. Elmo R. Zumwalt Jr., the Chief of Naval Operations, who has already done away with Navy bans on beards and beer, an nounced today the lifting of the most timebarnacled pro hibition of them all. Women will be allowed to serve aboard warships.

title: C. ROLAND BEDDOWS, UTILITIES EXECUTIVE
description: WESTFIELD, N. J., Aug. 8 C. Roland Beddows, a utilities executive who retired in 1961, died today at his home, 941 Kimball Avenue, He was 77 years old.

title: Joi Lansing, Actress, Dies at 37; Glamour Girl of TV and Films
description: HOLLYWOOD, Aug. 8 (AP) Joi Lansing, the blonde, bux om actress whose face was fa miliar to television and movie viewers died of cancer last night in St. John's Hospital. She was 37 years old.

title: Aircraft Company's Net Increases Despite Sharp Decline for Its Sales
L. I. Suit Is Dismissed
description: MINEOLA, L. I.Assemblyman Eli Wager of Woodmere today lost his suit to set aside the results of the June Demo cratic primary in the new 20th Assembly District. He was de feated in the voting by Arthur J. Kremer of Long Beach.

title: Legislator to Run for Court
description: Assemblyman Alexander Cha nanau, Democrat of the Bronx, will run for Bronx Civil Court judge on the Democrat, Re publican and Liberal tickets, a spokesman from his office said yesterday. Mr. Chananau, 56 years old, has served in the As sembly for 16 years.

title: Zack and Karalis Advance In Jersey MatchPlay Golf
description: WAYNE, N. J., Aug. 8Mi chael Zack 3d and Ben Karalis of Warrenbrook opened the de Tense of their New Jersey four ball matchplay championship today by defeating Kerry and Pat Mucci Jr. of Preakness Hills, 2 and 1, at the North Jersey Country Club.

title: Crossfire in the Senate
description: What is it about gun controls that brings out the weakness for sophistry in otherwise honest and sincere men? The crossfire resounding through the Senate cham ber this week is an insult to the intelligence and con science of the United States Senate and the constituents its members claim to be serving.

title: FASHION TALK
description: James Galanos, as usual, rang down the curtain on the fall and winter fash ion showings yesterday. Being last to appear is not such a bad idea, particu larly this season, when the acts that preceded him  the European couture showingstended to be unexciting.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Underworld Purchase of Land In Meadowlands Is Investigated
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N. Aug. 8  Underworld figures arc among those speculating in Hackensack Meadowlands real estate, according to law en forcement officials.

title: Business Briefs
description: New York City's serial bonds have a new look, hav ing been reduced in size for easier handling, processing and storing, it was announced yesterday by Controller Abraham D. Beanie.

title: Liberals Ready to Back McGovern on Staurday
description: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN

title: F.T.C. ACCEPTS BAN ON MISLEADING ADS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (UPI)The Federal Trade Com mission provisionally accepted today a proposed settlement of charges that the makers of EasyOn Speed Starch, Easy Off Window Cleaner, Aerowax and Black Flag Ant and Roach Killer had used deceptive ad vertising.

title: Roundup: A's Lose 6th in Last 7 Games
description: The slumping Oakland A's continued their slide back to the rest of the American League Western Division last night when they were beaten by the Royals, 4.3, in Kansas City.

title: Security Pacific Plans To Repurchase Own Shares
description: The Security Pacific Corpo ration, Los Angeles, the parent company of the $9.7billion Security Pacific National Bank, announced yesterday that it would repurchase up to 10 per cent of the 20.4 million com mon shares that it currently has outstanding.

title: Federal Warrants Issued for 3 Accused of Helping Fugitive
description: Federal warrants were Is sued yesterday for the arrest of three men on charges that they conspired to help one of them avoid apprehension on a doublemurder charge in New Jersey last year.

title: Ashe, Rosewall Win
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 8 (UPI) Topseeded Tony Roche of Australia, suffering from a painful swelling of his left el bow, was forced today to with draw from the $50,000 Cleve land Tennis Classic.

title: Governor Building New Home In Westchester for $650,000
description: NORTH TARRYTOWN, N.Y., Aug. 8Governor Rockefeller is building a onestory Japa nesestyle house on the Rocke feller family's Pocantico Hills estate here at an estimated cost of $650,000.

title: Derby Purse Redistribution For 1968 Race Is Ordered
description: FRANKFORT, Ky., Aug. 8 (AP)Barring an appeal, the big share of the purse from the 1968 Kentucky Derby will go to Forward Pass, who finished second.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 8 (UPI)  The former heavyweight champion, Muhammad Ali, will headline a professional boxing show at the Cleveland Arena Aug. 28.

title: Defensive D.A.'s
description: The reaction of New York City's District Attorneys to the Knapp Commission report on police corruption has been almost hysterical. It has also been disappoint ing. Typical was the forecast of Bronx District Attorney Burton Roberts that the report would so undermine public confidence in law enforcement as to provoke anarchy the streets which will make Vietnam look like a picnic.

title: SPONSOR SUSPENDS HOUSING PROTEST
description: CHAPPAQUA, N. Y., Aug. 8 The president of the county wide organization that is fight ing the Urban Development Corporation's housing plans in Westchester County announced today that he would ask his members to impose a mora torium of its own for a reason able period of time on further protest meetings.

title: Michigan G.O.P. Races
description: DETROIT, Aug. 8Michigan voters gave early leads tonight to two incumbent Republican members of Congress who faced challenges from moder ates in redrawn districts.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SHRIVER IS NAMED FOR SECOND PLACE BY THE DEMOCRATS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8The Democratic National Committee nominated Sargent Shriver to night to replace Senator Thomas F. Eagleton as the party's candidate for Vice Pres ident.

title: RIGGING OF STOCK IS CHARGED TO 10
description: A banker from New Jersey, two Florida men and seven New Yorkers were named yes terday in a Federal Court in lictment charging a stockrig ging conspiracy that cost bank here about $100,000 and drove a brokerage house out of operation:

title: Police Shaves Ordered
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 8 (UPI) The police in suburban Penn Hills were told by Chief E. E. Arnold yesterday to shave off conspicuous beards, mustaches and sideburns to convey to the public an impression of mod eration, maturity and settled confidence.

title: Miss Kostrinsky's 77 Leads Wheeler Golf by 3 Strokes
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Aug. 8 Doris Kostrinsky of Willow Ridge posted a 40, 3777 on the 6,048yard, par37, 3774 course at Round Hill Club today to take a threestroke lead in the 43d annual Elizabeth Wheel er Memorial Trophy tournament for the women's open cham pionship of Fairfield and West chester counties.

title: Nixon Aides Hope to Curb States' Aid Windfall in '72
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 High officials of the Nixon Ad ministration are hopeful that action can be taken this year to avoid about half of an unex pected $4.8billion outlay to the states, which have belatedly dis covered how to use an obscure Federal program to obtain windfall fiscal relief.

title: SKIPPER A WINNER BUT BOAT IS SIXTH
description: EDGARTOWN, Mass., Aug.  When Dick Sheehan gives orders to the crew of a racing yacht, he starts off softly and tactfully.

title: AIDE QUESTIONED SYPHILIS STUDY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP) A former employe of the United States Public Health Service says that six years ago he questioned the morality of a Federal syphilis study in Ala bama. The result, he says, was an internal inquiry and an of ficial decision to take no ac tion.

title: Senate Panel Votes to Cut Sharing for Urban States
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8The Senate Finance Committee, dominated by members from largely rural states, voted today to reduce drastically the amount of money that most urbanized states would receive under the proposed revenuesharing pro gram.

title: Advertising:
description: The controversy over lit tle cigar advertisingcon ceived when cigarettes were banned from television and fostered when R. J. Reynolds introduced its Winchesters is continuing without letup these days.

title: UNIFIED ARTS OFFICE FOR STATE DELAYED
description: ALBANY, Aug. 8  A pro posal to consolidate a diverse array of state cultural agencies under a unified Office of Cul tural Affairs was held in abey ance here today in a meeting of the State Commission on Cultural Resources.

title: Senator Gambrell Seems Headed For a Runoff Primary in Georgia
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 8Senator David H. Gambrell, Harvard educated scion of a wealthy Georgia family, and Sam Nunn, a young political unknown from the southern part of the state, appeared tonight to be headed for a runoff in their contest for the Democratic Senate nomination.

title: Britain Clinches Cup Tennis
description: VICHY, France, Aug. 8 (UPI) Britain won the Galea tennis cup today for the first time when Stephen Warboys downed Juan Herrera of Spain, 63, 62, 06, 26, 75, for an unbeatable 31 advantage in the threeof five series. In the consolation round, Czechoslovakia clinched third place by beating Italy.

title: Yanks Top Tigers, 42
description: As the Yankees drove re lentlessly toward a 42 victory over Detroit yesterday, a 12 yearold boy seeing a game at Yankee Stadium for the first time noticed the enthusiasm generated among the fans and said, They jump and scream like it never happened before.

title: Transcript of Shriver's Acceptance Speech
description: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN

title: Blacks Elected in Selma
description: SELMA, Ala., Aug. 8 (UPI) Voters in this central Alabama city, where civil rights demon strators were beaten back by the police seven years ago, elected five blacks today to a 10member City Council that had been all white.

title: MAX KARPER
description: Max Harper, who did pub licity and wrote reviews of the Yiddish theater for The New York Graphic, New York Amer ican and New York Journal American, died Monday in Mi ami Beach, where he had been living in retirement. He was 75 years old.

title: Front Page 4  No Title
description: IF YOU'RE NOT DRINKING WILLIAM LAWSON'S SCOTCH, DRINK DEWAR'S William Lawson's 86.6 Proof Blended Scotch Whisktes. Imported by Palmer & Lord, Ltd. Syosset N.Y.Advt.

title: Truman's Daughter Writes Book Based Upon His Private Papers
description: Mrs. Margaret Truman Daniel said yesterday that she had written a book about her father, former President Harry S. Truman, after being given access to certain un published letters and memo randa written by him.

title: Unread Manuscripts
description: One of the more pointless dislocations caused by the ArabIsraeli dispute these last five years is the loss to the scholarly world of authoritative publication of the Dead Sea Scrolls.

title: Plaza Hotel Gets New Chief
description: New top management has been announced for the Plaza Hotel, effective Sept. I. James H. Lavenson will become presi dent and chief executive offi cer, succeeding Paul Sonnabend, who will become chairman. Mr. Lavenson is a director and I Mr. Sonnabend is president of the Sonesta International Hotels Corporation, the Plaza's parent company. John F. Craver, gen eral manager, becomes vice president and general manager and will serve as chief operat ing office. He succeeds Arthur D. Dooley, who resigned last week to join the FPA Corpo ration as a vice president.

title: Thaler Is Given a Year in Securities Case
description: Seymour R. Thaler was sentenced to one year in prison and fined $10,000 yes terday for selling stolen se curities in 1970 when he was a State Senator from Queens.

title: Brief Visit to a Time Long Past
description: Sports of The Times

title: U.S. Aid Team Visit Sudan
description: WASHINGTON, Aug 8 (AP) The United States is sending an aid team to Sudan next month to discuss that country's request for economic aid techni cal assistance, the State De partment said today. The Sudanese need assistance in the transportation and agricul tural sectors, a spokesman said.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: The General American Trans portation Corporation yester day announced it may buy up to 300,000 of its common shares and up to 75,000 of its convertible preferred shares as authorized by directors. The company said that any shares acquired will be used for pos sible acquisitions, employe in centive plans and other cor porate purposes. The company's stock, traded on the New York Stock Exchange, closed yester day at 42 up 1

title: Books of The Times
description: Trailer (as in a film): The Mayor of New Orleans, spiffy in his patentleather brownandwhite shoes . . . sits in his of fice, with Zuzu, local doowhackadoo and voododeeodo flzgig . . . sprawled upon his knees . . . inhaling from a Ches terfield cigarette in a shameless brazen fashion. The telephone rings with an ur

title: Western Union Telegraph Plans a Satellite Net by 74
description: The Western Union Telegraph Company outlined plans here yesterday for the possible start up of a domestic satellite com munications system before mid1974.

title: STATE PENALIZES CITY ON WELFARE
description: The state cracked down on New York City yesterday by deducting $470,663 in Federal and state welfare payments as a penalty for the city's alleged failure to refer 7,700 employ able welfare recipients to the state workrelief program in June.

title: Casa Seeking Federal Funds to Hire L. I. Engineers Laid Off by Grumman
description: WASHINGTON, Aug, 8 Nassau County Executive Ralph G. Caso, carrying a reminder that Long Island voters could aid President Nixon's re election this fall, sought funds from the Nixon Administration today to let the county hire temporarily the engineers laid off by the Grumman Aerospace Corporation.

title: RUSSIANS REPORT ON ISRAELI ARMS
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 8The So viet press, which has already hinted to Egypt about the risk of counting on Western coun tries for arms to use against Israel, took the unusual step today of publicizing what it described as Israel's nuclear weapons capabilities.

title: Glass Union for McGovern
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Aug. 8 (UPI)The executive board of the United Glass and Ceramic Workers of North America an nounced today its unanimous endorsement of the Democratic Presidential nominee, Senator George McGovern. Officials of the 40,000member union said that the endorsement was made after an examination of the rec ords of both President Nixon and Senator McGovern.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: HEIDELBERG, West Germany, Aug. 8 (AP)Ecl Owen's basket with five seconds remaining gave the United States a 5958 victory over Israel for the gold medal in the Paraplegic Olympics tonight.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: UNIONDALE, L. I , Aug. 8 (AP)The New York Nets have acquired a forward, George Carter, from the Carolina Cougars in exchange for a high 1973 draft choice and an undisclosed amount of cash, the American Basketball Asso ciation club said today. Carter, 28 years old, has a 17.7point career average in the A.B.A.

title: Six More Trident Jets Are Ordered by Chinese
description: LONDON, Aug. 8 (UPI)Six more Trident 2E jetliners have been ordered by China, Hawker Siddeley Aviation, Ltd., an nounced today.

title: Nixon's Acceptance Speech Will Signal Street Protests
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 8 (AP) When President Nixon begins his acceptance speech inside convention hall, demonstrators will flood into the streets for nonviolent civil disobedi ences, according to the plan of the protest leaders.

title: Community Health Elects
description: Seth H. Baker, recently re signed chairman of the execu tive committee of H. Hentz & Co., Inc., the brokerage firm, has been elected chairman of Community Health Facilities, Inc. Baltimore.

title: Attacks Nixon Economics
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 8 Senator McGovern, in an attack on President Nixon's economic policies, asserted today that Nixonomics included delib erately throwing people out of work as part of the fight against inflation, a pillow fight for big business and a bludgeon for working people, and a tax structure which re wards those at the top and gouges those in the middle.

title: Joe Iz 4lENGTH Victor In Feature at Saratoga
Front Page 3  No Title
description: OLYMPIC Uckets holels Reduced rates Tn77700X638

title: Notes on People
description: Dr. Dixy Lee Ray, a marine biologist, became the first woman to be sworn in for a full fiveyear term on the Atomic Energy Commis sion. In a White House cere mony, for which President Nixon provided a new Bible, Dr. Ray was described by Dr. James Schlesinger, the A.E.C. chairman, as one who would be an asset in handling the commission's difficult prob lems of balancing the de demands of energy and en vironment.

title: Bank Aide Elected
description: Harry W. Albright Jr., New York Superintendent of Banks, announced yesterday that Eliot N. Vestner Jr. had been ap pointed to the $37,228ayear post of First Deputy Superin tendent of Banks. Mr. Vcstner, who previously served as spe cial counsel to the former Superintendent of Banks, Frank Wille, will succeed John T. Morgan, who resigned to accept a position in private industry.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES IN A MIXED COURSE
description: The price of oldcrop soy beans rose sharply yesterday as the price of newcrop beans dropped.

title: TieDyeing Festival Brightens a Park
description: More than 50 youngstersas young as 6 years and as old as 16had a ball last week at an outdoor tiedyeing festival in upper Riverside Park. After a little rudimentary instruction, dozens of youngsters from the neighborhood were squirting dye on pieces of muslin, knotting them up with rubber bands, cooking them in dye vats, rinsing them out under a nearby fire hydrant that had been uncorked for the event, and then proudly hanging their multicolored, gaily pat terned productions to dry.

title: LINDSAY REJECTS A REDLIGHT AREA
description: There will be no approval for a citycontrolled redlight dis trict here, Mayor Lindsay dis closed yesterday.

title: Mrs. Nixon Asserts Jane Fonda Should Have Bid Hanoi End War
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (UPI) Mrs. Richard Nixon, criticiz ing Jane Fonda's charges of American bombing damage in North Vietnam, said today that the actress should have asked Hanoi to stop their aggres sion,

title: Longshoremen and Police Clash in British Strike
description: LONDON, Aug. 8 (UPI)  Hundreds of striking longshore men hurled rocks and bricks today in a running battle with the police at Scunthorpe in Lincolnshire.

title: BATTLE DEVELOPS TO EAST OF SAIGON
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Aug. 9South Viet namese soldiers reportedly fought enemy forces in rubber plantations 17 miles east of Sai gon yesterday and early reports from the field said that Gov ernment casualties were heavy.

title: G.O.P. Says Rivals Plan $144Billion Budget Rise
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 The Nixon Administration charged today that the Demo cratic party platform, even without Senator George Mc. Govern's plan for basic income maintenance, would increase by $144billion a Federal budget that is already running a siza ble deficit.

title: Miss Stack Victor
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 8 (AP) Thirdseeded Susan Stap of Deerfield, Ill., came within 2 points of losing, but rallied to pull out a 36, 86, 64 victory today over Dundee Davis of Houston in the United States girls 18andunder tennis cham pionships.

title: U.S. Judge Rules F.D.I.C. Exceeded Power on Merger
description: In a decision of major Impor tance to bankmerger regula tion, a Federal court has ruled that the Federal Deposit Insur ance Corporation exceeded its powers in denying a proposed bank merger on the grounds that the combination would violate the F.D.I.C.'s concept of a desirable banking structure.

title: State Moose Convention Opens Here Tomorrow
description: Some 1,200 delegates from the 104 Loyal Order of the Moose lodges in the state will assemble at the Statler Hilton Hotel tomorrow for the start of the New York Moose Association's 57th annual con vention.

title: Six Men Start MontauktoConey Island Relay Swim
description: MONTAUK, L. I., Aug. 8 Benson Huggard, a Nassau County patrolman, pulled the blackrimmed goggles over his eyes, turned and waved to the 35 or so onlookers today, and said: I'm doing it because it's never been done before. Then he dived into Montauk Harbor here to be gin the first leg of a sixman, 150mile relay swim the length of Long Islandfrom Montauk to Coney Island.

title: Smoke Shrouds Moscow As PeatBog Fire Rages
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 8  Many Muscovites are wiping tears from their eyes these days, not because Boris Spassky is trailing Bobby Fischer in the world chess championship, but because of smoke from a forest and peatbog fire about 50 miles east of the capital.

title: Advertising:
description: Al Lerman, who traveled around the world last year to prepare Schlitz commercials for the Leo Burnett Company, has just joined McCann Erickson to travel some more. He has been appointed a senior vice president of McCann  Erickson Interna tional and will do creative work on such accounts as Esso and Nescafe.

title: End of Building Program and Change In Enrollments Planned by State U.
description: ALBANY, Aug. 8  The end of a $2.9billion building pro gram and the beginning of a period of innovation in enroll ment patterns were envisioned here today in the State Univer sity's master plan for the bal ance of the nineteenseventies.

title: SUPERSONICS SIGN BRISKER OF A.B.A.
description: SEATTLE, Aug. 8 (AP)The standout forward, John Brisker, who bought his own contract to escape the American Basket ball Association, signed a multi year pact with the Seattle Su per Sonics today, the National Basketball Association club an nounced.

title: Chess Play Adjourned
description: After 40 moves, Bobby Fischer and Boris Spassky adjourned the 12th game of their world championship chess match in Reykjavik, Iceland. Play is to resume to day. Details on Page 34.

title: C.I.A. Plans No Further Action
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8The C.I.A. plans no further attempts to block publication of the McCoy book, a spokesman for the agency said today.

title: Algeria Get Hijackers' Plea
description: ALGIERS, Aug. 8 (UPI)Five American hijackers who divert ed a Delta Airlines passenger jet to Algeria after extorting $1million in ransom appealed to the Algerian authorities to day to give them money and permit them to go elsewhere.

title: Some in Senate Seek to Modify Jackson Resolution to Stress OverAll, Not Numerical, Arms Equality
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 Some members of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee proposed today to add one word to Senator Henry M. Jack son's resolution setting forth Congressional interpretations of the interim agreement with the Soviet Union on offensive missiles.

title: A Summer Night's Dream: The Arts in Central Park
description: Just before dusk yesterday, hundreds of people packed up blankets, bottles of wine and elaborate picnic suppers, and struck out into Central Park.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: IRON CHANCELLOR WINS AT SOMERS
description: SOMERS, N. Y., Aug. 8Iron Chancellor, a 5yearold brown gelding owned by Mr. and Mrs. Allan Blinken of New York City, won his first champion ship today when he captured the regular working hunter title at the 25th annual Northern Westchester Professional Horse men's Association horse show.

title: White House Gets Portrait
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP) The White House announced today that it had obtained a portrait of President John Adams, the first President to occupy the mansion. The por trait, painted by John Trum bull in 1793 when Adams was Vice President, was presented to the White House on long term loan by the Fogg Art Mu seum of Harvard University.

title: About Motor Sports
description: There's an old Army story about the officer candidate who breaks a leg on the obstacle course. As he writhes on the ground, waiting for the ambulance, an instructor yells at him: Don't just lie there, do pushups!

title: Busing Bill's Sponsor Albert Harold Quie
description: Man in the News

title: . . . The Missing Chapters
description: Three chapters of the report of the Council on Environ mental Quality have been withheld at least until after the November election. The missing material concerns the energy crisis with its politically sensitive ramifica tions in the oil and gas industry, the weaknesses in Federalstate management of the Delaware River Basin and the problems involved in recycling wastes.

title: PATROLMAN IS SHOT AND THEN SUSPENDED
description: Critically wounded in a shoot ing after an earlymorning bar room argument in Brooklyn, 30yearold offduty policeman was suspended without pay yesterday pending an investiga tion of the case.

title: Woodall Really Cooking, But for Army, Not Jets
description: Both the Jets (who had to) and the Giants (who didn't) announced roster cuts yester day. Since none of the names was well known, a more note worthy development was the placing of Al Woodall, the Jets' reserve quarterback, on the military reserve list.

title: Sons of P.O.W.'s Aided
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP)  President Nixon signed to day a bill giving special treat ment to military academy ap plicants who are sons of pris oners of war or sons of men missing in action. The new law places them in the highest priority in a category already established for sons of service members who have been killed in action or who suffered com plete physical disability.

title: HOUSE BIT VOTES STIFF BUSING CURB FOR GRADE SCHOOL
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8The House Education and Labor Committee, the most liberal committee in the House, ap proved today legislation that would prohibit long  distance busing to desegregate elemen tary schools.

title: Music Fete
description: LENOX, Mass., Aug. 8 American symphony orches tras, in case you haven't no ticed, are not given to cud dling up with the avant garde. Because of their na ture and history, large or chestras are inherently con servative: They often may be led to the avantgarde water by some resourceful conduc tor, but it is rare indeed that they really swallow it.

title: Politics and Law
description: The refusal of the Supreme Court to overturn Justice Douglas' stay of the EllsbergRusso trial is a reassuring sign that judicial independence is capable of surviving the supercharged political atmosphere enveloping the Pentagon Papers case.

title: Japan's G.N.P. Increases
description: TOKYO, Aug. 8 (Reuters) The Economic Planning Agency announced today that Japan's gross national product in 1971 totaled 81,141,900,000,000 yen (about $101.42billion) in nom inal terms and 60,913,000,000, 000 yen (about $76.14billion) in real terms, an increase of 10.8 per cent and 5.9 per cent, respectively, over 1970.

title: Britain Frees 47 More Suspected Ulster Terrorists
description: BELFAST, Aug. 8The Brit ish administration in Northern Ireland announced today the release of an additional 47 men who had been held without trial as suspected terrorists.

title: Jersey Bus Fare Rise Sought
description: NEWARK, Aug. 8 (UPI) Transport of New Jersey asked, the Public Utilities Commission today to approve a series of fare increases. The company, according to Richard Fryling, the company counsel, is seeking an increase of 10 cents on all bus fares 60 cents or above and a new student fare of 40 cents, instead of the present 30 cent charge for students. Last May 22 the P.U.C. granted the company a 5cent use in fares to 40 cents for a basic, single zone ride.

title: Cornell's Wood in Dual Post
description: ITHACA, N. Y., Aug 8 (AP) Daniel P. Wood, soccer coach at Cornell for one season, will take on additional duties as tennis coach. Wood succeeds Edward J. Moylan, who will re main on Cornell's physical education staff.

title: Kenya Will Seal Border To Bar Ugandan Asians
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Aug. 8. (Reuters)  Kenya said today she would seal her frontier to bar entry to Asians threat ened with expulsion from neighboring Uganda.

title: Senate Unit, 10 to 4, Kills Bill to Limit Bank Taxes
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP)The Senate Banking Com mittee voted 10 to 4 today to kill legislation that would have barred state and local governments from imposing intangible property taxes on commercial banks. Senator William Proxmire of Wiscon sin, the committee's ranking Democrat, called the vote a great victory for state and local governments and crushing defeat for the bank ing lobby.

title: Ramsey Clark Describes Destruction in Haiphong
description: TOKYO, Wednesday, Aug. 9 (AP)The Hanoi radio quoted. Ramsey Clark today as having said that he had seen massive destruction in many parts of Haiphong and that many people must have been killed by American bombing.

title: Men's Lib Almost Underground, but a Growing Movement
description: All of my life, Richard Huggins, a New York industrial designer was say ing, I've wanted to feel a belonging, a sense of community, a brotherhood, and there's nothing in one's work or this crazy urban world you can get it from. But I'm getting it from the group, because we're not just rapping about politics or baseball scores; we're talking about feelings.

title: 72 Station Wagons Recalled By Ford to Check Jack Slot
description: DETROIT, Aug. 8 (AP)The Ford Company announced today it was recalling its entire pro duction of 1972model fullsize Ford station wagons for in spection and possible modifica tion of jack slots in the cars' bumpers. The recall will affect 157,467 cars.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8The back lash to the dropping of Senator Tom Eagleton as the Democratic party's VicePresidential nominee is now hit ting those who advocated his with drawal, and it adds up to a powerful politic al force.

title: Napalmed Girl Recovering in Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 8 (AP)Two months after napalm dropped by a South Vietnamese plane sent Phan Thi Kim Phuc, who is 9 years old, screaming in pain and panic down a high way northwest of Saigon, she has nearly recovered from her burns.

title: TV Posts to Russell, Liquori
description: Bill Russell, a former Olym pian and Boston Celtics basket ball star, and Marty Liguori, a runner sidelined with an in jury, will provide commentary on their specialties at the Munich Olympics for the Amer ican Broadcasting Company, the television network an nounced yesterday.

title: Law and the BurgerNixon Court
description: STANFORD, Calif.Does the Nixon Burger era mean a dratatic aboutface from the constitutional law of the War ren Court? If I had to limit myself to oneogeneralizationbased partly.on the substance of the decisions so far, partly on guesses about the future I would say that there is not nearly so much to the aboutface assertions as some newspaper columnists and polit ical leaders believe. The Court's work notoriously resists oversimplification.

title: Reports Say Russia Buying U.S. Soybeans
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (Reuters)The Soviet Union has bought between 35 mil lion and 40 million bushels of United States soybeans, val ued at about $125million, in formed sources here said to night. It could be the first purchase of soybeans made by the Soviet Union from the United States.

title: American Can to Close 9 Plants and Sell 3
description: The American Can Company announced yesterday that it would terminate nine obsolete or uneconomical canmaking plants and would transfer this business and move production to other facilities. The company also plans to sell three of its pulp and paper plants.

title: CONCERT IN PARK DRAWS BIG CROWD
description: Was it Tchaikovsky, booming cannons, fireworks, conductor Henry Lewis, pianist Gary Graffman or a beautiful starry night that drew acres of people to the New York Philharmonic concert at the Sheep Meadow in Central Park last night?

title: CITY UNIT WEIGHS FUENTES DISPUTE
description: Mrs. Eleanor Holmes Norton, the chairman of the City's Commission on Human Rights, said yesterday that her agency was actively involved in try ing to resolve the current con troversy over the appointment of Luis Fu'entes as superinten dent of Community School Dis trict 1, on the Lower East Side.

title: Crofut Charms in Songs Written for His Children
description: The Mall in Central Park was alive with sounds on Monday night. But only some of them were pertinent to the activities there. From the Wollman Rink, the amplified rock and Latin sounds of Sa voy Brown and Malo drifted across the Mall. From over head, the roar and thrum of planes and helicopters drifted down.

title: Personalities: K.C. Jones Hired
description: The American Basketball Association's new team, the San Diego Conquistadors, filled its two most important nonplaying positions yester day by naming K. C. Jones as coach and Alex Groza as gen eral manager. Jones a star with the Boston Celtics in their best years from 1956 to 1966, served as a scout with the Los Angeles Lakers, the National Basketball Associa tion champions, last season after coaching at Brandeis University and Harvard. Groza helped form the Ken tucky Colonels in 1968 when that team was a charter mem ber of the A.B.A. The former star at the University of Ken tucky played in the N.B.A. but had to leave pro basket ball as a player following a pointshaving scandal involv ing his play at Kentucky. Jones, 40 years old, and Groza, 45, will attend an A.B.A. expansion draft in New York tomorrow.

title: Walter Plate, Artist, Dies at 4C7; Taught at Woodstock and R.P.I.
description: WOODSTOCK, N.Y., Aug. 8 Walter Plate, an artist and teacher of art, died on Sunday at his home here of a cerebral hemorrhage. He was 47 years old.

title: SAFRA MAKES OFFER ON KINGS LAFAYETTE
description: Edmond J. Safra, the Swiss financier, announced yester day a formal offer to buy up to 155,423 shares of the King Lafayette Corporation at $40 per share. The tender offer which will he handled by a group of securities firms head ed by CBWLHayden, Stone, Inc.would give Mr. Safra 64 per cent of the shares of the parent company of the $237 million, Brooklynbased Kings Lafayette Bank.

title: Stage: A London Trio
description: LONDONWhat makes a national theater? Britain's National Theater, after lan guishing somewhat last year, has this season turned itself around and up, and current ly, at its temporary home at the Old Vic Theater, can of fer a very fair reply to that sometimes vexed question. One requirement of a na tional theater is variety, an other is tradition and yet a third is innovation.

title: Market Place Stock Plunges On Record Net
description: The shares of a Minneapo lis seed company with a heavy institutional following were hammered down 10 points to 23 bid in heavy trading yesterday.

title: Premier in Taiwan Warns Tokyo on Severing Ties
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Aug. 8 (Reuters)  Premier Chiang Chingkuo of Nationalist China warned Japan tonight to re frain from actions detrimen tal to relations between the countries.

title: Voter Confusion Cited in Lowenstein's Suit to Void His Defeat
description: Commissioner Jack J. Duber stein of the City Board of Elec tions testified in State Supreme Court in Brooklyn yesterday that many voters telephoned the board's Brooklyn office during the June 20 primary to find out where they were sup posed to vote.

title: Pope John's Brother Dies
description: ROME, Aug. 8Alfredo Ron calli, one of the three surviv ing brothers of the late Pope John XXIII, died early today at his home in the small village of Sotto ii Monte in northern Italy. He was 83 years old. Pope Paul VI sent Mr. Ron calli's family his apostolic blessing and a warm telegram of condolence in which he praised the shyness and sim plicity, the true humbleness, the Christian fortitude of his predecessor's younger brother.

title: Dorothy N. King, 64, Dies; Author of Children's Books
description: Dorothy N. King, author of children's books and, under her married name, Mrs. James Wer blow, a volunteer in cancer re search, died yesterday at Me morial Hospital for Cancer and Allied Diseases. She was 64 year old and lived at 50 East 79th Street.

title: Norwegian Skipper First
description: COPENHAGEN, Aug. 8 (UPI) Kalle Neergaard of Norway won the first heat of the Euro pean Soling Class sailing cham pionships today. Britain's John Oakley finished second ahead of Per Spilling of Norway, the defending world champion, Paul Elvstroem of Denmark, finished fifth.

title: OFFICIAL SUSPENDED BY POSTAL SERVICE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP) The banking director of the United States Postal Service has been placed on leave with out pay pending an inquiry in to his action in helping a Wash ington attorney obtain a $500,000 loan from a New York bank that does more than a billion dollars' worth of busi ness annually with the Postal Service. The suspension of James T. Blair was announced by the Postal Service today.

title: STOCKS DISPLAY MIXED PATTERN
description: The stock market basically played a waiting game yester day as some highqualityand highpriceglamour issues rose to new peaks while the general trend was flat.

title: Bangladesh Asks U.N. Tie But China May Bar Entry
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Aug. 8  Bangladesh formally applied today for United Na tions membership. The pros pects for admission were clouded by China's presence on the Security Council.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (Reuters)The Federal National Mortgage Association said today it had accepted $81.7 million of bids on fourmonth commitments for 7 per cent Federal Housing Administration and Veterans Administra tion home mortgages at its auction yesterday.

title: M. E. RICKETTS, 91, OF CHAPPELL & CO.
description: LONDON, Aug. 8 (UPI)The death of M. E. Ricketts. chair man of the Chappell & Co., the music publishing concern was announced today. He was 91 years old.

title: More U.S. Aid for Manila
description: WASHINGTON, Aug 8 (Reu ters) President Nixon today authorized $30million in addi tional aid to floodstricken areas in the Philippines, the White House announced. Most of the money will be used for rice and flour.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: MUNICH, West Germany. Aug. 8 (AP)Avery Brun dage, president of the International Olympic Committee, reaffirmed today the 1.0.C.'s decision to allow Rhodesian participation in the Olympic Games.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Executive Changes
description: Samuel A. Angotti, a vicepresident of R. J. Reynolds Industries, Inc., and president of R.J.R. Foods, Inc., a Reynolds subsidiary, has become chairman of R.J.R. Foods. He remains chief execu tive officer. W. Bradley Blair succeeds Mr. Angotti as president of the food company and as chair man of the R.J.R. Archer Inc. subsidiary of Reyn olds. Mr. Blair remains as chief executive officer RIR. Archer. James Corrigan Jr. succeeds Mr. Blair as president of R.J.R. Archer with the duties of chief operating officer.

title: Convention Reform Split Appears Wider ire G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8The split between Republican con servatives and liberals over the issue of convention reform ap peared to widen today.

title: FREDERIC TOZERE,
description: Frederic Tozere, an actor whose first Broadway ap pearance was in 1924 with Fred Stone in Stepping Stones and whose 52d and last was in the comedy Little Boxes in 1969 died on Saturday in his apart ment at 269 West 72d Street. He gave his age as 71 but was believed to be some years older.

title: NOFAULT IIELDUP BY SENATE, 4946
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8The Senate voted tonight to side track a bill to set up a national system of nofault automobile I insurance by sending it to the Judiciary Committee for further study, thus possibly closing the door to enactment in this ses sion of Congress.

title: Reputed Gangster Is Slain
description: CHICAGO HEIGHTS, Ill., Aug. 8 (AP)Guido Fidanzi, a 45 yearold reputed member of the] crime syndicate, was fatally shot today at a gasoline station here. Lieut. Frank Grupp of thel Chicago Heights Police Depart ment said witnesses told him two men drove into the service station moments after Fidanzi, arrived. Fidanzi tried to find refuge in a washroom but was shot four times in the head, chest and groin, Lieutenant Grupp said.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: G. LE ROY SCHEINLER
description: CROTON, N.Y., Aug. 8G. LeRoy Scheinler, onetime presi dent of the Rubber Exchange and a retired rubber broker, died today at the Bari Manor Apartments here. He was 71 years old.

title: ExGov.Williams Backs Nixon
description: JACKSON, Miss., Aug. 8 (AP)  Former Gov. John Bell Wil liams, a Democrat, threw his support to President Nixon's reelection effort today and predicted a Republican sweep of the South in a winning cam paign.

title: CARDS BEAT METS ON HOMER, 6 TO 5
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 8The New York Mets added a few more furrows to Yogi Berra's brow tonight when they lost again to the St. Louis Cardinals, 65, on a tworun homer by Luis Melendez in the eighth inning.

title: Williams Asks Changes
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP) Senator Harrison A. Williams. Jr. declared today the most im portant step Congress can take for the securities industry is to reshape its decision and pol icymaking structures.

title: ISI NEWBORN
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 8 (UPI) Isi Newborn, horse racing writer for The Cleveland Press, died last night, apparently of a heart attack. He was 64 years old.

title: Actor to Aid Schmitz
description: HOLLYWOOD, Aug. 8 (AP) Walter Brennan, the actor, said today that he had agreed to serve as finance chairman for the American party's presi dential candidate, Representa tive John G. Schmitz, Republi Icon of Calif.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: YIELDS DECLINE IN CREDIT MARKET
description: Credit Markets

title: Some Large Donors Deserting McGovern
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 Fif teen of 35 wealthy Democrats who contributed a total of $1.2 million to the preconvention nominating campaigns of Sen ators Hubert H. Humphrey and Edmund S. Muskie say that they will give nothing or only token amounts to the Presiden tial campaign of Senator George McGovern. Thirteen of them say that they will help to fi nance and will vote for the re election of President Nixon.

title: Gay Sonnet, $8.80, Captures Monmouth Sprint by 2 Lengths
Metropolitan Briefs
description: Hotel Workers Accept Pact

title: Idaho Senate Races
description: BOISE, Idaho, Aug. 8 (AP) Representative James A. Mc Clure and Idaho State Univer sity's president, William F. Da vis, were nominated today to the Senate seat of Len B. Jor dan, who is retiring.

title: Bush Universal Appoints
description: Bush Universal, Inc., an nounced yesterday the appoint ment of Miles S. Chenault as president and chief executive officer. Donald J. Matthews, who previously held these po sitions, will continue as chair man.

title: BROOKE OPPOSES SAFEGUARD PLAN
description: A new rule tentatively pro posed by the Securities and Exchange Commission to gov ern the safekeeping of custom ers' securities by brokerage firms has been challenged as possibly inadequate and un workable by Senator Edward W. Brooke.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: MAX KNOELL'S birthday to today. Happy Birthday Max, and many happy returns! Al.Advt.

title: Missouri Governorship
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 8 (AP) State Auditor Christopher Bond easily won the Republican nomination for Governor and Edward L. Dowd, a St. Louis lawyer, was the apparent win ner of the Democratic nomina tion in today's Missouri primary election.

title: STATE TURNSDOWN NASSAU OTB PLAN
description: Nassau County's application for an offtrack betting opera tion using the Pick Six game was rejected in Albany yester day by the Stale Offtrack Pari Mutuel Betting Commission as a numbers game purely and simply.

title: Philips Licenses Ford for Stirling Engine
description: DETROIT, Aug. 8The Ford Motor Company announced to day a multimilliondollar licens ing agreement with a Dutch electronics corporation to de velop and possibly manufacture a quiet, lowpollution engine.

title: Vatican Finds AllCovering Solution
description: ROME, Aug. 8The Vati can will provide long black plastic overcoats for women wearing miniskirts who want to enter St. Peter's Basilica, it was announced here today.

title: M.T.A. Gives Aid For Buses Serving Westchester Area
description: YONKERS, Aug. 8In a move to bolster Westchester County's financially pressed bus lines, the Metropolitan Transportation Authority gave the county $795,091 today. And the three major bus lines, in turn, gave their 90,000 riders a guarantee that present fares and services would remain in effect for the next 18 months.

title: Nigeria Uses Market Place to Ballyhoo New Money
description: IKEJA, Nigeria, Aug. 8 Although it was during the heat of the day and the trad ers were lounging in the shade of their Ikeja market stalls, Emanuel Adelaja Adel eye drew a crowd almost at once when he started to talk.

title: Meskill Gives Up On SalesTax Cut
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 8Gov. Thomas J. Meskill announced today that a rollback in the state sales tax from 7 per cent to 6.5 per cent would no longer be possible this year, in view of a State Supreme Court de cision Monday declaring that Connecticut's capitalgains lev ies were excessive.

title: Goldilocks Winner
description: BRANCHVILLE, N. J., Aug. 8Mary Ann Steiert, a high school junior from Gwynedd Valley, Pa., rode both the cham pion and runnerup in the small pony division tonight at the Sussex County horse show. Lis eter Hall Farm's Liseter Goldi locks captured the title with 17 points and Lisa Jerez's Liseter Rose Beauty was the reserve champion with 8.

title: Meeting of Democrats Checked on TV by Chess
description: Furious chess fans yester day forced WNET/Channel 13 to cut away from the Pub lic Broadcasting Service's coverage of the Democratic National Committee meeting in Washington and resume playbyplay recreations of the Bobby FischerBoris Spassky match underway in Iceland.

title: Notes on People
description: The United States today is like Russia before the 1917 Revolution, said Alexandra Tolstoy, the 88yearold daughter of Count Leo Tol stoy, the novelist. It's just the picture we had before the Revolution. Nobody wanted to work, money went down, strikes,

title: 47 Students in South Africa Plead Not Guilty to Rioting
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Aug. 9 (Reuters)  Fortyseven students arrested after a clash with policemen two months ago at the Uni versity of the Witwatersrand went on trial and pleaded not guilty today to violating the Riotous Assemblies Act.

title: Chinese Theater Is on the Rise in City
description: Stymied In attempts to break into the professional performing arts here, lead ing Chinese stage and film stars from Taiwan and Hong Kongand many na tive  born Chinese  Ameri cansare turning their tal ents inward toward the city's Chinese community, fostering what some see as the stirrings of a cultural revolution in Chinatown.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: HAPPY BIRTHDAY TO THE CHAMP, David Schorr, we got you last,Advt.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 9 (UPI)The Interna tional Olympic Committee solved the problem of Rhodesia's participation in the Olympic Games today by guaranteeing to the Supreme African Sports Council that the Rhodesians would compete as British subjects.

title: Soviet Using Planes to Fight Widespread Fires
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 9 Aircraft and explosives are being used to combat forest fires raging in the central Russian timber lands, the Soviet press reported today.

title: Business Briefs
description: LONDON, Aug. 9 (AP)The price of freemarket gold dropped about $1 an ounce in European bullion markets today but by the end of the day buyers were again appearing in the market. The dollar strengthened on most foreign exchanges except in London, where the pound improved at the expense of American money.

title: Business Briefs
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Aug. 9 (Reuters)The South African Reserve Bank's governor, Theunis De Jongh, said today that the bank rate would be cut to 6 per cent from 6,5 per cent, effective tomorrow lie added that the bank's pattern of interest rates for transactions in Government stock would be adjusted downward by a quarter per cent. Thus, the rate for stock of threeyear currency will be re duced to 6 per cent from 6.25 cent per annum and that for stock of 20year currency or more to 8.25 per cent from 8.5 per cent.

title: POWER IN LISBON IS CUT BY BEASTS
description: LISBON, Aug. 9Electric power was partly cut in this capital and other Portuguese centers today, apparently by revolutionary forces, shortly before President. Americo Thom az took office for a third term.

title: Psychiatrist Finds Insights on People From a Dog's Life
description: News of Dogs

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (AP) Mr. McGovern named Repre sentative Frank Thompson Jr. of New Jersey today to head national voter registration drive.

title: J. D. CARPENTER, JERSEY LAWYER
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N. J., Aug. 9James D. Carpenter, a noted New Jersey lawyer and former Government official, died today of heart failure at his summer home in Hayward, Wis. He was 87 years old and lived at 12 South Mountain Avenue.

title: Social Security Raise Will Cut Benefits for Aged, Lindsay Says
description: Mayor Lindsay warned yes terday that thousands of eld erly New Yorkers faced the loss of Medicaid coverage and the right to buy food stamps when Social Security payments increase 20 per cent starting Oct. 3.

title: Body Found in Car at Airport May Be Linked to a Drug War
description: A body found locked in the trunk of a beige 1972 Chrysler sedan at La Guardia Airport yes terday may have bees another casualty of the growing vio lence connected with narcotics trafficking within the black communities of East Coast cities, some investigators said.

title: Books of The Times
description: HOW TO KEEP WHAT YOU HAVE, OR, WHAT YOUR BROKER NEVER TOLD YOU. By Charles V. Neal. 216 pages. Doubleday. $7.95 FLATION. By Abba Lerner. 190 pages. Quad rangle Books. $5.95

title: WHITE HOUSE ADDS TO ARMS DEBATE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9The White House began backing away today from Senator Henry M. Jackson's public elaborations on the meaning of the resolu tion he has been trying to attach to the offensiveweapons agreement with the Soviet Union.

title: QUIET PLEASE TAKES GREEN HUNTER LEAD
description: BRANCHVILLE, N. J., Aug. 9 Quiet Please, owned by Mrs. Harry Hemphil and handled by Rod Jenkins, scored victories in the first two secondyear green working hunter classes today to move into the lead for the Sussex County horse show championship.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: QUABBIN RESERVOIR, Mass.Where the Swift Riv er forms a deep pool just be low the Quabbin Reservoir, Jack Swedberg and I cast flies for trout under a bril liant midday sun.

title: Poverty Aide's Death Puzzles Friends
description: People who had worked with Maria Estela and those she had helped expressed bewilderment over the slaying of the 40year old antipoverty official as they gathered for her funeral yester day at St. Athanasius Roman Catholic Church in the Hunts Point section of the Bronx.

title: Garelik Wants a New Way To Pick Investigation Chief
description: City Council President San ford D. Garelik proposed yester day that the city's Commis sioner of Investigation be chosen for a fiveyear term by a panel of judges, instead of being appointed by the Mayor, to make the office independent and nonpolitical.

title: G.O.P. BLOC FIGHTS 76 REFORM PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9A group of Republican Congress men seeking party reforms de clined today to support pend ing recommendations that would require young people and minority group members on all 1976 convention commit tees and thus in all state dele gations.

title: Decision on Productivity Made in 1970
description: Early in September, 1970, at a meeting in Mayor Lindsay's City Hall office, the key decision was made that culminated in yesterday's announcement of productivity standards.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (UPI) The Democratic National Com mittee adopted on a voice vote today a resolution creating a commission to study new meth ods of selecting the VicePresi dential nominee.

title: OIL AND GAS IMPORTS CALLED PERIL TO U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (UPI) Official and private oil ex perts warned today of the effects on national security and the international balance of payments resulting from in creasing American reliance on foreign oil and natural gas.

title: C.A.B. Votes, 32, To Let 3 Lines Talk On FlightCat Pact
description: In a 3to2 vote, the Civil Aeronautics Board yesterday authorized American Airlines, Trans World Airlines and United Air Lines to nego tiate a six  month extension of a controversial agree ment under which the lines reciprocally cut flights on four routes.

title: LINDSAY UPHOLDS HIS PROSECUTORS
description: Mayor Lindsay praised the city's District Attorneys and policemen yesterday and disa greed with the contention of the Knapp Commission that the District Attorneys were reluc tant to prosecute the police for corruption because they were allies.

title: FUND BILL PASSED AS HOUSE DEFIES THREAT OF A VETO
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9  The House passed today by a, vote of 239 to 166 the final version of a $30.5billion ap propriation bill for education, health, welfare and similar pro grams despite the nearcertain ty of a Presidential veto.

title: American Enka Co. Increases Prices On Nylon Products
description: Price Changes

title: City Pools Made Free
description: The Parks, Recreation and Cultural Affairs Administration announced yesterday that all of its 37 outdoor swimming pools would be open on week days, free of charge to both children and adults, from 10 A.M. to 1 P.M.

title: Brezhnev Meeting With Top Aides Seen as Effort to Spur Soviet Harvest
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 9Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Commu nist party leader, has held a new highlevel meeting on farm issues with party and Govern ment leaders in an evident ef fort to spur the harvest in the wake of unfavorable weather.

title: Jury in Pentagon Papers Trial Sent Home Until MidOctober
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 9The jury in the Pentagon papers case was sent home today until at least midOctober in what will apparently be the longest pause in the course of a jury trial in United States legal his tory.

title: 105 Killed in Nepal
description: KATMANDU, Nepal, Aug. 9 (UPI)Landslides and monsoon floods have claimed 105 lives in this Himalayan monarchy in the last two weeks, Government officials said today. The Home Minister. Jog Mehr Shrestha, told the National Assembly that a total of 105 persons were buried or drowned in landslides and floods, including 47 persons who were killed July 27 in a big landslide in western Nepal.

title: Big Board and Amex Issue Reports on the Stockholdings of Insiders
ROUNDUP: CARLTON WINS 13TH IN ROW
description: No pitcher with a last place team has ever won a Cy Young Award, but Steve Carlton of the Philadelphia Phillies may change all that.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug, 9 (UPI) To contribute to party un ity, Representative William S. Conover, Republican of Penn sylvania, today stepped out of the race for the 20th District. House seat, Mr. Conover was elected last April to fill out the term of the late James Fulton but the district was eliminated by redistricting.

title: L.I. Youth Hurt in Fall
description: MOAB, Utah, Aug. 9 (UPI) A Long Island teenager was still unconscious today but in improved condition at a hospi tal here after a 175foot fall in Canyonlands National Park. A spokesman at Allen Memorial Hospital said Howard Sard, 16, of Huntington, while in a coma, is in fair condition after suf fering a concussion and abra sions Monday in the fall down a slockrock slope.

title: Knicks Play Bullets Sept. 22
description: The New York Knickerbock ers' preseason opener against the Baltimore Bullets at Mon mouth College, West Long Branch, N. J., has been resched uled for Friday night, Sept. 22. The game had originally been scheduled for Sept. 23.

title: Tanglewood Concert Honors Fromm
description: LENOX, Mass., Aug. 9 The arguing, booing and in trafraternal namecalling that have enlivened or polluted (taste in these matters varies) this year's Festival of Contemporary Music at Tan glewood were put aside last night. The atleast temporary healing agent was a concert honoring the 20th anniver sary of the Fromm Music Foundation, which cooperates with the Berkshire Music Cen ter in putting on this annual celebration of newness in the very bosom of the conserva tive Boston Symphony Orches tra and its Tanglewood Fes tival.

title: Korean Cardinal Assails Repression by Seoul
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 9Stephen Cardinal Kim, the leader of the Roman Catholic Church in South Korea, strongly criticized the Gov ernment today for unilat erally imposing its policies on the South Korean people while repressing their basic right to freely look, listen, speak and consult.

title: Roads to Use to Reach Westchester Links
description: From Tappan Zee Bridge use U.S. Route 287 (Cross Westchester Expressway) to Exit 10 at Purchase Street (Route 120), Rye. Follow Pur chase Street to club.

title: Nixon Is Sent Bill Doubling Pension of Justices' Widows
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (AP) The Senate passed and sent to President Nixon today a bill increasing from $5,000 to $10, 000 the annual pensions of widow,: of former Justices of the Supreme Court.

title: Coast Film Festival Set
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 9 (UPI)The 1972 San Francisco International Film Festival will be held from Oct, 12 through Oct. 22 at the Fine Arts Thea ter here, it was reported by Claude Jarman, executive di rector. In addition to 21 feature films from countries through out the world, there will be two midnight showings and retrospective tributes to noted personalities and filmmakers, who will be on hand to discuss their works.

title: MARTIN I. KING DIES; EXSTOCKBROKER, 73
description: Martin I. King, a retired stockbroker and specialist in foreign exchange, died of a heart ailment on Tuesday at his home, 1025 Fifth Avenue. He was 73 years old.

title: Accidental No. 2 Man
description: Sad as it has been, the Eagleton af fair may be of some value if it focuses the country's attention on our sloppy method of choosing VicePresidential candidates. We allow the party's Pres idential nominee, punchdrunk with fatigue, to make his selection in the few hours between his weehours con vention floor victory and the follow ing afternoon's press conference. He does only as much homework as his time and inclinations allow. No wonder the system works poorly in its most crucial test  producing a man to follow fallen President.

title: Assemblyman Takes Post
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Aug. 9 Assemblyman Eli Wager of Woodmere announced today that he would assume the post of coordinator of all suburban campaigns for the Democratic state Legislative Campaign Committee rather than bring about devisiveness within the party by running as an in dependent candidate in Novem ber. Mr. Wager lost a suit yes terday that had sought to over turn the results of the June Democratic primary in the 20th Assembly District, in which he was defeated by Arthur J. Kremer of Long Beach.

title: British Prepare for Influx
description: LONDON, Aug. 9 (AP)The British Government announced today it was setting up a high level committee to handle possible influx from Uganda of thousands of Asians.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Italian Reds Assail Trials
description: ROME, Aug. 9The Italian Cmmunist party, largest in the West, today condemned the trials in Czechoslovakia, which it termed judicial persecu tion, and said that they raised serious questions about the sit uation in Czechoslovakia.

title: Race Skippers Enjoy Beaching
description: EDGARTOWN, Mass., Aug. 9For 600 racing sailors on the New York Yacht Club's annual cruise the key tactical decisions here today had nothing to do with sail changes.

title: Ernst von Salomon Dead; West German Author, 69
description: BONN, Aug. 9Ernst von Salomon, a West German author, died of heart failure at his home near Hamburg today. He was 69 years old.

title: VIOLATIONS CHARGED TO 8 FOOD OUTLETS
description: The names of eight food handling establishments cited for violations of the Health Code were released yesterday by Gordon Chase, the city's Health Services Administrator.

title: Jets and No. 1 Draft Pick Unable to Get Together
description: HEMPSTEAD, L,I., Aug. 9 Weeb Ewbank, the New York Jets' coach and general manager, has made an effort to speed up communications be tween himself and John Fox, the Mississippi lawyer for his No. 1 draft choice, Jerome Barkum, the wide receivertight end from Jackson State.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Right in the middle of the American Crafts Council Gallery at the moment is a very elaborate tooled saddle. But nobody is ever going to ride it: It's ceramic.

title: Curb on Expediters Urged To Reduce Building Graft
description: In a move to reduce corrup tion, a special board of inquiry within the city's Buildings De partment has urged that so called expediters who seek approval of construction plans be denied any personal contact with lowlevel officials who ex amine blueprints.

title: Idaho Campaign Starts
description: BOISE, Idaho, Aug. 9 (AP) Idaho's election campaign began today with one victor in the primary calling his oppo nent an errand boy of the out ofstate vested interests.

title: CITY HAILS UNIONS ON PRODUCTIVITY
description: Mayor Lindsay praised the unions yesterday for cooperat ing with his administration's drive for increased productiv ity, but some union leaders ex pressed reservations about fu ture steps, unless they were taken in consultation with union leaders.

title: Great Pension Issue
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9Although new, young voters have dominated political thinking this year, there are 20 million voters over 65almost the same number as there are between 18 and 24. Moreover, these elderly voters usually have the highest turnout of any part of the electorate.

title: Democrats in Nassau Seek New Reapportionment
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Aug. 9  The State Supreme Court was asked today to appoint a non partisan commission to restruc ture the government of Nassau: County and to prevent the county Board of Supervisors from adopting its present plan for reapportionment.

title: SENATE UNIT LIFTS SHARING BY CITIES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9The Senate Finance Committee com pleted work today on the rev enuesharing bill, adopting new formulas that would give New York. City and most other large cities a bigger share of the Fed eral funds contained in the leg islation.

title: Government Film Activity Called Peril to Movie Unions
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9Rep resentative Barry M. Goldwater Jr., Republican of California, charged today that Government production of motion pictures and radio and television tapes was robbing professional per formers and technical person nel of jobs.

title: NoFault's Detour
description: The narrowness of the margin by which the Senate detoured a Federal nofault automobile insurance pro posal from floor consideration to cold storage in the Judiciary Committee is some indication of the gathering support for this commendable consumer measure. A switch of two votes would have kept the measure alive. It is, as President Nixon has said, an idea whose time has come.

title: RosewallStolle Upset
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 9 (AP) Frank Froehling of Miami and Charles Pasarell of Puerto Rico upset the Australian team of Ken Rosewall and Fred Stolle, 76, 46, 63, in a firstround doubles match of the Cleveland tennis tournament today.

title: Trouble Still Pursues Yaz
description: BOSTON, Aug. 9(AP) Carl Yastrzemski, the Boston Red Sox's highsalaried slugger, retired from the lineup after grounding into two double plays today as the Red Sox found themselves involved in a new internal con troversy.

title: Panel Backs Medical Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (AP) A $255million bill to improve the nation's emergencymedical services system with new com munity programs to save lives of accident victims was ap proved today by the House Commerce Committee.

title: Dr. Charles W. Stark Dead; Led Queens Hospital Unit
description: Dr Charles W. Stark, presi dent of the medical board of Whitestone General Hospital, died Monday in Flushing Hos pital after suffering a heart at tack at his home, 5010 195th Street, Flushing, Queens. He was 65 years old.

title: KENNEDY IS SUING OVER POCKET VETO
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9Sen ator Edward M. Kennedy, initi ating a test of a President's pocket veto powers, asked a United States district court here today to order the Nixon administration to implement a $225million program to edu cate family doctors.

title: Baseball Club Owners Fail to Make Progress
description: KANSAS CITY, Aug. 9  Despite proposals for realign ment, reports from new com mittees, overtures from New Orleans and consideration of minor rule changes, baseball's status remained as quo as ever today as the major league club owners held their annual mid summer meeting.

title: Day's Activities in Washington: For the Record
Vanishing Taiwan
description: The United Nations, which took a great leap forward toward recognizing reality last fall when it finally ad mitted the People's Republic of China, has retrogressed into absurdity again with its decision to ban all mention of Taiwan in any form whatsoever.

title: After Years of Cooking, She Learned Virtue of the Simple Dish
description: PELHAM MANOR, N. Y.How can a woman with a fulltime career and four children entertain 40 people elegantly without losing her job, her husband or her mind? Leah Lenney's solution is soup and sandwiches.

title: Inquiry into Mackell Office Widened to Include Judge
description: Criminal Court Judge Philip J. Chetta is under Federal in vestigation to determine wheth er he participated in the al leged getrichquick scheme in volving members of the staff of District Attorney Thomas J. Mackell of Queens.

title: Plot Denied in Jersey Killings
