There's this housewife, and inexplicable things are happening to her, and little does she know that In the handle of her electric iron is the secret of Montezuma's treasure. Those were the good old days. Now, like as not, suspense novels deal not with a death but with megadeaths; not with an innocent, but with heads of state; not with Montezuma's treasure, but with atomic formulas.

title: The maker and enforcer of law as a law unto itself
description: Throughout America, government officials are on trial. Judge Otto Kerner has been indicted for accepting stock from owners of a race track while he was Governor of Illinois. Senator Daniel Brewster has been indicted for accepting an improper campaign contribution. Chicago State's Attorney Edward Hanrahan faces charges that he obstructed justice in connection with the investigation of police shooting of Black Panther leaders. In recent years Federal juries have convicted a Federal District Court judge, the top assistants to the Senate majority leader and the Speaker of the House, and numerous other prominent political figures. Even the United States Government's chief criminal prosecutor, Will Wilson, was forced to resign as an Assistant Attorney General when his name was linked to the financial scandal which has dragged half of the Texas political establishment in court.

title: To Bobby Allison, 69 Laps Will Equal $10,000 Today
description: CAMBRIDGE JUNCTION, Mich., Aug. 19 (AP)For Bobby Allison, there's considerably more at stake than the firstplace check in tomorrow's Yankee 400mile stock car race.

title: Documents Link Politics to the '76 Fete
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19If it were possible for anything in our national life in a political year to be beyond politics, that thing would be the observance of our 200th anniversary, David J. Mahoney told the Democratic party Platform Committee last month.

title: Saigon Press Closure Set To Protest Decree by Thieu
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 19About threequarters of Saigon's newspapers are expected to suspend publication for two days next week in protest against a presidential decree earlier this month imposing harsh new restrictions on the press.

title: F.B.I. USED DELAY TO FOIL HIJACKER
description: SEATTLE, Aug. 19Federal agents withheld their fire for almost seven hours yesterday before shooting and capturing the hijacker of a jet airliner because they feared for the life of one of the three pilots aboard.

title: Blacks Hail Trainee Plan On Newark Airport Job
description: NEWARK, Aug. 19 Spokesmen for Newark's black community said that they had won a significant victory when the owners of three new terminals at Newark Airport agreed to order their contractor to require hiring of eight nonunion black trainees by locals of the Iron Workers Union working on the site.

title: Dempsey and Ribicoff to Aid McGovern in Connecticut
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 19 (UPI)John M. Bailey, Democratic state chairman, announced today that former Gov. John N. Dempsey and Senator Abraham A. Ribicoff would serve as honorary cochairman of the McGovernShriver Presidential campaign in Connecticut.

title: SHEEPDOG IS GIVEN EASTON SHOW HONOR
description: EASTON, Md., Aug. 19Ch Langley Snowmaiden, an Old English sheepdog, was named best in show in an entry of 1,104 at the Talbot Kennel Club's 14th annual event today.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Aug. 19 (Agence France Presse)  The Kenyan Foreign Minister, Dr. Njoroge Mungai, described the International Olympic Committee's president, Avery Brundage, as a. racist and called for his replacement today.

title: MOROCCO'S RULER BARES AIDE'S PLOT
description: RABAT, Morocco, Aug. 19King Hassan II, in a radio and television address to the Moroccan people tonight, accused Gen. Mohammed Oufkir, his righthand man, of trying to kill him.

title: KISSINGER MEETS JAPAN'S PREMIER, RETURNS TO U.S.
description: TOKYO, Aug. 19  Premier Kakuei Tanaka of Japan and Henry A. Kissinger, President Nixon's adviser on national security, defined the issues today for the meeting between the Premier and the President scheduled for Hawaii Aug. 31.

title: Delaware Governor Wins Renomination In G.O.P. Primary
description: DOVER, Del., Aug. 19 (UPI)Gov. Russell W. Peterson won renomination for a second term in the Delaware Republican primary tonight after overcoming a stiff challenge from David P. Buckson, a race track presidebt and former state Attorney General.

title: State Republican Leader Sees 76 Delegate Fight
Mailbox:
description: To THE EDITOR: The present Yankee surge heard around the house that Ruth Built, brings somewhat false cries that the Bronx Bombers have returned to River Avenue.

title: Stamford Awarded Grant
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Aug. 19 (UPI)The National Institutes of Health awarded a $525,000 grant today to aid Stamford in its battle against narcotics use. Mayor Julius Wilensky said the grant would be used for programs such as methadone treatment and for the creation of halfway house for the rehabilitation of narcotics addicts.

title: Fire Island: Sands of Time Runnin
description: In August of 1932, a naturalist named Robert Cush man Murphy discovered the wilderness stretching along the soft underbelly of Long Island. His trained eyes took in with delight everything he found there, and his observations on the geology, foliage and wildlife of the place were published in the JulyAugust (1933) issue of Natural History magazine. The article was entitled, August on Fire Island Beach.

title: Group Train Ride to Shore Tested
description: ASBURY PARK  In a move to promote rail transportation and solve growing parking problems, cutrate group rail trips have been introduced between Newark and shore points by the Central Railroad of New Jersey. The program will continue through Sept. 15, when an evaluation will be made to determine if further impetus should be given to it.

title: Canada Honors Doctor Who Aided Mao
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 19  One of the unexpected twists of Canada's new friendship with China is the rehabilitation of Dr. Norman Bethune.

title: At U.S. Chess Tourney The Talk Is of Iceland
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Aug. 19Tom Hornbeck of Rio Grande, N.J., said he shad been playing chess for quite a number of years and, like all upandcorning chess players, he aspires for a chance to play for the world's title.

title: Elizabeth Terzian Bride Of Donald R. Cahoon
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N. Y., Aug. 19  Miss Elizabeth Anne Terzian and Donald R. Cahoon, both of whom were graduated last May from Drew University, were married here this afternoon in St. John's Episcopal Church by the Rev. Bradford Ketchum.

title: Dolphins Rout Bengals, 3517
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 19 (UPI) Bob Griese passed for three touchdowns and 161 yards tonight and led the Miami Dolphins to a 3517 victory over the Cincinnati Bengals.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: CONRAD Bromberg's experiences with the Cell Block Theater, while possibly frustrating, at least seem to have resulted in some semblance of fruition. Not so my own.

title: Speedup in Court Cases
description: In an effort to expedite the legal process for those involved in court proceedings, the office of Queens District Attorney Thomas J. Mackell has begun computerizing many of its operations.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: Jesus Christ! exclaimed White House Press Secretary Stephen Early in 1937, when his boss Franklin Roosevelt disclosed that Hugo Black was the choice for his first Supreme Court appointment. The astonishment was shared by F.D.R.'s friends and foes. There was little in the career of the Alabama Senator that seemed to warrant such a distinction, except that he was an evangelist New Dealer and certain of Senate approval. There was little to suggest that he would become one of the law's great liberal forces during his 34 years on the high court.

title: Unwanted Children Find Parents Across the Sea
description: A little boy named John is now living happily with his parents in their beautiful home outside Stockholm.

title: Nassau Controller Named to Transit Unit
description: MINEOLA, L. I.Angelo D. Roncallo, controller of Nassau County, has been appointed to the board of directors of the Institute for Public Transportation.

title: JETS AND GIANTS IN IVY SHOWDOWN
description: One man's Version of the first Super Bowl game between the New York Giants and the New York Jets appears somewhere around the gatefold of a popular men's magazine, (Playboy) this month. It is called Semitough, is set in Los Angeles and is apparently all fiction.

title: Kathryn A. Barnes Is Bride of Nathan Hendricks 3d
description: GRIFFIN, Ga., Aug. 19Miss Kathryn Andrea Barnes was married here today in St. George's Episcopal Church, to Nathan VanMeter Hendricks 3d of Atlanta. The rector, the Rev. Douglas Winn, performed the ceremony.

title: The World
description: LONDONFrom a makeshift platform on a playing field near the docks in London's East End, Bernie Steer, an unofficial but militant leader, last week urged London's longshoremen to carry on their strike.

title: Illusion and legend; John Fisher's Magic Book By John Fisher. Illustrated by Tomie de Paola. 128 pp. Englewood Cliffs, N. J.: PrenticeNall. $4.75. (Ages 9 to 13) So You Want To Be A Magician? By Laurence B. White Jr. Illustrated by Bill Morrison. 224 pp. Reading, Mass.: AddisonWesley. $5.50. (Ages 11 to 15)
description: John Fisher is an English magician who performs on B.B.C. My first impression of his book was that it is an excellent collection, amusingly presented, of the tricks magicians call selfworking. These are routines that demand no manual skill, that work because of underlying mathematical or scientific principles. Indeed, some of Fisher's tricks are so selfworking that the book itself is the magician. The reader executes what seem to be random operations on cards, words, numbers, matches and so onthen turns to the back of the book to discover, amazingly, that the author has predicted the outcome.

title: Mrs. Gunter Is Victor
description: DENVER, Aug. 19 (AP)Mrs. Nancy Richey Gunter, of San Angelo, Tex., posted a 64, 63 victory today over Valerie Ziegenfuss of San Diego and moved into the final opposite Mrs. Billie Jean King in the $25,000 Denver international.

title: To scoop or not to scoop
description: The press conference had ended, and Environmental Protection Administration chief Jerome Kretchmer, resplendent in a plaid Edwardian suit, was trying futilely to regain control of his office. But those disgruntled citizen leaders who had not had a chance to speak while the television cameras were present now refused to leave without first telling Kretchmer or anyone else who would listen just what they thought of his announcement.

title: Mosport Keeps Race Fans Purring
description: TORONTO, Aug. 19Harvey Hudes and Bernie Kamin are not sportscar buffs with the enthusiasts usual sentimentality about motor racing. So what are a nice accountant and a nice lawyer doing in such a precarious enterprise as road racing? Hudes and Kamin have a ready answer: They are proving that operation of a road course need not be the kind of crapgame gamble it is elsewhere, that they can make a buck through sound business practices. Their project is a pleasant spread named Mosport Park (Mosport is a contraction of motor sports) near Bowmanville, Ontario, about 50 miles east of Toronto.

title: Republicans:
description: MIAMI BEACHA special air of unreality hung over one of the most unreal of American cities all last week. Signs proclaimed that a national political convention was to be held here. A vanguard of recognizable political types gathered in the garish hotels for preliminary meetings. Reporters wrote stories and television took pictures.

title: Officials in Jersey Act to Protect Farm Migrants From Pesticides
description: HAMMONTON, N.J., Aug. 19  The state's first attempt to enforce a law protecting migrant workers from harmful pesticides has failed. But the effort may lead to a new and stronger law.

title: A Voice in '58 Led Alcoholic to Form Upstate Center for His Affliction and Drug Addiction
description: LAKE HUNTINGTON, N.Y. Jolted out of his alcoholism by a voice that began instructing him 14 years ago, Eddie Davis, a former black correction officer at the state correctional facility at Ossining, founded the New Horizons Rehabilitation Center here a year

title: Johnson Rites Monday
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 Funeral services for Edgar A. J. Johnson, an economic historian who died here yesterday, will be held Monday at 3 P.M. at Fort Myer Chapel in Arlington, Va. Dr. Johnson was professor emeritus of economics and history at the Johns Hopkins University School of Advanced International Studies.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: The North Passenger Terminal article contained a misconception that has become all too popular. I refer to the statement that ... the supplemental carriers, which are not eligible for the Federal subsidies handed out to the scheduled airlines... Neither United nor any of the other trunk airlines are on subsidy. In fact, United was dropped from the subsidy list over 20 years ago. Some of our local service carriers do receive subsidy payments, but those payments are specifically to cover costs for maintaining service to small, low treble points. ALAN B. WAYNE, United Air Lines

title: Deborah Hahn Wed To D. R. Chevalier
description: Miss Deborah Jessica Carey Hahn was married to Dennis Roland Chevalier yesterday afternoon at the Riverside Presbyterian Church by the Rev. James Spear.

title: ROYAL BLUE WINS HUNTER LAURELS
description: READINGTON, N.J., Aug. 19 Royal Blue, an unknown fox chaser until three months ago, won his second championship in seven days when he captured the regular working hunter title today at the Four Seasons Farm horse show. He won a similar title last week in the Sussex County show in Branchville.

title: Orchestra Is Planned
description: Nassau County is forming a senior citizens orchestra.. Any Nassau resident over 60 who would like to audition for the group should call 2924247.

title: F.B.I. Seeks Better Liaison To Curb Narcotics Traffic
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 (AP) The Federal Bureau of Investigation has announced that it is instituting steppedup liaison with other law enforcement agencies to speed and facilitate the exchange of information dealing with illicit narcotics traffic.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Dreyfus Reacts to HoHum Record
description: The Dreyfus Corporation, manager of the nation's third largest mutual fund and keeper of Wall Street's most famous lion, is regrouping for the future.

title: Mr. Nixon's Convention
description: As Republicans gather in Miami Beach for their national convention, all signs point to a wellorchestrated, threeday political rally climaxing in President Nixon's acceptance speech Wednesday evening. The party managers have allowed no leeway for surprises, and none expected.

title: BRANDT AND RIVAL LOOK TO ELECTION
description: BONN, Aug. 19West Germany faces an extraordinary) federal election in late autumn that will probably be decided by only a handful of the 40 million voters, so narrow is the margin between the antagonists.

title: Indians Mark Land Seizure in Milwaukee
description: MILWAUKEE, Aug. 19Seated around a drum near the Lake Michigan shore one night this week, a group of Indians sang a defiant chant: We are on the reservation at the Coast Guard station. We are people of this land, we are here to make a stand. But while the words were defiant, the mood of the Indians was joyous, for the ceremony marked the first anniversary of the successful seizure by a small band of Indians of an abandoned Coast Guard station.

title: TOP AWARD TAKEN BY COCKER SPANIEL
description: HARVARD, Mass., Aug. 19 Ch. Kenobo Rabbit of Nadou a 3yearold dark blue roan English cocker spaniel, was named best in show yesterday for the first time at the silver anniversity event of the Wachusett Kennel Club. Mrs. W. P. Wear made the final selection of the judges of 1,170 entries.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:Encouraged by the headline A Good Woman Is Hard to Find, a friend of mine phoned the head of a success head hunter association. He was brusque and suggested that she would be wasting 8 cents to send him her rsum. He told her to call another group, where a woman handled women,

title: Labor: All Over The Lot In 72 Campaign
description: Somebody is always taking the joy out of George Meany's birthdays. A year ago it was President Nixon freezing wages and prices as a birthday bomb for the leader of 13.5 million trade unionists. Last week, with the crusty labor chief celebrating his 78th birthday, the mickey came from top officers of 20 A.F.L.C.I.O. unions organizing to back Senator McGovern's Presidential aspirations in the face of the neutrality policy that Mr. Meany persuaded the parent federation to adopt last month.

title: FIRE VOLUNTEERS SCORE BIAS RULE
description: NEPTUNE, N. J. Aug. 19Confronted with a court order to broaden their membership rolls to include blacks and members of other minority groups, three volunteer fire companies here have threatened to stop operations next month.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: ISTANBUL, TurkeySufficient numbers of Soviet aircraft have flown across this country recently from Egypt and enough transports have sailed northward through the Straits bearing men and equipment so that Turkey, a skeptical country, is now convinced a major shift is under way in Moscow's Mediterranean policy. Planes and ships must notify Ankara prior to passing through its territorial air or water.

title: KATHY WHITWORTH TIES FOR GOLF LEAD
description: KANSAS CITY, Aug. 19 (AP) Kathy Whitworth shot a oneunderpar 71 today to tie Jocelyne Bourassa after two rounds of the $20,000 Southgate open golf tournament.

title: 5 Shot, Including 2 Bystanders, in 2 Bronx Gang Feud Incidents
description: Two bystanders and three gang members were shot Friday night in the Bronx in separate incidents.

title: Oilers Defeat Pacers, 203
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 19 (AP)Dan Pastorini threw two touchpasses and Mark, Moseley kicked two tfield goals tonight to give the Houston Oilers a 20.3 victory over the Green Bay Packers.

title: Want Adventure? Forget Everest, Try Bear Mountain
description: IN man's quest for adventure there are certain place names that stir the bloodAnnapurna, Death Valley, the Yukon, Mont Blanc, the Andes, Outer Mongolia, the Harriman.

title: Rachel Neumark Plans December Bridal
description: Mr. and Mrs. Melvin J. Neumark of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Rachel Elka Newmark, to Jonathon Herlands. He is the son of Mrs. William B. Herlands of New York and the late Judge Herlands, United States District Judge for the Southern District of New York.

title: 1973 Outboards Spurt to 135 Horsepower
description: A new line of outboard motors more powerful than they last hardly qualifies as a surprise any more. The horsepower escalation has been going on for years. Its latest surge came yesterday with the announcement by Johnson Outboards and Evinrude Motors that their topoftheline motors for 1973 would offer. 135 horsepower. The two companies, members of the Outboard Marine Corporation family, previously had a top of 125 horsepower.

title: Tickets Are Available For GiantEagle Test.
description: Tickets for the 11th annual New Jersey Jaycee Classic, which will pit the Philadelphia Eagles against the New York Giants Saturday afternoon, Sept. 2, in Princeton's Palmer Stadium are now on sale at all Giants and Eagles outlets, Ticketron or by mail by contacting the Jaycees Football Classic, P.O. Box 1972, Hightstown, N. J. 08520.

title: H.I.P. CONSIDERS 2 MERGER PLANS
description: The Health Insurance of Greater New York is sidering separate proposals from two other insurance riers for a possible merger administrative and financial sources to bail the prepaid surance plan out of its current troubles.

title: New &Novel
description: What happened to George Lionel, a concert pianist of prodigious talent and.prodigal longings? Looking backward from his most recent crackup, Lionel assembles the fragments of a tormented life. An unhappy childhood in a middleAmerican city of the 1930's, equivalent in social outlook to Sinclair Lewis's Zenith. A brief golden time before World War IL (Young and in love and famous. A standing ovation at the end of every concert.) Thereafter, a slow downhill slide to a mental institution.

title: Einstein Group Names Head
description: The appointment of Mrs. Louis Nathanson as president of the National Women's Division of Albert Einstein College of Medicine of Yeshiva University was announced last night. She succeeds Mrs. Alfred A. Rosenberg. The division supports the college's Clinical Research Institute for Child Development.

title: Suffolk Museum Salutes Native Son
description: STONY BROOK, L. I., It is a rare occasion when one gets the chance to see an artist's work in its entirety. Assembling shows of a retrospective nature is a formidable enterprise, one that requires much time, energy and scholarship.

title: Music: BobShooBops, a Rock n Roll ReView
description: LAWRENCEVILLE  The oldies revival, focused on the songs of the 1950's, which has produced one of the most successful current rock groups, ShaNaNa, and a Broadway musical, Grease, has now brought into existence a group that de'scribes itself as a rock and roll revue"the BobShooBops. They are seven singers, assisted by five musicians, who do a twohour show that is visual, vocal, atmospheric and as redolent of the highschool agonies of the fifties as they can make it.

title: FitzGibbon Gains Final
description: OCEAN CITY, Md., Aug. 19 (AP)Unseeded Herb FitzGibbon of New York upset secondseeded Clark Graebner in straight sets today to move into tomorrow's final of the Ocean pines international tournament.

title: She Had Such Eyelashes, She Just Had to Be An Actress
description: THE young woman sitting next to me on the subway had such fetching false eyelashes that she just had to be an actress, and I was pleased to be confirmed in my character analysis when she plucked from her shoulder bag a bound manuscript that had every appearance of being a playscript  eight by eleveninches, about threequarters of an inch thick. She placed it teasingly unopened on her lap. I wondered what play it might be  a new Pinter? An old Pirandello? Whatever it was, I wanted to be sitting up front on the other side of the footlights when she began batting those eyelashes at the audience. So after a couple of stops I contrived to swivel my head just far enough to make out the title imprinted on the cover. Trends in the DualPurpose Sofa Market, it said At that point we came into a station and the young woman, perhaps misinterpreting my sidelong glance, bolted from her seat and left my life.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONA slim black Congressman from Maryland strode angrily to the well of the vast and usually noisy House in the predawn hours last Friday. My country tis of thee, sweet land of bigotry, Representative Parrin Mitchell intoned as a hush fell. There are blacks tonight, he went on, whom you've forced to say, we want no more of America because America lied to us....

title: Sees Clark on Trip
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19(UPI) Senator McGovern met today with former Attorney General Ramsey Clark to receive a per sonal review of Mr. Clark's recent controversial trip to inspect bombing damage in North., Vietnam. Mr. Clark drove to Mr. McGovern's home fOr an hourlong briefing.

title: Music
description: TANGLEWOOD'S Festival of Contemporary Music, which ended last week, struck one as a festival in search of itself. Paul Fromm, whose Fromm Music Foundation sponsors this annual gettogether, confessed as much when he addressed the audience at a concert honoring his organization's 20th anniversary. I am concerned about our failure, not in activity, but in aim. By this I mean that we have carried on our work with rather naive hopes as to its eventual effect on the contemporary art scene.

title: The World
description: MOSCOWThe new order was not published. One Soviet Jew claimed to have seen the paper in the Ministry of Finance and said it was signed by Piernier Kosygin himself. Whatever form it took and whoever signed it, the order was obviously the result of a highlevel decision in the Kremlin, and it made emigration to Israel vastly more difficult for an entire category of Soviet Jews.

title: The Death of the Army A PreMortem. By Edward L. King. 244 pp. New York: Saturday Review Press. $6.95.
description: Institutions have a way of straying from their original purposes and taking on lives of their own. The American military is no exception. What began 200 years ago as a homebased militia of embattled farmers has mushroomed into a ludicrously expensive world police force, insulated from civilian influence, liberated from such outdated restraints as Congressional declarations of war, topheavy with paperpushing generals and obsessed with fancy gadgetry that, often as not, doesn't work.

title: Ship Medals Authorized
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 (AP) PreSident Nixon has signed a bill to permit the issuance of up to 100,000 medals commemorating the 175th anniversary of the launching of the Navy's first ship, the U.S. frigate Constellation.

title: Movies
description: AFRIEND of mine who is more or less determined to become an actor frequently recites his career as if he had already lived it. It begins extravagantly with instantaneous success, in his first film and vroceeds from there along a twisting, cairn. of scandal, disappointment, alcoholism, emotional bankruptcy, and creative decadence ending with the inevitable suicide and posthumous acclaim. Obviously my friend is not so interested. in becoming an actor as he is in becoming a myth.

title: Monica E. Donnelly Married to Interne
description: In St. Paul's Chapel of Columbia University yesterday afternoon, Miss Monica Ellen Donnelly, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Francis J. Donnelly of Manhattan, became the bride of Dr. Bernard Gerard Williams. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard J. Williams of Central Islip, L. I.

title: The Guest Word
description: During a recent weekend in the country and a visit to a country fair I spent a happy couple of hours wandering through the animal and poultry sheds, enjoying a world of unusual smells (fresh hay, fresh straw, cow dung, horse manure), listening to the ducks endless commentaries, admiring the Jerseys and Holsteins, staring at the goats as they stared back with their cool, lascivious gaze.

title: Blacks Quit German TraCk Meet Over Rhodesia Issue
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 19Feelings intensified in the mounting Rhodesian debate at the Olympic Games today. when black athletes from a number of countries, including the United States, boycotted a tuneup track and field meet 85 miles from this Bavarian capital.

title: Recordings
description: BACK when counterpoint was king and England showed the way, John Dunstable was a master to be reckoned with. His music was soon eclipsed, however, by Netherlandian and Burgundian successors and, most crushingly, by the brilliant Josquin des Pres. In fact, it was not until the end of the nineteenth century that enough of this fifteenth century composer's work had been rediscovered in various dark library corners of Europe for any kind of evaluation to be made. His place in musical history, although he has hardly become a household world, is certainly a considerable one, and it is good tot. have on hand such human and warm readings of several of his short compositions ascan be found on a recent Argo Issue (ZRG 681).

title: How South Plainfield Barred a Gas Plant
description: SOUTH PLAINFIELD  A yearlong, controversy over construction of a proposed $140million natural gas plant in this workingclass city reached a climax when the Borough Council unanimously rejected the ruge project.

title: Culture for Sale
description: LAGUNA BEACH, CalifWhat we are facing currently is nothing so serious as a new cultural conservatism but rather a media reaction to a culture vogue that no longer seems profitable. This phenomenon has more in common with the recent campaign on behalf of the midiskirt than it has with any serious critical reconsiderationand the latter might not be such a bad development were it to occur.

title: Cards Beat Broncos, 1713
description: ST.LOUIS, Aug. 19 (UPI)Tim Van Galder came off the bench in the second half tonight to lead the St. Louis Cardinals to a 1713 triumph over the Denver Broncos.

title: AROUND THE
description: Gardeners are never satisfied. This spring and summer, there was too much rain. Now there is not enough. One word of advice to newcomers: if you water with the hose or watering can, don't be just a sprinkler. That is, never wet the soil and think the watering has been done. Watering must be done thoroughly and deeply.

title: Clues Are Uncovered in Series of Fires Set in Five Stores Here
description: The Fire Department's chief tire marshal, Edwin H. Sheppard, said yesterday that investigators had some leads on the arsonist who set a series of fires with incendiary.devices in five variety and specialtychain stores in midtown Manhattan Thursday night and Friday.

title: Jerseyans at Miami Beach Reflect the Party's Image
description: TRENTON  There are more blacks, women and people under 30 years of age than ever before among the delegates and alternates who will cast New Jersey's votes at the Republican National Convention this week in Miami Beach, but their numbers are too few to change the party image.

title: Kashmir Landslides Kill 9
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 19 (AP)A college principal, five members of his family and three other persons died when six houses collapsed in landslides near Srinagar, the capital of Indian Kashmir, officials here reported today. They said that the land gave way beneath the houses Thursday after a cloudburst.

title: Olympic First Day
description: STAMP collectors can give the United States Olympic team a financial boost. Last Thursday; in firstday ceremonies at Washington during the release of the four U.S. stamps commemorative of the 1972 Olympic Games, the American First Day Cover Society and United States Olympic Committee prepared firstday covers that are available by mail to interested collectors. Proceeds from the sale will be donated to the Olympic Committee.

title: Deborah Horn Married
description: SCHENECTADY, N.Y., Aug. 19The marriage of Miss Deborah Wilson Horn, daughter of Mrs. F. Hubbard Horn and the late Mr. Horn, to Michael Anthony Roosevelt took place in the chapel of the Dominican Retreat House here at noon today. The bridegroom is a son of James Roosevelt of Newport Beach, Calif., and Mrs. Romelte S. Roosevelt of Pasadena, Calif., and a grandson of the late President and Mrs. Franklin D. Roosevelt.

title: Dave Anderson
description: BUFFALO, Aug. 19When the Minnesota Vikings opened their exhibition schedule a week. ago, Clint Jones ran back the opening kick off 99 yards for a touchdown. Watching him trot into the endzone from in front of the Viking bench, Fran Tarkenton turned to Bud Grant, the head coach.

title: Race Relations Crisis Poses Serious Threat to Olympics Games
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 19An air of uncertainty again hangs over an Olympiad, but this time the issues are of greater significance than whether 3,000 pigeons will be released inside or outside the Olympic Stadium during the opening ceremonies and in which direction they will fly.

title: If You Must Put Your Daughter on the Stage, Mrs.
description: Don't put your daughter on the stage, Mrs. Worthington, Noel Coward sang sardonically in his popular song of the 1930's. Now Margaret Websteractress, author. and director, who staged such memorable productions as Maurice Evans's Richard II, the fulllength Hamlet with Evans, and Othello with Pau/ Robesonechoes Coward in her book, Don't Put Your Daughter on the Stage, to published Sept. 19 by Knopf.

title: Land Reform Act in Ceylon Limits Owners to 50 Acres
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, Aug. 19 The Government has approved legislation to restrict individual land holdings to 50 acres.

title: Cartier Ship Flips Over At Launching in Quebec
description: QUEBEC, Aug. 19 (AP)A reproduction of the ship that carried the explorer JaCques Cartier to Canada in the 16th century made a bigger splash than expected at her launching.

title: Role for Foster Grandparents
description: SEA CLIFF, L. I.A new link has been added to the chain of services designed toward comforting children in Nassau County institutions. It is composed of men and women, all at least 60 years old, whose bright blue badges, each with their names and F.G.P. on them, means they, are Foster Grandparents.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Peron, the ExDictator, Is the Key as Argentina Again Attempts Democracy
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 17 Juan Domingo PerOn, whose name could not be publicly mentioned in Argentina for years, has again become the key to his country's future. But no one, not even among his followers, knows exactly which way he will turn.

title: Miss Worthley Is Bride
description: GLEN COVE, L.I., April 19 Miss Jeredith Ann Worthley, daughter of Mrs. John Abbott Worthley and the late Mr. Worthley, was married here today to James Kenneth Stifter, son of Mr. and Mrs. Otto Paul Stifter of Grafton, Wis. The Rev. John J. Fee performed the ceremony at St. Patrick's Roman Catholic Church. Both the bride and bridegroom served with the Peace Corps in Thailand.

title: Teacher Pushing Canarsie Center
description: Mrs. Harold Minsky looked out over the piles of old tires, abandoned washing machines and rotting mattresses in Canarsie Beach Park, Brooklyn, and sighed, It's just beautiful, and it's terribly, terribly wasted, For almost six years, Mrs. Minsky, a school teacher, has been working for the construction of a civic and cultural center in the park.

title: Spanish Magazine Begins Sales in Major U.S. Cities
description: MIAMI, Aug. 19Replica,a Spanishlanguage weekly news magazine, appeared this week for the first time on newsstands in major United States cities with large Latin populations, and in Puerto Rico.

title: S. C. L. C. Says It Is Broke  but Pround'
description: DALLAS, Aug. 19  The master of ceremonies explained to ,the dinner guests that salad was not. served because of boycott of lettuce picked by nonunion workers.

title: JOHN S. WILSON'S Music
description: EAST PATCHOGUE, L. I. Skip Henry's dream of having his own countrymusic club came true last October, when he proudly opened Skip's Frontier East on Montauk Highway. But the dream has begun to turn sour, and Mr. Henry is facing the prospect of shifting his focus to rock music.

title: STUDENT LOAN BILL SIGNED BY PRESIDENT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 (AP) President Nixon signed emergency legislation today to make it possible for many college students to get Governmentguaranteed loans for the school year starting next month.

title: MISS BUDKE VICTOR IN U.S. FINAL, 5 AND 4
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 19Mary Anne Budke, an 18yearold sophomore at Oregon State University defeated Cynthia Hill of South Haven, Mich., and 4 today in the 36hole final of the 72d annual United States women's amateur golf tournament.

title: Pop
description: THE EVERLY BROTHERS: Stories We Could Tell (RCA Victor LSP4620). The Everly Brothers first album for RCA is characterized by superlavish production and a successful attempt to return to the music they do best. Want the finest allround Rock sidemen in the business? Here they are. Want some highlyregarded secondgeneration (country) Rockers? Here they are  Delaney and Bonnie, David Crosby, Graham Nash, John Sebastian, Clarence Whiteall backing up Don and Phil's unique brand of close harmony with encouragement, material, and some mean licks from their own specialized fields. With song by Sebastian, the Bramletts, Jesse Winchester, Kristofferson, and Dennis Linde, the Everlys take a tour of the best of many varieties of country rock, stopping off once to make a point in I'm Tired of Singing My Song In Las Vegas,  and once to render a classic example of the triedandtrue Everly atmosphere in Up in Mabel's Room, a beautiful, haunting, slow latenight ballad about Mabel the essential (hip) lovin lady who teaches boys to be men. Appropriately, the next song vibrates with the crash and twang of pounding rock instrumentation. How could the album fail? Still, it's more than gratifying to see one of the seminal outfits of Fifties Rock and Roll cumCountry boogaloo getting back on the ball and doing it well.

title: JOB SPURT LIKELY IN HEALTH FIELDS
description: New York City is one of the world's great cultural and entertainment capitals, but its fastest growing occupations during the next decade are more likely to be medical and dental technicians than artists, musicians, authors, athletes and entertainers.

title: Expos Stop Braves, 60
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 19 (UPI)Ron Woods bit a threerun home run and Bob Bailey added another home run tonight as the Montreal Expos beat the Atlanta Braves, 6.0, on Ernie McAnally's fivehitter.

title: Mailbox:
description: TO THE EDITOR: I am in great need of your help. Here, in East Harlem, I am the coach of a little league football team and have been for the past two years; we have no sponsor, and only contributions by friends, neighbors, and myself have let us function. We are in the Buddy Young Football League, under the United Block Association, Carl Nesfield, Commissioner, located at 68 East 131 Street. We are in need of equipment, league dues, and uniforms; without these essentials we cannot participate in the league this season and therefore cause a heartbreak and a big letdown to about 75 kids in Harlem.

title: A new audience
description: Forty per cent of the people who come to my work have never been in the theater before, says Melvin Van Peebles. Broadway theatergoing is a comparatively new experience even for some black artists, including Van Peebles himself. When asked if he had seen any productions on Broadway other than his own, he replied: I think I saw Fiddler on the Roof, and then added, In 1952, I think, saw South Pacific or Damn Yankees.

title: Taconic Show Makes Debut Friday
description: Each year sees a steady rise in the number of American Kennel Club allbreed shows. In 1971, there were 586 fixtures, with a total entry of 604,884. That was an increase of 17 shows and 54,738 dogs. Joining the parade of new events is the Taconic Hills kennel Club show to be held next Friday at the Lakeland High School on Main Street, Shrub Oak, N.Y. The new Westchester event has drawn 1,127 dogs, Great Danes leading a wellbalanced list with 52. There are 112 breeds or varieties represented. Alva Rosenberg has the largest judging assignment, with 170 dogs, followed by Louis Murr, with 130. Rosenberg, who has been judging since 1910, will do the sporting and terrier groups. Murr has the nonsporting and best in show.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: As students of anthropology who recently spent a year in the Faroe. Islands, we think that the three articles on the Faroes by Paul J. C. Friedlander (Travel section, July 9, 16, and 23) are among the best touristic literature on them we have come across. However, they do contain several misleading or incorrect statements, First, pedantry compels us to point out that the Faroese language is not really based on Norwegian. Rather, Faroese, Icelandic and the western dialects of. Norwegian are descended from a common ancestor, the western branch of Old Scandinavian. Also, while the Faroese economy is based on the fishing industry and about 98 per cent of Faroese exports by value are fish and fish products, it is not true to say that 98 per cent of the population and the economy is involved in fishing. Just under a quarter of the population is supported directly by work in the fisheries and just over a quarter of the gross national product is derived from them.

title: Ulster: A New Scourge
description: BELFASTAlmost every day last week someone in Northern Ireland was killed by shooting or stabbingfor no other reason, say police, than being in the wrong place at the wrong time. There have been 42 of these apparently random killings since the beginning of July. The only pattern is that most of the victims were Catholic and that many of them were tortured by burning or beating before being killed.

title: Rosenbloom, One of the Boys, Wins Plaudits of Ram Players
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 19Carroll Rosenbloom, new owner of the Los Angeles Rams, appears to be the most casual, coolest millionaire in the exclusive coterie of National Football League owners.

title: U.S. Equestrians Given Chance At Winning 2 Olympic Medals
description: With the equestrian events of the Olympic Games scheduled to get under way in just nine days, most European experts are making their final assessments of the teams.

title: AntiBoycott Stand Defended by Nigeria
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Aug. 19A government owned daily newspaper, the Morning Post, came out in full support today of the government's decision to keep Nigerian athletes in the Olympic Games.

title: Arthur Daley
description: BERLIN, Aug. 19The plane broke through the clouds and the sunshine glinted off the suddenly remembered red tile roofs of Berlin in the approach to the Tempelhof Airfield. Memory needed all the brush up help it could get because had not seen this city since the 1936 Olympic Games. Many things have changed in that intervalincluding me.

title: Where Bob Hope Gets 2d Billing To Horses and Buggies
description: DU QUOIN, Ill.About halfway between Dowell and Elkville an unremarkable building stands beside U.S. 51 with a sign identifying it as Tom's Restaurant. Here, the visitor is told, Phil Harris ate 17 ears of corn, a platter of beefsteak tomatoes and several helpings of fried catfish between turns at the Du Quoin State Fair.

title: MOZART FESTIVAL HAS BACH FINALE
description: Remembering the extraordinarily beautiful performance of Bach's St. Matthew Passion that John Nelson conducted here last year, I went to Philharmonic Hall on Friday night hopingexpecting is the better wordto hear an equally enthralling interpretation of Bach's Mass in B minor.

title: LINDSAY ACCEPTS COMPROMISE PLAN FOR FOREST HILLS
description: After more than a year of bitter controversy, Mayor Lindsay yielded on the Forest Hills public housing issue yesterday and announced that he would reluctantly accept substantial changes along the lines of a proposed compromise to cut the planned lowincome project in half.

title: State Hearings on Transport End on a Call for More Public Transit
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 19The State Transportation Department's series of 15 hearings on its 20year master plan ended here this week on virtually the same note on which it opened last week in New York City: With a call for less highway construction and more public transportation.

title: Right to Life has a message for New York State legislators
description: The Church of St. Margaret Mary is a not very imposing, in fact somewhat dilapidated, compound of structures on the western edge of Albany. Outside the church auditorium and gymnasium, a sign promises bingo every Monday at 8 P.M. On a recent Saturday, a few of the bingo tables had been set up anyway, in a hollow square about midway between the two gymnasium basketball hoops. Around the tables were 23 men and 12 women, average middleclass ladies and gentlemen, none of whose names or faces would register at first with the average newspaper reader or television watcher. With the exception of one man who arrived wearing a sandwich board"Thou Shalt Not Kill, it said on one side, and, Abortion Kills Babies, on the othernone would have even stood out in the normal Monday night bingo game. Two of the men wore turned collars marking their religious vocations (only one was Roman Catholic, however), and the others were quietly and conservatively dressed, most of the men in slacks and sports jackets and the women in skirts of more than

title: Sharon Staub Has Wedding
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Aug. 19Miss Sharon Staub and Edward William Doty 3d, who were graduated with the class of 72 from the University of Denver, were married here this afternoon. The Rev. Albert Lucas performed the Episcopal ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. John H. Staub 3d, parents of the bride. The bridegroom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Doty 2d of Orchard Park, N. Y.

title: But Doctor, You Must Be Kidding!
description: LENOX, Mass. IT'S difficult to say, exactly, whether the dramatic high point of Doctor Selavy's Magic Theater (The Mental Cure) came at the moment when the mad patient received a cream pie in the face administered by a female doctor or when he engaged in an armwrestling contest for his psyche with the equally. demented Doctor Selavy himself. Or perhaps it occurred at the instant when the patient, Ben, emerged with primal scream, as if fired from a cannon, from beneath the skirts of a mock altar, possibly cured of whatever ailed his messedup head.

title: PLANS AMENDED ON MEADOWLANDS
description: LYNDHURST, N.J., Aug. 19 The Hackensack Meadowlands Development Commission is completing work on a revised master plan that reduces by 50 per cent proposed residential and officespace construction and bars the placing of a $100million shorttakeoffandlanding (STOL) airport in the development district.

title: FORD BOWS TO U.S.; LOWERS 73 PRICE
description: DETROIT, Aug. 19The Ford Motor Company, following the lead of the General Motors Corporation, today cut its requested price increase on new cars and trucks to an average $59 a vehicle from $92.

title: Which Way to Social Stability?
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19The nation's most important domestic need is to achieve a tolerable and constructive relationship between its black citizens and its workingclass and lowermiddleclass white citizens. One of the critical judgments to be made in the November election is whether President Nixon or Senator McGovern is more likely to produce progress toward such a relationship over the next four years.

title: NIPPON AIR VISIT  IS HAILED IN CHINA;Press Agency Says Flights Advanced Friendship
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 19 Hsinhua, the Chinese press agency, has issued a glowing report of a flight to Shanghai by two Japanese airliners. The flight has been regarded as link between Japan and China,

title: Garvey The Story of a Pioneer Black Nationalist By Elton C. Fax. Foreword by John Henrik Clarke. Illustrated. 305 pp. New York: Dodd, Mead &
description: Marcus Garvey Is not ranked among the Makers of the Twentieth Century, nor is he likely to find a place among those Modern Masters, who Frank Kermode assures us have changed the world and how we think about it. Yet, as an early Garveytte put it, no man has spoken to us like this man.. And no man had. Garvey's watchword, Africa for the Africans, was to change the African world, fanning the revolutionary fervor that still persists among the African millions those at home, and those abroad.

title: Suharto Frees Criminals
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Aug. 19 (Reuters)  President Suharto has ordered the release of 2,225 criminals to mark Indonesia's 27th anniversary of independence, a Justice Ministry spokesman said today. The order also reduced the sentences of 8,222 prisoners, but excluded Communists, he added.

title: Pop
description: GRAHAM NASH/DAVID CROSBY: Graham Nash/David Crosby (Atlantic SD 7220). Any permutation or combination of Crosby, Stills, Nash and Young would produce a hit record even if the grooves contained nothing but the chanting of their names. Their public remains loyal, even though CSNY have officially stopped performing together except for occasional surprise guest appearances at each other's concerts. Nash and Crosby's first dual venture continues in the tradition of softer, more lyrical rock and, yes, those exhilarating harmonies do remain.

title: Head of Coast Dock Union Tells Of Merger Talk With Teamsters
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 19 (Routers)Harry Bridges, president of the International Longshoremen's and Warehousemen's Union, which handles cargo on the West Coast and Hawaiian docks, indicated today that his 50,000man union might merge with the 1.8million member International Brotherhood of Teamsters.

title: Joanie's Still Bright, Brash and Blondell
description: I LOOKED for the old dressing rooms at Warners, where Kay Francis and Eddie Robinson, Bette Davis and Ann Dvorak lived and breathed, and there was nothing left. I try, I many try not to gaze too far Into the past. But then it all floods in: the grips and the gaffers from the old days step by and take me in a big bear hug and they say,.'Oh, Joanie, it's good to haveyou back. And I feel so tender I could cry.

title: T. I. P. Rewards DrugInformers
description: At least half a dozen selfhelp projects have been started in New Jersey, Staten Island and Rockland County to offer anonymous informers rewards of up to $500 if their tips put narcotics peddlers behind bars.

title: Laura Schoetz Becomes Bride Of Timothy Ely
description: OLD LYME, Conn., Aug. 19Miss Laura Randolph Schoetz, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Maximilian Charles Schoetz of Bloomfield Hills, Mich., and Old Black Point, was married here this morning to Timothy Bassett Ely, son of Mr. and Mrs. Matthew Griswold Ely Jr. of Pelham, N. Y., and Old Lyme.

title: Shriver Shuns Kennedy Legacy And Draws on Johnson Record
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19For all his Kennedy connections, Sargent Shriver is drawing the substance of his early campaign talks from Lyndon B. Johnson's Great Society, The style that his campaign revives is more the sunny salesmanship of Senator Hubert H. Humphrey than the mood of the Kennedy brothers.

title: ExU.M.W. Vice President Says He Won't Pun Again
description: BECKLEY, W. Va., Aug. 19 (UPI)George Titter former vice president of the United Mine Workers, announced day that he would not seek reelection in December in a courtordered.rerun of the union's 1969 election.

title: American Copter Pilot Wounded by Rifle Bullet
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 19 (UPI)  The commander of a United States Air Force advisory team was wounded yesterday when struck by a rifle bullet while piloting a South Vietnamese Air Force helicopter gunship, the American command announced today.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: Returning travelers from Europe are coming home with stories about their shock at finding that the dollar has not only lost the respect it once had abroad, but that sometimes there is difficulty converting it into other currency. While it is easy to condemn banks, hotels and tourist offices abroad for quoting buying rates for dollars at considerable variance from the official quotations, some condemnation should be extended to the money changers on this side of the water who quote an even more unrealistic rate. In July we exchanged dollars at Kennedy Airport for Belgian francs, receiving 40 to the dollar. Seven hours later, in Belgium, we were offered 44 to the dollar. A difference of 10 per cent on a transaction as simple as this is enormous.

title: National Student Group Plans A 5Year Drive for Local Units
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19The National Student Association completed its 25th annual convention here today, aware that it is nowin the words of its outgoing president"the only game in town.

title: TENTAM IS SECOND
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 19Key to the Mint ran a tremendous race in taking the $111,000 Travers Stakes today. Moving rhythmically under the astute guidance of Braulio Baeza, the Rokeby Stable's star came along at the proper time in the stretch to take the 1mile test for 3yearolds by a length.

title: Brooklyn Areas 9, 300 HousingUnits
description: There was a loss of 9,300 housing units in a large part of northern and central Brooklyn in the last decade. The area of the loss, as shown by an analysis of 1970 and 1960 Census Bureau figures, was that embodied by Community Planning Districts 1, 2, 3 and 4. They have a combined population of 608,000.

title: Mailbox:
description: To THE EDITOR: With regard to the nearautomatic nature of the pointaftertouchdown, one simple suggestion is that a kick for the point should be allowed only from farther back, say the 30yard line. A kick, run or pass from the 30, or a run or pass from the 2, would remove the automatic nature of the play.

title: Good, Clean Fun Marks Ecology Fair
description: WEST CORNWALL, Conn., Aug. 19Suntanned palefaces hurled tomahawks, children cheered competing, frogs, puppets dramatized the balance of nature and corporate experts extolled new methods of purifying water and air.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Fischer: A KillerAnd His Opponents Know It
description: REYKJAVIKOn the 27th move of the 14th game of the world championship chess match, last Tuesday, Bobby Fischer was dead lost. He was a pawn down in an inferior position, and he could not prolong the agony much longer. Boris Spassky, playing the black pieces, studied the board for 10 minutes and then made what he thought was a precautionary move. Instead was a ghastly blunder.

title: Village Issue Shows Rift in Israelis Outlook
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 19  For weeks, the ruins of two former Arab villages just inside Israel on the Lebanese border have been the focus of a national debate that, in the view of thoughtful Israelis. on both ides of the issue, goes to the heart of the problem of this country as it rounds out its first quarter century.

title: FOE SAID TO SEIZE POST NEAR DANANG
description: SAIGON, Sunday, Aug. 20 (AP)North Vietnamese sup ported by artillery overran a South Vietnamese fire base and district headquarters to seize control of the western half of the strategic Queson Valley 25 miles south of Danang, reports from the field said today.

title: Music Mailbag
description: TO THE Emma: OF ALL the pros and cons which I have read and studied concerning Leonard Bernstein's Mass, Donal Henahan's commentary is the most honest, just and mature.

title: Most N. Y. Yankees Call N. J. Home
description: HACKENSACKWhen the football Giants abandon New York for the Hackensack Meadows in 1975, they will find their new territory overflowing with the people they left behind: the Yankees.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: New &Novel
description: AngloSaxon novels about nature tend to be charming and nostalgic. This Spanish novel is as different from such ventures as the Castilian hills are from the Salisbury Plain. The land is wretchedly poor, the climate is harsh, and the atmosphere has a haunting, 19thcentury bleakness, although it is set in the age of moon missions.

title: Mailbox:
description: I was surprised to see that none of the track readers noticed the error in The Times article July 2, on Jesse Owens wherein it mentions his four gold medals. However, he did not anchor the 400meter relay team. The team ran as: Owens, Metcalfe, Draper, Wykoff, 39.8 seconds and a record.

title: Education
description: Last June a woman undercover narcotics agent, who had posed as a student in more than a dozen New York City high schools over a threeyear period, told the House of Representatives Select Committee on Crime that the city schools were a haven for drug sales and use. She contended that in some of the schools 90 per cent of the students were on drugs of some sort.

title: Hogan Calls Tombs Verdict A Miscarriage of Justice
description: The verdict of not guilty in the trial of three inmates at the Manhattan House of Detention for Men charged with leading the October, 1970, rebellion was criticized yesterday by District Attorney Frank S. Hogan as a hideous miscarriage of justice.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:The recruitment men say they can't find qualified female candidates ["A Good Woman Is Hard to Find, Aug. 6]. They are out there, Mr. Executive; believe me, they are out there.

title: It's Time for Racing's Elite to Meet at Saratoga
description: It's August, so naturally everybody who is anybody in America's racing establishment has taken his better thoroughbreds and his clubhouse identification badge to Saratoga Springs for a month under the enormous elm trees.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  The Internal Revenue Service and our people have had this big debate, related Clarence G. Adamy, president of the National Association of Food Chains.

title: Facing Major Dental Work? Take Your Teeth to Europe
description: IT sounds unbelievable, but it is true: If you are facing the prospect of a dental bill of $1,000 or more, chances are you can fly to Europe, stay two weeks or more, have the work done by a thoroughly competent dentist and end up spending less  the trip included  than the dental work alone would have cost in the United States. Put another way, why send your dentist to Europe when you can go yourself?

title: The White House watch over TV and the press
description: WASHINGTON, D. C.We of course don't take credit for the C.B.S. Spectrum commentators the wide range of opinion on The New York Times OpEd Page, White House aide Patrick J. Buchanan says with smile, but consider C.B.S.'s Spectrum. They've got Jeffrey St. John and Stan Evans on the right, Stu Alsop in the middle, and Murray Kempton and Nick von Hoffman on the left. This is a balanced run of commentary which is a byproduct of the Vice President's criticism of the networks.

title: Bridal Is Held For Ann Back
description: DAMEN, Conn., Aug. 19Miss Ann Louise Back, daughter of the Rev. Dr. Robert Nelson Back, rector of St. Luke's Episcopal Church here, and Mrs. Back, was married this morning to Mark Monroe Beckwith. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Andrew Madds Beckwith. Both families reside in Darien.

title: Colorado Blast Set
description: DENVER, Aug. 19 (UPI)Military authorities plan to detonate 500 tons, of TNT near Grand Junction Oct. 26 to see what effect it might have on military equipment and structures, Colorado officials said Tuesday. Spokesmen for Gov. John A. Love's office said the detonation would be staged by the Defense Nuclear Agency.

title: Elite Tea Party Plan Rejected by Boston
description: BOSTON, Aug. 19 (AP)City officials have rejected a proposal to commemorate the 200th anniversary of the Boston Tea. Party next year with an elite banquet m raneuil Hall because it's not in keeping with the revolutionary spirit.

title: Child to Mrs. Echikson
description: A daughter was born Aug. 9 to Mr. and Mrs. Richard Echikson of Elberon, N.J., in the Mount Sinai Hospital here.

title: Montclair Captains Named
description: Joe Kornarkowski and Bill Lowing have been elected cocaptains of Montclair State College's 1972 varsity crosscounty team.

title: Ohio Concern to Set Up Scranton Transit System
description: SCRANTON, Pa., Aug. 19The A. T. E. Management Service Company of Cincinnati has been hired by Lackawanna County to set up and operate a countyowned transit system here.

title: Safety Agency to Require Data on Loading Campers
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 (AP) The National Highway Traffice Safety Administration has ordered manufacturers of slidein campers, and trucks accommodating such campers, to provide purchasers with information on proper loading and load distribution.

title: House Banking Committee To Study Watergate Case
The Godforgotten By Gladys Schmitt. 312 pp. New York: Harcourt Brace Jovanovich. $6.95.
description: According to the publishers, Gladys Schmitt has built her dramatic story from one fragmentary document of A.D. 1100, which tells of a mysterious community (the author places it on the Flemish coast) that had disappeared during an earthquake and flood some hundred years before. But it was discovered that the rising waters had separated it from the mainland and in another upheaval restored it to its status as a promontory. If the fragmentary document ever existed  and I'm not sure it didit gave Miss Schmitt no more than an idea. For literary purposes, her imagination was free  and, as she showed in David the King and Rembrandt, she is at her best as a historical novelist when she is not bound down by facts.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: The life of the most successful novelist in America (in his own time) was as fraught with anguish and ordeal as that of any of his characters. John P. Marquand relished the luxuries success brought him, yet worried that his art suffered. He fabricated (and came to believe) the myth about himself that he was a boy of princely birth brought up basely who attained fame and wealth and returned home in triumph. In point of fact, he had come from an upperclass family fallen on evil days. He suffered two disastrous marriages, toyed with a number of affairs and seems to have derived most satisfaction from a long liaison with Carol Brandt, the wife of his literary agent.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Bridge
description: A good bridge player does not need to be a mathematician, but he does need to be able to do arithmetic of the gradeschool variety. The need to count up to 13 occurs constantly, but the effort involved is too much for most players, who are content to play by routine and guesswork.

title: NASA Seeks to Measure Structure of Atmosphere
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 (AP) The space agency has awarded an initial contract in a $5.3million project to obtain the first direct measurements of the vertical structure of the earth's atmosphere on a global scale.

title: USE OF MISSILES BY FOE IS STUDIEL
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 19.The United States command disclosed statistics today that indicated that enemy antiaircraft crews were now forced to fire about five times as many missiles to bring down a single plane as they were during the nineteensixties.

title: Devilishly good
description: Lobster seems to provoke the various nations into revealing their true natures. Nononsense Americans in Maine just boil them. The French, thrifty and artful, save all the trimmings and use them to make sauces with all manner of spirits. In Italy, the Pope of crustaceans is served on a bed of pasta and seasoned with basil and oregano and hot pepper flakeslike a pizza. The heat can, of course, be controlled, but some fire should be there to justify the name: lobster friar devil.

title: Victorian Homes Pull Bids in San Francisco
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 19 The San Francisco Redevelopment Agency has received bids on 33 of 41 Victorian houses offered for sale. In three previous offerings no bids were received.

title: British Embassy Attacked
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 19 (UPI)Demonstrators attacked the British Embassy In the Libyan capital of Tripoli today, trampled its flag and destroyed the embassy plaque, the Middle East News Agency reported.

title: Orioles EdgeTwins, 21
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 19 (UPI) Brooks Robinson's tworun single in the first and the sevenhit pitching. of Tim Palmer enabled the Baltimore Orioles to snap a fourgame losing streak tonight with a 21 victory over the Minnesota Twins.

title: Jersey Bride
description: MADISON, N. J., Aug. 19 Miss Margaret Louise Lafoon, who graduated from Drew University in June, was married in a garden ceremony on the Drew campus here this afternoon to Gerald C. Greene, a 1971 Drew graduate. The Rev. Denys Hennessey performed the Roman Catholic ceremony, assisted by Canon Earl Esterbrook of St. Paul's Episcopal Church in Woodbury, Conn.

title: Meeting at Camp David
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 President Nixon met tonight with Mr. Kissinger at Camp David, the President's retreat at Thurmont, Md. They were joined by Secretary of State William P. Rogers and Brig. Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr., Mr. Kissinger's deputy.

title: Linda Mumaw Is Wed
description: KENNEBUNKPORT, Me., Aug 19The marriage of Miss Linda Kathleen Mumaw to Eric Stephen Ruskoski took place here this afternoon in St. Ann's by the Sea Episcopal Church. The Rev. Dr. Laman H. Bruner performed the ceremony. The bride is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Dan P. Mumaw of Pittstown, N. J., and Kennebunkport. Her husband's parents are Mr. and Mrs. Chester F. Ruskoski of Hillside, N. J.

title: Mary C. Livingston Is Bride of David BushBrown
description: BRISTOL, R. I., Aug. 19Mary Coe Livingston, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Stanley Livingston Jr., was married here this afternoon to David Fraser BushBrown, son of Dr. and Mrs. Albert BushBrown of Locust Valley, L.I., and Barnstable, Mass. Dr. BushBrown, Chancellor of Long Island University, is former President of the Rhode Island School of Design.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Research Indicates That Mosquitoes May Spread Hepatitis
description: Scientists have discovered in mosquitoes evidence of the virus that causes serum hepatitis, thus strengthening theory that many cases of the common liver disease can be spread by mosquitoes and possibly other insects.

title: Pagels Wins Sunfish Class As Wet Pants Races Start
description: SAYVILLE, L. I., Aug. 19Bill Pagels of the host Wet Pants Sailing Association, who has captured several Great South Bay class championships, sailed to victory today in the Sunfish Class open division as his club's annual weekend invitation regatta got under way.

title: Music Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: Having just read Pierre Boulez's article, To Awaken Curiosity in Our Music, am once again stirred by this creative man of candor and sensitivity.

title: U.S. Presses Its Curbs on Prices Here
description: The Nixon Administration was prepared to take 500 concerns in the New York area to court on charges of noncompliance with wage, price and rent controls when it achieved) voluntary last minute settlements in most of the cases, it was disclosed last week,

title: REBEL INVASION STIRS YUGOSLAVS
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Aug. 19  The bizarre episode involving a band of wellarmed Croatian emigre terrorists who infiltrated into Yugoslavia late in June has aroused uneasiness here over a resurgence of conspiratorial activities among emigrants scattered around the world.

title: Son to Mrs. Tulman
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Gerald Tulman of Framingham, Mass., on July 30 in the LyingIn Division of the Boston Hospital for Women.

title: The World
description: RABAT  Morocco is a feudal state, essentially unchanged over the centuriesa country of mountain ranges and rich plains where gentle courtesy and hospitality coexist with sudden, cruel violence. It was not so long ago that the predecessors of Hassan II, temporal ruler of Morocco and Defender of the Faith, would throw their enemies into a lion's den. King Hassan, something of an aging playboy with a taste for sports cars, gold and pretty women, has managed to retain power by political maneuvering. But he has had his crises: a succession of plots, bloody attacks, strikes and riots since he assumed the crown at the age of 33 upon the death of his father in 1962.

title: Miss Redondo Wins
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Aug. 19 The forehand power of Marita Redondo of National City, Calif., brought her through to the United States amateur grasscourt tennis championship today for the second successive year with a 76, 36, 62 triumph over Laurie Fleming of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., at the Wilmington Country Club.

title: A curious resignation, an almost laissezfaire outlook
description: QUESON VALLEY, South Vietnam: Now the VC can go anywhere. We don't have enough troops, says Maj. Nguyen Thai Buu, sitting on one of the new sandbags piled up at Landing Zone Ross. My soldiers are very tired. They have been walking every day for the last six weeks. We have to keep the VC away from Queson town. If we give up Ross, they will go all the way the lowlands.

title: Barbara Ihnken Wed
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR, L. I., Aug. 19Miss Barbara Jean Ihnken, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles William Ihnken of Syosset, was married here this afternoon in St. John's Episcopal Church to Robert Edwin Ahlschlager, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edwin Henry Ahlschlager of Huntington. The Rev Carlton T. Lee performed the ceremony.

title: Black Value System Is Urged on Nuns
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Aug. 19The National Black Sisters Conference, extolling the politics of black life in America at its fifth annual meeting here this week, got a blueprint for action from Imamu Amiri Baraka, black poet and playwright.

title: Bradley Accepts New Knicks Pact With 1Year Limit
description: In these times when National Basketball Association and National Hockey League teams prefer signing their players to longterm contracts to ward off possible jumping to rival leagues, the Knicks yesterday announced the signing of Bill Bradley to a oneyear contract.

title: MILE PACE GOES TO JAMBo BELLE
description: YONKERS, Aug. 19 Bert James, who ,retired to a life of ease in Pittsburgh and, became a prominent owner of standardbreds, appears to have turned up another good one in Jambo Belle. The homebred daughter of Good Time and Maryellen Hanover prevailed by a nose tonight in capturing the $29,971 La Paloma Pace at Yonkers Raceway.

title: Monzon Halts Bogs And Retains Crown
description: Aug. 19Powerpunching Carlos Monzon of Argentina unbeaten in eight years, retained his world middleweight championship tonight, knocking out Tom Bogs of Denmark with a smashing right in the fifth round of their scheduled 15round fight.

title: TOLUCA, Mexico.;Music
description: TOLUCA, Mexico. AT first look it was that classic confrontation between conductor and orchestra known as the rehearsal. They were in the second movement of the Rachmaninoff Second Piano Concerto and the maestro's voice could be heard wailing over the soft, sensuous strings as he glared reproachfully at an errant horn player.

title: Olympic Judging Is Fine, but Fairness Is Hard to Come By
description: The Olympic Games, which are supposed to embody the highest principles of sportsmanship, often are blemished by politics, favoritism and athletic deals among referees.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: To an exNew Englander, someone seems wrong in the article about the Boston Irish (Travel section, Aug. 6). The Old Farmer's Almanac says Bunker Hill Day is June 17, not 14.

title: Hurricane Hits Pacific Atoll Used to Store U.S. War Gas
description: HONOLULU, Aug. 19 (UPI)Hurricane Celeste struck Johnston Island, the United States midPacific war gas arsenal, today but everyone had been evacuated from the tiny atoll.

title: Child to the Lanes
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Aug. 19  A daughter was born July 30 to Mr. and Mrs. Garrison Fairfield Lane in the Greenwich Hospital. Mrs. Lane is the former Marcia Huhn of New York. Her husband is with the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company in. New York.

title: 13 Handicapped Westchester Children Complete a Special Preschool Course
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 19Thirteen preschoolaged handlcaPped children, surrounded by proud parents and. families, graduated this week after attending a special program here for up to four years.

title: Just a little bit of fluff
description: Right! It's that same fuzzy angora that was around way back in the forties. Those were the days when angora sweaters used to be tucked away in the refrigerator. Cold, it was thought, kept them from shedding. Maybe, but... Well, it's lucky for men that blue serge suits are out these days. Because angora is fluffing up the fashion scene again. Shown here, along with an original forties angora sweater (on the original sweater girl, Lana Turner, at left) are the new angoras of the seventies.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 19 With their candidates, their rules, their platform and their record of performance all ready made by the White House, Republicans moved sedately through the heat here today toward their tamest national convention in years.

title: The civilians fight, the workers fight, the blacks fight
description: Our men feel that although may have my millions and they the rewards of their daily toil, still we are about equal in the end, said William Vanderbilt of the New York Central in 1877. If they suffer, I suffer, and if I stiffer they cannot escape. A trifle smug, yet Vanderbilt's words do point at a truism for American workers  dependence on the bosses which a century of sporadic labor warfare has not overcome. Labor's Wobblies have given way to its Meanys and its swords have been beaten into profit shares. It marches to the Crusades but the Cross it seeks is Blue. Accordingly, standard labor histories view the bloody engagements of yesteryear as little more than entr'actes in the unfolding pageant of business unionism.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: President Nixon and Kakuei Tanaka, Japan's new Premier, are scheduled to meet in Hawaii at the end of August to discuss the normalization of Japan's relations with the People's Republic of China and the huge American deficit in trade with Japan.

title: Cosmos Edge Tornado, 10
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Aug. 19 Despite a furious attack for the entire 90 minutes, the New York Cosmos managed to score only once at Hofstra Field tonight. But it was enough to defeat the Dallas Tornado, 10, in a North American Soccer League semifinal play off game.

title: JOB SPURT LIKELY IN HEALTH FIELDS
description: New York City is one of the world's great cultural and entertainment capitals, but its fastest growing occupations during the next decade are more likely to be medical and dental technicians than artists, musicians, authors, athletes and entertainers.

title: Johnston Wins in Louisiana
description: NEW ORLEANS, Aug. 19 (AP) J. Bennett Johnston Jr., a 40yearold former legislator who was denied the Governor's chair a halfyear ago by less than 5,000 votes, was nominated by Louisiana's Democrats to succeed the late Allen J. Ellender in the United States Senate.

title: A Picture History Of the Olympics By James Coote. Introduction by Jim McCay. Illustrated. 152 pp. New York: The Macmillan Company. $12.95.
description: The moment the Olympic Games should have come properly and poetically to an end was at the closing ceremony of the 1964 Olympiad, in Tokyo. There, sweeping aside the prohibitions of the Elders, the athletes broke ranks and fraternized joyfully, singing, dancing and laughing. The loudspeakers bellowed at them in vain to get back into line, to march solemnly as they were supposed to march. For once, the supposed spirit of the Olympic Games, the reconciliation of the youth of the world, was being movingly expressed, and predictably, it was more than the Olympic hierarchy could bear.

title: Police Commanders Map Plan For War on Organized Crime
description: Top police commanders spent a busy day yesterday formulating procedures for implementing Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy's plan to enlist every member of the force in the fight against organized crime.

title: Dodgers Beat Cubs, 42
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug., 19 (AP) Manny Mota and Wes Parker hit runscoring singles in the third and Tommy John allowed only four hits as the Los Angeles Dodgers defeated the Chicago Cubs, 42, tonight.

title: Nixon's Veto: No Reckless Spending
description: This bill, President Nixon said, Is a perfect example of that kind of reckless spending that just cannot be done without more taxes or more inflation, both of which I am determined to avoid.

title: The boadasssss success
description: His clothes look like remnants from a rummage sale: denims with barely a trace of blue, shirts that look slept inand usually are. His hair twisted in tight rows of braids, like a furrowed field, covered by a bright African skullcap. The bristle on his face is not a premeditated beard so much as an accidental accumulation by someone who simply does not have the time or interest to shave.

title: Miss Anne Mulligan, Teacher, Affianced
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Aug. 19The engagement of Miss Anne O'Boyle Mulligan to Michael Hartmere, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Hartmere of Dedham, Mass., has been announced by the future bride's parents, Judge William Hughes Mulligan of the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit, and Mrs. Mulligan of Bronxville.

title: Jersey Port Authority Aide Finally Confirmed by Senate
description: James C. Kellogg 3d, whose reappointment as a Commissioner of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey had been held up by a political feud in the New Jersey Senate, has been confirmed by that body, spokesman for the Port Authority said last week.

title: Republicans DiscoverIt's All Such Fun
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 19The Republicans, whose national convention promises galas and social oneupmanship rather than, pOlitical floor fights, are beginning to assemble. Private jets litter the airports. Yachts are moving into the marinas. Elegant clubs and villas are jammed with the rich and famous. A fourday party is about to begin.

title: Temple to Unveil Stained Windows
description: LAWRENCE, L. I.Temple Sinai, an edifice of quietness and simplicity, has added a procession of stainedglass windows to it sanctuary. The windows will be shown to the public at 4 P.M. today in a program that includes a talk by the artist, Nissan Engel.

title: Movies
description: LITERARYORIENT criticsAndrew Sarris once called them bookish film critics will have no trouble ticking off what is wrong with John Boorman's movie of the. James Dickey novel Deliverance. The plotfour Atlanta suburbanites on a backtonatire canoe trip that turns into a terrifying test of survivalseems overly schematic; the underlying ideas on aggression and the territorial imperative are already slightly threadbare; dialogue tends to be ponderous. In the last analysis, none of that matters. Deliverance also happens to be the most stunning piece of moviemaking released this year.

title: Olympic First Day
description: STAMP collectors can give the United States Olympic team a financial boost. Last Thursday; in firstday ceremonies at Washington during the release of the four U.S. stamps commemorative of the 1972 Olympic Games, the American First Day Cover Society and United States Olympic Committee prepared firstday covers that are available by mail to interested collectors. Proceeds from the sale will be donated to the Olympic Committee.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: SHANGHAI  Once the most fabled city in Asia, Shanghai today is a city where romantic notions die hard. Of nothing is this more true than the port, which in its modern guise is a far cry from the breeding. ground of wickedness and intrigue it was in the days of yore.

title: Two Surveys Show Nixon Getting 3040% of Democrats'
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 Between 30 and 40 per cent of Democratic voters now say that they will abandon George McGovern, their party's Presidential nominee, and vote to reelect President Nixon, according to two political surveys released today.

title: FIRE VOLUNTEERS SCORE BIAS RULE
