description: NEPTUNE, N. J. Aug. 19Confronted with a court order to broaden their membership rolls to include blacks and members of. other minority groups, three volunteer fire companies here have threatened to stop operations next month.

title: PRESTON REGISTERS LUDERS16 TRIUMPH
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Aug. 19Albert G. Preston Jr., with his wife and daughter in the crew, sailed Davada to a 400yard Luders16 Class victory on Long Island Sound off Riverside Yacht Club today. It was the season's 28th Yacht Racing Association championship regatta for fleets based East of Rye.

title: Sherlock Lives On In a Swiss Chateau
description: SIR ARTHUR CONAN DOYLE once wrote of his creation Sherlock Holmes: One likes to think that there is some fantastic limbo for the children of imagination, some strange, impossible place... Perhaps in some humble corner of such a Valhalla, Holmes and his Watson may for a time find a place....

title: Mrs. Hertz Has Child
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., Aug. 19A daughter was born on Aug. 2 to Mr. and Mrs. Julian Hertz in the New Rochelle Hospital. Mrs. Hertz is the former Suzanne Brown.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Moving south and west with alarming speed, the gypsy moth is defoliating huge tracts of certain broadleafed trees, primarily the various species of oaks.

title: World News Briefs
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 19Foreign Minister Chi Pengfei of China today accepted an invitation from Canada's Secretary of State for External Affairs, Mitchell F. Sharp, to visit Canada, the New China News Agency reported.

title: Ohio Group Plans Arena To Honor Jesse Owens
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Aug. 19 (UPI)Plans to build a $12mi1lion sports complex honoring the Olympic hero, Jesse Owens, including a 20,000seat indoor arena and a national track and field Hall of Fame, were disclosed today.

title: Uganda Says That All Asians, Even Citizens, Must Leave Country
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Aug. 19 President Ibi Amin, in a surprise move, announced today that all Asians in Ugandaeven citizens  would be expelled.

title: Keeping on the Go
description: When Roger M. Blough retired as chairman of the United States Steel Corporation in January, 1969, he had a $70,000ayear contributory pension waiting for him.

title: Alfred L. Scopp Marries Elise B. Miller
description: ORKNEY SPRINGS, Va., Aug. 19Miss Elise Browning Miller, a graduate student at the University of North Carolina, was married here this afternoon to Alfred Lee Scopp, who is a doctoral candidate in psychology at Duke University. The Rev. James Lincoln performed the ceremony at Shrine Mont, an

title: Playing It Cool by a Cool Sea
description: EAST HAMPTON, L.I. Lithe, suntanned and casually barefoot, Mrs. Robert Blinken showed a visitor to a chaise, longue, sat down herself and then cast a calm glance across her privethedged pool toward the distant sand dunes separating Lily Pond Lane from the misty reaches of the Atlantic Ocean.

title: Sandra Fuchs Is Wed To Roger M. Eichel
description: Miss Sandra Fuchs was married in the Grand Ballroom of the Pierre last night to Roger Madison Eichel. Rabbi Irving Koslowe performed the ceremony.

title: Gilligan Supports Chavez
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Aug. 19 (UPI)Gov. John J. Gilligan, who met last week with Cesar Chavez, said this week that he had no legal authority to order state agencies to stop buying nonunion lettuce. But he said he was strongly urging that they voluntarily do so.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: With an article entitled No More Renting! We Chose to Buy a Summer Cottage [July 23], you published a table under the heading, First Year's Cost of Cottage Ownership.

title: Crisp Herman Style Marshals His Group For St. Regis, Shows
description: Woody Herman and his orchestra are riding a strange musical seesaw in their current stand at the St. Regis Roof Things go up then they go down, then up then down, finally leyeling off in a more or less neutral position during the short dance set that is now a standard part of the big band presentations at the St. Regis.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: The North Terminal is not only used by students and hippies but also, by families, professionals and business people intent on saving as much as $400 on a roundtrip flight to London by utilizing legitimate charter groups. This overcrowded, outdated hangartype building is a disgraceful departing sight for visitors from overseas and an ignominious nightmare for all who find their way to the boondocks of J.F.K. If there is no room at the airport's main Terminal City, why cannot the facilities at the new Newark Airport, presently under construction, be used for all nonscheduled flights?

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday that the fine for parking at a fire hydrant would be raised to $35 from $25 on Sept. 11. The reason, he said, is that fire trucks and ambulances have frequently been delayed by parked vehicles blocking traffic,

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 (AP)  A campaign contribution of $25,000 to the McGovern for President Committee from the Oil, Chemical and Atomic Workers Union was announced today.

title: Brooklyn's Finntown Losing Its Flavor
description: The sauna in Finntown is for sale, thus lending further evidence , to the fact that this oncethriving Finnish community in Brooklyn is declining.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:I am curious as to who the vice president of an executive firm in your story is because I have found that it is very hard for a woman executive to find a head hunter and apparently you have found it is hard for head hunters to find women.

title: Valerie Warde, Harry A. Schult Plan Marriage
description: The engagement of Miss Valerie Warde to Harry A. Schult, son of Mrs. Harry A. Schult of Old Westbury, LI., and the late Mr. Schult, has been announced by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. George A. Warde of New York. A November wedding is planned.

title: Flemish Mernorial to Volunteers In Nazi SS Arouses Protests
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 19The construction of a memorial in Flemish hamlet honoring Belgian volunteers in the Nazi SS who were killed oil Oennany's eastern front is arousing indignation in Belgium.

title: National Guard Now ls Aiding Youths
description: SEA GIRT  Specialist 4 Robert Fass spent the first week of his annual field training last summer with the New Jersey National Guard constructing roads and bridges fon armored vehicles. The second week, the 23yearold specialist, who in civilian life is a teacher, was kept busy tearing down what he had built the first week.

title: Frenchmen Win Title Sail
description: HANKO, Finland, Aug. 19 (AP)  Nicolas Loday and Nicolas Federenko of France won the world 505 Class sailing championships today, their best five races totaled 58,0 points. Giles Levesque of France was second with 59.0 points and the Wilen brothers of Finland third with 59.7.

title: Karate Games Slated
description: The first annual New Jersey State karate games will be held at the State Fair in Trenton. The martial arts event, to determine karate's best, will run for nine days, starting on Friday evening, Sept. 8.

title: Miss Mary Bellew Is Bride in Suburb
description: PURCHASE, N.Y., Aug. 19 Miss Mary Angela Bellew, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Vincent D. Bellew of Scarsdale, was married here this morning to Donald J. Kennedy, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur R. Kennedy of Huntington, L.I. The ceremony was performed in the Manhattanville College Chapel by Msgr. Daniel Daley, a cousin of the bride, who also married the bride's parents.

title: MIGRANTS GETTING HEALTH CARE UNIT
description: IMMOKALEE, Fla., Aug. 19A health care center is planned for this migrant community that came into national focus three years ago following a visit.by the Senate Select Committee on Nutrition and Human Needs headed by Senator George Mc. Govern.

title: Zerega Youth Center is Closed To Start Move to Foster Homes
description: A first step in replacing largescale institutions for the detention or care ?? problem children in favor ?? small personal facilities was announced by Mayor Lindsay yesterday with the closing of the Zerega Juvenile Center in the Bronx.

title: Loan Will Keep Frogs Jumping at Coast Fair
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Aug. 19 (AP)The state government has come to the aid of the jumping frogs of Calaveras County.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Michael McGee Weds Nesa Hassanein
description: RYE, N. Y., Aug. 19Miss Nesa Hassanein, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Salah M. Hassanein of Glen Cove, L. I., was married at the Westchester Country Club here this afternoon to Michael McGee, son of Dr. and Mrs. William R. McGee of Lexington, Ky. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Dr. Ward Glenn Gypson, pasto emeritus of the First Presbyterian Church in Glen Cove, who baptized and confirmed the bride.

title: Linda C. Vanderbilt Is Married To James S. Kitchen in Ontario
description: Miss Linda Claire Vanderbilt, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Hugh Bedford Vanderbilt of Greenwich, Conn., and Devil Lake, Ontario, was married yesterday at noon to James Sherwood Kitchen, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Hill Kitchen Jr. of Rochester. The ceremony was performed at St. Stephen's Anglican Church in Bedford Hills, Ontario, by the Rev. Alan Brandon.

title: Undersized Boy Helps Others Like Him
description: MENDHAM TOWNSHIPTwelveyearyearold Kerry Lahs collects human pituttary glands, to help scientific research, and other youngsters, who, like him, haven't grown as much as they should have.

title: Miss Wendy A. Silberstein Is Wed
description: The marriage of Miss Wendy Alexandra Silberstein to Second Lieut. Kenneth B. Simons, U.S.A., took place in New Brighton, S. I., yesterday. Rabbi Marcus Kramer performed the ceremony at noon at the home of Dr. and Mrs. Richard M. Silberstein, parents of the bride. The bridegroom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence 13. Simons of Grymes Hill, S. 1.

title: TV IN AUSTRALIA IS CALLED UNFAII
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Aug. 20 Australians are heatedly debating the objectivity of the political reporting of the Government television network as a hardfought national election nears.

title: Rose all, Newcombe in Final
description: FORT WORTH, Tex., Aug. 20 (AP)Ken Rosman advanced into the final of the $50,000 Colonial tennis tournament last night with a 76, 36. 7.6 victory over Arthur Ashe of Gum Spring, Va.

title: Javits Aide Here Quits to Work In McGovern's State Campaign
description: The executive assistant in charge of the New York City office of Senator Jacob K. Javils, a Republican, has resigned to join the New York State Democratic campaign for Senator George McGovern for President.

title: Ellen S. Kitzis Bride on L.I.
description: WOODBURY, L. I., Aug. 20  Miss Ellen Sara Kitzis, daughter of Mrs. Norma Kitzis of Woodbury and Dr. Donald Kitzis of Melville, was married here at noon today to Steven Edward Levy, son of Mr. and Mrs. Melvin H. Levy of New York.

title: NEWHOUSE POSTS 2 TRACK VICTORIES
description: GARMISCH PARTENKIR CHEN, West Germany, Aug. 20 (AP)  United States Army Specialist Fred Newhouse was the only double winner today in an international preOlympic track meet at this Alpine resort.

title: Puerto Ricans Hold Fiesta Folklorica in el Parque
description: Tens of thousands of the city's Puerto Ricans transformed the Central Park Mall into a tropical playground yesterday in celebration of the seventh annual Puerto Rican Folklore Fiesta.

title: Borg Takes Swedish Title
description: STOCKHOLM, Aug. 20 (AP) Bjoern Borg, who is 16 years old, captured the Swedish tennis championship today by defeating Ove Bengtsson, 64, 61, 64. Borg won the Wimbledon junior title in July.

title: Lyle's Batting Lifts Yanks in 10th, 20
description: ARLINGTON, Tex., Aug. 20Sparky Lyle, pitching after Rob Gardner worked seven stingy innings, turned hitter tonight, beating out a bunt for a single that triggered a tworun, 10th inning and carried the Yankees to victory over the Texas. Rangers, 20.

title: Personalities: Halos to Rings
description: Bo Belinsky and Dean Chance, the funloving Los Angeles Angels pitchers of the early nineteensixties, are together again, this time in boxing. Belinsky is the matchmaker for next Saturday night's 10round heavyweight bout between Ernie Shaver and Vicente Rondon in Canton (Ohio) Municipal Auditorium. Chance is the promoter. I'll announce the cards, said the 35yearold Belinsky, who is plunging into the fight game for the first time. Chance has promoted 75 minor matches in the last three years in Ohio, some while he was still pitching in the major leagues. I'll even wear a tuxedo, Belinsky said. Boxing is at a standstill. I'd like to boost it up.... The winner of the George Foreman and Oscar Bonavena fight on Oct. 11 has been promised a title fight with Joe Frazier. We talked to Frazier by telephone, said Foreman, and he said he would give the winner a shot at the title anytime we wanted it. Foreman, who has won all 37 of his fights, 34 by knockouts, meets Jack O'Halloran, the California heavyweight champion, Sept. 16.

title: 400 Protesters Dispersed at G.O.P. Party in Hotel
PAPER IN DISPUTE AT U. OF FLORIDA
description: GAINESVILLE, Ha., Aug. 20 Stephen C. O'Connell, the president of the University of Florida, has begun a drive to gain editorial control over the campus newspaper, The Florida, Alligator, before fall classes begin in September.

title: Former Thai Princess Wed to M.I.T. Student
description: SAN DIEGO, Calif., Aug. 20 (UPI) Thailand's former Princess Ubolratana, who last month renounced her title, was married yesterday at All Souls Episcopal Church here to Peter L. Jensen, a student.

title: Advertising:
description: When it conies to marketing television sets, manufacturers have to reach three levels: distributors, dealers and consumers. And traditionally, manufacturers have relied on their distributors to promote their wares to the dealers, while urging the dealers to reach out to their customers.

title: DISTRICT CAPITAL IN VIETNAM FALLS TO ENEMY FORCES
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam. Monday, Aug. 21South Vietnamese troops have abandoned a northern district capital and nearby defense base in the lace, of a twoday Communist shellMg and ground attackthe biggest Government loss since to early weeks of the North Vietnamese offensive, which began! March 30.

title: Foreign Debt Rose To $13.3Billion For U.S. Concerns
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 20Foreign debt of American companies prompted to borrow by Government controls on their direct investments rose to $13.3billion by the end of last year, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: She's a Triple Threat Who Feels at Home in the World
MONETARY SALVO PREPARED IN IRE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20The 20 executive directors of the International Monetary Fund completed work over the weekend on what amounts to the first salvo in the impending lengthy negotiations on world monetary reform.

title: Stan Shaw. 64. Originated Milkman's Matinee Show
description: Stanley W. Shaw, a retired radio and television announcer who as Stan Shaw originated the Milkman's Matinee show on station WNEW in 1935, died last Wednesday in the Newton (N.J.) Memorial Hospital. He was 64 years old and lived on Mixim Drive in Hopatcong, N.J.

title: American Quintet Will Meet Czechoslovakia in Opener
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 20 (UPI)  The United States basketball team will open its campaign for an eighth straight Olympics championship next Sunday against Czechoslovakia. The first real test, however, will probably come Aug. 29, against Cuba.

title: Harz of N.Y.A.C. Triumphs In A.A.U. AllRound Track
description: Karl J. Harz of the New York Athletic Club won the national allround track championship of the Amateur Athletic Union Saturday at Randalls Island with 7,976 points. Of the 10 events, Harz won the shotput and 880yard walk and tied for first in the high jump.

title: Giving Vote to Inmates Creates Problem in Ohio
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 20 (UPI)  Unconvicted inmates and misdemeanants held in the Cuyahoga County jail will be able to vote in November, the County Board of Elections has decided.

title: ShortTerm Rates Begin Their LongDelayed Rise
Israelis Finding Life in Occupied Gaza, Scene of Toughest Guerrilla Resistance, More Secure These Days
description: GAZA, Aug. 17It's like Petah Tiqva, said an Israeli colonel when asked about life in Gaza today.

title: Gogolak Is Fit to Be Tied Over Miss
JUAN MANUEL GALVEZ OF HONDURAS IS DEAD
description: TEGUCIGALPA, Honduras, Aug. 20 (AP)  Juan Manuel Galvez, President of Honduras from 1949 to 1954 and a power in the ruling National party, died last night of a cerebral hemorrhage. He was 85 years old.

title: 37 Soviet Petitioners Say Czech Trials Recall Stalin
description: MOSCOW. Aug. 20  Thirty. seven Soviet intellectuals and civil rights campaigners charged tonight that the Soviet Union must bear responsibility for the political trials under way in Czechoslovakia and warned that these events were reminiscent of Stalinist repressions.

title: 7,000 Hear 4th Blood, Sweat and Tears
description: The latest edition of Blood, Sweat and Tears drew a full house of 7,000 to the Wollman Rink in Central Park Saturday evening. The new version of the group includes four new members and, in this, its New York debut, it concentrated on new material.

title: Job Action Is Expected By Subway Supervisors
description: Despite a court order temporarily barring a work slowdown scheduled for today by members of the SubwaySurface Supervisors Association, union sources said yesterday that they expected some employes to proceed with th job action.

title: COWBOYS 30, SAINTS 7
description: Craig Morton returned as the Dallas Cowboys No. 1 quarterback and passed the Super Bowl champions to a 307 decision over the New Orleans Saints. This was Morton's first start since early last season when he lost his job to Roger Staubach, who suffered a shoulder separation last week.

title: 6 Hospitalized and 7 Arrested In Melee at S.I. Rock Concert
description: Staten Island's first rock concert ended in disorder last night when all but one of the scheduled acts failed to appear and irate fans knocked down sections of plywood fencing and stormed the stage.

title: Arlynn Beyer Is Wed
description: ROSLYN, L. I., Aug. 20Miss Arlynn Nan Beyer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bertram Beyer of East Hills, was married here today to Alan Bruce Palmer, son of Mr. and Mrs. S. Edward Palmer of Long Beach, in Temple Beth Sholom. Rabbis Samuel Director and Joseph Shevelowitz, both of the Synagogue of Maspeth, officiated. Both Mr. and Mrs. Palmer graduated from the School of Art, Science and Engineering at New York University, where they are working toward their master's degrees, she in mathematics Pod he in biomathetics.

title: Holdout Union in Liverpool Votes to End Dock Strike
description: LIVERPOOL, England, Aug. 20 (Reuters)Longshoremen in Liverpool, the last major British port to be strikebound, voted today to resume work tomorrow.

title: Platform Appeals to the Right but Adds Liberal Stands
Saturday Night Games CARDINALS 17, BRONCOS 13
description: Tim Van Galder, in the taxi squad last year, took over at quarterback in the second half with the Cards trailing, 130, and led St. Louis to a 1713 victory. He passed to Jackie Smith for one touchdown and set up the other scores that came on Jim Bakken's 24yard field goal and Donny Anderson's 2yard run.

title: Navy Awards Contract
description: I.T.T. Gilfillan, a division of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation in Van Nuys. Calif.. announced receipt, of a $16million award for longrange airsearch radar systems and equipment for the United States Naval Ship Systems Command. The systems are for, use aboard destroyers. aircraft carriers. and guided missile frigates and cruisers.

title: Both Players Appeared Content to Split a Point
description: The 16th game of the world chess championship match between Bobby Fischer and Boris Spaasky yesterday was devoid of excitement. Judging from the choice of the opening moves, both players seemed content to play for a draw.

title: Rhodesia Issue Studied as Ethiopians Set Flight Home
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 20 (AP)  The 34man Ethiopian team, including two of the world's best distance runners, arranged today a booking for airline passage home tomorrow from Olympic Village.

title: Opposing Pakistani Factions Agree to Settle Differences
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Aug. 20 The governing Pakistan People's Party and the twoparty coalition that controls the assemblies of two of Pakistan's four provinces agreed to settle their differences at a meeting in Rawalpindi last night.

title: ZEPHYROS TAKES YACHT RACE CUP
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., Aug. 20 Handicap again proved no obstacle today in the Storm Trysail Club's race west from Block Island. Zephyros, the scratch boat, won the Governor's Cup, just as La Forza del Destino had done as the scratch boat going east lastweek.

title: China Little League Victor
description: GARY, Ind., Aug. 20 (AP)China won the senior Little League World Series today, defeating Oxnard, Calif., 9.0, before a crowd of 8,678.

title: Adm. Harold Stark Dies; Operations Chief in 1941
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (AP) Adm. Harold R. Stark, chief of naval operations when the Japanese attacked Pearl Harbor, died today at his Washington home of a heart attack. He was 91 years old.

title: JAMES PATTERSON OF STAGE, 40, DIES
description: James Patterson, a versatile stage actor who won both Tony and Obie awards, died of cancer Saturday in the Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 40 years old and lived at 1 Christopher Street.

title: Nastase Conquers Pattison In Canadian Tennis Final
description: TORONTO, Aug. 20 (AP)Topseeded Hie Nastase of Rumania defeated Andrew Pattison of Rhodesia, 64, 63, today and won the men's singles title in the $72,600 Canadian open tennis tournament.

title: JAPAN'S ECONOMY BEGINS RECOVERY
description: TOKYO, Aug. 20The Japanese economy, after a period of stagnation by Japanese, standards, is recovering, according to senior Government Officials.

title: DAVID B. BLUM
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 David B. Blum, formerly of New York, a retired agent for the Paul Revere Life Insurance Company who had been active in the early Zionist movement, died here yesterday. He was 82 years old and lived in Silver Spring, Md.

title: In a Coal Town, an Elegant Eatery Fights for Success
description: WILLIAMSON, W. Va. sandwizhed between Nelson's Women's Apparel and Caplan's Furniture Store on the main street of this rather depressing coal town is stepchild of the war on poverty, a carpeted cave of a restaurant called the Lock, Stock and Barrel.

title: Checkless Relief?
description: Some of the mailmen delivering welfare checks on mother's day, the day payments are made to families on welfare, carry a length of lead pipe. They also make their deliveries in the city's slum neighborhoods under a buddysystem, which assures their traveling in pairs for safety.

title: Briton Used to Crisis
description: LONDON, Aug. 20Last Friday. in an office building near Downing Street, Robert Carr. Britain's new Home Secretary, went before re. porters to deal with vet another crisishow he planned to help resettle the thousands of Asians with British passports who are being expelled from Uganda. This is a problem we are determined to handle in a humans and orderly way, he said in the methodical and patient tones that Britons have come to expect from him.

title: RUSTIN PROPOSES ETHNIC COALITION
description: Bayard Rustin, the civil rights leader, called last night for strongly united coalition of blacks, Jews and Puerto Ricans and other ethnic groups to insure a progressive social and economic environment.

title: Roundup: Pat Kelly Makes White Sox a CoLeader
description: The Kellys were in action yesterdayLeroy, the Cleveland Browns running back, played in a preseason football game against the Detroit Lions, and his brother, Pat, was in right field for the White Sox in the first game of a doubleheader against the Boston Red Sox in Chicago.

title: Today's Program for Convention
description: SWAMI BEACH, Aug. 20Following are the major scheduled events of tomorrow's opening sessions of the Republican National Convention:

title: Appeal by U.S. Athletes
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 20 (UPI)Black and white members of the United States track and field team, including coaches, drafted a statement today to be presented to the International Olympic Committee, asking for a reappraisal of the decision to allow Rhodesia to participate in the Olympics.

title: Seebold Wins Boat Title
description: WASHINGTON, N. C., Aug. (AP)Bill Seebold of St. Louis set a worldrecord pace today and won the American Power Boat Association's national outboard marathon championship. He averaged 76.986 miles an hour for 235 miles.

title: Feminists Shifting Emphasis From Persons to Politics
description: The women's liberation movement  a massive behavioral revolution aimed at overturning the very structures of a male dominated societyhas entered a new stage of development. It is now concentrating aner gies on legislative lohbying and politics.

title: Fisherman. 80. Lost at Sea After His Boat Capsizes
description: An 80yearold man was lost at sea off Far Rockaway, Queens, yesterday morning when the boat he was riding in capsized, the police said.

title: REDS POST MEEP, ROUTING METS, 81
description: The New York Mets, who are even losing arguments now, lost their third straight game, 8.1, to the Cincinnati Reds yesterday before a large and sometimes hooting crowd of 42,555 in Shea Stadium.

title: 2 Young Bicyclists Spending Summer On a 900Mile Adventure on Wheels
description: Walter and Daniel Brooks set off on bicycles last Monday from their home in Middle Hope, N. Y., a suburb of Newburgh, for a summer adventure they have been planning since spring.

title: In which it is opined that Grand Central is not at all a thing of beauty, but an eyesore, depressing to the spirit, and should be knocked down.
description: As one who has absolutely no connection with any real estate interests or with anyone involved in real estate, I query the statement of the Municipal Art Society that the building proposal at Grand Central will deprive the people of New York of the extensive public benefits which derive from the continued presence of the terminal in its present form.

title: NEWARK WEIGHING WATERSHED PLAN
description: NEWARK, Aug. 20A suggested plan for developing a portion of Newark's 35,000acre Pequannock watershed in northwestern New Jersey could provide the city with new revenues and recreation sites and Mayor Kenneth E. Gibson with some needed common ground with the City Council.

title: Japanese Securities Firms Give City New Dimension
description: Three Japanese securities! firms and the real estate! branch of Mitsubishi, the vast; conglomerate, are establishing offices in the Financial District in a move that is expected! to facilitate the flow of capital! between Japan and the United States.

title: City Reduces Waiting Period. to Enter Its Methadone Program
description: HEROIN ADDICTS: Now there's just a SHORT WAIT for FREE Methadone Maintenance Treatment. This alluring message appears on flyers the city's Health Services Administration will begin distributing this week.

title: U.S. Team Uncovers Phoenician Temple in Lebanon
description: The first Phoenician temple to be found in the homeland of the ancient seatrading empire was unearthed this summer by an archeological expedition from the University of Pennsylvania.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: CAMBRIDGE JUNCTION, Mich. (AP)David Pears.on of Spartanburg, S.C., outdrove Bobby Allison during the final 50 miles today and won the Yankee 400 stock car race by a length before 27,404 spectators at Michigan International Speedway.

title: Excerpts From Platform Approved by G.O.P. Resolutions Panel for the Convention
Research Links Moonshine to Cancer
description: VALHALLA, N. Y., Aug. 20A British specialist in the environmental causes of disease! believes that he has found a link between the drinking of moonshine whisky and cancer of the esophagus, one of the most devastating forms of the disease.

title: DOLPHINS 35, BENGALS 17
description: Bob Griese opened the scoring by tossing a 12yard touchdown pass to Paul Warfield and then threw two other passes to lead Miami to its triumph.

title: Georgia O'Keeffe Gets Medal for Work in Art
description: PETERBOROUGH, N. H., Aug. 20  Georgia O'Keeffc, a pioneer of modern art in America, today was awarded this year's Edward MacDowell Medal for her outstanding contribution to the arts.

title: Mrs. Gunter Beats Mrs. King
description: DENVER, Aug. 18 (AP)Mrs. Nancey Richey Gunter of San Angelo, Tex., shrugged off a leg injury today and defeated Mrs. Billie Jean. King of PalmAire, Fla.. 16, 64, 6.3, in the final of the $25,000 Virginia Slims international tennis tournament.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: On July 5 The Times carried a letter from S. David Leibowitt criticizing Senator McGovern for his cosponsorship of Senate bill 3378. One of the provisions of this legislation makes charitable bequest deductible for estate tax purposes only if it is to be used predominantly within the United States or its possessions.

title: 1973 Congress Called On Future of Olympics
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 20 (AP)The International Olympic Committee announced plans today, for congressonly the second in its historyto review the future of the Olympics.

title: Federal Hearings Set in Fall On Land Developers'
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (UPI) The Department of Housing and Urban Development announced today that public hearings would be held across the nation this fall into shady tactics used by land developers to promote interstate sale of recreational and retirement property.

title: Connors Defeats FitzGibbon
description: OCEAN CITY, Md., Aug. 20 (AP)Jimmy Connors, the 19yearold player from Belleville, III., captured the $1,500 Ocean Pipes international tennis tournament today by defeating Herb FitzGibbon of Garden City, L. I., 63, 62, for his seventh tourney victory of 1972.

title: Fisehleiarid Spassky Draw 16th Game of Title Match
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Aug. 20 Boris Spaasky and Bobby Fischer played to a 60move draw today in the 16th game of the world championship chess match.

title: Strip Mining of Coal Shows Drop in West Virginia
description: ELKINS, W. Va., Aug. 20Jimmy Polino, president of the Douglas Coal Company, is trying to find a buyer for two 10cubicyard draglines, which are dredging machines used in strip mining.

title: A Mission to Rhodesia Set
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 20 (AP)The International Olympic Committee confirmed today that it would send a factfinding commission to Rhodesia next year to investigate sports there.

title: Dissent Appears Scarce In 3 Area Delegations
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Aficionados of turnpikes ought to come over to Fifth Avenue in the mornings where there's nostop traveling from 110th Street to Washington Square for trailertrucksize buses coming from all over New York City. I counted fourteen of them between 7:26 and 7:31 A.M. Tuesday, and the noise was terrific. [Editorial July 18.]

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Giants and Jets attic to a 3131 Tie in Yale Bowl
description: NEW HAVEN,,Aug. 20  A wild 3131 tie in the Yale Bowl today left the Giant fans with all satisfactions except victory and the Jet fans with most of the discomforts associated with defeat.

title: ROCK PICNIC ON S.I. ENDS IN BAD TRIP
description: Yesterday's Rock Picnic in Staten Island was a good ideain theory. The prospect of playing volleyball, basking in the sun, picnicking and riding horseback while listening to an allday program of rock music sounded like a fine prospect for a warm, late August afternoon.

title: Hydroplane Driver Killed
description: CINCINNATI, Aug, 20 (AP) Conely Snowden, a 42yearold hydroplane driver from Lexington, Ky., was killed and another driver was seriously injured during a collision today in a regatta on the Ohio River. Ronald Davies, 18, of Kettering, Ohio, was listed in serious condition at St. Francis Hospital.

title: Mayer Wins Amateur Title
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I., Aug. 20 (AP)Alex Mayer of Wayne, N. J., won the United States amateur grass court tennis championship today, defeating Vitas Gerulaitis of Howard Beach, Queens, in the final at the Meadow Club, 63, 63, 62, Mayer's precision placements and passing shots dominated play. Mayer, seeded third, had upset topseeded Jeff Austin of Rolling Hills, Calif., in the semifinals yesterday.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 20 (UPI)The Chicago Black Hawks have sued for an injunction to keep Bobby Hull from playing for the new World Hockey Association with the Winnipeg Jets. The case is scheduled for Wednesday in Cook County Circuit Court.

title: Steel Makers Weigh Costs And Hope for Higher Prices
description: PITTSBURGH. Aug 20Steel mills were mulling over prices last week.

title: Taiwan Ties Survival to Economic Gains
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Aug. 20So long as our economy con tinues to grow fast, Premier. Chiang ChiangKuo told a meeting of the Government's Economic Planning Agency last week, we will be able to meet any challenge from without and overcome any difficulty we may encounter in international politics so as to open up a bright future for our nation.

title: Red Smith
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 20The Oberwiesenfeld is a green plain on the northern edge of the city where the soldiers of Bavaria's rulers used to drill. was the airfield at which Neville Chamberlain landed 3 years ago, clinging to a furled umbrella and a dream of peace in our time. It was a prime target for the Allied bombers that reduced half of Munich to rubble in World War II. Today it must have been the busiest spot in the Federal Republic of Germany as thousands upon thousands of sightseers swarmed over pedestrian bridges over the avenue called Georg Brauchle Ring to view at close range the topsyturvy circus camp of glass that is already the symbol of the XX Olympiad.

title: Attack on Soldiers In Belfast Starts HalfHour Gunfight
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 20 (Reuters)Irish Republican. Army gunmen made their biggest attack on British soldiers in Belfast tonight since the troops entered Catholic areas formerly barred to them three weeks ago.

title: DANCE HALL BLAST KILLS ONE
description: TULSA, Okla., Aug. 20The latest in a series of mystery bombings in eastern Oklahoma has killed one person and injured 14. The authorities said that they feared more bombings at the hands of a madman.

title: Books of The Times
description: GAROWN OF INNOCENTS. By Art Fisher and Neal Marshall. Will? Charles Einstein, 186 loges. Dutton. $5.95.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: We met, FitzGreene Halleck and in Central Park by a bench in the long wide alley leading from the Mall.

title: Party on L.I. Assists Attica Defense
description: AMAGANSETT, I,. I., Aug. 20  You've really got to believe in something to go to a fundraising party these days, said one woman standing near a platter of steak tartare. That radical chic business hurt us a lot.

title: Longer Victor on Protest In Continental 5000 Race
description: GAINESVILLE, Ga., Aug. 20 (AP)Brette Lunger of Pomona, Calif., won a protested decision today from Brian Redman, a Formula One driver from England, in the L&M Continental 5000 championship series race at Road Atlanta.

title: Drahomir Kolder, A Successor To Dubcek in 1968, Dies at 46
description: VIENNA, Aug. 20 (AP)Drahomir Kolder, a member of the Czechoslovak Communist party's Central Committee and minister chairman of the Committee of People's Control, died today after a long illness, according to the news agency K.T.K. He was 46 years old.

title: Trials in Czechoslovakia
description: Four years ago today Soviet tanks launched the invasion that ended the Prague spring of 1968, but full normalization of the Czechoslovak scene still eludes Moscow. That is evidenced by the series of trials this summer, which has resulted in the sentencing to prison of almost fifty Czechoslovak liberals. If the Husak regime now ruling in Prague were fully confident, it would not have chosen to stage these trials at this late date, and thus touch off a fresh avalanche of criticism from Communist as well as nonCommunist sources in the West.

title: Mine Kills 40 Civilians
description: SAIGON, Monday, Aug. 21 (UPI)  Forty civilians were killed and 30 wounded yesterday when a bus carrying 70 persons hit a mine on the highway between Pleiku and Phunhon in the Central Highlands, South Vietnamese military spokesman said.

title: 3 Supply Routes Reopened
description: SAIGON, Aug. 20 (AP) Three major supply highways to Saigon, two of them from the Mekong Delta and the Central Highlands, hays been reopened to traffic from the field, reports said today. The highways had been closed since Friday by enemy attacks. A fourth highway remained cut about 35 miles north of Saigon.

title: Olivares Wins in New Class
description: MONTERREY, Mexico, Aug. 20 (AP)The former. world bantamweight champion. Ruben Olivares, won his first featherweight bout last night when he defeated Godfrey Stevens of Chile over 10 rounds.

title: CHINA AND CANADA WIDEN RELATIONS
description: PEKING. Aug. 20Canada's relations with China took major step forward yesterday with the announcement that the two countries had agreed to a wide range of cultural, scientific and other exchanges.

title: OILERS 20, PACKERS 3
description: Dan Pastorini threw two touchdown passes and Mark Moseley kicked two field goals in Houston's victory.

title: Brookville Beats Sands Pt. In Polo, 75
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., Aug. 20Peter Daly scored three goals and Tony Coppola added two more as Brookville defeated Sands Point, 75, today in polo at Bethpage State Park.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: MARACAY, Venezuela, Aug. 20 (AP)Ernesto Marcel of Panama bloodied Antonio Gomez's face last night and won the World Boxing Association featherweight chantpionship with a 15round split decision.

title: Israel Assails Soviet
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 20Israel said today that the new Soviet exitvisa levies smacked of the dark ages. After the weekly Cabinet meeting in Jerusalem the Government said that fixing ransom prices for human beings evokes the memory oft the dark middle ages.

title: Badges and Burn Bags Mark Convention Security
Patriots 2717 Victors After Braw1 With Bears
Unity Among Blacks
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug, 20John Smith could not remember the name or country of the black African athlete walking toward him in the Olympic Village, but he recognized the face from another time and place in track and field.

title: Shriver Sunday Interrupted
description: HYANNIS PORT, Mass., Aug. 20 (AP)Sargent Shriver had planned to spend today swimming, sailing and water skiing and perhaps playing tennis. Instead, much of his day was spent on the telephone and in meetings with aides discussing the business of campaigning.

title: Lin Piao in Retrospect
description: PARISWhen I visited the city of Sian in July 1971, the political commissar of the province said to me: No revolutionary can be truly called revolutionary until he is safely dead.

title: I.C.C. Urged to Halt Rail Ferry Service In Mackinac Straits
description: MACKINAC CITY, Mich., Aug. 20  A suspension of railroad car ferry service between Michigan's Lower and Upper Peninsulas across the Straits of Mackinac between here and St. Ignace has been recommended to the Interstate Commerce Commission by a commission examiner, George P. Morin,

title: Outlook for 1976: G.O.P. Delegates, Sure of Victory This Year, Eye Hopefuls
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 20Since nearly all of the Republican politiciansand many of the hangerson as wellhave concluded that the reelection of President Nixon this fall is only slightly less certain than his renomination here on Tuesday night, the natural thing is for everyone to gossip about whom the Republicans might nominate four years hence. Thus, even before the convention has for mally opened, the corridors, the bars and the newspapers are full of talk about the 1976 ticket. It beats speculating about what James Stewart may have to say in his encomium to Mrs. Nixon, and it provides a certain desultory interest, like batting averages in the off season.

title: ABROAD AT HOME
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 20The man who will shortly be renominated for President has done many significant things in his first term of office. But in a way his most remarkable achievement has been in the Vietnam war: He has taken a national mistake and made it an obsession.

title: M'GOVERN REJECTS AID OF ARAB GROUP
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (Reuter)Senator George McGovern repudiated today any support from the Action Committee on AmericanArab Relations, saying that the group's endorsement of him yesterday was a cynical attempt to harm him and to win votes for President Nixon.

title: EqualRights Proposal Approved by 20 States
description: The proposed Equal Rights Amendment, which would prohibit discrimination based on sex by any law or government action, was approved by Congress last March and is now being considered by many state legislatures. Ratification by 38 states is required to amend the Constitution.

title: Shanghai Learning to Say Hello
description: SHANGHAIA full generation after English went out of fashion along Nanking Road, it's back again. Along this oncegrand avenue in the small hours of the morning, youths pedaling their vegetable carts to market will cry out in unison as they pass: Hello! How are you? Goodby! Wait for a second wave of carts, and their riders in turn pick up the refrain: Hello! How are you? Goodby!

title: Thailand Kills 12 Terrorists
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Aug. 20 (AP)Government forces killed 12 terrorists in southern Thailand's Suratthani Province Saturday, according to reports reaching here today. The reports said that two helicopters were called in to strafe the terrorists positions after a policeman was killed and eight others were wounded when their truck was ambushed.

title: First Woman President of Islamic Units Says She's TraditionalistNot Feminist
description: The Federation of Islamic Associations in the United States and Canadaa group that represents two million Muslimselected its first woman president yesterday at its 21st annual convention, held at the Americana Hotel.

title: Miami Beach Tent City A Carvinal of Protesters
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 20The couple, both in their 70's, shuffled tentatively to the entrance, asked whether they could look around and were handed a piece of paper by a massive, bearded and shirtless gatekeeper.

title: The Youth Vote
description: The magnitude and impact of the youth vote has developed into a key issue in the Presidential election, with both parties staking out their claim to the 25 million new voters enfranchised by the Twentysixth Amendment. Democrats point optimistically to the fact that far three of four youths have registered Democratic and that 57 per cent of those already registered favor Senator McGovern. They make much of the fact that President Nixon's 1968 total margin of victory in most states was only oneeighth or less of the number represented by newly enfranchised voters in those states.

title: U.S. Steel Bows to Pressures for Wide Pollution Curbs
Three Convicts Flee Jail In Florida With 2 Hostages
description: PENSACOLA, Fla., Aug. 20 (AP)Three inmates described as desperate men with histories of previous escapes broke out of Escambia County jail today, taking two deputy sheriffs hostage and commandeering a patrol car, the police said.

title: Miss Wynkoop Becomes Bride
description: DOWNSVILLE, N.Y., Aug. 20In the Colchester Community Church here this afternoon Miss Marilyn Wynkoop and Robert Thomas Banes, 1971 graduates of the College of William and Mary, were married by the Rev. John G. Wall.

title: HOGAN'S REMARKS ON TOMBS SCORED
description: William T. vanden Heuvel, chairman of the city's Board of Correction, assailed District Attorney Frank S. Hogan yesterday for criticizing the jury that had acquitted three Tombs prisoners on riot charges and said he would call on Governor Rockefeller to take the two remaining cases out of Mr. Hogan's hands.

title: Auto Rollback
description: The Nixon Administration's confrontation with the auto industry on price increases is far from over, although the Ford Motor Company has disappointed White House hopes that it would cancel its request for a price increase and thereby force the other auto producers to back down. Instead, Ford has followed General Motors lead and has cut its proposed price increase from $92 to $59 a car, to cover the cost of new safety and antipollution equipment. Chrysler and American Motors are standing firm on their original bids for larger price increases, while recognizing that the price dominance the Big Two may oblige them to scale down their price hikes on 1973 models, even if these should win the approval of the Price Commission.

title: AMEX TO IMPLEMENT VOTINGRIGHTS RULE
description: The American Stock Exchange announced yesterday that its governing board had strengthened listing standards by adopting a rule calling for mandatory voting rights for the holders of all common stocks seeking future listings.

title: SCORES FLEE FIRE IN SHERATON HERE
description: A smoky fire on an upper floor of the New York Sheraton Hotel forced scores of people to flee to the lobby last night and caused minor injuries from smoke inhalation to two occupants and four firemen battling the blaze.

title: Chess Game Is Drawn
description: After 60 moves, Bobby Fischer and Boris Spassky agreed to a draw in the 16th game of their world championship chess match in Reykjavik, Iceland. The 17th game is to be played tomorrow. Details are on Page 38.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The issue with the Eagleton affair is really just how constructive should the New Politics be? if the public insists on complete disclosure and full rationalization, why doesn't McGovern respond by announcing his Cabinet choices at this time? It would be exciting to know just who is going to manage each of the new programs. Such a tactic would surely serve to bring some of the Democrats back together. Everyone should prefer a Cabinet of potential Vice Presidents to one of mere Secretaries.

title: Kathy Whitworth Takes Golf Playoff; Miss Bourassa 2d
description: LEAWOOD, Kan., Aug. 20 (UPI)Kathy Whitworth carded a par on the fifth hole of a suddendeath playoff with Jocelyne Bourassa today and won her 63d Ladies Professional Golf Association title in the $20,000 Southgate open.

title: Mexico, Sweden Split
description: Mexico and Sweden senior !minis players split singles matches yesterday in the final elimination of Stevens Cup play at the Town Tennis Club. Aake Eliaeson of Sweden defeated Alfredo Millet, 64, 63, and Jorge Solano of Mexico beat Torsten Johannsen, 75, 62.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 20 (AP)Bert Firestone, bidding by transAtlantic telephone, purchased for $40,000 today a yearling from a special sale at Deauville, France. He was the only one at the sales ring here who made a purchase. Bidding in France was heard simultaneously here by telephone, while pretaped pictures of the yearlings were flashed on a screen.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I should like to present some unmentioned but vital aspects of strip mining in response to your Aug. editorial SemiStrip Mining.

title: Pope Condemns Violence, Air Hijacking and Sabotage
description: CASTELGANDOLFO, Italy, Aug. 20Pope Paul VI today condemned acts of violence and specifically referred to sabotage, airline hijacking and kidnapping.

title: European 800 Mark Bettered
description: HELSINKI, Aug. 20 (AP)Pekka Vsala of Finland established a European record of minute 44.5 seconds In the 800meter run today at a FinlandSweden track and field meet.

title: Final Satellite in Orbiting Observatory Ready for Launching Today in Florida
description: An American spacecraft honoring Copernicus is scheduled to be launched today to observe interstellar gases, young hot stars, Xray stars and other phenomena never dreamed of by the Polish monk, the father of modern astronomy.

title: Elks Leader Says Admitting of Blacks Depends on Vote
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Aug. 201 (UPI)The national leader of the 1.5 millionmember Elks organization, which does not have black members, says Negroes may be admitted after July, 1973, if the membership votes to change its constitution.

title: Withdrawals in Vietnam Nearing President's Goal
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 20 (Reuters)  American troop strength in Vietnam dropped to 39,200 last week, within 300 of President Nixon's withdrawal target for Sept. 1, a United States spokesman said today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your editorial ["The Real Issue, July 31] purports to rely on an article by Professor Alexander M. Bickel, but it misreads that article. Professor Bickel does not contend, as you do, that the war in Vietnam is unconstitutional because Congress failed to pass a resolution declaring that a state of war exists between the United States and North Vietnam.

title: Levitt Finds Interns Who Live In Collect Housing Allowance, Too
description: As many as 200 resident doctors and interns may have been living in municipal hospitals while also drawing the $1.500ayear allowances given those whose homes are outside the hospitals, a report on a state audit. indicated yesterday.

title: City Council Hearings Scheduled This Week
description: Following are public hearings scheduled this week by City Council Committees.

title: Personal Finance: Liability on Cards
description: The Federal Reserve Board is considering an amendment to its creditcard regulations so that a businessman cannot be penalized more than $50 for unauthorized use of a lost or stolen card.

title: 300 on EarlyMorning W alking Tour Are Told Paterson IsLike Florence
description: PATERSON, N. J., Aug. 20 At 5:30 this morning, a thin wail of Where's tile castle was heard from one of the 300 people trudging up the steep eastern slope of Garret Mountain Reservation along a rough cobblestone path.

title: Prosperous Uganda Asians Now Despair
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Aug. 20Along Kampala Road the theaters with Indian films were empty today. There were few rummy and mahjongg games in the hilltop suburbs of Kololo and Buglobi. The golf course and cricket fields near the Nakasero club were silent.

title: For Street Festival, Curtain Time!
description: Free theater will come to Lincoln Center in lavish measure starting today at noon, when the center's second annual Community/ Street Theater Festival begins a 14day run.

title: Advertising:
description: A new series of ads for a nonprofit organization seeking to create publicprivate partnerships in low income areas will hit the public soon and the pitch will be selfinterest.

title: BrownsLions Exhibition No Big Hit in Ann Arbor
description: More than 100,000 persons can squeeze into the University of Michigan Stadium, and they do when there are such attractions as Michigan vs. Ohio State. So it must have been major disappointinent to the Detroit Lions and Cleveland Browns yesterday when only 58,400 were in the stadium at Ann Arbor to watch the Lions passing game carry them to 347 victory in a preseason game.

title: BEST IN SHOW GOES TO GORDON SETTER
description: SANDY POINT, Md., Aug. 20 Ch. Afternod Yank of Rockaplenty, a 3yearold Gordon setter, was Judge John H. Honig's choice for best in show at the Annapolis Kennel Club's 21st dog show today.

title: PRICE UNIT ASSAYS IMPACT OF CURBS
description: A year ago President Nixon made his historic speech ordering a freeze on most prices and inaugurating a new era of price control.

title: SILVER LINING WINS HORSE SHOW STAKE
SHEIK CALLS TALKS ON OIL VERY USEFUL
description: BEIRUT, Aug. 20 (Reuters)Three hours of negotiations tonight between Saudi Arabia and Western Oil Companies, on demands by oilproducing countries in the Persian Gulf for more participation in the oil industry, were descrbed as very useful by the Saudi Oil Minister, Sheik Ahmed Zaki AlYamani.

title: DEVLIN TRIUMPHS BY THREE SHOTS
description: SUTTON, Mass., Aug. 20Bruce Devlin of Australia accepted a $40,000 going away present today. After a final 69 in the U.S. Industries Classic, he won by three strokes with an aggregate of 275 and bade the pro tour goodby until December.

title: 155 Korean Children Enter U.S. for Adoption
U.S. Soccer Squad Rallies but Loses To Canada, 3 to 2
description: The defeat suffered by the United States World Cup soccer squad yesterday came as no surprise to soccer authorities here. The team, without several regulars and with only two practice sessions, suffered a 32 setback to Canada in the first qualifying match for the World Cup in Munich in 1974.

title: Harlem Five Tops Philadelphia Club At Forum, 10298
description: Charlie Scott was voted the most valuable player yesterday after he scored 4 points in the final 45 seconds to give the Harlem Professional League AllStars a 10298 victory over the AllStars of Philadelphia's Baker League at Madison Square Garden's Felt Forum. This is the 20th year of the intercity rivalry, but the first time it enjoyed the exposure of the Garden and it was watched by 3,072.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The recent letter by Thomas G. Rieke asserting that money spent on Reserve armed forces is wasteful and should be eliminated is so onesided that a reply is demanded. Not all Reserve units can claim to be highly effective militarily or monetarily, but I do believe that funds expended on Reserve forces can be money well spent.

title: Screen Tanner's Charles, Dead or Alive'
Tequila Demands Strain Mexico's Quality Control
description: GUADALAJARA, Mexico, Aug. 20Mexico's tequila industry is marching ahead at such a rapid pace that some officials in the country fear it is facing a quality crisis.

title: Missing Youth Found Dead
description: The body of a youth found dead of multiple stab wounds Saturday in a wooded area in the Mariner's Harbor district of Staten Island was identified yesterday as that of Al Owens, 15 years old, of 172 South Avenue, which is nearby. The youth had last been seen last Wednesday. He was reported missing Saturday morning by his mother, Mrs. Lucille Owens. His body, fully clothed, was found about 1,000 feet from Holland Avenue.

title: The House Surrenders
description: The House of Representatives, by a vote of 282 to 102, has passed an antibusing bill that would literally turn back the clock of history. The measure not only prohibits virtually all busing for purposes of desegregation, regardless of the pupils age or grade; it also permits the reopening of previously settled cases involving courtordered desegregation.

title: Man Hurt in Subway Fall
description: A 55yearold man fell onto subway tracks at Penn Station yesterday morning and was struck by a northbound IRT local subway train but sustained only minor Injuries, the police said. The man, Ralph Ortiz of 161 West 36th Street, was being held for medical observation at French Hospital where he was treated for scalp lacerations and bruises after being struck by the braking train shortly before 6 A.M. Power was shut off from 5:54 A.M. to 6:09 A.M., the Transit Authority said.

title: Lucy Di Nozzi, Teacher, Married
description: In St. Robert Bellarmine Roman Catholic Church in Bayside, Queens, yesterday Miss Lucy Di Nozzi. daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Luigi Di Nozzi of Bayside, was married to Richard Brancato, son of Mr. and Mrs. Anthony Brancato of Richmond Hill, Queens. The Rev. Placid Macaya performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass.

title: 12 Killed in Yugoslavia
description: DUBROVNIK, Yugoslavia, Aug. 20 (Reuters)  Twelve workers were killed when water from two swollen rivers gushed into a tunnel they were reconstructing in a field near here yesterday, the Yugoslav press agency reported today.

title: RAIDERS 34, RAMS 9
description: The Oakland Raiders won despite the fact that Roman Gabriel returned at the Rams starting quarterback. Gabriel was out of action since early in training camp when he suffered a collapsed lung.

title: Filipinos Rule on Lands
description: MANILA, Aug. 20 (Reuters) The Supreme Court here ruled yesterday that American citizens and corporations cannot own private agricultural lands in the Philipines and that all rights already acquired to exploit and develop natural resources as well as operate public utilities will expire July 3, 1974.

title: Nixon Far Ahead in Survey Of New York Tristate Area
description: President Nixon holds commanding midsummer leads over Senator George McGovern in New York, New Jersey, Connecticut and six other major states, according to the first measures of next November's electoral vote.

title: Rail Pension Fund Is Near Bankruptcy, Commission Warns
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20A highlevel commission will shortly report to President Nixon and Congress that the nation's 37yearold railroad retirement system is gradually going bankrupt.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: This week has been declared CarouselLapital Week at Coney Island, according to the Coney Island Chamber of Commerce. Our five merrygorounds and carousels here, said Matthew Kennedy, executive secretary of the Chamber, will play special music that first was heard on the old handturned organs in the first carousels to appear on the scene before the turn of the century.

title: Bridge: Opponents'
description: Unlike chess, which is 99 per cent technique, bridge is a game in which psychology and morale play major roles. II is proper, and indeed essential, to pick up clues from one's opponent's behavior  although not one's partner.

title: Reykjavik's Fish Gambit
description: Reykjavik, currently a focus of attention as the site of the international chess championship matches, soon may make another kind of splash on the world news front, with Iceland itself as the challenger and fish as the pawns.

title: CHARGERS 17, 49 ERS 16
description: John Hadl hit Jerry Levias with a 3yard touchdown pass with 56 seconds remaining to spark the Chargers to their victory.

title: South Korea Starts Relief Drive; Death Toll in Floods Is Over 300
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 20 The South Korean Government opened a drive today toward recovery from flood damages and for the relief of flood victims, as the heaviest rains in 65 years ceased. More than 300 lives were lost in central Korea since the rains began on Friday.

title: COURT ORDER ENDS TIMES STOPPAGE
description: Members of New York Mailers Union No. 6 complied with a temporary court order last night and returned to work at The New York Times, ending a oneday work stoppage that had prevented the publication of yesterday's issue of the paper.

title: Vietnam Troop Withdrawals Reported Ahead of Schedule
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 21 (AP)The United States command announced yesterday that American troop strength in Vietnam dropped to 39,200 men as of Thursday, and other sources said that in the following three days, it fell below 39,000, President Nixon's announced goal for Sept. 1.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: TOUR, marriage may be hell. Must your divorce be worse? Read Uncoupling: The Art of Coming Apart, by Norman Sheresky and Marya Mannes, Viking, $6.95 at bookstores. ADVT.

title: A Contractor's Help Leads To 3 Bribery Arrests Here
description: Three plumbing inspectors were arrested yesterday on charges of taking bribes, bringing to eight the number of inspectors in the Buildings Department arrested for corruption in the last two months.

title: WHEAT FUTURES REFLECT RUMORS
description: Wheat futures prices fell early yesterday and then rebounded amid an ebb and flow of rumors about purchases by the Soviet Union and the Peoples Republic of China.

title: BENJAMIN SMERLING
description: Benjamin Smerling, a leader in the food service industry, died Saturday in Miami. He was 72 years old and lived at the Regency Hotel.

title: Levitt Says Internes Who Live In Collect Housing Allowance, Too
Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21The Federal Reserve's Open Market Committee voted at its May meeting to slow somewhat further the expansion of the money supply and other monetary aggregates, it was disclosed today.

title: STRICKMAN PAYS BACK TAXES ON LAB
description: HILLSDALE, N.J., Aug. 21The Internal Revenue Service said today that Robert Strickman, developer of a cigarette filter that attracted national attention five years ago, has paid in full back taxes due from his laboratory here.

title: PARAMOUNT FORMS A DIRECTORS UNIT
description: Paramount Pictures Corporation and three directors, Peter Bogdanovich, Francis Ford Coppola and William Friedkin, have formed a jointly owned production company called the Director's Company, it was announced yesterday by Frank Yablans, Paramount president.

title: I.C.C. Examiner Suggests Halt In Upper Michigan Rail Ferry
description: MACKINAW CITY, Mich., Aug. 21  A suspension of railroad car ferry service between Michigan's Lower and Upper Peninsulas across the Straits of Mackinac between here and St. Ignace has been recommended to the Interstate Commerce Commission by a commission examiner, George P. Morin.

title: Britain's Blockade Ends
description: The unsealing of British ports yesterday by striking longshoremen marks an overdue start toward union acceptance of revolutionary changes in waterfront technology in return for generous protection of displaced workers. West Coast dock workers in this country made that turn a dozen years ago. East Coast longshoremen took longer to convince, but both unions have now discovered that there are dividends for workers as well employers in the shared benefits of automation.

title: Screen: Charles Takes a Trip Inward
CHARLES SCHANBERG
description: Charles Schanberg, a partner in the New York Stock Exchange firm of Josephthal & Company, died yesterday in Boston, where he made his home. He was 77 years old.

title: METS TOP ASTROS ON HOMER IN 9TH
description: The New York Mets, who have been discovering plenty of goats lately, discovered a hero last night at Shea Stadium Jim Beauchamp, a 33yearold, itinerant who hit a twoout homer in the ninth inning to defeat the Houston Astros, 42.

title: V.F.W. CLUB BOMBING TIED TO BANK BLAST
description: SAPULPA, Okla., Aug. 21 (UPI)A Saturday night bombing that killed one person and injured 12 others at a crowded Veterans of Foreign Wars club was similar to another dynamiting a few days earlier, Federal agents said today.

title: CAMBODIAN PREMIER ESCAPES BOMBERS
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Aug. 21 (Reuters)  Premier Son Ngoc Thanh of Cambodia escaped unhurt today aften an attempt on his life.

title: Economic Mixmaster
description: The sections of the platform dealing with Jobs, Inflation and the Economy cavalierly disregard the inconsistencies of the Administration record. We have brought about a rapid rise in both employment and in real income. We stand for full employment, it asserts.

title: Levitt Audit Says Local School Board Funds Here Are Wasted
description: An audit by the State Controller's office has found that some of the city's decentralized community school boards made questionable expenditures and engaged in uneconomical practices in using their district cash funds.

title: KOREA STARTING A FLOOD CLEANUP
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 21More than half a million public servants, militiamen and students joined today in a drive to repair damage and help victims of the floods that claimed more than 350 lives over the weekend in South Korea.

title: JOSEPH SACHTER, 67, SCARSDALE LAWYER
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Aug. 21 Joseph Sachter, a lawyer here and a director of the Loral Corporation, electronic manufacturers, died yesterday at his home, 251 Fox Meadow Road. He was 67 years old.

title: Rules Panel Approves ';76 Delegate Plan Retaining SmallState Advantage Intact
News Analysis
description: RABAT, Morocco, Aug. 21King Hassan II of Morocco, who has escaped from two violent attempts to unseat him in the last 13 months, has assured Moroccans that there is no need for coups because they have legal access to all posts except his own.

title: Notes on People
description: Thirtysix years ago, the Republican who was going to lead the G.O.P. in the Presidential campaign was Alf M. Landon of Kansas. Mr. Landon is now 84, so it seemed natural enough for The Los Angeles Times to refer to him as living in retirement. But Mr. Landon wrote to the newspaper that the report of his retirement was causing humorous comment in Topeka, where he lives.

title: PAPER IN DISPUTE AT U. OF FLORIDA
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Aug. 21Stephen C. O'Connell, the president of the University of Florida, has begun a drive to gain editorial control over the campus newspaper, The Florida Alligator, before fall classes begin in September.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: CAMP PERRY, Ohio, Aug. 21 (UPI)Army James McQuien of Plant City, Fla., led the Army Blue team to victory in the National Trophy team match today the annual rifle and pistol championships ended here.

title: Reykjavik's Fish Gambit
description: Reykjavik, currently a focus of attention as the site of the international chess championship matches, soon may make another kind of splash on the world news front, with Iceland itself as the challenger and fish as the pawns.

title: $50,000 BAIL SET IN BRONX ATTACKS
description: According to the indictment, the defendants on Aug. 9, picked up separately at gunpoint Gregory White and Michael Wilson, both 16 years old, at 166th Street and Boston Road.

title: DAVID R. DEWEY 2D
description: NEW LONDON, N.H., Aug. 21 (AP)David R. Dewey 2d, la chemist and businessman of Lincoln, Mass., died yesterday at his summer home here after a long illness. He was 55 years old.

title: ...Which Will Run for 2 Weeks at Lincoln Center
description: Before the Lincoln Center Community / Street Theater Festival is over two weeks from now, 30 troupes and about 800 players will have staged roughly 40 hours of music, dance, comedy, poetry and dramain some cases incorporating four, or all five, of those elements in single performances running about an hour. Last year there were only 14 companies present.

title: Adm. Harold Stark Dies; Top Naval Officer in 1941
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (AP) Adm. Harold R. Stark, who, as chief of naval operations, was the top officer in the Navy when the Japanese attacked Pearl Harbor. died Sunday at his Washington home of a heart attack. He was 91 years old.

title: Roundup: 52,662 See Braves End Carlton Victory String at 15 in 11 Innings,
description: Steve Carlton of the Philadelphia Phillies, the National League's top pitcher with 20 victories, was beaten last night, 21, by Atlanta in 11 innings at Veterans Stadium, Philadelphia, before 52,662 fans, ending Carlton's winning streak at 15 games.

title: Storm Effect on Gas Base
description: HONOLULU, Aug. 21 (AP)Military spokesmen said today that aerial photographs had shown Hurricane Celeste had caused only slight damage to Johnston Island, the Army's secret Pacific storehouse of mustard and nerve gas. The entire force of 580 military and civilians stationed on the island was evacuated to Honolulu before Celeste passed within 30 miles of the island Saturday, with winds up to 130 miles an hour.

title: Executive Changes
description: Sam Mann, president of Bowater Incorporated, a subsidiary of The Bowater Corporation, will return to the United Kingdom to become deputy chairman of Bowaters United Kingdom, Ltd., and chairman of Bowaters United Kingdom Paper Company, Ltd., effective Oct. 1. Mr. Mann has been on temporary assignment in North America since 1970 to establish a central North American management. Hugh K. Joyce, vice president of Bowater Incorporated, will become president and an additional director of the company and will continue as president of Bowater Sales Company Inc. A. E. Balloch, vice president, will become executive vice president.

title: Bunker Hill Monument Plan
description: BOSTON, Aug. 21 (UPI)Transfer of the Bunker Hill Monument to the National Park Service has been proposed by the Metropolitan District Commission. The monument is now maintained by the commission and has fallen into disrepair.

title: WAR FOES GRANTED RIGHT IN GAINESVILLE
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Aug. 21 The city commission here voted tonight to let members of the Vietnam Veterans Against the War camp on municipal property as they protest the arraignment of six of the war foes on conspiracy charges.

title: Operating Engineers End Construction Strike Here
description: Operating engineers began reporting back at construction sites yesterday after a sevenweek strike, but the industry remained largely crippled by other crafts still on strike.

title: Senator Buckley Named As a Nixon Seconder
4 Swedish Fugitives Caught
description: MARIESTAD, Sweden, Aug. 21 (UPI)  Policemen captured a fourth fugitive from the Kumla maximum security prison tonight as he attempted to buy food at a bar. JanErik Hoegstroem, 29, was one of 15 inmates, including the two killers of the Yugoslav Ambassador to Sweden, who escaped from the prison Friday.

title: 1,000 See Opening of Street Festival...
description: The elegant, spacious plaza at Lincoln Center was turned into a New York City play street yesterday with the opening of the second annual Community/Street Theater Festival. Every afternoon for two weeks, free to the public, the plaza and adjacent outdoor areas at Lincoln Center will be filled with the sounds, voices, music, and drama of the streets.

title: Bolivian Reported to Admit Role as a Gestapo Officer
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Aug. 21 (Reuters)A Bolivian Govern ment spokesman said last night, that Klaus Altmann, a Germanborn Bolivian businesman, had admitted he was a former Gestapo chief, Klaus Barbie. But the spokesman said that he would not be extradited to France, where he has been sentenced to die for war crimes.

title: CRITICISM HARSH
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 21The Republicans rolled easily through two of the five sessions of their national convention here today, combining nostalgic tributes to the heroes of past political wars with increasingly harsh attacks on President Nixon's challenger, Senator George McGovern.

title: AMEX AND OTC DECLINE SHARPLY
description: Trading was quiet and prices declined yesterday on they American Stock Exchange and on the overthecounter market..

title: McGovern Talks to Discontented Flood Victims in Pennsylvania
description: WILKESBARRE, Pa., Aug. 21 Senator George McGovern toured the floodstricken Wyoming Valley today, riding the crest of a wave of anger at what many victims consider the indifference of the Nixon Administration toward their problems.

title: Nobel Economist Says Taxes Must Increase Next Year
description: BOSTON, Aug. 21 (UPI) Paul A. Samuelson, Nobel prizewinning economist, says Federal taxes will rise again next year, regardless of who is President.

title: President's Letter Backs Heroin Maintenance Ban
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (AP) President Nixon says he supports fully a bill to prevent the use of heroin for any drugmaintenance program.

title: Veterans Face Guardsmen In Protest at Miami Beach
Israelis Finding Life in Occupied Gaza, Scene of Toughest Guerrilla Resistance, More Secure These Days
description: GAZA. Aug. 17"It's like Petah Tiqva, said an Israeli colonel when asked about life in Gaza today.

title: $90,000 IS AWARDED 24 WORKERS IN SUIT
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 21 (AP)A Federal court has ordered the United Aircraft Corporation to pay 24 past and present employes about $90,000 in a settlement of a lawsuit stemming from a 64day strike in 1960 at the company's Hamilton Standard and Pratt & Whitney divisions.

title: Meany Orders a Hearing On Colorado Unit's Stand
description: WASHINGTON, Aug.21 (UPI) George Meany, A.F.L.C.I.O. president, ordered a hearing today on the Colorado Labor Council's refusal to rescind its endorsement of George McGovern, the Democratic presidential nominee.

title: Boy, 5, Is One of Four Wounded by Queens Gunman
description: A 5yearold Queens boy playing outside his home was shot in the head by a stray bullet yesterday when the irate loser in a sidewalk card game returned with a pistol and wounded two other card players and a woman passerby, the! police reported.

title: 3 Area Delegations, Unlike Democrats, Are Not Disturbed by Voices of Dissent
Jersey Man's Sentence Cut by Claustrophobia
description: JERSEY CITY, Aug. 21 (AP) A Bayonne man was released from jail today after two physicians agreed he suffered from claustrophobia while in prison. He had served two months of a onetotwoyear sentence.

title: Rhodesia Vote Set for Today
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 21 (AP)  The threat of a walkout by African nations, possibly joined by some American blacks, remained alive today, with the Rhodesian issue passing from one hand to another.

title: OUTPUT OF STEEL UP 1.8% IN WEEK
description: Steel production for the week ended Aug. 19 totaled 2,461,000 net tons, the American Iron and Streel Institute reported yesterday. This was up 1.8 per cent from the 2,418,000 tons poured the preceding week.

title: BANKRUPTCY NEAR FOR RAIL PENSIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21  A highlevel commission will shortly report to President Nixon and Congress that the nation's 37yearold railroad retirement system is gradually going bankrupt.

title: Books of The Times
description: For reasons he would rather not examine too closely, the reviewer had been proud at the time that he saw the Muhammad AliJoe Frazier heavyweight boxing match alive at Madison Square Garden from a $150 ringside seat. True, the seat turned out to be several hundred feet away from the action, and was actually, when you came right down to it and faced the unpleasant facts, not quite as good as the seats you pay about a tenth as much for to see any other fight. But after all, the reviewer had been there... where it was happening... the Fight of the Century. He had shared the stale air with the lungs of such as John V. Lindsay, Elizabeth and Richard Burton, Marcello Mastroianni, Abbie Hoffman, El Cordobes, Bernadette Devlin and Hugh Hefner. The reviewer could even see the boxers (although not as well as if he'd brought along the binoculars he'd left at home because he had ringside seat). Some day he would be able to tell his grandchildren about it.

title: JAMES PATTERSON OF STAGE, 40, DIES
description: James Patterson, a versatile stage actor who won both Tony and Obie awards, died of cancer Saturday in the Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 40 years old and lived at I Christopher Street.

title: Crow Not on Jets Menu At Picnic Following Drill
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Aug. 21 The New York Jets worked out briefly today at their Hofstra. University camp, then prepared for their annual cookout:

title: Diplomatic Golden Age
description: The platform gives pride of place to the Nixon record in foreign policy. Historians may well regard these years as a golden age of American diplomacy, the platform declares with characteristic modesty. Since the Administration's diplomacy has been unable in three and onehalf years to negotiate a settlement of the Vietnam war; has alienated Japan, the strongest power in Asia, and India, the largest democracy in Asia; and has shown itself indifferent to the underdeveloped onethird of the world, to say nothing of the United Nations, it will be astonishing if history reaches any such verdict.

title: Robbins Advances In Satellite Tennis; DuPre Sets Pace
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., Aug. 21F. D. Robbins of Salt Lake City, seeded second, defeated Tom Rautenberg of Sands Point, L. I., 61, 62, today in an openinground match of the United States Lawn Tennis Association satellite tournament to qualify players for the United States Open championship.

title: 3 IN JERSEY GUARD KILLED IN ACCIDENT
description: Three New Jersey National Guardsmen attending summer training camp at Camp Pickett, Va., were killed Sunday afternoon when their jeep apparently ran over an unexploded artillery shell.

title: CITY IS TOLD TO END SCOTT PANEL DELAYS
description: The Lindsay administration was ordered yesterday to discontinue delaying tactics and have city employes appear before the state's Scott Commission investigating New York City government, in accordance with previous court rulings.

title: Protest at U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Aug. 21  The Israeli representative to the United Nations, Yosef Tekoah, today protested to Secretary General Waldheim about the exorbitant taxes being levied on Jews who wish to leave the Soviet Union to settle in Israel.

title: U.S. Blue Collar Workers To Get 4 Per Cent Raise
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (AP) President Nixon signed today a bill to give many of the Government's 650,000 blue collar workers a 4 per cent, pay raise by next April 30.

title: Hijacking Suspect Held in $500,000 Bail
description: SEATTLE, Aug. 21 (UPI)Frank M. Sibley Jr. heard a magistrAte set his bail today at $500,000, one fourth the amount the accused bicycling hijacker had demanded in the largest ransom attempt against a United States airline.

title: Alexandra Fedorova, 83, Dies; A Ballerina and Choreographer
description: Alexandra Fedorova, a former Russian ballerina, choreographer and teacher, died Sunday in a nursing home here. She was 83 years old and lived in Ridgewood, N. J. In private life she was the widow of Alexander Fokine, the brother of the late Michel Fokine, the choreographer.

title: Excerpts From Platform Approved by G.O.P. Resolutions Panel for the Convention
BRITISH PORTS BUSY AS STRIKERS RETURN
description: LONDON, Aug. 21 (Reuters) Britain's dockers returned work in strength today, ending a fourweek strike that cut food supplies and damaged British trade.

title: Shanghai Is Tuning In the Radio Daily and Gleefully Learning to Say Hello
description: SHANGHAIA full generation after English went out of fashion along Nanking Road. it's hack again. Along this oncegrand avenue in the small hours of the morning, youths pedaling their vegetable carts to market will cry out in unison as they pass: Hello! How are you? Goodby! Wait for a second wave of carts, and their riders in turn pick up the refrain: Hello! How are you? Goodby!

title: City Cuts Waiting Time for Addicts to Enter Methadone Program
description: HEROIN ADDICTS: Now there's just a SHORT WAIT for FREE Methadone Maintenance Treatment. This alluring message appears on flyers the city's Health Services Administration will begin distributing this week.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 21 (AP)LaSalle Hanover, 3yearold trotter ranked among the favorites for next week's Hambletonian, fell dead today during a workout the Indiana State Fairgrounds.
