title: Scotsman and American Cross the Alps in Balloon
description: BIELLA, Italy, Tuesday, Aug. 22 (AP)A Scotsman and his American copilot successfully completed the first crossing of the Swiss and Italian Alps by hot air balloon last night, landing in a field near this town 50 miles northeast of Turin.

title: TV IN AUSTRALIA IS CALLED UNFAIR
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Aug. 21 Australians are heatedly debating the objectivity of the political reporting of the Government television net work as a hardfought national election nears.

title: MAYOR ASKS STUDY ON FESTIVAL LITTER
description: Depressed by Sunday's havoc, which left a part of Central Park filthy and littered following a Puerto Rican folklore festival, Mayor Lindsay directed his staff yesterday to study ways to hold sponsors of such events accountable.

title: Assurance in U.S. Camp
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 21 (AP)  Clifford Buck, president of the United States Olympic Committee, said today that a number of black athletes had assured team leaders that they would compete regardless of the outcome of the RhodesianAfrican issue.

title: Hogan Aide Says Officials Fight Crime Wrong Way
description: Alfred J. Scotti, chief assistant to Manhattan District Attorney Frank S. Hogan, yesterday criticized public officials who had been making pronouncements about fighting organized crime in the city during the last week.

title: 2 Cardinals Stress Unity At World Council Meeting
description: UTRECHT, the Netherlands, Aug. 21Two Cardinals, appearing as guests before the Central Committee of the World Council of Churches, today stressed the need for Christian unity.

title: Health Department Cites Food Outlets On Code Violations
description: The Health Services Administration's latest list of restaurants and other foodprocessing establishments that have failed to correct sanitary violations after a second inspection was made public yesterday.

title: Front Page 4  No Title
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 21The couple, both in their 70's, shuffled tentatively to the entrance, asked whether they could look around and were handed a piece of paper by massive, bearded and shirtless gatekeeper.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I should like to present some unmentioned but vital aspects of strip mining in response to your Aug. 6 editorial SemiStrip Mining.

title: Israel Assails Soviet
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 21Israel said yesterday that the new Soviet exitvisa levies smacked of the dark ages. After the weekly Cabinet meeting in Jerusalem the Government said that fixing ransom prices for human beings evokes the memory of the dark middle ages.

title: ITEL ANNOUNCES COMPUTER ITEMS
description: The Itel Corporation announced yesterday that it had developed two new products that will enable computer users to increase the efficiency of the virtual memory capability announced recently by the International Business Machines Corporation for its System 370 computers.

title: 3 Radio Stations Sold
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 21 (UPI) Sheridan Broadcasting Corporation, a blackowned Pittsburgh company, has announced the purchase of three radio stations in Boston, Pittsburgh and Buffalo, for a reported $2million. The three stations were acquired from Dynamic Broadcasting, Inc. The stations are WAMO in Pittsburgh, WILD in Boston, and WUFO in Buffalo.

title: DAVID A. WOODCOCK
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Aug. 21 David Avery Woodcock, former New York lawyer, specializing in patents and trademarks, died today in Norwalk Hospital. He was 80 years old and lived here.

title: Jubilant G.O.P. Delegates Show Mood of Confidence
McGovern Trails, But Will Win State, Wagner Declares
description: SYRACUSE, Aug. 21Conceding that Senator George McGovern, the Democratic Presidential candidate, is behind at this point in New York State, former New York City Mayor Robert F. Wagner predicted he would come up fast by November and carry the state.

title: GROUP TO BUY STOCK IN ATLANTIC STORES
description: An investment group headed by Sydney Mittleman agreed yesterday to purchase one million shares, or twothirds of the outstanding common stock, of Atlantic Department Stores! from Heck's, Inc., which had acquired the stock last March 22 through an exchange offer on the basis of 0.225 of a common share of Heck's for each Atlantic share.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The recent letter by Thomas G. Rieke asserting that money spent on Reserve armed forces is wasteful and should be eliminated is so onesided that a reply is demanded. Not all Reserve units can claim to be highly effective militarily or monetarily, but I do believe that funds expended on Reserve forces can be money well spent.

title: FRANKLIN LOSES MENTAL AID UNIT
description: The mental health board of Franklin County has been removed by the County Legislature in a running dispute over the organization of services for this rural community in the northeastern area of the state.

title: MICHAEL X DOOMED IN TRINIDAD MURDER
description: PORT OF SPAIN, Trinidad, Aug. 21 (Reuters)  Michael Abdul Malik, also known as Michael X, a former black power leader in Britain, was sentenced to death by hanging here today.

title: Kenyan Aide Warns Asians They May Face Expulsion
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Aug. 21 (AP)Kenya's deputy Home Affairs Minister, Martin Shikuku, warned today that noncitizens will have to leave Kenya unless they stop sabotaging our economy.

title: Nixon Far Ahead in Survey Of New York Tristate Area
description: President Nixon holds comminding midsummer leads over Senator George McGovern in New York, New Jersey, Connecticut and six other major states, according to the first, measures of next November's electoral vote.

title: Laird Is Planning a Tour Of Coast Plants and Bases
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (AP) The Pentagon announced today that Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird would visit defense installations in California this week on what was described as a combined vacation and business trip.

title: IUAN MANUEL GALVEZ OF HONDURAS IS DEAD
description: TEGUCIGALPA, Honduras, Aug. 20 (AP)  Juan Manuel Galvez, President of Honduras from 1949 to 1954 and a power in the ruling National party, died Saturday night of a cerebral hemorrhage. He was 85 years old.

title: Chinese Castigate Lin Piao By Name for the First Time
description: TOKYO, Aug. 21 (UPI) A high Chinese official castigated the former Defense Minister, Lin Piao, by name yesterday for the first time, the Kyodo news agency said today in a dispatch from Peking.

title: Business Briefs
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 21 (UPI)Seven of the West's major petroleum companies worked out final details today for granting concessions to five Middle East Governments in order to avert a world oil supply crisis.

title: Short Interest Rises on the Big Board
Bankruptcy Referee Backs Astrodata's Creditor Plan
description: Astrodata Inc., Anaheim, Calif., which has been in proceedings under Chapter XI of the Bankruptcy Act since December, 1970, said yesterday that a bankruptcy court had confirmed its plan for an arrangement with its creditors.

title: To Our Readers
description: A work stoppage by the Mailers Union made it impossible to publish yesterday's issue of The New York Times, although the press runs had been started for both the City and Late City Editions.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: We met, FitzGreene Halleck and I, in Central Park by a bench in the long wide alley leading from the Mall.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., Aug. 21Pat Du Pre of Birmingham, Ala., the national junior champion, led the field into the third round of the Eastern junior and boys tennis championships today. He defeated Peter Simel of Roslyn, L.I., 61, 60, at the Port Washington Tennis Academy.

title: WIRE CHIEF WINS AT ATLANTIC CITY
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Aug, 21 (UPI)  Wire Chief overcame slow start today at Atlantic City to win the $22,800 Miss America Handicap for fillies and mares at seven furlongs.

title: Stage: English Festival
description: CHICHESTER, England The pleasures of Chichester are not entirely theatrical. Although its theater festival which runs each year from the beginning of May through the first week in September  has put Chichester on the international map, and vastly Improved the quality of its hotel accommodations and restaurants, Chichester itself is an ideal town for tourists to visit. It is a mediumsized English market town of typical. southern counties charm.

title: Last of Orbiting Observatory Satellites, The Copernicus, Launched From Florida
description: An American spacecraft honoring Copernicus was launched into an orbit of the earth yesterday to observe interstellar gases, young hot stars, Xray stars and other phenomena never dreamt of by the Polish monk, the father of modern astronomy.

title: U.S. DISCOURAGING HINTS OF SUCCESS AT PEACE PARLEY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug, 21The Nixon Administration sought today to discourage speculation that a breakthrough in the Vietnam negotiations had been achieved or was imminent.

title: Subway Watchdog Unit Member Says Group Lacks Power for Job
description: A member of the city's dormant Subway Service Watchdog Commission accused the Lindsay administration yesterday of allowing it to fade into nonexistence.

title: Bhutan's New King to Open Door a Bit
description: THTMBU, Bhutan, Aug. 21 (Reuters)The new King of Bhutan, Jigme Singhl Wangchuk, says he intends to open his remote Himalayan country to the world only gradually.

title: Stanford Heart Transplant
description: STANFORD, Calif., Aug. 21 (AP)A 47yearold man was reported in satisfactory condition today after becoming the 47th heart transplant recipient at Stanford University Hospital, a hospital spokesman said. He said both the man and the family of the donor requested anonymity.

title: Seeley Feels Sad About Roofer's Job After Garden Bout
description: Even should Walter Seeley beat Jose Fernandez in their North American junior lightweight title bout at Madison Square Garden Monday night, the packagesized Long Island roofer will be thinking of Tuesday morning with regret.

title: PARAGUAY HOLDS UP MAN'S EXTRADITION
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21A State Department official said today that the extradition from Paraguay of Auguste Joseph Ricord, who is wanted in New York on narcotics charges, had been unexpectedly delayed.

title: Graebner Loses in Upset, Wife Wins in Same Manner
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., Aug. 21Three New Yorkers, Clark and Carole Graebner and Herb, FitzGibbon, were involved in major upsets today in the opening matches of the 46th Eastern grasscourts open tennis tournament at the Orange Lawn, Tennis Club.

title: City Council Hearings Scheduled For Today
description: Following are public hearings scheduled for today by City Council Committees.

title: Patrolman Killed in Car Crash
description: NORWALK, Conn., Aug. 21An offduty patrolman was fatally injured yesterday morning when the car he was driving struck two trees a short distance from his parents home on Center Avenue here. Patrolman George Kitchens, 27 years old, of Slocum Street, married and the father of two children, died two hours later at Norwalk Hospital. A witness said the car appeared to be driven at high speed.

title: STOCKS ARE EXED AS TRADING SLOWS
description: The stock market's modest advance on Friday after three consecutive sessions of losses slowed yesterday as prices finished mixed in reduced trading.

title: Arthur Daley
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 21The clipped Britiish accents seemed to give his words an extra emphasis. They were spoken by a London member of his Olympic delegation after the National Olympic Committees Africa had filed a formal protest with the International Olympic Committee over the continuance of Rhodesia's entry in the world's foremost sport spectacle a few days hence.

title: ShortTerm Rates Seem To Be Starting Long Rise
description: Shortterm interest rates !seem to have finally begun the gradual and extended climb that has long been expected. The apparent force behind it is a less expansive Federal Reserve credit policy.

title: Mayer Foundation Grants $150,000 for Film History
description: The American Film Institute has received a $150,000 grant from the Louis B. Mayer Foundation to continue its threeyearold program of research on American film history. It was the second such grant by the foundation.

title: John Huston Set to Direct And Act in Catholics
description: John Huston will direct and have a leading role in Catholics, a film adaptation of the forthcoming novella by Brian Moore. The book is described as a dramatic Illumination of the turmoil in modern day religion. It will be published in England in October and in the United States in January by Holt, Rinehart & Winston.

title: Hogan Scorns vanden Heuvel's Attack
description: District Attorney Frank S. Hogan rebuked the chairman of the city's Board of Correction yesterday for suggesting that Governor Rockefeller supersede him in the prosecution of two inmates accused of leading an uprising at the Manhattan House of Detention for Men in 1970.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: HAVERFORD, Pa., Aug. 21. Mal Anderson of Australia, who won the United States title in 1957, survived two match points in one of the dramatic matches marking the opening of the $15,000 73d annual Pennsylvania lawn ten nis championships today at Merion Cricket Club.

title: Man Slain After Argument
description: A man allegedly stabbed neighbor to death early yesterday after an argument near the corner of 100th Street and West End Avenue, the police said. The suspect, Gregory Dilligard, 22 years old, of 304 West 99th Street, was arrested near the corner at about A.M., shortly after the incident occurred, the police said. They identified the victim as Tyrone Hughes, 29, of the same address.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 21 (UPI)The president of the Chicago Cougars said today that a lawsuit filed by the Chicago Black Hawks to block Bobby Hull from playing in the World Hockey Association was an immoral move against hockey fans.

title: Thomas S. Brown, Officer Of American Distilling, Dies
description: Thomas S. Brown, senior vice president of the American Distilling Company, died here Sunday. He was 72 years old and lived at 270 Bronxville Road, Bronxville, N. Y.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Aficionados of turnpikes ought to come over to Fifth Avenue in the mornings where there's nostop traveling from 110th Street to Washington Square for trailertrucksize buses coming from all over New York City. I counted fourteen of them between 7:26 and 7:31 A.M. Tuesday, and the noise was terrific. [Editorial July 18.]

title: 3 Found Slain Near Jamaica Bay After Police Get Anonymous Call
description: The bodies of three men who, had been shot to death were found late last night on Cross; Bay Boulevard a few hundred yards south of Howard Beach, Queens.

title: M'GOVERN REJECTS AID OF ARAB GROUP
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (Reuter)Senator George McGovern repudiated yesterday any support from the Action Committee on AmericanArab Relations, saying that the group's endorsement of him Saturday was a cynical attempt to harm him and to win votes for President Nixon.

title: Missouri Pacific Pursues Effort to Block Merger
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (AP) The Missouri Pacific Railroad asked Supreme Court Justice Harry A. Blackmun today to stay enforcement of the Interstate Commerce Commission's orders authorizing the merger of the Illinois Central Railroad and the Gulf, Mobile & Ohio Railroad. There was no immediate action by Justice Blackmun.

title: Dr. Howard Marshall Dies; Led Vassar Economics Unit
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y., Aug. 21A funeral service for Dr. Howard Drake Marshall, professor of economics and chairman of the economics department at Vassar College, was held today in Pleasant Valley Presbyterian Church. Dr. Marshall died Aug. 15 of a heart attack at his summer home in Port Wing, Wis. His age was 48.

title: Elegant Restaurant Fights for Success in a Coal Town
description: WILLIAMSON, W. Va. Sandwiched between Nelson's Women's Apparel and Caplan's Furniture Store on the main street of this rather depressing coal town is a stepchild of the war on poverty, a carpeted cave of restaurant called the Lock, Stock and Barrel.

title: 1976 Outlook: Delegates, Sure of Victory in Fall, Eye Hopefuls
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 21Since nearly all of the Republican politiciansand many of the hangerson as wellhave concluded that the reelection of President Nixon this fall is only slightly less certain than this renomination here tomorrow, the natural thing is for everyone to gossip about whom the Republicans might nominate four years hence. Thus, as the convention opened, the corridors, the bars and the newspapers were full of talk about the 1976 ticket. It beats speculating about what John Wayne might have to say in his encomium on Mr. Nixon, and it provides a certain desultory interest, like batting averages in the off season.

title: Music Programs Clash on 62d St. And Discord is the Only Harmony
description: Charles Ives might have loved it, Leonard Bernstein and Richard Rodgers would certainly have hated it, and the hapless performers caught in the middle are probably still wondering how it could have happened.

title: West Germany Fretting
description: BONN, Aug. 21 (AP)Chancellor Willy Brandt's Government made a fresh appeal to Olympic organizers today to solve the dispute over Rhodesian participation.

title: 47 LOST AS TANKERS COLLIDE OFF AFRICA
description: CAPETOWN, Aug. 21 (Reuters;)  Harbor officials said they believed 47 members of the 50man crew of a tanker, the. Texanita, died today in collision with another tanker.

title: Bridge: Opponents'
description: Unlike chess, which is 99 per cent technique, bridge is a game in which psychology and morale play major roles. It is proper, and indeed essential, to pick up clues from one's opponent's behavior  although not one's partner.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: DOVER, England, Aug. 21 (AP)  Richard Hart, United States Army lieutenant, has set a record for swimming the English Channel from England to France, the Channel Swimming Association ruled today.

title: SAIGON REGROUPS AFTER QUESON LOSS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Aug. 22Badly mauled South Vietnamese troops tried to rally yesterday to stem a North Vietnamese advance, after abandoning a northern district capital and its adjacent defense base to the Communists over the weekend.

title: President Visits Mrs. Eisenhower
description: GETTYSBURG, Pa., Aug. 21 (AP)President Nixon visited today Mrs. Dwight D. Eisenhower, widow of the President with whom he served eight years as Vice President.

title: Mt. Vernon Backs Peace Plant
description: MOUNT VERNON, N. Y., Aug. 21The Republican controlled City Council here has passed a resolution asking PreSident Nixon and the city's representatives in Congress to continue their efforts for an early withdrawal of all American forces from Vietnam. The resolution, requested by the Mount Vernon Women for Peace, was adopted unanimously by the four Republicans and one Democrat on the board.

title: I.O.C. Elects Tomorrow
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 21 (Reuters)  Avery Brundage's successor as president of the International Olympic Committee will be announced Wednesday, an I.O.C. spokesman said today.

title: LYLESTYLE BUNT MOTIVATES YANKS
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 21  The Yankees arrived in Chicago today with their new secret weapon primed and prepared to shoot down the high flying. White Sox.

title: Advertising:
description: When it comes to marketing television sets, manufacturers have to reach three levels: distributors, dealers and consumers. And traditionally, manufacturers have relied on their distributors to promote to the dealers, while urging the dealers to reach out to their customers.

title: Schiller Now Quits Seats But Stays in Brandt Party
description: BONN, Aug. 21 (UPI)Karl Schiller, who resigned as Minister of Economics and Finance last month, gave up his seats on the board and the executive council of Chancellor Willy Brandt's Social Democratic party today, the party announced.

title: Unity Among Blacks
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 21John Smith could not remember the name or country of the black African athlete walking toward him in the Olympic Village, but he recognized the face from another time and place in track and field.

title: S.I. Cycle Gang Is Angry Over RockFestival Melee
description: At their bombedout clubhouse and garage on Jersey Street in New Brighton, S. I., yesterday, members of the Breed tinkered sullenly with their motorcycles.

title: Trade Fair Opens
description: PEKING, Aug. 21 (UPI)A $3million Canadian trade fair with exhibits ranging from a logging machine and snowmobiles to cures for hog diseases was opened by External Affairs Minister Mitchell W. Sharp today.

title: 70 JAILED IN CHILE IN 24HOUR STRIKE
description: SANTIAGO, Chile. Aug. 21 (UPI)  The police arrested more than 70 people today in clashes with antiGovernment demonstrators who sought to block federal inspectors from forcing open retail establishments that had closed in a 24hour protest strike.

title: Fog Over Tax Reform
description: The platform promises tax reform but gives no hint of its nature. It endorses the Administration's health insurance proposals and condemns universal compulsory health insurance. As expected, the platform not only endorses the Administration's antibusing bill, which undermines the independent authority of the judiciary to interpret the Constitution, but also promises a constitutional amendment if the bill fails. There could hardly be a more egregious example of political overkill.

title: MILLS STRESSES REFORM OF TAXES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (Renter)Representative Wilbur D. Mills, Democrat of Arkansas, who is the leading tax writer, in Congress, said today that he planned to make tax reform his first order of business in the next Congress.

title: Warning by Kahane
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 21 (Reuters)Rabbi Meir Kahane, head of the militant Jewish Defense League, warned today that members in the United States would kidnap Soviet diplomats and hold them for ransom if the Soviet Union did not abandon within one month its exit fees on Jewish intellectuals seeking to come to Israel.

title: REXENE CO. RAISES PRICES FOR RESIN
description: A price Increase on low density polyethylene resin ranging from 0.3 cent to 2.2 cents a pound was announced yesterday by the Rexene Polymers Company, a division of Dart Industries.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Twentyfour patients and two employes of Trenton Psychiatric Hospital remained stricken with a form of diarrhea, which, officials believed, caused the death of 51yearold inmate over the weekend. Albert Fulling, spokesman for the State Department of Institutions and Agencies, said that teams of health officials from various state agencies, including his own, were awaiting results of cultures taken from stricken patients and several unaffected food handlers at the hospital to determine the cause of the illness.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: DO YOU KNOW ANT IMPORTANT MAN IN BUSINESS WIN) DOES NOT READ FORBES MAGAZINE?  ADVT.

title: IN THE NATION
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 21No American political party has been more confident since the Republicans went forth to elect Tom Dewey in 1948. Not even Lyndon Johnson's Democrats in 1964 were more certain they had made than Is the party of Richard Nixon and Spiro T. Agnew in 1972. Yet, an air of incongruity hangs over this convention; something funny going on here.

title: 5 Big Retail Chains Expand Profits As City Stores Co. Narrows Loss
description: Six of the country's largest retail chains yesterday reported improved results in both net income and sales for the quarter ended in July compared with yearearlier levels.

title: Hundreds Attend the Funeral of Boy Shot to Death on S.I. by a Policeman
description: Nearly 200 mourners jammed into the small, twostory Mount Calvary Holy Pentecostal Church yesterday for the funeral of a 10yearold Staten Island youth shot last week by a policeman.

title: Soviet Dance Tour Shifted
description: The Russian Beryozka Dance Company, which was originally scheduled to open a tour of the United States with three performances at Carnegie Hall, will, instead, play a twoweek engagement at the City Center beginning Sept. 19. The Ballet Contemporaneo de Buenos Aires, which had been announced for this period at the City Center, will not appear. Tickets purchased for the Ballet Contemporaneo may be exchanged at the City Center box office.

title: Market Place: A Big Guy Has His Woes, Too
description: Stanley Wynett believed that it was next to impossible for the Little Guy to get good investment management in Wall Street.

title: Olympics Boycott?
description: Memories are still vivid of the 1936 Olympics in Berlin when Adolf Hitler ruled Germany and the brilliant performances of black American athletes supplied a wellmerited rebuff to the Nazi racist fantasies of those days. Now the 1972 Olympics are about to begin in Munich and the issue of racism has emerged again, but in sharply different form. Today, most African countriessupported by some black athletes from the United States and various Caribbean nationsare threatening to boycott this year's games if Rhodesia is allowed to participate. Their threat is undiminished by the fact that Rhodesia has sent a squad including black as well as white athletes, and has agreed to abide by the polite fiction that it is still Southern Rhodesia, a member the British Commonwealth.

title: Gay Activists in Protest Occupy McGovern Office
description: Senator George McGovern's New York campaign headquarters was occupied yesterday by about 30 members of the Gay Activists Alliance, The Associated Press reported.

title: Drahomir bolder, A Successor To Dubcek in 1968, Dies at 46
description: VIENNA, Aug. 20 (AP)Drahomir Kolder, a member of the Czechoslovak Communist party's Central Committee and minister chairman of the Committee of People's Control, died Sunday after a long illness, according to the news agency K.T.K. He was 46 years old.

title: Cook United, Inc., Appoints
description: James Williamson Jr., vice presidentfinance, of Cook United, Inc., has been named to the newly created post of executive (vice president.

title: Front Page 3  No Title
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 21Two miles from the radical headquarters in Flamingo Park, on another ballfield in another part of town, some 3,000 young men and women have been quietly mobilizing their energies to achieve precisely the result the radicals fear: the reelection of President Nixon.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Stunned Uganda Asians: From Prosperity to Despair
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Aug. 21Along Kampala Road the theaters with Indian films were empty today. There were few rummy and mahjongg games in the hilltop suburbs of Kololo and Buglobi. The golf course and cricket fields near the Nakasero club were silent.

title: Air Guard General In Alabama Quits; Charges Dropped
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Aug. 21  Federal criminal charges against Maj. Gen. G. Reid Doster, the commander of the Alabama Air National Guard. were dropped today when the officer agreed to resign.

title: She's a Triple Threat Who Feels at Home in the World
description: NICE, France  The socialites, the magnates and the film stars are here as usual. But the big celebrity at Nice this season is the new United States consul.

title: Riva Ridge Suspected of Being Under the Influence of Drug in Monmouth Loss
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS. N.Y., Aug. 21Riva Ridge, the star 3yearold of the Meadow Stable, winner of the Kentucky Derby and Belmont Stakes, was under the effects of a tranquilizer when he ran fourth in the Monmouth Invitational at Monmouth Park on Aug. 5, Mrs. John (Penny) Tweedy, who manages the Meadow Stable, said today.

title: U.S. COURT UPHOLDS SCHOOL INTEGRATION
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 21 (UPI)The United States Court of Appeals for the Eighth Circuit today upheld desegregation plans for the fourth and fifth grades in the Little Rock, Ark., school, district, but rejected a proposal for the first three elementary grades in two sections of the city on the grounds it failed to meet constitutional standards.

title: Soviet Jews Monthly Departure Rate Reported at 2,500 Despite Slackening
description: MOSCOW. Aug. 21Wellplaced Western diplomats report that the flow of Jewish emigration to Israel is continuing at the rate of 2,500 people a month.

title: For the Proud Parents of 18, Happiness Is a Large Family
description: MELROSE, N. Y.Dominick and Margaret Denio are the parents of Tom, Dom, Bill, Terese, John, Mary, Mat, Annie, Rosy, Ellen, Paul, Martha, Mary, Michael, Patty, Stephen, Beth and Robert. Eighteen children in all, ranging in age from 22 years to 5 months. No multiple births. The Denios have been married for 23 years.

title: MRS. RUTH SCHWARTZ
description: Mrs. Ruth Blum Schwartz, president of the Seymour Blum Advertising Agency, 25 West 45th Street, died Saturday of a heart ailment at Hackensack (N. J.) Hospital. She was 59 years old and a resident of Fort Lee, N. J.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: On July 5 The Times carried a letter from S. David Leibowitt criticizing Senator McGovern for his cosponsorship of Senate bill 3378. One of the provisions of this legislation makes a charitable bequest deductible for estate tax purposes only if it is to be used predominantly within the United States or its possessions.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 21The White House said today that Henry A. Kissinger had no !plans to meet with an envoy from Egypt if Mr. Kissinger attended the Olympics.

title: CHINA AND CANADA WILL WIDEN TIES
description: PEKING, Aug. 21Canada's relations with China have taken a major step forward with the announcement that the two countries have agreed to a wide range of cultural, scientific and other exchanges.

title: The Republican Platform
description: The Republican party platform is a massive document which contains not only the usual highly selective version of recent history and the usual partisan selfpraise, but also some unusual internal contradictions. Thus, it reaches out for the support of moderate Democrats opposed to Senator George McGovern while also making a thoroughgoing attack from a conservative Republicanstandpoint on the programs and philosophy of the Democratic party, and especially on the record of President Lyndon Johnson. It defends the erratic and adventurist record of the Nixon Administration in bland, selfrighteous language without ever acknowledging how much of that record consists of borrowed liberal Democratic ideas or warmedover policies of previous Democratic Administrations. It is as if Representative John Rhodes of Arizona, the resolutions committee chairman, and other party stalwarts had favored, and maybe even foreseen, four years ago, the imposition of wageprice controls, the devaluation of the dollar, huge budget deficits, the Nixon welfare reform plan, the withdrawal of support for Nationalist China, the arms control and grain deals with the Soviet Union, and all the other examples of Mr. Nixon's zigzag approach to public

title: MALCOLM WARNS OF JAIL CROWDING
description: With overcrowding in city prisons nearing a record level, Benjamin J. Malcolm, Commissioner of Correction, said yesterday that the situation had reached a crisis level and blamed our sluggish judicial system.

title: 2 Men Rob a Chelsea Hotel, Injure a Tenant and Escape
description: Two armed men robbed a Chelsea hotel of $140 and injured a hotel resident early yesterday, the police of the East 21st Street station reported.

title: Italy Sells and Sends Tanks And Armored Cars to Libya
description: SPEZIA, Italy, Aug. 21 (AP) Military authorities said today that Italy had sold and shipped armored cars and tanks to Libya from this northern port on Friday. They declined to comment on reports that the shipment had included 113 Americandesigned armored personnel carriers that the Italian Army had used for years and that they were the first under a bigger contract.

title: Tax Court Judge Named
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (UPI) President Nixon nominated Darrell D. Wiles of St. Louis today to he a judge of the United States Tax Court for a 15year term. Mr. Wiles, 57 years old, a partner in the St. Louis law firm of Wiles & Gillum, succeeds Graydon G. Withey, who retired June 1.

title: Man Stabbed to Death
description: A 41year old Manhattan man was stabbed to death by an unknown assailant at 94th Street and Broadway shortly before 10 P.M. Sunday, the police of the West 100th Street station reported. The man, identified as Lloyd Crider of the St. James Hotel at 46th Street and Avenue of the Americas, was declared dead on arrival at St. Luke's Hospital of multiple stab wounds of the chest.

title: 2 Commit First Holdup In Capital of Majorca
description: PALMA, Majorca, Aug. 21 Reuters)  The first armed robbery in this island capital's history was committed over the weekend by two men, armed with pistols, who robbed a lottery vendor's shop of nearly $3,750, the police reported today.

title: Ineligible Candidate on Ballot
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Aug. 21 (UPI)The name of Linda Jenness, Socialist Workers Party candidate appears on samples of the Ohio Presidential ballot distributed today by Secretary of State Ted W. Brown, despite the fact that Mr. Brown ruled her off the ballot. Mr. Brown said Miss Jenness and her running mate, Andrew Pulley, could not be on the ballot because they did not comply with age requirements.

title: Russell Made Tackle
description: In a caption describing action during Saturday's FalconsSteelers exhibition football game at Atlanta, it was erroneously reported that Andy Russell of the Steelers was tackled by Jim Butler. The reverse was true.

title: Report Kissinger Will Meet Sadat Aide Denied by U.S.
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 21 (AP)The newspaper An Nahar has reported that Henry A. Kissinger, President Nixon's adviser on national security, will meet in Munich next month with an adviser of President Anwar elSadat of Egypt.

title: Wisconsin Town Thrilled by 20Million Bequest to Its Hospital
description: WOODRUFF, Wis., Aug. 21In this tiny community of 500 people in northern Wisconsin, S. Howard Young was known as a wealthy New York art dealer who entertained such notables as the former President, Dwight D. Eisenhower, at his nearby summer home.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21Adoption by the platform committee at the Republican National Convention of plank urging the right of private ownership of gold unlikely to lead to an early change in the Treasury's opposition to such a plan, in the view of observers here.

title: World Soccer Group Bars Teams From Games in China
description: PARIS, Aug. 21 (Reuters)The executive committee of the Federal International Football Association (FIFA) today reversed its position on letting its members play in South Africa, which is not a FIFA member, and ruled out games against China.

title: COLTS CONQUER CHIEFS, 23 TO 17
description: KANSAS CITY, Aug. 21 (UPI) Baltimore's first touchdown of the season, a 16yard run with a fumble recovery by Ray May, a linebacker, spurred the Colts to a 23.17 victory tonight over the Kansas City Chiefs in an exhibition game.

title: ROGER FURSE DIES; STAGE DESIGNER
description: Roger Furse, the British stage and screen designer, died Saturday at his home on the island of Corfu in Greece, according to word received by friends here. He was 68 years old.

title: BLESSING ANGELICA SCORES BY NECK
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 21  Eddie Belmonte gave a fine exhibition of riding in guiding Blessing Angelica of the Hobeau Farm to success in the $27,700 Diana Handicap today. The race, run for the 34th time, was for fillies and mares at 1 miles, and Belmonte steered Blessing Angelica to a neck triumph over Light Hearted of the Christina Stable.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: ATHENS, Aug. 21 (AP)Authorities said today that seven of the 18 crewmen on the Suzi, a 2,800ton Greek cargo ship that sank in heavy seas off Albania yesterday, had been found alive on a raft, eight bodies had been recovered and that the three other crewmen were missing.

title: Albany Frees $275,000 For FloodDamage Study
description: ALBANY, Aug. 21 (AP) Governor Rockefeller and the Legislature's Republican leaders freed $275,000 from the Governmental Emergency Fund today to pay for a study of the impact of the flood damage on property assessments in stricken areas.

title: Magazine Gets an Injunction On Puerto Rican Protesters
description: A Manhattan Supreme Court justice yesterday granted temporary injunction to New York magazine, barring a group of young LatinAmerican writers from interfering with the operations of the periodical.

title: Feminists Shifting Emphasis From Persons to Politics
description: The women's liberation movement  a massive behavioral revolution aimed at overturning the very structures of a maledominated societyhas entered a new stage of development. It is now concentrating its energies on legislative lobbying and politics.

title: 2 Soviet Musicians Given Political Asylum in Mexico
description: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 21 (AP) Two members of the Leningrad Music Hall orchestra have defected and been granted political asylum in Mexico, the government announced tonight.

title: Bremer, in Prison, Is 22
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 21 (UPI) Arthur Herman Bremer, convicted assailant of Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama, marked his 22d birthday today at the Maryland Penitentiary. Bremer, convicted in a Maryland court two weeks ago of assault with intent to murder and lesser charges, was sentenced to 63 years in prison.

title: U.S. SIGNS REPORT ON TRADE REFORM
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (Reuters)  President Nixon's chief trade negotiator, William D. Eberle, said today he had signed the majority report of the Rey Committee on Trade Reform, although he had expressed reservations in an accompanying letter.

title: Business Briefs
description: TOKYO, Aug. 21 (AP)The Ministry of International Trade and Industry and electricpower companies agreed today to pay $320million to the United States for processing uranium for nuclear fuel, the Kyodo News Service said.

title: Personalities: No.1 With Celtics
description: With the signing of Paul Westphal of Southern California, the Boston Celtics, one of the two charter members of the National Basketball Association still playing in their original cities (New York is the other), maintained their record yesterday of never having missed signing a firstround draft pick. The signing of Westphal, a 6foot4inch backcourt man, to a multipleyear contract made him the 27th consecutive top choice Boston has signed.

title: Strip Mining of Coal Shows Drop in West Virginia
description: ELKINS, W. Va., Aug. 21Jimmy Polino, president of the Douglas Coal Company, is trying to find a buyer for two 10cubicyard draglines, which are dredging machines used in strip mining.

title: MET LISTS OPERAS OF FIRST 2 WEEKS
description: Tickets for the first two weeks of the 197273 Metropolitan Opera season will go on sale at the company's Lincoln Center box office on Sept. 5, two weeks before the opening of the season on Sept. 19.

title: Giants'
description: The New York Giants spent their day off yesterday contemplating positives from their separate points of view and they displayed a large collection of them in Sunday's 3131 tie with the Jets in the Yale Bowl.

title: Mexico Senior Netmen Win In Doubles, Lead Sweden
description: Mexico won the doubles match yesterday and gained 21 lead over Sweden in the international senior team tennis elimination final for the Stevens Cup at the Town Tennis Club.

title: ABROAD AT HOME
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 20The man who will shortly be renominated for President has done many significant things in his first term of office. But in a way his most remarkable achievement has been in the Vietnam war: He has taken a national mistake and made it an obsession.

title: Convicts Die in Trieste Fire
description: TRIESTE, Italy, Monday, Aug. 21 (UPI)Prisoners rioted and set fires in the Trieste city jail last night and at least two of them died in the flames, offiicals reported. They said the prisoners had been trapped between piles of blazing mattresses and furniture and the steel doors of a cell block that were closed to quell the riot. The police said early today they had the situation under control.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Rose at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21Yields on United Slates Treasury bills rose in the Government's weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: 87 New Vessels Welcomed in 6 Months, With Only 2 Designed for Passengers
description: The Port of New York during the first half of this year rolled out the welcome mat 87 times to greet new vessels.

title: U.N. Violation Hinted
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 21 (UPI)The Security Council's sanctions committee told West Germany today that the presence of the Rhodesian Olympic team in Munich might violate the Council's resolutions of 1968.

title: EqualRights Proposal Approved by 20 States
description: The proposed Equal Rights Amendment, which would prohibit discrimination based on sex by any law or government action, was approved by Congress last March and is now being considered by many state legislatures. Ratification by 38 states is required to amend the Constitution.

title: Jewish Veterans Fill Post
description: BOSTON, Aug. 21 (AP)Norman D. Tilles of Providence, R.I.was named national commander of the Jewish War Veterans of the U.S.A. during the final session of the organizations 77th annual. convention here yesterday. It was the first time that the convention was held in Texas since the organization was formed in New York in 1896. Titles served as a radar intelligence specialist with the Eizhth Air Force.

title: ACQUISITION SET BY FIDELITY UNION
description: The Fidelity Union Bancorporation, one of New Jersey's largest bank holding companies, yesterday offered to pay $17.9million in cash for the Suburban Trust Company, Westfield, N. J. Acquisition of the $113million Westfield bank, if approved and consummated, would push the assets of the Newarkbased bank holding company well over the $lKillion mark. Close relationships already exist between Fidelity Union and Suburban Trust. Robert S. Corbin. chairman and a major stockholder of Suburban Trust, of the Newarkbased bank holding company well over the $lKillion mark. Close relationships already exist between Fidelity Union and Suburban Trust. Robert S. Corbin. chairman and a major stockholder of Suburban Trust, also a director and major stockholder of Fidelity Union. In addition, Mr. Corbin's late father, Horace K. Corbin, was chairman of Fidelity Union.

title: July Orders for Durables Fell From June's Record
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21Influenced for the second consecutive month by the volatile sector of defense orders, new orders for durable goods fell back in July from June's record, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: DialaRide Provides LowFare Taxi Service for Elderly and Handicapped
description: The older you get, Mrs. James McGeechan said the other day, the tougher it is getting around  which may be why she says that DialaRide is one of the best things to happen to the Bronx in years.

title: BID OVERSUBSCRIBED! ON KINGS LAFAYETTE!
description: A tender offer by international financier Edmond J. Safra for twothirds control of the Kings Lafayette Corporation has been oversubscribed, Herman E. Cooper, Mr. Safra's lawyer, said last night. The offer, which was announced Aug. S. ended yesterday.

title: BRANDO FILM OPENS FESTIVAL ON SEPT. 29
description: A new Marlon Brando film made in Europe is among the first seven international features selected for showing at the 10th annual New York Film Festival, starting Sept. 29 at Alice Tully Hall. The initial group of movies represents the United States, France, Hungary, India and Japan.

title: Advertising:
description: There's going to be a threehour program starring Jerry Lucas on the American Broadcasting Company television network on the Friday morning after Thanksgiving. And there's going to be a single sponsor for that program: the Ideal Toy Corporation, with a whopping 72 spots on this first day of the official Christmas toybuying season.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: 2 States List Deer Dates
description: Summer's waning is implicit in the announcement of the 1972 deer hunting season in Maine and New Hampshire.

title: Case Asks Wider Coverage For Recipients of Medicaid
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (AP) Senator Clifford P. Case, Republican of New Jersey, said today the Social Security Administration was reviewing legislative proposals to prevent Medicaid recipient cutbacks scheduled to take place Oct. after a 20 per cent increase in Social Security payments.

title: I. R. A. Blows Up Belfast Shop After Blast at Catholic Church
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 21The Irish Republican Army blew up a paint store here today, apparently in retaliation for the bombing of Roman Catholic church yesterday.

title: Europe Radio Funds Set
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (Reuters)  President Nixon signed legislation today authorizing $38.5million to finance the operation of Radio Free Europe and Radio Liberty during the current financial year ending next June 30. The stations broadcast to Eastern Europe and the Soviet Union from Munich.

title: Stan Shaw, 64, Originated Milkman's Matinee Show
description: Stanley W. Shaw, a retired radio and television announcer who as Stan Shaw originated the Milkman's Matinee show on station WNEW in 1935, died last Wednesday in the Newton (N.J.) Memorial Hospital. He was 64 years old and lived on Mixim Drive in Hopatcong, N.J.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21Republican riddles, instantly solved:

title: Fischer and Spassky Draw 16th Game of Title Match
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Aug. 21  Boris Spassky and Bobby Fischer played to a 60move draw yesterday in the 16th game of the world championship chess match.

title: N.L.R.B. Director Retiring
description: The National Labor Relations Board announced yesterday] that Ivan C. McLeod, director of the New York region for 15 years, would retire Aug. 31. Mr. McLeod, who in 1957 became the first black to head an N.L.R.B. region, has reached the Federal Government's mandatory retirement age of 70. He: plans to continue working as a labor arbitrator.

title: General Telephone Plans Share Offering in Japan
description: TOKYO. Aug. 21The General Telephone and Electronics Corporation has applied to sell its common stock on the Tokyo Stock Exchange  the first time a foreign corporation has made such an applicationthe Nikko Securities Company Ltd. announced today.

title: MRS. ABRAHAM LIPTON
description: EAST ORANGE, N. J., Aug. 20 Mrs. Ida Abramowitz Lipton, cofounder with her husband, Abraham, of Lipton's Department Store in Bloomfield, died today at their home, 32 South Munn Avenue. She was 79 years old.

title: Both Players Appeared Content to Split a Point
description: The 16th game of the world chess championship match between Bobby Fischer and Boris Spassky on Sunday was devoid of excitement. Judging from the choice of the opening moves, both players seemed content to play for a draw.

title: U.S. Loses Land Rights in Philippines
description: MANILA, Aug. 21 (AP)American citizensindividuals or corporationscannot legally and solely own private residential properties and business enterprises in the Philippines after July 3, 1974, Supreme Court Justice Fred Rutz Castro said today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The issue with the Eagleton affair is really just how constructive should the New Politics be? If the public insists on complete disclosure and full rationalization, why doesn't McGovern respond by announcing his Cabinet choices at this time? It would be exciting to know just who is going to manage each of the new programs. Such a tactic would surely serve to bring some of the Democrats back together. Everyone should prefer a Cabinet of potential Vice Presidents to one of mere Secretaries.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your editorial ["The Real Issue, July 31] purports to rely on an article by Professor Alexander M. Bickel, but it misreads that article. Professor Bickel does not contend, as you do, that the war in Vietnam is unconstitutional because Congress failed to pass a resolution declaring that a state of war exists between the United States and North Vietnam.

title: Bigger Forest Hills Project Cut Urged by Queens Jewish Group
description: A 'construction moratoriinn on the Forest Hills lowincome housing project was urged yesterday by the Queens Jewish Community Council, representing 60 synagogues and other organizations, in view of Mayor Lindsay's withdrawal of support of the original plan.

title: EUGENE LEHMAN; HEADED COLLEGE
description: LONG BRANCH, N. J., Aug. 22Eugene H. Lehman, president emeritus of Monmouth College in West Long Branch and a former Mayor of Tarrytown, N. Y., died yesterday in Monmouth Medical Center. He was 92 years old and lived at 675 Ocean Avenue.

title: Plan for More Delegates For Urban Areas Beaten
Slow Clock Stalls Bobby Unser
description: Bobby Unser is sputteringly angry at the United States Auto Club, and in practicing for the California 500 of Sept. 3 at Ontario, he may be tempted to bring one of his more unusual trophies. It is a $400 grandfather clock given him last week by a Milwaukee antiques dealer as a backup clock against USAC timing. The grandfather clock commemorates the latest gaffe in the officiating of USAC's Championship Trail races. In May there was the mismanaged Indianapolis 500 and in July there was the wrong winner at Pocono. The latest incident deprives Unser of a distinction he had hoped to achieveto set qualifying records and to win the pole for every race this season.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: A. M. KLEIN, POET, DIES IN MONTREAL
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 22 (AP)A. M. Klein, one of Canada's bestknown poets, died yesterday. He was 63 years old.

title: WAR FOES HARASS G.O.P. DELEGATES
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 22 Republican delegates entering their convention hall were harassed tonight by a crowd of more than 3,000 antiwar demonstrators, many with their faces painted to represent death masks, who chanted, cursed, jostled and sometimes beat on their cars.

title: Grant's Quarter Net Lags
description: Retail business around the country continues to strengthen, but principal merchants complained yesterday that economic controls were beginning to pinch profit margins. This emerged as four more major merchandising chains yesterday reported improved results in the second fiscal quarter ended in July. A fifth retailer, the W. T. Grant Company, however, suffered a sharp reversal in earnings. Grant officials said that poor weather conditions had adversely affected the company's business.

title: Leni Riefenstahl Returns to Olympics
description: MUNICH  Leni Riefenstahl, the German filmmaker who earned worldwide ac claim and disdain for her docummtary on Hitler's 1936 Olympics, is returning to the scene to take still photographs of the 1972 games, which begin here on Saturday.

title: Josephine Vance Tucker Is Bride
description: Miss Josephine Vance Tucker, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Edwin Tucker of San Antonio, Tex., was married here at noon yesterday to Julian Hart Robertson Jr., a vice president and director of Kidder, Peabody & Co., investment hankers, and son of Mr. and Mrs. Robertson of Salisbury, N. C. The Rev. Hugh McCandless performed the ceremony in the Episcopal Church of the Epiphany, where the bridegroom is vestryman.

title: Briles Tops Giants, 10, Missing a Perfect Game
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 22 (AP)Nelson Briles pitched a onehitter and the Pittsburgh Pirates scored an unearned run in the first inning for a 10 victory over the San Francisco Giants tonight.

title: U.S. Aide Speeds Flood Relief As Aged Await Autumn's Chill
description: WILKESBARRE, Pa., Aug. 21On the back slope of Giant's Despair, a mountain on the east wall of the flooddevastated Wyoming Valley, three old ladies are camping in the living room of a small frame house, sleeping on couches and sharing the crowded quarters with two parrots and a dog.

title: Mets Defeat Astros, 42; Beauchamp Is Hero Again
description: Jim Beauchamp, suddenly one of the guns of August, won his second straight game for: the New York Mets last night with two singles and a home run that shot down the Houston Astros, 42.

title: CHURCH UNIT ACTS ON SOUTH AFRICA
EMBEZZLING LAID TO JERSEY BANKER
description: NEWARK, Aug. 22The former president of the Middlesex County Bank was arrested today by Federal Bureau of Investigation agents on charges of misapplying more than $509,380 in bank funds between April 22, 1969 and March 16, 1971.

title: Reynelds Securities to Buy A Communications Systems
description: Reynolds Securities, Inc., the large investment concern, signed contracts yesterday with GTE Information Systems Ultronic subsidiary and the Control Data Corporation for a $7million brokerage communications system. GTE Information is a subsidiary of the General Telephone and Electronics Corporation.

title: $3.16Million Loss Reported by Amex For First Quarter
description: The Ampex Corporation, which lost an estimated $89.6million in its fiscal year ended last April, reported yesterday a $3,155.000 loss for the first quarter ended July 29 on sales of $68,809,000. In the comparable quarter last year the company lost $774,000 on sales of $72,975,000.

title: Mortgage Yields Decrease At Fanny May's Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (Reuters)The Federal National Mortgage Association announced today that yields decreased slightly and the range of accepted bids narrowed in its latest auction for fourmonth commitments on Governmentbacked home mortgages.

title: Personalities: Ralston Serves
description: A new element was introduced yesterday in the controversy over where the Davis Cup final between the United States and Rumania will be played. And it came from Dennis Ralston, the 29yearold captain and coach of the American squad.

title: 2 Jump From Coast Span
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 22 (UPI)  Two persons jumped from the Golden Gate Bridge within three minutes of each other today, the California Highway Patrol reported. The Coast Guard recovered the body of one and was looking for the other.

title: Harlem Tourists Get New Slant on Russia
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 22Man, the discipline, Russell Davis said, sheer wonder in his voice. The streets are clean. People get in early at night. They have a whole lot of respect for police. You find a whole lot of discipline in this place.

title: RANDY JOHNSON OF GIANTS HURT; OUT FOR 3 WEEKS
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, N. J., Aug. 22Randy Johnson. the quarterback who played so well for the Giants in their 3131 tie with the Jets Sunday, suffered a slight right shoulder separation on the final play and will he out of action for at least three weeks.

title: Directors and Choreographers Will Own Their Work for Stage
description: A fouryear contract was announced yesterday between the Society of Stage Directors and Choreographers and the League of New York Theaters that for the first time gives directors and choreographers property rights over their creative efforts.

title: Executive Changes
description: John P. Williamson, senior vice president the Toledo Edison Company, has been named president and chief executive officer succeeding John K. Davis, who was elected chairman.

title: Mexico Defeats Sweden. Gains Stevens Cup Finals
description: EAST NORWICH, L. I., Aug 22 Mexico defeated Sweden. 32 in the international senior team tennis elimination finals yesterday and will challenge the defending United States team for the Stevens Cup starting tomorrow at the Town Tennis Club.

title: TV: Covering a Convention With Little to Report
description: The Republican convention in Miami Beach may well be little more than an elaborate coronation, as contended by John Kenneth Gailbraith. the liberal economist and somewhat more liberal Democrat. But then. according to William F. Buckley Jr., the conservative columnist and considerably more conservative Republican, that would only be sort of like those F.D.R. conventions.

title: Lavine Agrees to Testify Here on Welfare Inquiry
description: A statecity confrontation was resolved yesterday when;, Abe Lavine, State Commissioner of Social Services, agreed! to voluntarily appear before a City Council committee Oct. 18 to describe the first results of the state's new checkup on welfare Ineligibility here.

title: Rhodesians Cry, Politics
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Aug. 22 (Reuters)For many of Rhodesia's five million black majority, today's expulsion of Rhodesia from the Olympic Games is another indication that the country will remain an international outcast until the independence dispute with Britain is settled.

title: Banda Calls for Harmony
description: BLANTYRE, Malawi, Aug. 22 (Agence FrancePresse)  President Kamuzu Banda of Malawi said today that he wanted Africans, whites and Asians in his country to live in peace and harmony.

title: Cerro and ICX Reach Accord on Merger
description: The Cerro Corporation reached an agreement in principle yesterday to purchase ICX Industries, Inc., owner of IllinoisCalifornia Express, Inc., a leading generalmotor freight carrier. Terms of the cash transaction were not disclosed, but Wall Street observers and industry trade sources estimate it involves about $30million.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Market Place: Taking a Look At Xerox Now
description: Almost three years ago the publisher of a stock market advisory service wrote a long dissertation on the Xerox Corporation in which he concluded that this still great company was no longer a great stock.

title: Screen: British Comedy
description: If ever a screen comedy arrived on these shores to challenge strictly personal, American taste it's a British bundle called And Now for Something Completely Different. It is.

title: SOUTH YEMENI PLANE IS HIJACKED TO LIBYA
description: CAIRO, Aug. 22 (Reuters)A South Yemeni airplane was hijacked today on a flight. front Beirut to Cairo. It landed to night at Benahad airport in Libya. according to a message. received at. Cairo airport.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: Laura Baugh, Mrs. Jane Bastanchury Booth and Mary Anne Budke were named yesterday by the United States Golf Association to play in the women's world amateur team championship Oct. 11 to 14 at Buenos Aires.

title: Bank Merger Is Dropped
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., Aug. 22 (AP)The South Jersey National Bank here, a subsidiary of the Heritage Bancorporation, and the Guarantee Bank of Atlantic City announced today that discussions of a possible merger of the two banks have been terminated by mutual agreement.

title: Doctors Predict A Broken Foot
description: There's a new fashion malady afoot these days the brokenbone syndrome. It's the summertime version skiing's broken leg and this time it's a direct result those stiltlike platform shoes that are teetering all over the sidewalks of New York. Dr. Monroe Jacobs, president of the Podiatry Association of the State of New York, says that the platform shoe is supremely dangerous.

title: Public TV Plans to Combat V.D. With Nationwide Show on Oct. 9
description: Public television, with the aid of 14 medical, public health, and civic associations, the 3M Company, and several wellknown actors, musicians, composers and writers, will begin a nationwide campaign Oct. 9 to combat the fast growing epidemic of venereal disease.

title: Nixon Backer T ells of Link To Lawyer in Funds Case
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 22One of President Nixon's financial backers acknowledged today a longstanding friendship with the Mexican lawyer whose bank drafts for $89,000 have turned up in connection with the breakin at Democratic headquarters in Washington.

title: SEEWAGEN BEATS KODES IN TENNIS
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., Aug. 22  George (Butch) Seewagen of New York upset fourthseeded Jan Kodes of Czechoslovakia, 64, 46, 75, in firstround play today in the 46th Eastern grass courts open championship at the Orange Lawn Tennis Club.

title: Unexpected Preview Provides a Jolt To a Hitherto Predictable Convention
Ira Morrow Marries Carol N. Klaperman
description: LAWRENCE. L.I., Aug. 22 Miss Carol Nechama Klaperman, daughter of Rabbi and Mrs. Gilbert Klaperman of Lawrence, and Ira Jay Morrow, son of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Morrow of Brooklyn, were married here this evening in Congregation Beth Sholom, by the bride's father, its spiritual leader.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: VERNON, N.Y., Aug. 22 (AP)A postponed attempt by Albatross to lower his world harness racing record pace at Vernon Downs has been rescheduled for Sept. 9.

title: The G.O.P. Reforms
description: The search for a fair formula for allocating delegates to the next Republican National Convention has ended in failure. Instead of facing the issue on its merits, the delegates in Miami Beach unfortunately became entangled in the ideological and personal power rivalries within the party. Contending conservative and progressive factions foughtto the first frontier, but scarcely the lastin the struggle to determine the G.O.P.'s postNixon leadership in 1976.

title: KEY HOUSING AIDE SUSPENDED HERE
description: The chief of the city's housing rehabilitation inspectors, Michael Pesce, was suspended yesterday on charges that he had accepted $1,000 worth of lumber for a backyard swimming pool from a contractor doing business under the city's slum rehabilitation program.

title: For the Expelled Olympians, It's a Bitter Defeat
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 22First there was Mexico City, Graham Benins said tonight, sipping whisky from a plastic cup to drown the disappointment, now another defeat.

title: Autos and Prices: A Confusing Battle
MONSIGNOR MONTICONE
description: ROME, Aug. 22The Vatican today announced the death in Turin yesterday of Msgr. Giuseppe Monticone, who from 1923 to 1958 was the archivist general of the Sacred Congregation for the Propagation of the Faith. the Vatican's missionary office. He was 86 years old.

title: Red Smith
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 22  When weight lifters, wrestlers and other apprentice demigods on the United States Olympic team were in Washington last week living it up with Pat Nixon and Spiro Agnew, the swimmers were penned up in Knoxville, Tenn., and West Point, N. Y., with water in their ears. A fortnight after qualifying for the trip to Munich, the girls were straining for greater and greater speed in the University Tennessee pool, and the men were making waves in the United States Military Academy's big tank. They met in Washington for a few hours of sleep Sunday night, took off for this gray town at 9 A.M. yesterday and checked into Olympic Village about 10:45 P.M. Fifteen minutes later they were in the water again; they swam for an hour and a half, got to bed about 2 A.M., and returned to the Schwimmhalle for another training session starting at 11.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: White Sox Top Yanks On Allen's Homer, 54
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 22Dick Allen, who comes to hat to the organ rendition of Jesus Christ, Superstar, gave a Fritz Peterson pitch the Superman treatment tonight he sent it up, up and awayand gave Chicago a 54 victory over the Yankees.

title: SOVIET EMIGREE GETS A HADASSAH AWARD
description: Hadassah, the women's Zionist organization, emphasized last night its concern abouttheplight of Soviet Jews by giving its highest award to a Soviet Jewish woman and announcing training program for 20 refugee RuSsian Jewish doctors and 10 scientists now in Israel.

title: CHINESE ARE BUSY ON FOREIGN POLICY
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 22The active foreign policy initiated by China after the Cultural Revolution has recently gained new momentum as if someone in Peking had pushed a lever forward from the medium position to one marked fast.

title: PRICES RISE 0.4%; INCREASE BIGGEST IN LAST 5 MONTHS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22The Consumer Price Index, pushed upward as expected mainly by higher food prices, rose fourtenths of 1 per cent in July following four months of more moderate increases, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Assistant Chief Inspector Arthur B. Hill, one of the highest ranking black members of the uniformed force, applied for retirement yesterday after almost 26 years with the police department. The 50yearold officer negotiating for a Federal position, the details of which he will not disclose at this time, and plans to go vacaton and terminal leave starting Sept. 1.

title: PAUL FRILLMANN, OLD CHINA BAND,60
description: Paul W. Frillmann, president of Oram International Corporation, a fundraising organization, and coauthor with Ora ham Peck of China: The Remembered Life, died Saturday at his summer home in Scituate, Mass. He was 60 years old and lived at 186 Riverside Drive.

title: Captain of Liberian Tanker Says Ship Sank in 4 Minutes
description: CAPETOWN, Aug. 22 (Reuters)The master of a 43,339ton tanker that exploded yesterday after a collision off the South African coast said foday that his ship went down in four minutes, leaving the few survivors of its crew of 50 floundering in the oilcovered sea.

title: Israel Reports en Exchange Of Fire on Golan Heights
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 22 (UPI)Israelis and Arabs exchanged fire across the ceasefire line on the occupied Golan heights of Syria early today, Israeli military sources said. No casualties or damage were reported.

title: Steelworkers for McGovern
description: YOUNGSTOWN, Ohio, Aug. 22 (UPI)  Four Youngstown area officials of the United Steelworkers of America broke today with the union President, I. W. Abel, and said they had joined a committee to work for the Democratic Presidential nominee, George McGovern. The District 26 officials are Frank Trainor, subdistrict director at Ashtabula; Tony Antonucci and Marvin Weinstock, staff representatives in Youngstown, and Frenk Leon, president of local 3253.

title: Wall Street Profits Fell in First Period
description: Wall Street profits declined substantially in the first quarter of 1972, according to a survey by the New York Stock Exchange staff.

title: BACON PURCHASERS TO GET BETTER LOOK
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (UPI) Acting on the belief that a consumer should be able to tell how much fat is in a package of bacon before he buys it, the Department of Agriculture adopted today a fulldisclosure rule for bacon that is sold in standard windowtype packages.

title: NIXON IS RENOMINATED BY 1,347TO1 VOTE; LIBERALS LOSE FIGHT OVER RULES FOR 1976
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 22 The Republican party formally and jubilantly proclaimed Richard Milhous Nixon here tonight as its candidate for another term as President.

title: Rock Picnic Will Give Refunds, But Getting One May Be Tough
description: The 655 paying concertgoers who attended the abortive Rock, Picnic on Staten Island on Sunday can have their $9 admission fees refunded, under an agreement announced yesterday between the city's Department of Consumer Affairs and the concert sponsor.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (Reuters)Rates by finance companies for consumergoods loans, excluding cars, declined from March to May, but interest rates for personal loans went up slightly in the period, the Federal Reserve Board reported today.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: A public offering of 1,300 000 common shares of the Dayton Power and Light Company at 22 per share was announced yesterday by an underwriting group headed by Morgan Stanley & Co. and MP E. Hutton & Co. The company will use the net proceeds to reduce shortterm indebtedness. The company's stock closed at 223, up  on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Disenfranchised Democrats Wooed at G.O.P. Parley
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 22At times at the Republican National Convention it appeared that the stage managers might roll out Hubert Humphrey himself.

title: L.I. Man Killed in Plane Crash
description: SMITHTOWN, L. I., Aug. 22 (UPI)A Long Island executive was killed today when his plane crashed while attempting to make a landing at an airfield in Farmingdale, L. I. According to the police, Henry G. Siracusan, 50 years old, of Valley Stream, was returning from a business trip to Connecticut when his singleengine plane crashed in a wooded area of the Wyandanch Sportsman Club in Smithtown. Mr. Siracusan was president of the Berillum Company in Valley Stream.

title: Explosion in Ulster Kills 8, 2 Apparently the Bombers
description: NEWRY, Northern Ireland, Aug. 22 (Reuters)  A bomb ripped through a busy customs station in this border town today, killing eight people, including the two men who apparently it.

title: McGovern Meets Johnson And Welcomes Support
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Aug. 22Senator George McGovern gratefully accepted today the personal, largely private, blessing of an old adversary, former President Lyndon. B. Johnson.

title: ROGERS REBUTTED BY VIETCONG AIDE
description: PARIS, Aug. 22The spokesman for the National Liberation Front, or Vietcong, said today that Secretary of State William P. Rogers's optimistic prediction of an early Vietnam settlement was entirely false.

title: Business Briefs
description: TOKYO, Aug. 22 (Reuters)  Transport Minister Hidcyo Sasaki announced today details of a plan for the emergency importation by Japan of $300million worth of American goods. Included at e jetliners and airbuses. He said this will form part of the onetime Imports now being worked out by the Government to cut Japan's trade surplus with the United States this year to below $3billion. Without this, the surplus is expected to reach $3.8billion.

title: Integrity, Ostrich Style
description: Of all the ways to stop official corruption, the worst is to stop enforcing the laws. We didn't think much this nonapproach to cleaning up the police force when it was proposed by the Knapp Commission; we think even less of it now that the Police Department has run up the white flag on enforcing laws affecting such things air or noise pollution, sanitation and material storage at construction sites.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: FIGHTING LESSENS IN QUESON REGION
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Aug. 23pposing North and South Vietnamese forces, exhausted by heavy casualties, were reported yesterday to have settled for the moment along a loose battle line northeast of the district capital of Queson, which fell to the Communists on Saturday.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (AP)  The State Department expressed hope today that Hanoi would respond to Saigon's offer by freeing American prisoners.

title: Utility to Build Generator
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Utah, Aug. 22 (UPI)  The Utah Power and Light Company said today it plans to build a $100million electric generating unit for its Huntington, Utah plant.

title: Virtual Execution Charged
description: TRELEW Argentina, Aug. 22 (AP)Three defense attorneys for the slain guerrilla suspects denounced the deaths as a virtual execution and charged that it would have been impossible for the guerrillas to try to escape because they were held in separate cells under heavy guard.

title: PRICE PANEL LIFTS PROFIT RESTRICTION
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (AP) The Price Commission told, businessmen today that they could make as much profit as possible if they cut prices to a level not higher than the level of either Aug. 15, 1971, or May 25, 1970.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: ISTANBUL, TurkeyFour centuries ago (Aug. 24, 1572) the Massacre of Saint Bartholomew, worst of a series of Protestant killings by Catholics, tore apart a France whose politics were deeply mixed with religious bigotry.

title: Ideological Throttle
description: Internal morale is clearly becoming an increasing worry to the Kremlin. Recent months have brought such moves as an intensified campaign against alcoholism, intensified repression of democratic and ethnic dissidents, and, yesterday, removal of the czar of the Soviet film industry. As Pravda made plain in a front page editorial, dissatisfaction with the ideological content of Soviet movies was the prime reason for the ouster.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Dollar Is Unsteady
description: LONDON, Aug. 22 (AP) The United States dollar and the pound sterling were hit again today on European foreign exchange markets, but gold prices bounced upward in key markets.

title: THOMAS J. BOWDELL
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 22Thomas J. Bowdell, a member of the law firm here of Bowdell, Sears, Sugrue, Giambalvo & Crawley, died of a heart attack on Sunday in Wesley Memorial Hospital. He was 66 years old and lived at 1500 Lake Shore Drive.

title: HASSAN DISMISSES NAVY COMMANDER
description: RABAT, Morocco. Aug. 22King Hassan II dismissed the chief of the navy today apparently in a continuation of the general shakeup of the armed forces that followed the attempt by air force pilots to shoot down the King's plane last week.

title: Fire Chief's Mom Seeks Job
description: LINDEN (AP)  Fire Chief Terry Scully recently received an application for a fireman's job from 52yearold Mrs. Louise Scully  his mother. Chief Scully said he's worried his mother will be unable to stand the physical strain of firefighting. Mrs. Scully, grandmother, said, I just want to help. I always did like chasing fire trucks.

title: Spassky Elects an Aggressive, if Risky, Line of Play
description: Boris Spassky, conducting the white pieces, made a strong bid for a victory in yesterday's game in his match with Bobby Fischer for the world chess championship.

title: Nyerere Criticizes Amin
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, Aug. 22 (Agence FrancePresse)  Tanzania's official Government and party newspapers today both came out strongly against the decision of President Idi Amin to expel all Uganda's Asians, including 25,000 citizens.

title: Prices: Rule of Law
description: Now that Ford has disappointed White House hopes that it would set a pattern for total cancellation of the auto industry's projected price increases on 1973 models, the issue goes back where it belongsto the Price Commission for adjudication under its rules.

title: DONALD STEINFIRST, MUSIC CRITIC, DEAD
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 22Donald S. Steinfirst, music critic of The Pittsburgh PostGazette since 1938, died today. He was 68 years old.

title: To Taiwan, Strong Trade Is Lifeblood of Survival
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Aug. 20So long as our economy continues to grow fast, Premier Chiang ChiangKuo told a meeting of the Government's Economic Planning Agency last week, we will be able to meet any challenge from without and ;overcome any difficulty we may encounter in international politics so as to open up a bright future for our nation.

title: Notes on People
description: It was an active day for Democratic mayors. In Chicago, Mayor Richard J. Daley, who usually knows how the wheels are turning, celebrated a new North Side bicycle route by riding on a tandem with Keith Kinghay, the former Olympic cyclist, and yelling to pedestrians, Hi, pal. How you doing?

title: Sports News in Brief
description: The Pittsburgh Pirates and Cincinnati Reds, leaders their respective divisions of the National League, were given permission yesterday to start printing tickets for the 1972 World Series, Baseball Commissioner Bowie Kuhn announced.

title: TIMES WILL SEEK REDRESS OF UNION
description: The New York Times notified Mailers Union 6 yesterday that it was seeking damages as result of a work stoppage by the mailers on Sunday night and Monday morning.

title: PRICE INCREASES SET BY DOW CHEMICAL CO.
description: The Dow Chemical Company said yesterday that it planned to increase prices by 0.5 cent a pound for propylene oxide, propylene glycol, dipropylene glycol and tripropylene glycol, beginning Sept. 1.

title: Rhodesia Out of Olympics After a Dispute on Racism
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 22The International Olympic Committee tonight withdrew its invitation to Rhodesia to compete in the Olympic Games. The decision followed a week of objections by black athletes from other African nations to Rhodesia's participation in the Olympics because of that country's racial policies.

title: MIAMI BEACH
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 22The Republicans have done a brilliant job of dramatizing their candidate and their program for the November election. They have organized and controlled this gathering here like a TV show, put the spotlight on the President and his family, mobilized an effective roving youth corps to lead the cheers, scalded McGovern and appealed effectively to the disorganized and disappointed Democrats.

title: Mine Kills 2 in Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam. Aug, 22 (AP)A civilian bus packed with passengers ran over a nine in the Central Highlands today, Wiling 21 persons and wounding two others, the Saigon command announced.

title: U.S.Uruguay Reach Accord
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (UPI); The United States and Uruquay agreed to modernize their; extradition treaty to include aircraft hijacking, narcotics offenses and diplomatic kidnap: ping. the State Department said today. The department said the two nations reached an agreement on the updated treaty Aug. 17, lt will take effect as soon as it is ratified by the ?? congresses.

title: BERTRAND L. TAYLOR OF STOCK EXCHANGE
description: Bertrand L. Taylor, who had been a member and a governor of the New York Stock Exchange, died yesterday in Paris, where he had lived for some 23 years. He was 80 years old.

title: Seagull Reprint Soars to $1.11Million
description: Jonathan Livingston Seagull, the highminded, highflying bird who set all kinds of altitude records among his own feathered species, set one for his publishers yesterday.

title: Some Important Unanswered Questions Cast Doubt on Riva Ridge's Drugging
description: When Bobby Byrne testified about fixing horse races by tranquilizing favorites, he compared the process to putting a baby to sleep with pacifier.

title: Indians Reviving Religious Heritage
description: MORLEY, Alberta, Aug. 19 When the Rev. John S. Hascall, an American Roman Catholic priest, says mass he prefers a tepee to a church.

title: Advertising:
description: There's a design firm at 285 Madison Avenue called 285 Design There's also an ad agency at that address called Young & Rubicam. And this is not coincidental.

title: Advertising:
