description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 25Reacting to the heavy losses suffered last Saturday by the South Vietnamese Army's Second Division when it lost the Queson district south of Danang, the Saigon high command has relieved the division's commander, according to American officials here.

title: Democrats to Lease 2 Jets For Nominees for 2 Months
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25 (AP) The Civil Aeronautics Board authorized United Air Lines today to lease two Boeing 727200 jets, with crews, to the McGovern Transportation Committee from Sept. 4 through Nov. 7.

title: Dollar Is Strong In Quiet Trading On Market Here
description: The dollar was strong in relation to several key European currencies in quiet preweekend trading in the New York foreign exchange market yesterday. The German mark, the Swiss franc and the Dutch guilder all closed lower in relation to the United States currency, as did the Belgian franc and the Italian lira.

title: Legion's Response to Campaigners Reflects Its Makeup
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 25 When Senator George McGovern of south Dakota stepped from the wings and hurried toward the speaker's rostrum. not one Qf the more than 4,000 delegates to the American Legion's annual convention applauded.

title: Roundup: Reynolds of Phils Loses His 12th in a Row
description: It has been a long, hot summer for Ken Reynolds of the Phillies.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In front of City Hall are six trees in concrete tubs dying for lack of water. On Aug. 14 as I walked by on my way to the Building Department I noticed them and asked the patrolman on duty if he could get the maintenance people to water the trees. The patrolman was very sympathetic but helpless. He said it was the Parks Department's job. He told me to write a letter.

title: Officials Hail Court Restoration Of Medicaid Abortion Payments
description: The Federal Court ruling this, week restoring Medical payments to hospitals for performing elective abortions was praised by hospital and city officials yesterday as removing a barrier to the full implementation of New York State's liberal abortion law.

title: Woman a Suicide in Subway
description: A 56yearold woman was killed when she jumped in front of a southbound IND A train as it entered the West 168th Street subway station at 4:10 A.M. yesterday, the police said. The dead woman was identified as Ruth Levi of 709 West 169th Street.

title: Antiques: On Simplified Furniture
description: Antiques shops as far apart as Rome and New York are offering more of the simpler versions of 19thcentury rococo revival furniture as a reasonably priced substitute for hardtofind simple 18thcentury pieces.

title: ... Milk and Money
description: Money seems to be causing the Nixon campaign an extraordinary amount of trouble. First, Maurice Stans, the President's chief political money raiser, refused divulge the names of the people who gave $10 million to the Nixon campaign fund in the weeks just before the new election finance law requiring disclosure of all names went into effect last April. Then auditors for the General Accounting Office, charged with enforcing the new law, discovered possibly illegal discrepancies in the handling of some $500,000 in Nixon campaign funds.

title: CHECK ON AN AUTO LEADS TO A CHASE
description: A routine police check on a car weaving erratically down the Franklin D. Roosevelt Drive near 40th Street early yesterday turned into a wild shootout and chase after the occupants of the car fired at the patrolmen who had ordered them to pull over.

title: Dayan to Be Retired After Trot Campaign
description: Dayan, the 6yearold trotting son of Hickory Smoke and East Star whose career has been plagued by numerous ailments, returned to training yesterday and shortly will resume competing for the Adonis Stable of Fair Lawn, N.J.

title: More Accurate Way Is Devised To Detect Hemophilia Carriers
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25 (AP)  A Cleveland researcher re ported yesterday the development of a more accurate method for detecting female earn ers of hemophilia, the hereditary blood malady that strikes only men but is transmitted by women.

title: Soldier Is Killed by a Sniper in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 25 (Reuters)A British soldier was shot dead by a sniper in Londonderry early today and guerrillas in Belfast blew up two buildings near the city hall.

title: VOLTAGE IS CUT 5% IN THE NORTHEAST
description: The power pools of the Northeast, straining to meet nearrecord demands for electricity, cut voltage by 5 per cent yesterday for consumers throughout New York State and the six states of New England.

title: Miss Wade Gains Final
description: HAVERFORD, Pa., Aug. 25The national titleholders of Japan and Colombia yielded today as Virginia Wade of England and Laurie Fleming of Florida reached the final round of the $15,000 73d annual Pennsylvania lawntennis tournament at Merion Cricket club.

title: Hudson Leader Won Over by Shriver
Judith Wilson, William Martin Marry Upstate
description: ROCHESTER, Aug. 25Miss Judith Anne Wilson, daughter of Mrs. Joseph Chamberlain Wilson and the late Mr. Wilson, who was board chairman of the Xerox Corporation, was married here at noon today to William Jennings Martin, son of Mr. and Mrs. George Harwood Martin of Honcoye Falls.

title: Cosmos, Stars Vie For N.A.S.L. Title Tonight at Hofstra
description: The general's battle strategy may determine tonight's outcome of the North American Soccer League championship game between the New York Cosmos and the St. Louis Stars, at Hofstra Field in Hempstead, L. I., at 8 o'clock.

title: George Henderson, 78, Dead; A Founder of Sheraton Hotels
description: BOSTON, Aug. 25  George B. Henderson, a cofounder of the Sheraton Hotel chain in 1939 and its vice president and secretary until he retired in 1959, died Monday in the Massachusetts General Hospital. He was 78 years old and had homes here, in Marblehead and in Key Biscayne, Fla.

title: More Banks Join In Raising Prime By Quarter Point
description: The increase in the prime lending rate of the nation's commercial banks to 5 per cent from 5 per cent which was kicked off on Thursday by the Chase Manhattan Bank in New York started to spread yesterday, as had been anticipated.

title: Business Briefs
description: GENEVA, Aug. 25Switzerland's freetrade pact with the European Economic Community is of such momentous import for the country that the Swiss people should have the right to accept or reject it, the Government said today. In a special message, the Government urged Parliament ratify the association agreement concluded last month with the Common Market, but make it subject to a final vote in a national referendum.

title: ABROAD AT HOME
description: MIAMI BEACHMencken! Thou should'st be living at this hour.

title: 8 Are Injured in Syracuse As Truck and Bus Collide
description: SYRACUSE, Aug. 25 (AP)A dump truck loaded with gravel hit a city bus broadside today, splitting the bus in half and injuring its driver and seven passengers, one seriously.

title: Stage: The Royal Court
description: LONDONIt was in 1956 that the Royal Court Theater established itself as the center of the new British drama. With plays like John Osborne's Look Back in Anger, it became evident that a new generation was tearing at the gates. But in 16 years a new generation becomes a middleaged generation. Yet the position of the Royal Court Theater, now very much part of Britain's theatrical Establishment, remains a strong one.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I was very much interested in C. L. Sulzberger's Aug. 18 column concerning the European view of McGovern.

title: Executive Changes
description: Walter J. Rauseher, senior vice president of American Airlines, Inc., has been elected an executive vice president.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 25 (UPI)Super Bowl tuned up for next week's Hambletonian by winning the Indiana Horseman Futurity Trot today in the opening round of the Indiana State Fair's harnessracing program.

title: Striking the Schools
description: Senator McGovern's Presidential campaign is swinging into high gear after a month of postconvention fumbles and floundering, but it would be an exaggeration to pretend that his speeches this week contributed vastly to clarifying major issues.

title: Protest Strike in Cordoba
description: CORDOBA, Argentina, Aug. 25 (AP)This industrial city of nearly a million people was crippled today by a 14hour general strike protesting the slaying of the 16 guerrillas and supporting a demand for higher wages. of nearly a million people was crippled today by a 14hour general strike protesting the slaying of the 16 guerrillas and supporting a demand for higher wages.

title: Copter Rescues Climber
description: INDEX, Wash., Aug. 25 (UPI) A daring helicopter rescue today saved an injured climber who had dangled since Monday hundreds of feet off the ground at the end of a rope. The craft hovered less than six feet from a rock wall to lower a cable and save the climber, Craig Keyes. Rescuers said that he was in real good shapemuch better than expected.

title: WINE TALK
description: New York's betterknown restaurants are mostly east of the Avenue of the Americas. But one of the better wine cellars in town is far to the west, in the basement of Le Chambertin restaurant at 348 West 46th Street, almost at Ninth Avenue.

title: China's First U. N. Veto Bars Bangladesh
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 25After a bitter attack on the Soviet Union and India, the Peking Government today cast its first veto in the Security Council to bar Bangladesh from membership in the United Nations.

title: A MOBSTER IS LINKED TO BIZARRE HOLDUP
description: An acquaintance of JohnWojtowicz  who has beencharged with robbing a ChaseManhattan Bank branch inBrooklyn last Tuesday and holding nine persons hostagereportedly told the Federal Bureau of Investigation yesterday that an underworld figure supplied the guns used by Wojtowicz and two accomplices in the holdup.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: ST. GERVAIS, France, Aug. 25 (Reuters)  Robert Bradshaw of the United States won both the compulsory figures and the free setfigures events today to take strong lead in the International figureskating Grand Prix, which ends here tomorrow.

title: Muscovites Suffer From Record Heat and Lack of Beer
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 25A prolonged summer heat wave that the Soviet press is calling the worst in a century has prompted Moscow city officials to give the city's seven million residents health lectures about boiling milk at home and to urge them to save water.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: SEATTLE, Aug. 25 (UPI)The general manager of the Seattle SuperSonics today issued a public apology to his former playercoach, Lenny Wilkens, and the National Basketball Association team's fans for his handling of the 34yearold guard's trade to Cleveland.

title: Barbarossa Sets Pace in Golf With 136
description: PINEHURST, N. C., Aug. 25Bob Barbarossa, a 24yearold professional from Pompano Beach, Fla., led after 36 holes in the $100,000 Liggett and Myers open today with an eightunderpar total of 136.

title: Louisiana Senate Backs Governor On Gas Tax Rise
description: BATON ROUGE, Aug. 25 (UPI)The State Senate approved by an overwhelming margin yesterday legislation sponsored by Gov. Edwin...W. Edwards that would tax the oil and gas industry and relieve the property tax burden as the state's homeowners.

title: Andean Nations Are Increasing Their Trade
IndiaPakistan Talks on Threats to Peace Pact Open in New Delhi
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 25Indian and Pakistani officials met today and grappled with the issues imperiling the peace agreement the two countries signed on July 3.

title: Arthur Daley
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 25Avery Brundage hung up the phone and returned to the breakfast table his hotel suite this morning.

title: Golf Method Devised to Cut Walking
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25A California engineer has invented a method of playing golf that he says provides for maximum driving and a minimum amount of walking. Theodore B. Johnson of Burlingame was granted Patent 3,685,832 this week for what is trademarked Fore and Aft Golf. The patent cites an objectionable aura that the conventional course has attained by requiring the average golfer to walk four or five miles. With waiting time, a player on a metropolitan course may have to spend five or six hours.

title: 3,000 Heed Call to Join Us, Sisters! In March and Rally Here for Equality
description: Shouting its theme, Our rights and nothing less!, a Women's March for Equality moved down Fifth Avenue yesterday, swelling steadily to a crowd estimated at 3,000 to 5,000 for a rally that filled 40th Street from Fifth Avenue to the Avenue of the Americas.

title: Mrs. Knauer Bids Makers Vie for Safer Cosmetics
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25 (UPI) Mrs. Virginia H. Knauer, special assistant to the President for consumer affairs, dismissed today a charge by a committee of the American Medical Association that her office has used pressure tactics to get cosmetic manufacturers to provide safer products.

title: New Building for U.N. Aims at Security Fears
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Aug. 25A skyscraper to be constructed overlooking the United Nations will allow tenants to work. confer, live, eat shop and swim without stepping outside the premises.

title: Olympians March to Softer Drum Today
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 25Having hopefully dispensed with politics, the Olympics will turn toward pomp and pageantry tomorrow for the ceremonies that will officially open the 20th Games.

title: Cadillac Recalls Biggest Models After Ambulance Axle Failures
description: DETROIT, Aug. 25Cadillac Motor Car Division recalled today 3,878 of its biggest 1972 sedans and commercial vehicles, including ambulances and hearses, to replace axle shafts that could break and cause rear wheels to come off.

title: Border Flights Confirmed
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25The Pentagon confirmed today that on occasion United States warplanes have been given permission to bomb targets in North Vietnam close to the China border.

title: Lions Top Redskins
description: DETROIT, Aug. 25 (AP)Detroit's youthful Lions scored 20 points in the second quater tonight on the way to a 2310 exhibition victory over the Washington Redskins.

title: 26 Are Hart in Gaza By a Grenade Attack
description: GAZA, Aug. 25 (Reuters)Twentyfive Arabs and an Israeli woman soldier were injured today when an Arab guerrilla hurled a hand grenade at an Israeli civilian car in the center of Gaza, an Israeli military spokesman announced here.

title: $25,000 Donor to G.O.P. Got Federal Bank Charter
Vietnam: That Missed Opportunity
description: WASHINGTONThe American public is entitled to know what the President's current plan is to end the war in Vietnam. As the election campaign heats up, Henry Kissinger has held highly publicized secret talks in Paris and in Saigon. An impression that real progress toward peace is being made is being created. Secretary Rogers personally predicts peace before the end of the year. Yet nothing has been disclosed of the substance of these talks and therefore it is impossible to judge whether realistic offers are being made or whether the flurry of activity is just part of the effort to reelect the President.

title: At Each Port, a Lesson in Geography
description: Why would parents consider laying out $8,500 provide a teenager with eight months of private schooling?

title: Detroit Edison
description: DETROIT, Aug. 25 (AP)The Detroit Edison Company has announced net income of $69,498,000, or $1.94 a share, for the fiscal year ended July 31, up from the $59,885,000, or $1.87 a share, reported for the period a year ago.

title: Prank Fails to Deter Torch's Arrival
description: MUNICH, Aug. 25  The Olympic flame officially reached Munich tonight after an adventurous journey of 3,435 miles from Olympia, Greece.

title: Murphy Predicts More Arrests Of Policemen on Graft Charges
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy predicted yesterday that there would be more arrests of policemen on corruption charges before long.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Connecticut Blue Cross yesterday was granted a 3.28 per cent rate increase for most directpayment subscriber policies, less than half the size it had requested. State Insurance Commissioner Paul B. Altermatt said the Blue Cross request for an 8.5 per cent rate increase was excessive.

title: Skyscraper Question: Build Them Better or Not at All?
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., Aug. 24 Not everybody wants to go up in the world, but everybody here at the first international conference on the high rise building was prepared to examine the consequences of going up.

title: Consumers Get Advantage
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Aug. 25 (AP) Attorney General James S. Erwin said today that 465 Maine consumers had been told they could cancel certain sales contracts totaling $80,000 and demand the return of their money. The notification was result of alleged violations of the Consumer Protection and Home Solicitation Sales Acts by Lincoln Services, Inc., of Pekin, Ill., and Filter Queen Sales Center. Inc., of New Hampshire, he said.

title: PHONE CONCERN ACTS ON INFORMATION FEE
description: BUFFALO, Aug. 25 (AP)The New York Telephone Company is designing, ordering and installing equipment to bill customers for directoryassistance calls, a company spokesman said today.

title: Food Hoarding for Attack Urged in Federal Pamphlet
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25 (AP) The Agriculture Department, at a time when consumers are paying record high prices for groceries, says Americans should hoard food in case of atomic attack.

title: Farmer's Almanac Kinder to Women In Newest Edition
description: LEWISTON, Maine, Aug. 25 (AP)The Farmer's Almanac has spent 156 years poking gentle fun at women with lines like Many women would be more spic if they had less span.

title: Notes on People
description: Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama was 53 years old yesterday, and celebrated in a party at his office in Montgomeryhis first visit to the state's capitol since being shot down and partly paralyzed at a rally in Maryland in May. At the party, attended mostly by relatives and friends, Winton M. Blount, Republican candidate for the Senate in Alabama, gave Mr. Wallace a copy of the G.O.P. campaign platform. Mr. Wallace, a Democrat, declined comment on the gift.

title: 826 STOCKS CROP AS 566 ADVANCE
description: The stock market finished lower yesterday for the second consecutive session although the decline was not so sharp as Thursday's.

title: AMEX AND OTC SHOW DECLINES
description: Stocks on the American Stock Exchange continued to decline yesterday in slightly lighter trading.

title: Bridge: Slam Rule Is Easy to Learn, But Figuring Odds Is Harder
description: It is easy to say, as the textbooks do, that a small slam should be attempted if it has a 5050 chance of success. It is much less easy to say, on a given hand, whether the chances add up to 50 per cent. The answer will sometimes depend on whether the opponents invariably make the best opening lead.

title: PHILIPPINE DEALS GIVEN ASSURANCE
description: MANILA, Aug. 25  United States citizens in the Philippines seem assured of having two years in which to transfer to Filipino ownership lands affected by a Supreme Court ruling last week invalidating ownership of commercial and residential land purchased by Americans since the Philippines gained independence in 1946.

title: 3 Are Seized With Heroin
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25 (UPI) Three persons have been arrested in Southern California and two pounds of heroin with a street value of $1million were seized along with them, Assistant Secretary of the Treasury Eugene T. Rossides announced today. The Federal authorities had the three suspeots under sudveillance and on Wednesday they arrested William Taylor, 54 years old, and Angie Lee Henly, 33, both of Madison, Tenn., at San Diego International Airport and they seized Alfred A. Madrid, 36, of Tijuana, Mexico, at San Clemente, Calif.

title: Personalities: Grim Signs Pact
description: Bob Grim, the former Minnesota Viking's widereceiver, is now a fullfledged member of the Giants. Although the 6foot 200pounder has been in the New York team's camp for almost two weeks, he hadn't been interested in anything Wellington Mara, the president of the Giants, had to offer.

title: Ferros Score 75 to Win BrotherSister Tourney
description: EASTCHESTER, N. Y., Aug. 25Cindy and Stephen Ferro of Forest Hill Field Club won the 38th annual metropolitan sisterbrother championship of the Women's Metropolitan Golf Association by one stroke toI day with a card of 36, 3975. in the selecteddrive, alternate stroke event at Leewood Golf Club. Miss Ferro is the New Jersey women's state cham, pion.

title: Levitz Clarifies Figures
description: The Levitz Furniture Corporation, Pottstown, Pa., announced yesterday a correction in its earnings report for the six months ended July 31 to include the results of the R. B. Levitz, Inc., acquisition concluded in April. The retail furniture concern said that first half net income rose to $5,052,000, or 30 cents a share, from $2,962,000, or 18 cents a share. in the 1971 first half.

title: F.D.A. TO REQUIRE FEDERAL CONTROL OF BLOOD CENTERS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25The Food and Drug Administration, in a new use of a 10yearold law, moved today to bring all blood collection and processing centers under Federal control.

title: U.S. DOUBTS JETS SANK A LIFEBOAT
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 25 (UPI)  The United States command said today that it had no evidence that a 30foot boat sunk by American warplanes off the North Vietnamese coast was a lifeboat from a Chinese merchant ship.

title: Business Briefs
description: TOKYO, Aug. 25 (Reuters) The Japanese Finance Ministry said it had given preliminary approval for 11 Japanese banks to issue dollar certificates of deposits in London. The measure opens the way for Japanese banks to raise mediumterm funds in the Eurodollar market, added.

title: To Munchners, Foreigners Are an Olympian Nuisance
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 23Feeling against foreigners is on the rise in this tantalizing city, and if the natives had a grain less of humor it would be cause for serious alarm.

title: Pay Board Rejects Rises In Jersey Turnpike Pact
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Aug. 25 (AP)The Pay Board in Washington has rejected a salary package for more than 1,000 employes of the New Jersey Turnpike because it was well over 5.5 per cent, turnpike sources confirmed today.

title: ONLY 5 PROTESTERS STILL IN MIAMI JAIL
JACOB HUTNER
description: Jacob Hutner, principal of Public School 146 in Howard Beach, Queens, died of a heart attack Thursday evening at St. Moritz, Switzerland, where he had been vacationing with his wife, the former Adela Herznan. He was 64 years old and lived at 9825 54th Road in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Columbia to Grant 10Day Extension Of 30 Maids Jobs
description: Columbia University, under mounting pressure from civil liberties groups, the State Human Rights Division and the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission, agreed yesterday to extend for 10 days the jobs of the 30 maids who were to have been laid off starting this morning.

title: Abrupt Shifts Mark Amin Rule of Uganda
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Aug. 23 The 19 puzzling months of President Idi Amin's reign have been marked by the disappearances of about a dozen prominent officials, the murder of two Americans, perilous economic problems, an erratic foreign policy and tribal strife within the Uganda Army that has left thousands of soldiers dead.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Undecided Democrats should not be misled by the advertisement in The Times of Aug. 16, Announcing Democrats for Nixon. The organization described therein is nothing but an oxymoronic fraud being perpetrated on a currently divided Democratic party. The correct title should be New Republicans for Nixon.

title: Corrections Leader Martha Elizabeth Wheeler
description: The newly installed president of the American Correctional Association spent the better part of her youth in the tiny town of Madison, Ohio, in close. association with known criminals.

title: MONSIGNOR DISPUTES GALLUP ON ABORTION
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25A spokesman for the Roman Catholic Church challenged as ambiguous today a Gallup poll indicating that twothirds of the public now favored liberalized abortion laws.

title: ExRikers Inmate Wins Court Round In Alimony Case
description: A Bronx keypunch repairman has won the first round of his battle against the city for sending him to Bikers Island prison rather than to a civil jail when he could not make an alimony payment.

title: Fire Fatality Laid To Illegal Parkers
description: Fire Commissioner Robert O. Lowery put the blame for the death of an 84yearold retired surgeon in the Bronx yesterday on the selfishness or criminal negligence of persons who, night after night, block streets and fire hydrants with their cars.

title: FISCHER, SPASSKY DRAM GAME NO.18
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Aug. 25  Bobby Fischer and Boris Spassky spent very little time today before agreeing to draw in the 18th game of their world championship chess match here.

title: Sharp Back From China
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Aug. 25 (UPI)Mitchell Sharp, External Affairs Minister, arrived back in Canada today after a nineday, 2,000 mile tour of China, which included talks with Premier Chou, Enlai and the opening of the Canadian Trade Fair in Peking.

title: Bankrupt Ebinger Bakeries to Close
description: The Ebinger Baking Company, founded in Brooklyn in 1898, will shut down all its 54 stores at 6 P.M. today for the last time.

title: Chris Evert Triumphs
description: NEWPORT, R.I., Aug. 25 (AP) Chris Evert of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., and Mrs. Margaret Smith Court of Australia moved today into the semifinals of the Virginia Slims grass court tennis tournament at the Newport Casino.

title: Isle at U.N. Occupied In a Jewish Protest
description: A sixmember citizens group landed on tiny Belmont Island in the East River yesterday and renamed the rock outcropping Soviet Jewry Freedom Island.

title: Suspect Is Held Without Bail In Slaying of Three in Queens
description: A 17yearold Brooklyn soldier charged with the murder Monday night of three young men in the Broad Channel section of Queens was held without bail yesterday in Queens Criminal Court.

title: Wage Exemption Sought
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25 (AP) The International Union of Electrical, Radio and Machine Workers has asked a Federal District court judge to bar controls on wages under $3.83 an hour. Judge William Jones ruled on July 14 that the level of $1,90 set at the time by the Cost of Living Council was too low, but he offered no alternative. The current cutoff point for control is $2.75.

title: RENO JET HIJACKER GETS 30YEAR TERM
description: RENO, Aug. 25 (UPI)Robb Heady, 22 years old, was sentenced today to 30 years in prison for hijacking a New YorktoSan Francisco jetliner in Reno June 2 and holding it for $200,000 ransom.

title: Brezhnev Goes to Kazakhstan To Speed Up the Grain Harvest
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 25Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist party leader, has flown to the virgin lands in Soviet central Asia to spur the crucial grain harvest in Kazakhstan amid reports that Moscow's foreign grain purchases would be even larger than had been expected.

title: In which it is opined that Grand Central is not at all a thing of beauty, but an eyesore, depressing to the spirit, and should be knocked down.
description: As one who has absolutely no connection with any real estate interests or with anyone involved in real estate, I query the statement of the Municipal Art Society that the building proposal at Grand Central will deprive the people of New York of the extensive public benefits which derive from the continued presence of the terminal in its present form.

title: LOST SECURITIES TOTAL $2BILLION
description: More than $2billion of stocks and bonds are known to be lost or stolen, and the real figure more likely may turn out to be $10billion.

title: Hogan Indicates He's Tired of Talk Of Tombs Verdict
description: District Attorney Frank S. Hogan indicated yesterday that public discussion of the verdict in the recent trial of three Tombs inmates and his remarks about that verdict were wearying him.

title: POODLE IS CHOSEN TACONIC HILLS BEST
description: SHRUB OAK, N. Y., Aug. 25 Ch. Dassin's Blue Tango O'Chalmar, a black standard poodle, owned by Marjorie Bauman of Napoleon, Ohio, and R. W. Mullen of Naples, Fla., was best of 1,127 dogs today at the Taconic Hills Kennel Club show on the grounds of Lakeland High School.

title: A JEWELER SLAYS HOLDUP MAN HERE
description: A Queens jewelry store owner shot and killed a holdup man yesterday as he attempted to flee by taxi with his loot.

title: A Medical Plan for the Ailing House
description: One wintry Sunday a few years ago, David T. Smiththen an executive of an educational materials company  experienced homeowner's trauma. His heating system whimpered to a halt and died.

title: Automobile Production Up 23.6% From a Week Ago
description: DETROIT, Aug. 25 (UPI) United States production of 1973 automobiles increased 23.6 per cent this week over the previous week as the automakers completed further changeovers from 1972model production.

title: M'ANDREW BEATEN AS BRAVES CHECK METS HOPES, 21
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 25Having lost the battle for New York to the Yankees, the Mets mushed into the South tonight and lost a round in their battle for second place in the National League's East.

title: DialaCowboy Service Gives the Line on Dallas
description: DALLAS, Aug. 25 Becausel of the methodical way they do, everything, including the winning of football games, the 1972 Super Bowl winners, they Dallas Cowboys, have been likened to a welloiled machine. In keeping with that image, the team now has what it calls DialaCowboy service.

title: Yanks Win, 41, Then Lose, 51
description: All sorts of promising possibilities came apart for the New York Yankees midway through the second game at Yankee Stadium last night, and by splitting a doubleheader with the Kansas City Royals they wound up losing ground instead of gaining it in the American League's Eastern Division.

title: OSCAR M'PEAK
description: Oscar McPeak, assistant general counsel of the General Foods Corporation from 1950 until his retirement in 1958, died yesterday in the Montefiore Hospital. He was 78 years old.

title: C. &
description: John W. Hanifin has been elected executive vice president of the Chesapeake & OhioBalti more & Ohio Railroads, Mr. Hanifin has been vice president in the executive department of the affiliated railroads. He is a director of the B&O and the Western Maryland Railway and president of the James Center Development Company in Richmond, Va.

title: G.O.P. Platform Termed Hawkish by Hanoi Paper
Peronists Defy Argentina Regime and Plan Rallies
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 25 As tension between the military Government and the followers of former President Juan D. Peron increased, army commanders throughout Argentina warned today that political agitation would be severely repressed.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In reading the Aug. 14 Times about the tragic automobile accident on the Henry Hudson Parkway, it once more occurred to me that metal dividers should be put on this parkway where so many tragic accidents happen.

title: PLATINUM FUTURES SEESAW SHARPLY
description: Platinum futures prices fluctuated sharply yesterday on the New York Mercantile Exchange. They were up $3.50 an ounce at the opening, dropped $7 below the close of the day before and closed 70 cents to $1.50 an ounce lower. Trading was active with volume at 1,245.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: As a worker in Henry Wallace's Progressive party in 1948, I am not surprised that George McGovern was for a time associated with that party. Wallace was a critic of the postWorld War II United States policy which relied upon militaryindustrial support for unstable and often corrupt governments, with the purpose of containing Communism. Wallace emphasized that the way to world peace was not by any balance of power (meaning military power), but rather by working through the United Nations. He felt that the U.S. was sabotaging that world organization by taking unilateral actions to pursue its own nationalistic goals.

title: 700 Demonstrate In Protest to Close Tambourine Club
description: About 700 Upper East Side residents surged through neighborhood streets last night, demanding that a neighborhood bar be closed down for criminal nuisance and exchanging epithets and slogans with the bar's patrons.

title: Ping, Pong, Plunk
description: China's deft exercise in pingpong diplomacy plunked to the depths of cynical bigpower politics at the United Nations yesterday when Peking used its first Security Bangladesh.

title: Elmer M. Jackson 3d Dies; Editor of Maryland Paper
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 25 (AP)Elmer M. Jackson 3d, editor and general manager of The Anne Arundel Times in Glen Burnie, Md., today after a brief illness. He. was 42 years old.

title: BALKY MY LAI FIGURE WILLING TO TESTIFY
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Aug. 25An Army sergeant who refused to testify at the trial of First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. in connection with the mass killings at Mylai said today that he ;new willing to testify at any ;new trial.

title: 10 Argentine Guerrillas Leave Chile for Havana
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 25 (Reuters)Ten leftwing urban guerrillas who had fled here from Argentina aboard a hijacked airliner 10 days ago left for Havana tonight aboard a Cuban airliner.

title: HELEN WINSTON DIES; FILM, TV PRODUCER
description: Helen Winston, a film and televison producer, died Thursday at Doctors Hospital after a brief illness. She was about 40 years old and lived at 35 East 35th Street.

title: Margaret A. O'Donnell Is Bride
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Aug. 25In St. Aloysius Roman Catholic Church here this evening, Miss Margaret Anne O'Donnell, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Joseph O'Donnell, was married to Michael James O'Neil, son of Mr. and Mrs. James O'Neil of Akron. Ohio. The Rev. Eugene O'Neil, a cousin of the bridegroom, performed the ceremony at a nuptial mass celebrated by the Rev. George Fogarty.

title: 2 Soviet Defectors Due Here
description: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 25 (UPI) Two defectors from a touring Soviet orchestra were given visas by the United States Embassy here and left for New York today. Yuri Grodetzky, 33 years old, and Aleksandr Ivanov, 25, both trombone players, slipped away from the Leningrad Music Hall Orchestra last Saturday and were granted political asylum by the Mexican Government. They said that they could not be free in the Soviet Union and wanted to work as musicians in the United States.

title: Queson Reported Retaken By Saigon Ranger Force
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, Aug. 26The district capital of Queson, overrun by North Vietnamese forces last weekend, was reportedly retaken yesterday by South Vietnamese troops.

title: Bench's Finger Broken
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 25 (AP)The Cincinnati Reds catcher, Johnny Bench, suffered a fractured little finger on his left hand when he was hit by the New York Mets pitcher, Gary Gentry, last Saturday, the club, announced today. Bench remained in the lineup tonight with a splint on the finger and played right field. A spokesman said Bench would not go back to catching for a while.

title: Reynolds Metals Awaiting Soviet Equipment Arrival
description: The Reynolds Metals Company said yesterday that a shipment of Soviet equipment was en route to a company facility in Sheffield, Ala., for the pouring of aluminum ingot by an electromagnetic process.

title: CITY DISCHARGES BOILER INSPECTOR
description: A city boiler inspector was dismissed yesterday, charged with having falsified inspection reports and carrying on a private plumbing business during working hours.

title: Building Through Sports
description: The Harlembased Sports Foundation, Inc., is in the midst of completing its fifth annual Harlem Junior Olympics. The privately financed foundation has been serving more than 15,000 children each year since 1968 through clinics in soccer, fencing, tennis, boxing, wrestling, judo, track and field and other sports activities.

title: Senegal Cholera Spreads
description: DAKAR, Senegal, Aug. 25 (Agence FrancePresse)SaintLouis, the former capital of Senegal, has been isolated following an outbreak of cholera in which six people have died, Senegalese health authorities said today. No one is allowed to leave the town at the mouth of the Senegal River estuary without vaccination certificates. The disease is believed to have spread downstream from Rosso, about 60 miles northeast.

title: The First Woodstock
description: Olympia is impossible. Impossible to get to, impossible to live in, impossible to understand. In ancient times competitors would journey months to suffer this unbearable climate, to swelter, suffocate and be a feast for famished bugs. And for what? Games. Ah yes, but The Games. As Pindar long ago sang:

title: Business Briefs
description: ROME, Aug. 25 (Reuters)Italy recorded a balanceofpayments deficit of 227.5 million lire in June, compared with a May surplus of 25.5 million and a June, 1971, deficit of 26.1 million, the Bank of Italy reported today. The lira is currently valued at 0917 American cent.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: Fred S. James & Co. announced yesterday it would file with the Securities and Exchange Commission, possibly next week, a secondary stock offering of between 500,000 and 600,000 common shares. The shares will be offered by about 140 shareholders, the company said. The company stock was down 3 at 30, a new low for the year, on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Nixon Is Buoyed by Tour; Tactics of 1968 Revived
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Aug. 25President Nixon turned his attention to the business of the Presidency today after a grueling crosscountry political tour that revealed much about the likely tone, techniques and content of his reelection campaign.

title: BRAFF, CORNETIST, LEADS CLEAN JAZZ
description: The greening of jazz on the Upper East Side, which has. for the most part, been limited, so far to an incursion of jazz pianists, has now been broadened to include a cornetled quartet. The cornetist is Ruby Braff, and the group plays the cleanest, most directly type of mainstream jazz.

title: British Bill Rate Gains
description: LONDON, Aug. 25 (Reuters) Average rate at today's tender of treasury bills rose to 5.8260 from 5.7709 last week. This week's 120million offer of 91day bills met applications of 328,840,000. Applicants for bills dated Monday to Friday at 98.54 received about 60 per cent. Next week 60million bills will be offered replacing 60million of maturities,

title: TWO SHARE LEAD IN WOMEN'S GOLF
description: DENVER, Aug. 25 (AP)Sandra Haynie and Mrs. Marlene Hagge each carded a twounderpar 69 today and shared the lead by a stroke after the first round of the $25,000 National Jewish Hospital Ladies Professional Golf Association tournament.

title: Republican Mystery...
description: For a Government dedicated to law and order, the Nixon Administration gets itself involved in some remarkable difficulties. For many weeks earlier this year, the story unfolded before the Senate Judiciary Committee of how the International Telephone & Telegraph Corp. promised $400,000 to help finance the Republican National Convention and how officials in the White House and the Justice Department went through some extraordinary maneuvers to arrange an antitrust settlement favorable to I.T.T.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: TORONTO, Aug. 25 (UPI)Following a meeting the National Hockey League's board of governors today, the league president, Clarence Campbell, said Cincinnati would definitely be included in the N.H.L.'s next expansion.

title: Chess Game Is Drawn
description: Bobby Fischer and Boris Spassky agreed to a draw after 47 moves of the 18th game in their world chess championship match in Reykjavik, Iceland. The 19th game will be played tomorrow. Details, Page 11.

title: Browne of Australia Is Winner Of the 73d U.S. Chess Tourney
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Aug. 25 (AP)Walter Browne, an Australian grandmaster, tonight won the 73d annual United States Chess Tournament here.

title: Miss Ryan Bride Of Kevin McKeon
description: BAY SHORE, L. I., Aug. 25 Miss Frances Virginia Ryan, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John F. Ryan of Brightwaters, was married here this noon to Kevin Gary McKeon, son of Mr. and Mrs. Malachy McKeon of Riverdale, the Bronx. The Rev. Gerald Chasse performed the ceremony in St. Patrick's Roman Catholic Church.

title: Art: Drawings Emerge
description: In the past, the art world has tended to look at drawing as an esthetic expression of less importance than painting and sculpture, a kind of halfsister in the arts. Within recent years, however, prejudices against this medium have been disappearing. Although drawing is still far from being considered an equal to painting and sculpture, it is currently enjoying an unprecedented popularity.

title: YONKERS FEATURE TO KEYSTONE PAT
description: YONKERS, Aug. 25  Keystone Pat unleashed an 0:58 final half and easily captured the $20,000 Atlantic Pace at Yonkers Raceway tonight. The 5 year old Tar Heel Pebble Adios bay led through nearly all of the eight furlongs, as John Hayes Jr. steered his father's pacer to a 1length!, victory over Dangerous Wave.

title: 9 Guards Injured In Quelling Fights At Trenton Prison
description: TRENTON, Aug. 25 (AP)Nine guards were injured, none of them seriously, while breaking up a fight between prisoners in the recreation yard at Trenton State Prison tonight.

title: Army Discloses a Plan To Spur Reenlistments
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25 (AP) The Army announced today a new recruiting program for former servicemen and women allowing them to reenlist at the previous rank.

title: SHARER REPORTS NO PACT PROGRESS
description: Virtually no substantive progress has been made in five months of negotiating a new contract between the Board of Education and the United Federation of Teachers, according to Albert Shanker, the union president.

title: Mental Patients Will Man OTB Parlor
description: Mental patients and former patients, considered by many private employers to be among the ranks of unemployables, will be staffing a new Queens betting parlor scheduled to open in October, Howard J. Samuels, president of the Offtrack Betting Corporation, said yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The recent articles by Linda Charlton and Iver Peterson have performed a much needed public service by points ing out that there is still no licensing by the state for psychotherapists and psychoanalysts. One reason licensing has been so difficult to achieve for these professions is that there is as yet no professional doctoral degree in the field.

title: PANEL TOLD TO FORM STATE POWER POLICY
description: ALBANY, Aug. 25 (UPI) Legislative leaders today named six lawmakers, two conservationists and the head of the state's Offtrack PariMutuel Betting Commission to a newlycreated panel to develop a comprehensive energy policy for the state.

title: The Screen: 'Blacula':Yes, the Vampire Is Back in Los Angeles
description: It was surely nothing more than very bad luck that when the 18th-century African Prince Mamuwalde journeyed to Europe to petition an end to slavery, his mission took him to Transylvania and the castle of a certain Count Dracula. Two hundred years pass, and in a Los Angeles warehouse holding a shipment of Transylvanian antiques sits Mamuwalde's coffin with the prince still insidewaiting, undead, not a bad sort really, but cursed.So begins the story of William Crain's "Blacula," a new and probably inevitable look in vampire movies, which opened yesterday at the Criterion and Juliet 2 Theaters.Mamuwalde (William Marshall) escapes his coffin and makes his entrance into Los Angeles society. But although personable and polite, he is never quite accepted. Maybe it is his long black cape, or his unavailability during the day, or his curious manner of speaking: "Please forgive me. I must depart now. I have indeed had a rare pleasure." (He is off to sink his teeth into a pretty nightclub photographer.) "That," observes a casual companion, "is one strange dude!" We can only agree.Mamuwalde's problem is that although he really enjoys drinking people's blood, he unfortunately falls in love with Tina, whose best friend, Michelle, works for Dr. Gordon Thomas (Thalmus Rasulala) of the police department. The police, of course, are powerless  one even grows fangs and joins the other side  but not Dr. Thomas, who does his research, sharpens his wooden stakes, and brings matters to their necessary conclusion. But for Mamuwalde, while he lasts, there is at least the compensation that Tina loves him too, and she is played by Vonetta McGee  just possibly the most beautiful woman currently acting in movies.Anybody who goes to a vampire movie expecting sense is in serious trouble, and "Blacula" offers less sense than most. But it does provide such bits of knowledge as the "well-known fact" (not well-known to me) "that vampires multiply geometrically . . .", or the useful information that a silver cross will also work against Third-world vampires from emergent African nations.For answers to other questions we may have to wait, perhaps until "Blackenstein," due to open next Christmas.

title: BRIMMER ANALYZES RESERVE BORROWING
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25Andrew F. Brimmer, a member of the Federal Reserve Board, published today an exhaustive analysis of the use by Federal Reserve member banks of their privilege of borrowing at the discount window, but he drew no policy conclusions.

title: 6 STAY UNBEATEN AMONG SKIPPERS
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., Aug. 25The unbeatenskipper list was reduced to six today after 216 boats sailed on tlw third day of Manhasset Bay Yacht Club's 40th annual Race Week.

title: Jet Capital Gets Control of Texas International in $35Million Deal
description: The Jet Capital Corporation of New York assumed control yesterday of Texas International Airlines, Inc., as part of a $35million refinancing and equity program. In line with the move Francisco A. Lorenzo, 32yearold chairman of Jet Capital, was also elected president and chief executive officer of Texas International. This makes him the youngest airline president in the country. The airline's new ex ecutive committee consists of Mr. Lorenzo, Howard Wolf, who had served as acting president, and Robert J. Carney, president of Jet Capital, who is also 32.

title: Books of The Times
description: Using Stella Snead's striking and captivating photographs as a spool on which to wind their reflections on India, Jon and Rumer Godden have in the process evoked the texture of Indian life. Not, as they concede, the whole range of Indian life. The country is too vast and too various for that. It is the life of an everyman, who is neither too poor nor too rich (though they touch on beggars and princes), neither too saintly nor too sinful, neither too conspicuous, nor a cipher either. He is, in short a human being like us.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: There is a simple expedient which would simultaneously double available fuel reserves and halve automotive airpolluting exhaust emissions. If legislation could be enacted limiting the cubic volume of passenger vehicle engines, automotive engineers could pursue the task of developing lighter, more efficient cars which would then approach the powertoweight ratios existing in current models. Then instead of emission exhaust control systems which increase fuel consumption substantially, the natural level of exhaust gases would be reduced by the use of less fuel.

title: Apache Sets Acquisition
description: The Apache Corporation has agreed to acquire the National Crane Corporation, which manufactures truckmounted cranes used for handling material and personnel.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 25 (UPI)Jackie Paul Isaac Bellbrook, Ohio, died today of injuries suffered last Friday when lie was struck by a car at Indianapolis Raceway Park, where he was working on a pit crew.

title: Ruth Harrison Married on L.I. To Stephen Joseph D'Ambrosio
description: OYSTER BAY, L. I., Aug. 25Miss Ruth Harrison, a granddaughter of the late Henry Francis du Pont, founder of the Winterthur Museum in Wilmington, Del., was married here this afternoon to Stephen Joseph D'Ambrosio. The Rev. James E. Collins performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass in St. Dominic's Roman Catholic Church.

title: Rate Increase Is Denied A Phone Company Upstate
description: ALBANY, Aug. 25 (UPI)The Public Service Commission today denied a request for a $2.4million temporary rate increase by General Telephone Company of Upstate New York.

title: Brazil Kidnappers Get Life
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 25 (UPI)A military court sentenced three students to life in prison last night for the 1970 kidnapping of the Swiss Ambassador to Brazil, Giovanni Enrico Bucher. Mr. Bucher was released unharmed after the Brazilian Government freed 70 political prisoners to ransom him.

title: Brush Fire Imperils Home Of the California Condors
description: FILLMORE, Calif., Aug. 25 (UPI)Warming temperatures and rising winds whipped up a fourdayold brush fire today in the Los Padres National Forest, the mountain home of the last of the California condors.

title: Giants Pat Marichal On Routine Waivers
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 25 CAP)Horace Stoneham, president of the San Francisco Giants, said tonight that the pitcher, Juan Marichal, had been routinely placed on waivers along with several other players he did not identify.

title: 2 SEIZED FLEEING METHADONE THEFT
description: The police captured two AWOL infantrymen charged with holding up a methadone clinic on the East Side yesterday morning, but two other robbers escaped after a wild chase across the Manhattan Bridge and through the Fort Greene housing project in Brooklyn.

title: A PRECINCT CAPTAIN LOSES HIS COMMAND
description: A police captain was relieved of his command in Brooklyn yesterday by Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy on the ground of inefficiency.

title: Cloudy Dawn Scores
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 26 (AP)Cloudy Dawn, the oddson favorite, scored a 1length victory in the $109,350 Arlington Park Handicap today.

title: Saigon's Policemen Fire Warning Shots On Regular Patrols
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 26 Policemen here are now authorized to fire three warning shots to stop cars and motorcycles whose drivers they wish to question, according to la police spokesman. If the warning fails, he said, the policemen are authorized to shoot to kill.

title: Hustling Scholars
description: Changing interests among students, faculty and financial donors have a way of relegating once prestigious academic disciplines to that ignominious realm known as The Irrelevant. This can be a healthy process. One this generation's greatest advances over the lingering nineteenthcentury mentality in education is that no specific discipline or set of studies can any longer claim monopoly on defining the educated man.

title: Chicago Is Struck By Torrential Rain; Homes Are Flooded
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 26 (UPI)Torrential rainstorms struck Chicago and its suburbs last night and early today, turning major traffic arteries into virtual rivers, flooding thousands of basements and collapsing the roof of a macaroni factory.

title: Dark human corners
description: Grandfather died choking with a peanut in his windpipe, or was it a slice of glassfilled New York angel cake? asks Daughter Buffalo. Janet Frame's New York is a great gorge on lethal food, a picnic on killing sweets and carrion delicacies. Miss Frame serves up derelicts gone rotten on 42d Street; she dishes out the dead rich like so many chilled hors d'oeuvres. Daughter Buffalo is about death's gourmands, those hungries who need the taste of relic meat, who are doomed to crave glassfilled angel cake, and who end by leaving the cake and eating only the glass.

title: APARTHEID FACING UNION OPPOSITION;Black Organizing Rights Are South in South Africa
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Aug. 22Delegates to the annual conference of the Trades Union Council of South Africa in Capetown this week are pressing the Government to change the country's apartheid labor laws and allow black workers to organize into officially registered unions.

title: Son to Mrs. R. L. Price
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Richard Lee Price on Aug. 6 in the Beth Israel Hospital. Mrs. Price is the former Miss Caroyln Ann Small, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Sidney Small of Bayside, Queens.

title: Marsha Taxon Engaged
description: Mr. and Mrs. Saul Taxon have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Marsha Taxon, to David M. Gershberg, son of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Gershberg. Both families are of Brooklyn. Miss Taxon is with the corporate bond department of Mahon, Nugent & Co. Her fianc is with the corporate bond department of Salomon Brothers.

title: Young Delegate Speaks Up
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla.Even the most enthusiastic New Jersey Republicans who attended the convention here last week were willing to admit that much of their party's national convention this year was something less than an affair to remember.

title: Environment Chief Aims Shot at Zoning
description: TRENTON  The interest of those who want multifamily housing constructed in New Jersey's outlying areas may well be reconcilable with those fighting to preserve the state's environment, according to Richard J. Sullivan, the state Commissioner of Environmental Protection.

title: Police Urged to Go to College
description: PLAINFIELDWho makes a better policeman: the experienced officer who Is collegetrained or the experienced officer who is streetwise?

title: Brothers'
description: VENTURA, Calif., Aug. 26 (UPI)  Henderson Brooks looked 54 years for his older brother before discovering they had been living about an hour's drive apart since 1949. But the reunion was too late. The older brother, Charles, was dead and the first that Mr. Henderson heard of him since 1918 was in a newspaper obituary.

title: Pratt &
description: NORTH HAVEN, Conn. Aug. 26 (AP)The Federal Pay Board has approved a 9.1 per cent increase in pay and fringe benefits for 3,000 employes here at the Pratt & Whitney Aircraft Division of the United Aircraft Corporation.

title: Small Farms Dying As Costs Skyrocket
description: RANDOLPH TOWNSHIPEdgar and. Elsie Longnecker want to remain farmers, but it is, getting harder each year for them to do so.raise them. So we can't sell them.

title: ExSaigon Aide a Restaurateur in California
description: MOUNTAINVIEW, Calif., Aug. 25Eight years ago when Nguyen Ton Hoan went to work in Saigon, everyone he passed noticed his shiny chauffeurdriven limousine and the armed bodyguards who rode with hint Then, Dr. Hoan was Deputy Premier of South Vietnam. Now each morning he and his wife drive unnoticed the few miles from their home to the little Vietnamese restaurant they operate here.

title: Real Estate Lures Wall Street
description: Wall Street, which once disdained real estate as a highly fragmented, entrepreneurial affair, has recently become enamored of the industry. Most brokerage houses expect real estate to play an increasingly significant role in their mix of business over the coming years.

title: 2 Soviet Women Defeat Americans in GrassCourt Semifinals at So. Orange
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J., Aug 26The first allSoviet Union final ever held In the United States was set up today following semfinal victories by Olga Morozova and Marina Kroshina in the 46th Eastern grass courts open championships at the Orange Lawn Tennis Club.

title: The World
description: JERUSALEM  Berem and Ikrit are the names of two villages that once stood on the Lebanese border, the homes of a largely Christian Arab population. During Israel's 1948 war of independence the Arabs were expelled for security reasons, and in 1952 both villages were razed to the ground. This last action has since been admitted to have been a mistake. The Arab villagers have been resettled elsewhere in Israel and offered compensation, but few of them have accepted the money. They have kept alive their attachment to their villages and their claim to a right to return and rebuild their homes, and they have instilled these feelings in children.

title: Soviet ABlast Reported
description: UPPSALA, Sweden, Aug. 26 (AP)An underground explosion in the Soviet nuclear testing area of Semipalatinsk in eastern Siberia was registered here early today, the Seismological Institution reported.

title: DENTAL PATIENTS HELD FOR RANSOM
description: Two youths, one of them armed with a 22caliber revolver, surrendered to the police yesterday after they invaded a dentist's office in Queens and threatened to kill three patients unless the dentist gave them $3,000.

title: When gods were human, all too human
description: The old Greek gods are still good company. They are very human gods, strongly drawn to mortals. Their exuberant life styles reflect the best and worst of our own. In their celestial ranks, even women have rights and power. And these deities and demigods from the childhood of man make perfect heroes and fairy godmothers for children's books.

title: Recordings
description: IN January 1950, the first album of a movie score, For Whom the Bell Tolls, was released. Ten years later, for lack of interest, the album was cancelled from Decca's catalog. Today, one mint copy of that album could fetch $'250 on the burgeoning rare soundtrack market.

title: Demonstration Held Here
description: About 30 members of the Bangladesh League of America demonstrated in front of the Chinese mission to the United Nations on Manhattan's West Side yesterday. They tried to deliver a letter to the mission protesting Friday's veto of Dacca's United Nations membership, but no one answered the bell at the mission.

title: Nancy C. McCandless Has Nuptials
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Aug. 26Miss Nancy Cable McCandless was married here this afternoon to John Langdon Crum.Tr., assistant treasurer of the Great Western United Corporation, a Denver conglomerate.

title: 420's Topped by Fraser
description: BABYLON, L.I., Aug. 26 Dick Fraser is showing that consistency pays off The Larchmont skipper had a second and a third today, matching his performance of yesterday, to take the lead in the 420 Class national championships. The series concludes with two more races tomorrow.

title: 2 Young Bicyclists Spending Summer on a 900Mile Adventure on Wheels
description: Walter and Daniel Brooks set off on bicycles last Monday from their home in Middle Hope, N. Y., a suburb of Newburgh, for a summer adventure they have been planning since spring.

title: Four novels: naive, meretricious, masterly, aimless
description: These are bodiless people, but their souls have a fierce physique. James Hanley's writing is succint as a telegram, nude, yet terrific. He speaks of love in various forms and of madness, love's cousin. The style is idiosyncratic and special. Human archetypes glide, strong specters, through the novel. It's as if the subconscious were worn outside. Another World is a masterly book.

title: U.S. Steel Forced Into Vast Antipollution Program
description: WASHINGTONThe State of Pennsylvania, Allegheny County and an aggressive environmental organization named GASP have demonstrated that local government with citizen support can force an industrial giant as big as the United States Steel Corporation to adopt an antipollution program far beyond anything it had planned.

title: Taipei Denounces the U.N. For Erasing Taiwan Data
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Aug. 26The Nationalist Chinese Government yesterday condemned the United Nations Secretariat for yielding to pressure from Peking to eliminate all statistical references to Taiwan in United Nations publications and to remove a plaque presented to the organization by the Nationalist Government.

title: Celebrity Golf Benefit To Aid Highway Safety
description: Sammy Davis Jr. will head an allstar golf tournament today in Las Vegas. The tournament will benefit the Highway Safety Foundation, a private, nonprofit organization dedicated to reducing the nation's annual traffic toll through research, information and legislation. Davis will lead a contingent of 25 entertainers including Tom Jones, Johnny Carson and Wayne Newton. They will be matched in foursomes with 75 of the nation's top industrialists, each of whom donated $1,000 to the Highway Safety Foundation for the privilege of entering the tournament.

title: Lakebed Parking Garage Draws Tourists to Geneva
description: GENEVA, Aug. 26The parking garage that Geneva's downtown merchants decided to hide under Lake Geneva is already a success in attracting tourists although it has yet to disappear beneath the water. In fact, the garage, which is to be the world's first to go under water, has proved almost too successful in drawing the visitor.

title: What It's Like to Drive a Mazda
description: The silkysmooth Wankel rotary engine still has a way to go in development, but when it reaches its potential in the next few years its impact on the automobile industry will be staggering, far greater than any previous innovation. It should be comparable to commercial aviation's shift from propellers to jets.

title: Solzhenitsyn's Credo
description: To read Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn's undelivered, but extraordinarily eloquent, Nobel lecture is a moving experience. He is, he reminds the world, one of the few writers to survive the archipelago of GULAGa reference to the world of Soviet slave labor camps  and he still lives and works in the muffled zone where the Orwellian nightmare of history rewritten is daily reality. His lecture is in part an expression of thanks to the world public opinion that has protected my work and freedom and in part an explanation of why constant persecution does not induce him to put his neck into the yoke all officially approved Soviet writers must accept.

title: BRAZIL REJECTS CALL FOR VOTE ON DIVORCE
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 26 (AP)Brazil is the biggest country in the world where divorce is impossible, and it looks as if things will stay that way.

title: Switzerland to Cut Herd Of Deer Over Five Years
description: ZERNEZ, Switzerland, Aug. 26 (AP)Bowing to widespread criticism, authorities have revised plans for reducing drastically the number of red deer in the Swiss National Park.

title: RAINTREE'S HOPE YORKERS VICTOR
description: YONKERS, N. Y., Aug. 26Raintree's Hope led almost all the way to score a head victory over Nancy Isle in the $25,000 Empire Pacing Series final tonight at Yonkers Raceway..

title: Pop
description: RANDY BURNS: I'm A Lover, Not A Fool (Polydor, PD 5030). The average pop album featuring a vocalist has two or three good tracks and another nine or ten to fill the gaps in between. What sets a particular album (positively) apart from most is having either more than the usual number of good cuts or above average filler material. I'm A Lover, Not A Fool has both qualities, and offers us a well rounded view of Randy Burns as a songwriter as well.

title: Kennedy Wins Hydro Race
description: SYLVAN BEACH, N. Y., Aug 26 (AP)Art Kennedy of St. Louis won the American Power Boat Association's national outboard pleasure craft race for unlimited boats today on Oneida Lake.

title: Notes:
description: VIORE and more airports across the United States are imposing taxes of $1 or more on departing passengers, but relief appears to be in sightboth for the passengers, who have had to pay the levies, and for the airlines, which in most cases have had to do the collecting and contend that the task has added heavily to their operating costs.

title: Massage Parlor Raided; Girls and $17,000 Seized
description: A police raid early yesterday morning on a socalled massage parlor in the Times Square area revealed profits or midtown pornography far beyond what the police had believed and indications that the operators might be filming and taping customers actions for potential blackmail.

title: YACHTS FIGHT CALM IN 126MILE RACE
description: RYE, N.Y., Aug. 26There was no report from the course today on the progress of the American Yacht Club's overnight race for the Roger Sherman Trophy, which already had become the slowest in the fouryear history of the 126mile event on Long Island Sound.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Yea, Joan! It's about time someone punctured these women's balloons....

title: JAPAN AND KOREA CURBING ENMITY
description: TOKYO, Aug. 26A Japanese high school allstar baseball team is scheduled to go to South Korea next month to compete with a Korean allstar tram in a threegame series. Next year, the South Koreans plan to come to Japan for return match.

title: Tax Shelters Coming Under Scrutiny
description: Fifty men with bulging wallets and a monumental tax problem have put up $1million kitty to drill for oil in Borneo.

title: A REPORTER LOSES IN CONTEMPT CASE
description: NEWARK, Aug. 26The con tempt conviction of a New Jersey newsman for refusing to an swer questions before a grand jury about his sources of information concerning the housing authority here has been allowed to stand, at least temporarily, by a threejudge state Appellate Court.

title: FOX ALONE IN SUIT AGAINST FISCHER
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Aug. 26The Icelandic Chess Federation announced today that it would waive all shares in any law suit instituted agiinst Bobby Fischer by the attorneys of Chester Fox. In return, the attorneys have promised that no action will be taken against Fischer in Iceland.

title: U.S.and State Testing Drinking Water
description: TRENTONThe state and Federal Governments are pooling their resources for a joint study of the New Jersey's drinking water, the first program of its kind in the nation.

title: Krulevitz Beats Benovides For U.S. Open Tennis Spot
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., Aug. 26Steve Krulevitz of Baltimore defeated Ramiro Benovides of Bolivia, 76, 62, to reach the semifinals of the United States Lawn Tennis Association satellite tournament today at the Port Washington Tennis Academy. The victory qualified Krulevitz for the, United States Open championships at Forest Hills.

title: HORACE L. HOTCHKISS
description: LAKEVILLE, Conn., Aug. 26  Horace L. Hotchkiss, who held the sales franchise for northern Connecticut for Minute Maid juice products, died last night at Sharon Hospital after a long illness. He was 77 years old and lived here.

title: World News Briefs
description: ATHENS, Aug. 27 The Greek Government charged the Italian Socialist party today with financing subversion in Greece, including the abortive assassination attempt in 1968 on Premier George Papadopoulos.

title: E. K. Dey to Marry Odile Alquier
description: Mrs. Pierre Alquier of BievilleenAuge, Normandy, France, has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Odile Alquier, to Edward Knapp Dey of New York, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph C. Dey Jr. of Locust Valley, L. I. A wedding in October is planned in BievilleenAuge.

title: DENVER GOLF LED BY MISS BLALOCK
description: DENVER, Aug. 26 (AP)Jane Blalock shot a 67 today to take the lead in the $25,000 National Jewish Hospital Ladies Professional Golf tournament after 36 holes.

title: U.S. Open Net Victors Get Cash, Bonus Points
description: The United States Open tennis championships, beginning Wednesday at Forest Hills, mark the start of the homestretch in the $375,000plus Commercial Union Grand Prix for 1972.

title: Mystery Cloaks Fate Of Brain of Kennedy
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26The preserved brain of President Kennedy, plus microscopic slides of tissues removed from his bullet wounds, have been withheld, apparently by the Kennedy family, from the assassination evidence in the National Archives, a medical expert said today.

title: Pop
description: DAVID BUSKIN: David Buskin (Epic, KE 31233). David Buskin is another in the presently rising crop of singersongwriters who have abandoned straight topicality for a more general sensitivity toward life. The attitude is not one of blind acceptance or of complacency, but one which considers problems in the context of a whole experience.

title: IN THE NATION
description: MIAMI BEACHThe new Vice President Agnew positioned himself brilliantly in his acceptance address and his morningafter news conference. He will travel the high road, discussing the issues in a low key, responding only when his opponents say something scurrilous or when they inject foreign policy into politics. That leaves him all the room he needs.

title: AN HOUR'S RAIN CUTS HEAT WAVE IN REGION
description: A lateafternoon thundershower dropped nearly an inch of rain in the space of an hour yesterday, bringing the temperature and some power lines down along with the rain.

title: Shavers Outpoints Rondos
description: CANTON. Ohio, Aug. 26 (UPI)Earnie Shavers recorded a unanimous 10round decision over the former World Boxing Association lightheavyweight champion, Vicente Rondon of Venezuela, in a 10round bout tonight, In lifting his wonlost record to 432, Shavers failed for the first time in his career to knock out an opponent in winning effort. champion, Vicente Rondon of Venezuela, in a 10round bout tonight, In lifting his wonlost record to 432, Shavers failed for the first time in his career to knock out an opponent in winning effort.

title: Travel Notes: Air Piracy
description: More worrisome to airline passengers than departure taxes Is the thought of being caught in a plane hijacking. As airlines and Federal authorities step up their screening procedures, passengers are being asked to assist as follows: (1) Arrive at the airport early to allow enough time to pass through metaldetection devices and have hand luggage searched. (2) Keep hand luggage to minimum. (3) Open hand luggage upon approaching an Inspector and do not lock it until after it has been searched. (4) Remove metal objects from pockets and hold them in sight of an inspector. (5) Carry proper identification and keep it handy. (6) Retain a good humor, bearing in mind that although inspections can cause delays they may also insure an undisturbed flight.

title: Japanese Would Foil Forgers of Passports
description: TOKYO, Aug. 26 (UPI)Japan will adopt a new passport designed to foil counterfeiters as a result of the airport massacre in Israel, Foreign office sources said tihs week.

title: Education
description: Foreign languages have never been classroom favorites. Students took them as they would cod liver oiland could do little about it. But today, as part of the general youth revolution, requirements have cased and language study is a casualty.

title: Fancy Fennel from Florence
description: FINOCCHIO or Florence, fennel is a distinct vegetable not a mere herb. In uses and appearance, it is similar to celery.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Magnificent, Miss Didion! You said it for the rest of us.

title: Barbara Lane Has Wedding
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Aug. 26Miss Barbara Ainsworth Lane and Randall Scott May were married this afternoon in St. Andrew's Episcopal Church here by the Rev. Gordon Jones Jr.

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: Cultivate flower, vegetable and cutting garden plots that are unmulched; this opens and aerates the soil.... Last call to apply watersoluble foliage fertilizers to roses; this weekend or never til 73.... Last call to sow lettuce, spinach, peas and radish for late harvest.... Keep after weeds and insect pests.

title: Kathy Hellenbrand Wed To R. Michael Rocklen
description: The marriage of Miss Kathy N. Hellenbrand, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Hellenbrand, to R. Michael Rocklen, son of Mr. and Mrs. Sherman Rocklen of West Haven Conn., took place here yesterday in the BethEl Chapel of Temple EmanuEl. The Rev. Dr. Nathan A. Perilman performed the ceremony.

title: City Improves MaternityLeave Rules
description: Improved maternity leave policies to provide better medical coverage, employment protection and other benefits for pregnant city employes will go into effect Friday under a personnel order announced yesterday by Mayor Lindsay.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  There has emerged a friendly disagreement between the head of the Treasury and the head of the Federal Reserve Board over the seriousness of a problem that is new in Government policy.

title: Joe Page Lauds the Lyle Style, Gives Successor A for Attitude
description: Joe Page, who popularized the modern art of relief pitching 25 years ago, feels that Sparky Lyle, latest in a long line of bull pen specialists for the New York Yankees, deserves a big A for attitude.

title: Navy Officer Plans to Wed Miss Danaher
description: MERIDEN, Conn., Aug. 26 Mr. and Mrs. Francis R. Danaher have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss D. Alannah Danaher, to Lieut. Comdr. George H. Coshow 2d, U. S. N., an instructor in engineering on the staff of the Naval Destroyer School at Newport, R.I.

title: Wendy Christina Meyer Is Bride
description: WELLESLEY, Mass., Aug. 26Miss Wendy Christina Meyer and Anthony Wyckoff Woodfield were married here this afternoon. The Rev. Theodore Clapp, a Congregational minister performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Norman Meyer.

title: For Nixonpity, contempt and grudging admiration
description: He has been a headline figure for two decades, dominant in the public consciousness longer than was Franklin Delano Roosevelt. But because he is a mysterious presence, Richard Nixon seems knowable only through his past and present evocations. Every American must have his own imagery of the man, a vision that turns out to be discordanteither too harsh or too gentle a judgment.

title: Soviet Renews Campaign Of Polemics Against China
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 26The So viet press, after a summer lull in the mutual propaganda war with China, has mounted a new campaign, accusing Peking of being in league with the capitalist nations of Western Europe against the Communist countries of Eastern Europe.

title: Rinks Are Jammed As Hockey Booms
description: NEWARKHundreds of youngsters across northern New Jersey have abandoned their swimsuits for ice skates and hockey sticks, and are getting a fast start on what promises to be the busiest icehockey season in the state's history.

title: Child to LeniadoChiras
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Aug. 26A daughter was born on Aug. 3 to Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Leniado Chira of Greenwich, in the Greenwich Hospital.

title: The Nation
description: MIAMI BEACH  The candidates themselves have now defined the situation best. The central issue of this campaign, said George McGovern upon his nomination here six weeks ago, is Richard Nixon. And the central issue of this campaign, replied Mr. Nixon upon his renomination here last week, is George McGovern.

title: Knapp Panel's Recommendation a T ouchy Problem for Mayor and Governor
description: The Knapp Commission's recommendation for a special state anticorrption investigator is proving to be one of the touchiest, most studied problems of recent months for aides of Governor Rockefeller and Mayor Lindsay.

title: Review 1  No Title
description: After photographing the war in Vietnam from 1967 through 1971, Welshman Philip Jones Griffiths is an angry man. His magnificent and heartrending pictures in Vietnam Inc. (cloth, Macmillan, $7.95; paper, Collier Books, $3.95) testify to his horror at the corruption and the killing and his compassion for the victims. He is appalled at what he sees as the stupidity of the policies that have kept Vietnam a battleground and destroyed its peopletheir traditions and their countryside. Photographs like the above and on the cover of this issue are accompanied by a text and captions that further reveal his bitterness: 'Motivating the American soldier to fight was cause of great concern. One view was that they should be made to stay until the war was won. Considering what carnage was caused by somewhat lazy and goodhumored G.I.'s the Vietnamese people can only be thankful for their lack of motivation. His observations and the conclusions he has reached are subjective where Miss FitzGerald's are objective, yet they are so similar to hers that Vietnam Inc. makes a logical companion volume to Fire in the Lake.

title: That Moored Hulk Helped Beat Rommel
description: WEEHAWKEN  On a rainy day here, the downspout on the bridge deck of the old Seatrain Texas leaks and the wet, peeling red paint on her open deck looks like a sea of red mud.

title: Cubs Top Giants, 109
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 26 (AP)Joe Pepitone was hit by a pitch with the bases loaded, forcing in the winning run in the 10th inning to give the Chicago Cubs a 109 victory over the San Francisco Giants today.

title: To be read for the who as much as the what
Wagner, Queens Enter College Hockey Loop
description: The Metropolitan Intercollegiate Hockey League has added Wagner and Queens Colleges and dropped Stony Brook and Newark College of Engineering. Queens College joins Nassau Community College, St. John's, Brooklyn College, St. Francis and City College in the Eastern Division, while Wagner College is in the Western Division with Fairfield University, the University of Bridgeport, Iona College, Manhattan College and Fordham University. The league will open its sixth season Oct. 9 with each team playing a 22game schedule.

title: Laviano Captures 2 Awards
description: BELLPORT, L.I., Aug. 262Ed Laviano sailed his catamaran Tornado No. 251 home first today and saved enough of his handicap to capture two awards in the annual QueenoftheBay multihull race of the Great South Bay Yacht Racing Association.

title: W.S.Poole Marries Judith K. Costello
description: CRESCENT, N.Y., Aug. 26  Miss Judith Kathryn Costello and William Sidney Poole, son of Mrs. Sidney S. Poole of Montreal and the late Mr. Poole, were married here this morning in St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Anthony Diacetis, who also celebrated the nuptial mass.

title: Ann Arbor Adopts Penguin
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Aug. 26 (AP)Since everything about the penguin is clearly black or white and because it is considered to be a strange bird, the Ann Arbor Planning Commission has declared the penguin its official bird. Commissioner Douglas Crary said that there are three kinds of penguinsemperor, jackass and blue. The commissioners didn't specify which one they were adopting as their official bird.

title: Former Addicts Are Singing a Different Tune
description: COPIAGUE, L. I.Brother Ross Davi goes strictly by the book in dealing with the problems of young people. Mr. Davi, pastor of the Full Gospel Christian Chtfrch here in Copiague, says that the Bible is relevant to the problems of widespread drug addiction and alcoholism among today's youth.
