title: COSMOS CONQUER STARS FOR TITLE
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Aug. 26The New York Cosmos became the North American Soccer League champions tonight by defeating the St. Louis Stars, 21, at Hofstra before 6,102 fans.

title: Fire at Jersey Airport
description: LUMBERTON, N. J., Aug. 26 (AP)  A fire swept through a hangar at the Burlington County Air Park here early today, damaging the structure and three planes. The flames also damaged the offices, flight communications center and a restaurant at the private air field.

title: Bicycling Officers Cut. Thefts in Central Park
description: In New York's Central Park Precinct, a popular hunting ground for bicycle thieves, reported thefts fell by onethird from 189 to 133during the first six months of this year, compared with the same period last year, after bikeriding plainclothesmen began patrolling the park in search of bicycle thieves.

title: Pop
description: JIM CROCE: Don't Mess Around With Jim (ABC ABCX 756). Comparisons in this business are inevitable, so when I say James Taylor fans will probably enjoy the songs of a man named Jim Croce, I don't mean to impugn the individuality of either artist. It's just that Croce sounds a lot like Taylor, down to little hums and unhunhs tagged onto the ends of lines. Croce's album is aptly titled You Don't Mess Around With Jim and includes several highenergy songs about broken loves and hardtimes losers like the poolhall shark of the title number.

title: Hospitals Corporation, Emerging From Deficit Operation, to End Hiring Freeze
description: After its first two years of troubled operation, the city's Health and Hospitals Corporation has emerged from deficits and has told its 18 hospitals there were discretionary funds  amounts unspecified to improve services.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 26 (AP)The Australian swimming sensation, Shane Gould, has entered five individual events in the Olympic Games, the swimming draw revealed today. The 15yearold Miss Gould will shoot for gold medals in freestyle races at 100, 200, 400 and 800 meters and the 200meter individual medley.

title: PINSCHER JUDGED AS BEST IN SHOW
description: NEWTON, Conn., Aug. 26In the 22d annual Newton Kennel Club show, Ch. Rosedale Dark Temptation was judged best in a field of 1,517 dogs today.

title: U.S. STAR FELLED BY LUNG AILMENT
description: MUNICH, West Germany Aug. 25 (AP)A United States swimmer, Steve Genter, collapsed during a workout for the Olympic Games and became an uncertain starter because of lung ailment, an American trainer said today.

title: Granger Rejoins Oilers
description: KERRVILLE, Tex., Aug. 28 (AP)Hoyle Granger, who left the Houston Oilers in a trade in 1970 to the New Orleans Saints, was back in the Oiler camp today. Granger, a running back, was cut by the Saints.

title: McGovern Fund Raisers Named for State Campaign
description: Cyrus R. Vance, the former deputy secretary of defense and envoy to the Paris peace talks au Vietnam, and Mrs. Mathilde run, ?? and author, were ??amed yesterday to head Sen??tor George McGovern's drive for campaign funds in this State.

title: FORDHAM ELEVEN TO FACE 10 RIVALS
description: Fordham's varsity football team will play a 10game schedule this fallthe most games in 50 yearsand six of these will be at home, the most in Fordham's 92year football history.

title: A REPORTER LOSES IN CONTEMPT CASE
description: NEWARK, Aug. 26The contempt conviction of a New Jersey newsman for refusing to answer questions before a grand jury about his sources of information concerning the housing authority here has been allowed to stand, at least temporarily, by a threejudge state Appellate Court.

title: Like to Race Autos? It Can Cost Over a Million a Year
description: Vel Miletich is one of the big men of auto racing both physically and financially.

title: Profit Pinch May End Lakes'
description: FRANKFORT, Mich., Aug. 26  The oldest fleet of automobile ferries on the Great Lakes may soon steam out of this tiny Lake Michigan harbor for the last time, a victim of a costconscious railroad's struggle to turn a profit.

title: Women Foresee Approval Of Sex Amendment by May
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26 (AP) The League of Women Voters predicted today ratification by next May of the equal rights constitutional amendment.

title: Widowhood Led to a Thriving Business
description: WOODBURY, Conn.  The sign over the shop on Main Street here reads Escargo. The missing T at the end of the French word for snail (escargot) bothers Kaye Lee no end. It used to bother her husband, the late Manfred Lee (who was half of the writing team of Ellery Queen) even more.

title: HERBERT KERKOW
description: Herbert Kerkow, a producer of educational films, died yesterday in New Milford (Conn.) Hospital. He was 68 years old and lived in Pawling, N. Y.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Everytime someone moves, it's classic, they buy furniture, Allen MacKenzie, president of Drexel. Enterprises, the furnishings division of Champion International, said last week.

title: RIBBON CAPTURES HORSE SHOW TITLE
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Aug 26 Ribbon owned by the Kent School, piled up all his points by winning the first three classes and captured the junior jumper championship at the end of the twoday Fairfield County Hunt Club horse show today.

title: Betterton, Generously, Still Calls Itself a Resort
description: It Is Labor Day, 30 or so years ago. The members of the International Ladies Garment Workers Union are catching an early morning steamboat out of Baltimore, going down to the shore; many have their nieces and nephews along. On board the boat, a man is alternately playing a banjo and an electric organ. The trip takes about three hours, but so what? Everybody is having a good time, and there are brown paper bags containing lots of food.

title: The World
description: KAMPALA, Uganda They came from India in the early 19th century to set up shops in Zanzibar. They prospered, serving as bankers and moneylenders, acting as agents for British merchant firms, developing into a powerful community of British subjects who were usedquietly, perhaps unwittinglyto extend British political influence in the age of European imperialism.

title: Thomas Triumphs In O'Day Cup Sail; Thompson Second
description: RICHMOND, Calif., Aug. 26 (AP)Gary Jebsen of Toms River, N. J., came in third yesterday in the North American smallboat sailing champion. ship, which ended the O'Day Cup competition that began Tuesday.

title: Self Favored in Bout
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 26 (UPI)Louis Self, a featherweight from Toledo, Ohio, will be the only American competing in the opening program of the Olympic boxing tournament today. Self is favored over Maurice Apeang of France.

title: Ft. Lauderdale Gets $5Million Show
description: With the multitude of boat shows coming up this fall, both in the water and indoors, it would seem difficult to come up with a new gimmick in that line. But Peter J. Carroll and F. Jerry Wood have in announcing the American Yacht Brokerage Show for Fort Lauderdale,

title: Funds Lost, Library to Go on
description: FREEHOLD  The Monmouth County Library, one of the oldest county library systems in the state, expects to have to struggle for existence with a smaller budget next year, following the loss of its largest contributor, Neptune.

title: The Nation
description: Despite her homey nickname, Ma Bell  the telephone company  is probably the least loved of all American business firms. Especially in New York, where phone service is the butt of bitter jokes, the nation's most powerful utility has never had an easy time convincing consumers that it is doing the best it can to help them communicate.

title: Italian Jews, Disturbed by a Spate of AntiSemitism, Regard NeoFascist Sentiment as a Major Cause
description: ROME, Aug. 26  After centuries of experience, said Mrs. Leontina Levi, a secretary to the Rome rabbi, we Italian Jews can tell by the air if it is a good period or bad period. And this is a bad one. Why just recently, the head rabbi said to me, Here we go again.'

title: ...And the Mexico of Violence In the Night
description: YOU are an American? the taxi driver asked at the airport in Mexico City. Then, without waiting for my reply, You are here to stay?

title: The Last Word
description: Frances FitzGerald's Fire in the Lake: The Vietnamese and the Americans in Vietnam, reviewed on Page 1 by Stanley Hoffmann this week, is dedicated To the memory of my father and Paul Mus. As Deputy Director of the Central Intelligence Agency, the late Desmond FitzGerald briefed Defense Secretary McNamara on Vietnam intelligence each week. He once stopped McNamara as he was scribbling down facts and figures, and asked if he might venture a personal opinion. The situation would get worse, FitzGerald said, despite the official optimism in all the charts and computer printouts. Startled, McNamara asked for reasons. FitzGerald replied that it was an intuition, based on his experience. McNamara was appalled, and FitzGerald did not brief McNamara again.

title: 2 McGovern Fund Raisers Named for State Campaign
description: Cyrus R. Vance, the former deputy secretary of defense and envoy to the Paris peace talks on Vietnam, and Mrs. Mathilde Krim, scientist and author, were named yesterday to head Senator George McGovern's drive for campaign funds in this state.

title: MIAMI BEACH
description: MIAMI BEACHAt no time since he came into public life has Richard Nixon dominated American politics as he does today, and yet he is still not using his vast power and prestige to unify the nation.

title: Carlton Pitches 21st Victory, With Help, as Phils Top Reds
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 26 (AP)Steve Carlton won his 21st game with ninthinning relief help from Pat Scarce as the Philadelphia Phillies nipped the Cincinnati Reds, 43 tonight.

title: Evonne Goolagong to Receive Award Here for Achievements
description: Evonne Goolagong, 21yearold daughter of an aboriginal, shepherd, who rose from the red clay of an old Australian outback court to the championship of Wimbledon, will be honored tomorrow in New York for her achievements in tennis.

title: Dressage to Open Equestrian Events In the Olympics
description: The equestrian division of the Olympic games gets under way in Munich on Tuesday with the dressage section of the threeday competition.

title: St. John Takes Over Lead
description: WEST BABYLON, L. I., Aug 26Frank St. John of Babylon sailed his Tomahawk to a first and a third place today to take the lead in the Narrasketuck Class national championship series. The defending champion Jim Grover, also of Babylon, had a fourth and a third today and is third in the series behind Bill Pagels of West Sayville The series concludes with one race tomorrow.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONOn any given work day Americans make 25 billion measurements: Peering at the thermometer outside the kitchen window; folding tablespoons of sugar into cake batter; putting exactly four ounces of gin into a martini; taping their waistlines for a new suit.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In her essayreview The Women's Movement (July 30), based on 15 books dealing with that subject, novelist Joan Didion drew specific conclusions on its collective inchoate yearnings for fulfillment.

title: Sara Holcomb Wed To Richard Collins
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., Aug. 26  Miss Sara Wren Holcomb, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert L. Holcomb, was married here this afternoon to Richard James Collins of Stowe, Vt., son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward, William Collins of Marion, Mass. Msgr. Thomas F. Henahan performed the ceremony in Our Lady of the Assumption Roman Catholic Church.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Joan Didion's comments fairly bristle with impatience: at minorities for not pressing on beyond the attainment of material goods; at women for getting hung up in fantasies (to become a star, to have fun); for not being strong enough to repel the sexual hostility of construction workers  whom she apparently views as a healthy proletariat.

title: SHOP TALK
description: LEDGEWOOD  Except for antiques hunters often 4ealers from the citie,s  most visitors to this small community (population 1,000) in Roxbury Township have friends who live here.

title: Dr. Waiter D.Netimann Marries Miss Anne Waldron
description: PRINCETON, N.., Aug 26Miss Anne Goddard Waldron and Dr. Walter David Neumann of Canberra, Australia, a visiting member of the Institute for Advanced Study at Princeton, were married here at noon today. The ceremony was performed in the garden of the home of the bride's parents by the Rev. Joseph. Harrison of Trinity Episcopal Church.

title: City Council Hearings Scheduled This Week
description: Following are the public hearings scheduled for this week by City Council Committees:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The Bretton Woods Conference of 1944 was doomed from the start. It fixed monetary exchange rates with the dollar, the world's principal trading currency, which, however, was pegged tightly to gold, and in turn, all other currencies were pegged to the dollar.

title: The Campaign Issues
description: In what was probably the most proficiently controlled and smoothly contrived national convention in American political history, the Republican party last week went through the formality of renominating Richard M. Nixon for President and Spiro T. Agnew for Vice President the United States, and of adopting a platform and party rules tailormade in the White House.

title: Nevada Gambling Record
description: CARSON CITY, Nev., Aug. 26 (UPI)Gambling casino operators in Nevada raked a record $657.7million during the fiscal year coding June 31, it was reported yesterday. State officials said the amount was 12 per cent over the figure for the previous year.

title: The World
description: MOSCOW  The fourth anniversary of the Sovietled invasion of Czechoslovakia almost slipped by unnoticed here last week until 37 hardy Soviet intellectuals and civilrights campaigners used the occasion to raise a protest against the new round of political trials in Prague. We realize with particular bitterness that the Soviet Union, which sent its troops into Czechoslovakia four years ago, thus bears full responsibility for the current situation in that country, including the political trials now under way, they declared in an open letter to the Czechoslovak National Assembly.

title: City Gets Warning On 6 Stolen Vials Of Hepatitis Serum
description: The city's Commissioner of Health warned last night that anyone coming into contact with hepatitis serum in six vials stolen in Brooklyn Friday  or even the empty vials who could contract the dangerous and often fatal disease.

title: Jurgensen Agrees to Pact
description: WASHINGTON, Aug 26 (UPI) Sonny Jurgensen said today he had agreed to a new oneyear contract with the Washington Redskins The contract was believed to be about $125, 000. The 3Syear old Jurgensen is trying to win his job back after sitting out most of last season with a shoulder injury.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The real significance of the Indochina war has never been a question of money, as the Pentagon's The Economics of Defense Spending now implies (news story Aug. 11), for even if the Nixon Administration could gratuitously inflict the misery it has visited on the Indochinese people could not make the war one iota less abominable. But the Pentagon's release of highly dubious figures it insisted on classifying secret until now smacks of the crudest electionyear politics.

title: EDUCATORS DECRY TUITION TAX PLAN FOR UNIVERSITIES
description: EVANSTON. III., Aug. 26This city's 10,000 college students face the prospect of paying a $30 annual tuition tax this year under a proposed ordinance nearing a vote in the City Council.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONWhile the Republicans danced on his grave at Miami Beach last week, George McGovern gave signs that he may be a livelier corpse than they had suspected.

title: British Stake in Uganda
description: LONDON, Aug. 26  A spokesman for the Foreign Office said tonight that British investment in Uganda had been estimated to range from $25million to $35million.

title: NIXON IS STALLED ON 2D BALLOT LINE
description: Talks between the state Re publican and Conservative par ties on a possible Conservative endorsement of President Nixon have run into snags that are jeopardizing the President's chances of getting a second line on the state ballot on Nov. 7

title: The World
description: RABAT  Some 50 foreign and local journalists were invited to King Hassan's guest palace last Monday for a press conference. Admitted by way of the palace kitchens, the newsmen heard a royal speech in which the King averred puzzlement over the motives of those in his armed forces who have twice tried to kill him in an attack on his summer palace at Skhirat last September and in an air force attack on his plane 11 days ago as he was returning from a visit to Paris. Neither in the speech nor in the questionandanswer period that followed was there any hint that the King had examined his conscience to see whether the attempts on his life might have been the outcome of any actions or policies of his own.

title: C. J. Hausmann Plans to Marry Julilly Kohler
description: KOHLER, Wis., Aug. 26 Mrs. John Michael Kohler has made known the engagement of her daughter, Miss Julilly Waller Kohler, to Charles Joseph Hausmann, son of Mr. and Mrs. Theodore L Hausmann of Brookfield.

title: Quangtri Fighting Heavy; Queson Gain Is Reported
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sunday, Aug. 27 (AP)Heavy fighting was reported in and around the provincial capital of Quangtri yesterday, while more than 100 miles to the south Government units reported continuing progress in their efforts to recapture the strategic Queson Valley.

title: DrugLinked Slaying of Girl Unsolved
description: YELLOW SPRINGS, Ohio, Aug. 26  Deborah Gail Rubenfeld, of 1200 East 53d Street, Brooklyn, completed her courses at Samuel J. Tilden High School in three and a half years. She never earned less than an A and graduated as valedictorian of her class in January, 1971, at the age of 16.

title: Amin Plans Uganda TakeOver of Foreign Businesses
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Aug. 26 (Reuters)President Id Amin said today that his plans for black Ugandans to take over foreignowned businesses would be extended to include European enterprises whether they like it or not.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: Don Durgin answers the question Is Anyone Still Interested in TV? (July 23) with a ringing affirmative, citing figures to prove that viewing is on the increase. Not only that, he tells us, but acceptance is growing on the part of highest income families.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: During the last decade, an oyster thief has endangered the already faltering East Coast shellfish industry.

title: 2 Scoring Passes to Siani Help Raiders Rout Bills, 3113
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Aug. 26 (AP)  Mike Siani, Oakland's prize rookie receiver, caught two touchdown passes against Buffalo today and the Raiders defense dropped opposing backs nine times in a 3113 preseason victory over the Bills.

title: Japanese Car Revs Up Sales
description: From zero to 40,000. That was the message behind last week's announcement by Mazda Motors of America that it had signed an initial group of 22 East Coast dealers to sell Mazda automobiles, most of them powered by the Wankel rotary engine.

title: Investigators Say Collusive Bids on Nassau School Buses Add Millions to Cost
description: The State Commission of Investigation reported yesterday that collusive bidding by schoolbus bus operators in Nassau County) was costing the state and local school districts millions of dollars in excessive schooltransportation costs.

title: Judo Tourney Set Sept. 4
description: The Judo Association of New York will hold a junior tournament on Sept. 4 in conjunction with the Jerry Lewis Telethon for Muscular Dystrophy. The judo event, starting at noon, will take place at the McBurney Branch of the Young Men's Christian Association, 215 West 23d. Street.

title: TOMBSTONE CALLS ABEL BRITISHBORN
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 26 (AP) Col. Rudolf Ivanovich Abel, the Soviet master spy whose impeccable English and intimate knowledge of Western ways permitted him to melt into American life for almost nine years, had an invaluable asset: He was born and reared in England.

title: Junk Cars Buried at Sea
description: HONOLULU, Aug. 26 (AP)Hawaiians are involved in a campaign to rid the state of thousands of rusting, abandoned cars by burying them at sea. The main idea is to get these unsightly things out of front yards so you don't have to stare at a junk car every time you want to take a look at Diamond Head, said Eddie Anderson, chairman of the drive, which has enlisted more than 2,000 volunteers.

title: Photography
description: AFTER a book leaves here, it's for whatever anyone wants to use it for. I'd love to have the facts on where ray books are... I had a daydream once not long ago about an imaginary person known as the Information Man, and I wrote it down. Let me read it to you.

title: City Losses Placed Above $3.5Million On Queens Project
description: The proposed compromise in the Forest Hills public housing controversy will cost the city at least $3.5million and possibly as much as $9.7million, according to Housing Authority estimates made available yesterday.

title: Lady Chatterley's predecessor
description: Lady Chatterley is back. Her reappearance calls for a bit of history. Between 1925 and 1928, D. H. Lawrence wrote three versions of a novel; and in the last year published the third of these in Europe as Lady Chatterley's Lover. No publisher in the Englishspeaking world dared touch it. Copies shipped to England and America were seized by customs officers who, Lawrence suspected, were selling them on the sly for a tidy profit.

title: Liquid  Lunch Is lt an Asset?
description: Was it Cardinal Spellman, Winston Churchill or someone else who precipitated a crisis at the Chase Manhattan Bank by calling for a sherry before lunch in the chairman's dining room?

title: MANHATTAN CLUB STARTS PRACTICE
description: In preparation for its longest schedule ever as a club team10 games, seven of them on the road  Manhattan College's football squad started preseason practice Friday with double workouts.

title: U. S. vs. Morocco
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 26 (Reuters)A capacity crowd of 80,000 is expected at the Olympic Stadium tomorrow when the 16nation soccer tournament kicks off.

title: As Phase III approaches:
description: WASHINGTON: The United States has now had a year of tasting the heady, sometimes sour, wine of price and wage controls for the first time ever in what is essentially peacetime, and with a partially slack, nonbooming economy to boot. Will we come to like themor if not like them, accept them as a necessary evil for the indefinite future?

title: Brenda Moore Is Wed on
description: OYSTER BAY, L. I., Aug. 26  Miss Brenda Lynn Moore, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Lee S. Moore of Hoeilaart, Belgium, formerly of Mill Neck, was married here this morning to Peter Kevin Cherry, son of Mr. and Mrs. Francis Cherry Of Hicksville.

title: Tears Replace the Coffee Cakes On Ebinger Bakeries'
description: The Ebinger Baking Company, a Brooklyn institution since 1898, sold the last of pineapplecrunch cakes and pecan coffee rings yesterday and went the way of the Navy Yard, the Dodgers and Luna Park.

title: Three Young Men Arrested In Drug Raid in Westport
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Aug 26Three young men were arrested and 100 pounds of marijuana was allegedly seized in a raid at a home here last night by the Westport police, Federal narcotics agents and police officials from Westchester County and Tarrytown in New York.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: NICOSIA, CyprusThe appearance of change in the Mediterranean power balance produced by Russian military eviction from Egypt has not inspired in Cyprus any desire to abandon its policy of nonalignment, according to Archbishop Makarios, only President this little country has ever had.

title: Jean Gertmenian a Bride in Jersey
description: SHORT HILLS, N.J., Aug 26Miis Jean Veronica Gertmenian, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Roy Z. Gertmenian, was married here this afternoon to Paul Frederick Speidell, son of Mrs. Henry Speidell of Livingston and the late Mr. Speidell.

title: More Aid Flood Victims
description: Three more city housing and plumbing inspectors of the Buildings Department were sent to WilkesBarre, Pa., last week to help victims of the June floods, Buildings Commissioner Joseph Stein said yesterday. The three joined 12 fellow workers in assisting local residents in installing prefabricated houses and maintaining trailers.

title: NixonDrive Aide Is Named
description: Governor Rockefeller yesterday announced the appointment of G. Collins Lyden of Loudonville as Northeastern New York regional campaign chairman for the reelection of President Nixon. Mr. Rockefeller is chairman of the New York Committee to Reelect the President. Mr. Lyden will be responsible for volunteer activities in 10 counties: Clinton, Essex, Warren, Saratoga, Washington, Rensselaer, Albany, Schenectady, Schoharie and Otsego.

title: COWBOYS'
description: IRVING, Tex., Aug. 26Mike Montgomery, the running back Dallas acquired from San Diego in the deal for Duane Thomas, scored three times in the last quarter to lead the Cowboys to a 3427 victory over the New York Jets tonight before a sellout crowd of, 65,386 in Texas! Stadium.

title: Civilization Bedevils A Modern Noah's Ark
description: MARSEILLES, France, Aug. 26 (Reuters)  A modern Noah's Ark discharged its cargo of 93 zebras, giraffes and other African wild animals this week after a 40day quarantine. Almost immediately, it ran into another problem of modern civilization.

title: Yawkey of Red Sox Gets Surprise Party
description: BOSTON, Aug. 26 (AP)Tom Yawkey, who has made a habit of shunning personal publicity as owner of the Boston Red Sox, was saluted at a surprise testimonial dinner tonight after his team's dramatic 76 victory over the Texas Rangers.

title: Bill to Protect Shore Softened
description: TRENTON  Assembly Speaker Thomas. S. Kean disclosed here this weekendthat he was prepared to accept an administrationbacked compromise that would soften his legislative proposal to ban heavy industry from much of New Jersey's remaining undeveloped coastline.

title: Anne Rosenberg Marries in Cincinnati
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 26Miss Anne Elizabeth Rosenberg daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Lee Sander Rosenberg, was married here this evening to Charles Lieberman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leo Lieberman of Brooklyn. Rabbi Harold Hahn performed the ceremony in the chapel of the Rockdale Temple.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: When a former partisan of National Review attacks Women's Lib for daring to disobey Marxist notions of class, I know at whose door to lay the charge of intellectual rigidity. The Conversion of Joan Didion by Joan Baez, painted by herself a few years back, has now assumed truly religious proportions. It is always the problem of converts that they are the first to wage war against another's heresy...

title: Mrs. King, Mrs. Court Reach Tennis Final at Newport
description: NEWPORT, R.I., Aug. 26 Mrs. Billie Jean King, the favorite, and Mrs. Margaret Court won decisively today and advanced to the finals of the Virginia Slims grass court tennis tournament. Mrs. King defeated Julie Heldman, 60, 63, and Mrs. Court beat secondseeded Chris Evert, 63, 60.

title: Heavy Rains in the Sudan Said to Destroy 3 Villages
description: CAIRO, Aug. 26 (AP) Heavy rains destroyed three villages on the outskirts of Khartoum, the Middle East News Agency reported from the Sudanese capital today.

title: JULIUS KAZIN
description: SPRINGFIELD, N. J., Aug. 26 Julius Kazin, an attorney and manager of the professional office of the New Jersey Department of Labor and Industry in Newark, died yesterday in St. Barnabas Medical Center, Livingston. He was 63 years old and lived at 100 Stone Hill Road.

title: Black Theater, Bourgeois Critics
description: IN the midsixties when most of the now working Black artists entered what soon became known as the Black Theater Movement, there was an open contempt from the Negro middleclass, or Black bourgeois class, for this artistic and psychic thrust of Black intellectual selfdetermination growing out of the Black Power impulse of the day.

title: DANNY M'FAYDEN, 67, EXYANKEE PITCHER
description: BRUNSWICK, Me., Aug. 26Daniel K. MacFayden, who pitched for the New York Yankees in the 30's during 17year bigleague career and later coached Bowdoin College's varsity for 23 years, died in Brunswick Hospital today. He was 67 years old.

Fourth floor, Bergdorf Goodman, midSeptember. Shoes, David Evins. Hat, Bob Greene for Irene of New York. title: Eleanor Bertha Wed
description: YONKERS Aug 26Miss Eleanor Bertha daughter of Mrs. Michael Bertha and the late Mr. Bertha was married here this morning in the Holy Trinity Lutheran Church to James Lee Lisher of New York, son of Mr. and Mrs. Claude G. Lisher of Topeka, Kan. The Rev. Thomas Soltis performed the ceremony.

title: Nixon Scored by Proxmire On BudgetBusting Charge
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26 (AP) Senator William Proxmire, Democrat of Wisconsin, said today that the Nixon Administration was engaged in political hogwash in blaming Congress for budgetbusting spending.

title: Jersey Woman Scores Ace
description: DEAL, N. J., Aug. 26 Mrs. Emmett Altschul of the Hollywood Golf Club made her first holeinone last week. Playing the 140yard, par3 fourth hole of the course, Mrs. Altschul sent her shot into the cup with a No. 7 wood. Playing in her threesome were Mrs. Henry Doubilet and Mrs. Caesar Kimmel.

description: MILWAUKEE, Aug. 26 (UPI) Jim Colborn and Frank Linzy combined on a threehitter in the nightcap to give the Milwaukee Brewers a 40 victory and a split of their doubleheader with Chicago today loiter the White Sox had won the opener, 31, in 13 innings.The split, however, gave the White Sox a 1game lead over Oakland in the American League West.

title: All Lanes of Span to Be Open
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 26 (AP)All seven lanes of the Walt Whitman Bridge between here and Camden, N. J., will be open for Labor Day weekend traffic, the Delaware River Port Authority has announced.

description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26The General Accounting Office said today that apparent and possible violations of the Federal Election Campaign Act had been committed by the Finance Committee to Reelect the President.

description: CAPE ELIZABETH, Me., Aug. 26Miss Stewart Spencer and Dr. William Seth Lieber plan to be married in December. Mr. and Mrs. Edgar A. Spencer have announced their daughter's engagement to the son of Dr. and Mrs. Leon Lieber of Englewood, N. J.

description: OAKLAND, Aug. 26 (AP)Doubles by Brooks Robinson and Paul Blair sparked a fourrun Baltimore ninth inning as the Orioles defeated the Oakland A's, 51, today.

title: Felicity Forbes Is Married To John Barber in Bay State
description: SOUTH DARTMOUTH Mass., Aug. 26St Aidan's Episcopal Chapel was the setting here this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Felicity Irene Forbes, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alexander Cochrane Forbes, to John Tippett Barber, son of Mr. and Mrs. George Fox Barber of Sewickley, Pa. The ceremony was performed by the Right Rev. J. Brooke Mosley, president, of Union Theological Seminary in New York, former Episcopal Bishop in charge of the Convocation of American Churches in Europe and

title: Pop
description: ARLO GUTHRIE: Hobo's Lullaby (Reprise, MS 2060). The air of casualness at Arlo Guthrie's recent performance has been transposed on this album into a friendliness which begs you to just sit down and join in. It is not a simple record, yet there is a folksy quality to it that remains constant; nothing sounds rehearsed, but everything comes off solidly and well structured.

title: Sensor Will Sound Alarm for Floods
description: GREEN BROOKA sensing device for early flood warning has been installed on the banks of the Green Brook in the Watchung Mountains, north of Route 22.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I quote from a letter from my 20yearold daughter:

title: Oscar Levant 190672
description: WHEN I first met Oscar Levant in California the mid1940's, I was terrified. Oscar was at the height of his national fame as a mercurial badboy Renaissance man, with a farranging intellect and shattering wit. He had a quality that has best been described by Kenneth Tynan in his analysis of Laurence Olivier's art when he noted that an essential attribute of a great actor is the mysterious ability transmit to an audience a feeling of imminent dangera sense that he was liable suddenly to do something totally unpredictable and devastating.

title: Anne Harrison Is Bride
description: JENKINTOWN, Pa., Aug. 26 Miss Ann Louise Harrison and Dennis James Lewis were married here today by the Rev. Theodore Loder, a Methodist minister. The ceremony was written by the couple. Mrs. Lewis is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Henry Van Arnum Harrison of Abington. Mr. Harrison is sales manager of Shepard Niles Crane and Hoist Corporation. Mr. Lewis is a son of Dr. and Mrs. Alexander Lewis Jr. of Pittsburgh and Danville, Pa. His father is president of the Gulf Oil Corporation Foundation.

title: GREAT DANE TAKES DELAWARE HONORS
description: HARRINGTON, Del., Aug. 26 A Great Dane, Ch. Heirere'd Kolyer Kimbayh, owned by Dr. and Mrs. James Gribbin of Trenton, won his sixth best in show tonight at the Mispillion Kennel Club event.

title: Divorces In Haiti Outlawed By State
description: A Superior Court judge has ruled quick Haitian divorces invalid in New Jersey and banned the operations of a travel agency that was selling package divorce tours.

title: Bicker, $9.80, Triumphs
description: DEL MAR, Calif., Aug. 26 Bicker, ridden by Glen Brogan, beat Burt Bacharach's Oh Hello by 100BD lengthse today in the $43,950 Del Mar Derby. The favored Solar Salute was ninth in the field of a dozen 3yearholds. Bicker paid $9.S0, $5.40 and $5.20.

title: Vita Gallo Wed To G.W.Scotti
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Aug. 26Miss. Vita May Gallo, daughter of Mrs. Gasper Gallo and the late Mr. Gallo, was married here this afternoon to Gavin William Scotti, son of Alfred J. Scottl, chief assistant district attorney and head of the Rackets Bureau in the Manhattan District Attorney's office, and Mrs. Scotti. Both families are of Garden City. The Rev. William Costello performed the ceremony in St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church there.

title: STRIKES TO DELAY I.S. 53 IN QUEENS
description: Strikes in the construction industry will delay the scheduled opening next month of one school in Queens and possibly four school projects in the Bronx and Brooklyn, the Board cif Education announced yesterday.

title: Bergen Fighting Addiction With AwardWinning Program
description: PARAMUS  Although New Jersey, like most of the country, has awakened slowly to the ubiquitous drug scene, Bergen County has for several years been in the process of developing a series of awardwinning projects to cope with drug abuse at different age levels.

title: Annual Powwow Slated By Shinnecock Indians
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I.Indians representing tribes from all parts of the United States, Canada and Central America will gather here next Saturday, Sunday and Monday for the 26th annual Shinnecock Powwow. The event, to which the public is invited, will be held at the Shinnecock Reservation on the Montauk Highway.

title: Daume: A Dedicated Man
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 26  He vividly remembers the monster buildings of the Berlin Olympic Games 36 years ago, those high, wide and unhandsome structures with which Hitler wanted to overhelm the world.

title: Study Attributes Doctors'
description: Practicing physicians are more likely than their college classmates who went into other professions to have poor marriages, use drugs and alcohol heavily and obtain psychotherapy, according to the report of a 30year research study.

title: People Who Believe That Man's Best Friends Are Feathered
description: Nobody would call Arthur and Catherine Tyler lonesome. Although their two married daughters have long since flown the coop, their 250 birds haven't.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: An offduty Long Island Rail Road police lieutenant arrested a Brooklyn man early yesterday after the man allegedly held up two conductors on a train between Jamaica and St. Albans, Queens. The police said that Lawrence Carter, 22 years old, of 778 Quincy Street, Brooklyn, pulled a 45caliber revolver on the conductors, Thomas Williams and Stephen Bruno, and robbed them of $130 shortly before 1 A.M.

title: CHARGERS VICTORS OVER SAINTS, 1614
description: NEW ORLEANS, Aug. 26 (AP)A rookie placekicker, Bill McClard booted a 9yard field goal with 500BD minutes to play to lift the San Diego Chargers to a 1614 victory over the New Orleans Saints in a National Football League preseason game tonight.

title: Mona Fisher Married
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Aug. 26 The marriage of Miss Mona Elizabeth Fisher, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Burnet Fisher, to Kenton Carl Dalby, son of Mr. and Mrs. ThOmas E. Dalby of Bethlehem, Pa., took place here today in the Princeton University Chapel. Msgr. Edward C. Henry performed the Roman Catholic ceremony. The bride's father is chief structural engineer with the Rohm & Haas Company in East Paterson. Mr. Dalby's father is general manager of fabricated structural steel of the Bethlehem Steel Corporation.

title: Canadians Are Invited To Cheat on Their Tax
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 26 (AP)The Canadian Government is advertising that there is a legal way to cheat the tax collector.

title: Mrs. Margery Bigio Is Remarried
description: GLADSTONE, N.J., Aug 26  The marriage of Mrs. Margery Dillon Bigio to John Kroll Turpin, a real estate broker in Mendham, took place in the garden at St. Luke's Episcopal Church here this afternoon. The Rev. Edwin H. Brown performed the ceremony.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: With regard to the letter about baggage allowances on planes, I believe that the present 44pound (economy) and 66pound (firstclass) allowances on international flights cause unnecessary inconvenience. The present limits were understandable in the old days of pistonengine aircraft, but today's jets can carry all the weight that can be loaded aboard. It is difficut for passengers to weigh their luggage accurately before leaving home. The usual answer for a person who is told on arriving at the airport that is or her luggage is overweight is to unpack on the airport floor, taking out heary articles and carrying them on board. I suggest the allowances be made similar to those on United States domestic flights, each passenger being permitted two or three pieces of certain dimensions. In this way the passenger can, simply by measuring the dimensions at home, ascertain whether his baggage is in order.

title: Shelter I.: Its State Of Health Is Excellent
description: SHELTER ISLAND. LT. For this improbable little island, a longstanding concern over medical emergencies is being lifted.

title: For Somerset, Statistics Are Favorable
description: Somerset is the little one among the heavily populated counties making up the northeastern New Jersey metropolitan region close to New York City.

title: Maureen Cummings Married to a Pilot
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., Aug 26Miss Maureen Cummings daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Patrick Cummings, was married here this morning to Lieut. William C. Brown 3d, an Air Force pilot stationed at McGuire Air Force Base in New Jersey He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Brown Jr. of Cincinnati.

title: Uruguay Kills 3 Tupamaros
description: Montevideo, Uruguay, Aug. 26 (Reuters)  Uruguayan security forces killed three Tupamaro urban guerrillas in a clash six miles outside Montevideo today, police sources said.

title: Secret Park for Adventure
description: WAWAYANDA STATE PARKAs the man stood on the porch of his lakeside cabin at sundown, a 5foot puma leaped out of the pines in hot pursuit of a deer, then rocked and braked on huge paws as the buck escaped into the cold water and swam toward Scott Island.

title: Painters'
description: A group of volunteers from District Council 9 of the International Brotherhood of Painters and Allied Trades have spent this weekend and last painting both the exterior and interior of the historic Kingsland mansion in Flushing.

title: Travel Notes: Air Piracy
description: Bus tours emphasing black history and culture are being organized by the Greyhound Lines. The first destination in a series of oneday trips called What It Is/What It Was is Milwaukee, with Washington, D.C., being considered for the future. The Milwaukee tour will originate in Chicago and includes roundtrip bus transportation between Chicago and Milwaukee, a soulfood lunch, an African art memento and admission to the Gallery Toward the Black Aesthetic, Mitchell Park's Flower Conservatory and either the Milwaukee Zoo or the Milwaukee Museum, depending on the weather. Departure dates are Sept. 16, Oct. 28, Nov. 11 and Dec. 2. The allinclusive price, from Chicago, is $27.95. Roundtrip bus fare from New York to Chicago is $72.70.

title: The bluff that worked, at least temporarily
description: Whatever else history may say about the Nixon Administration, it has undoubtedly provided an exciting time for economists. It began hard on the heels of Walter Heller's soft sell of the new economics (never let it be called Keynesianism) to Presidents Kennedy and Johnson and the Congress with the apparent success of the rival school of monetarism (call it the new, new economics and try not to mention Milton Friedman). It ended with the conversion of the President (I am now a Keynesian) to the most vulgar form of Keynesianismhapniness is an incomes policy. The shock to monetarists, economic liberals, Republicans and the silent majority in general was total and traumatic. This sense of betrayal is reflected in the two books under review, though in widely different ways. Roger LeRoy Miller, of the University of Washington, and Raburn M. Williams, or the University of Hawaii, are outraged monetarists, concerned to demonstrate that the New Economic Policy of last August was primarily politics and not ecoi nomics. Leonard Silk, a member of The Times editorial board, is more of a cynic about politics and more concerned about the longerrun implications of the New Economic Policy for the general style of American economic policymaking.

title: 1971 MURDER CASE FACES NEW DELAY
description: FAIRFIELD, Calif., Aug. 26The mass murder trial of Juan Vallejo Corona, a farm labor contractor, may be delayed again Monday as attorneys battle over a request for handwriting sample.

title: LAGOS TAKES OVER ALL UNIVERSITIES
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Aug. 24Nigeria's military Government has taken control of all six of the nation's universities, assuming what an official announcement called full responsibility for higher education throughout the country.

title: Music.
description: ONCE upon a time, my children, the world seemed a simple thing. For a music critic, life shaped itself into neat, welldefined patterns of hectic activity and healing repose. There was something known as the music season, a period of some seven or eight months, beginning no earlier than late September and extending not much beyond the first warm day in early May. Concerts, recitals and operas were presented then and dutifully reviewed. For the remaining months, the music critic made himself scarce around the office. He thought a great deal, deeply, on many subjects. He learned another language. He Visited the spas of Europe, or the local beach. He read intensively in the collected works of P. G. Wodehouse or Agatha Christle.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: Giulo E. Miranda's article on the pitfalls of the Grand Reunion in Italy (Travel section, Aug. 6) was of special interest to us because this summer we went back to the paese that my inlaws eft 65 years ago. And we were warned; vere we ever warned! We were told Lhey just come right out and ask for expensive things. Cousin Luigi, seemed, would ask you to join him while ho picks up a few things at the store for dinner and then proceed to buy enough groceries to feed his entire family for a month. So we went to Italy, but the dire consequences predicted did not materialize.

title: Basketball, Boxing and Soccer Help Open Competition in Olympics Today

Russell of Locust Valley and New York and Herbert Pratt Van Ingen of New York, was married here this afternoon to Brackenridge Costin, son of Mrs. William H. Murdoch of Brielle, N.J., and William G. Costin Jr. of Middleburg, Va.

title: U.N. Plan for Germans
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 26 (AP)Chancellor Willy Brandt of West Germany and Secretary General Waldheim of the United Nations met today and agreed that East and West Germany should join the United Nations, a spokesman for Mr. Brandt announced. The Bonn Goverment spokesman, Conrad Ahlers, said Mr. Waldheim viewed the dual German United Nations membership with great interest and agreement.

title: ARMY'S NEW PRISON TO OPEN AT FORT DIX
description: FORT DIX, N. J., Aug. 26The first prisoners at the United States Army's new correctional facility, which it calls its largest and most modern, will arrive here Tuesday.

title: A Mutual Admiration Society: Jets and Nassau
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I.Now you take Green Bay [Wisconsin] or South Bend [Indiana], said an aide to Nassau County Executive Ralph G. Caso. Who ever would have heard of those towns without their football teams? People are now associating us with the big time.

title: New &Novel
description: Where are the Presidential conventions of yesteryear? Buried beneath some snowdeep Alp of confetti and indifference. Al Morgan performs an archeological feat by reviving the 1968 Democratic donnybrook, but it's hard to rev up a sense of indignation at such an obsolete shambles. In the novel, heads are bashed once again; the Yippies caper in Lincoln Park; Pigasus is nominated for President; Walter Cronkite interviews Mayor Daleyand Gene McCarthy begins his celebrated disappearing act. A lot has happened since.

title: South Vietnam's Civilian Victims Doubled
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 26American officials report that the rate of civilian casualties in the war in South Vietnam has increased more than 100 per cent since th& current enemy offensive began March 31

title: Prayers Help Some Reform
description: RUTHERFORDA young woman was praying aloud to a group of worshipers gathered in the Rutherford Baptist Church one Sunday evening.

title: Aboriginal vengeance
description: The North American Indian, the Aztec, the Inca, the Bantu, the Ainu, the Maori, the Australian aboriginal each now lies heavy on the conscience of the races that slaughtered and dispossessed them. The inheritance and customs of those who survive have been debased, and whatever assimilation there has been into the invading culture has been uneasy. The choices have seemed to be either servility or the dubious benefits of survival as museums for anthropologists and tourists.

title: Giants Hope to End 2Year Jinx
description: NEWTON, Mass., Aug. 26The fourth of six scheduled exhibition games is the assignment for the New York Giants tomorrow and this one will be exactly that an exhibition game.

title: All Over Vietnam, G. I.'s Still Have a Role
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 26My mother wrote to me and said, If you ain't over there, why aren't you here?  said Specialist 4 John. Walling, an infantryman from Lexington, Ky.

title: World News Briefs
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 26Seven men, including three terrorists and two parttime soldiers, were killed early today in sectarian violence in Ulster.

title: Tigers Triumph in 11th
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Aug. 26 (AP)Aurelio Rodirguez hit a tworun home run in the top of the 11th inning today, lifting the Detroit Tigers to a 53 victory over the Minnesota Twins in the first game of an American League baseball doubleheader. The second game was rained out and rescheduled as part of a doubleheader tomorrow.

title: Flame Glows Amid Pageantry
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 26To the accompaniment of a swinging dance band, booming cannon and the poppoppop of snapping Bavarian bullwhips, the Olympic Games opened today before 80,000 cash customers with thousands of freeloaders looking on from the crest of a mountain of rubble created by the bombs of World War II and conceivably 800 million more watching by satellite television.

title: Spanish joke: Franco declines the gift of a baby tortoise because it will live to be only 100 and he can't bear to see a pet die
description: By August, the wheat on the hills near Avila is bleached nearly silver under the long sun. The sky is intensely blue and the threshers look like black chessmen set out on a vast glittering board. The road dips and rises in mile long sweeps, and you drive, fuddled by the heat and stillness, through what might be the fields and the willows are so bright and the sky so dark  a photographic negative.

title: Letters
description: Martha Weinman Lear's Save the Spouses, Rather than the Marriage, (Aug. 13) certainly contains some interesting conceptualizations; but I must take issue with the language used by therapists themselves in marital counseling.

title: From a Nantucket Sketchbook
description: Two communities, Nantucket Town and Siasconset (Sconset to the islanders), dominate Nantucket, the 49squaremile island of lovely beaches and rolling moors 30 miles off Cape Cod. In addition to being a great tourist resort, the island is a living museum; it was the world's greatest whaling port from the late 17th century into the 1800's. The artist says of Sankaty Head Lighthouse in Sconset: It is from this point that you are able to look out across the Atlantic Ocean, and even on a clear day, see nothing. Nothing, except the horizon.

title: CONSUMER STUDY SCORES CAT FOOD
description: Only five out of 22 brands of cat food tested by Consumers Union provided cats with nutrition for adequate growth and good health, the magazine Consumer Reports said last week.

title: Travel Notes: Air Piracy
description: Maryland's port city of Baltimore will stage a 175th birthday party this week, and the Russians are coming. The festivities, which begin Wednesday, will continue through Sept. 8. The anniversary salutes the Baltimore seaport and the frigate Constellation, which was launched in Baltimore on Sept. 7, 1797, and which is tied up at the city's Pratt Street pier within cannon shot of the ship's birthplace. The Russian guests, sea cadets aboard the training ship Tovarish, a 242foot squarerigged bark from Odessa, are due to arrive Wednesday. They will be joined by crewmen of navy vessels from Canada, Greece and the United States. All the vessels will be open to the public.

title: Teacher Weds Jane Goodman
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 26Miss Jane Elizabeth Goodman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. E. Lawrence Goodman of White Plains, was married here this evening to Bernard Pollak, son of Dr. and Mrs. Robert Pollak of Fair Lawn, N. J.

title: Travel Notes: Air Piracy
description: A number of fairs and festivals are coming up, among them the Powers Crossroads Country Fair and Art Festival, which runs from Friday through Sept. 4 in Powers Crossroads, near Newnan, Ga. The event is billed as the world's largest arts and crafts festival. In Vermont the Stratton Arts Festival opens Saturday for an eightweek stand at the base lodge of Stratton Mountain Ski Area. A weeklong fair begins Sept. 3 in Rutland, Vt., and a fall foliage festival is set to begin on Sept, 23 in St. Albans, Vt. In Richmond, Va., the Virginia State Fair will be on from Sept. 22 to Oct. 1. Sept. 29, Sept. 30 and Oct. 1 are the dates of an autumn festival in Pensacola, Fla., and on Sept. 30 the Danbury, Conn., State Fair will begin a 10day run.

title: DROP IS FORECAST IN PRICE OF BEEF
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 26Housewives appalled by the prices they pay for beef can look forward to better times, the trend in farm prices indicates.

title: Gardens
description: THE most beautiful place on Cape Cod said one woman. Another asked if she might sketch the house because she was building near Philadelphia and wanted to plan something similar.

title: Trottier Joins W.H.A.
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 26 (UPI)The Ottawa Nationals of the World Hockey Association toclay announced the signing of Guy Trottier, who spent the last two seasons with the Toronto Maple Leafs of the National Hockey League. No details were released on the length or amount of the contract but it was reported to be a threeyear deal.

title: A woman anthropologist offers a solution to the woman problem
description: The first time I ever stood up in front of a class to lecture about anthropology was several years ago at San Francisco State College. It was not long after the campus had been seriously disrupted by Black Panthers and others trying to reconstitute the college, and some of my fellow teachers were worried that I, as a novice, might be hassled by revolutionaries. I was a little nervous about this myself, but I delivered a wholly uneventful first lecture describing the topics I planned cover marriage, the family, kinship, social organizationin other words, the stockintrade of any basic course in social anthropology. No Panthers raised their fists; no Maoists heckled me. At the end of my lecture, however, a very sweetfaced, longhaired boy came up to the podium and demanded, with unmistakable iciness, Mrs. Johnson, are you planning to teach this course from a heterosexual point of view? Because, you see, I'm gay, and I want to know how you're going to relate this material to my lifestyle.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: President Nixon has kindly let us know that for the duration of the campaign at least no official St. Georges will be poking at the dragons of radlib journalistic bias. Good. But I find it hard not to question Mr. Nixon's motives.

title: Celebrities Swing With Pros in Kennedy Event
description: Don't play tennis with George Plimpton unless you feel like running.

title: R. D. Hull Marries Patricia H. Morgan
description: REDDING RIDGE, Conn., Aug. 26The marriage of Miss Patricia Honors Morgan to Richard Drummond Hull, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harry S. Hull Jr of Sewickley Pa. took place here today The ceremony in Christ Episcopal Church was performed by the Rev. Randall C. Giddings. The bride is a daughter of Mrs. Johnson Morgan of Wilton and James Keeler Morgan of Redding Ridge.

title: A talk with Golda Meir
description: The Prime Minister received me in her modest, wood paneled office near the Knesset, the Israeli Parliament, in West Jerusalem. Now in her 75th year, Mrs. Meir wore a beige dress and white shoes; our conversation lasted nearly 95 minutes. She spoke English in her broad Milwaukee accent; her tone oscillated between sarcasm and passion. She is the most formidable woman I have ever met. She smoked incessantly. On a mischievous impulse, I offered her a Jordanian cigarette. She grimaced, said, Why not? and smoked it. This was the closest she came to making any concessions to the Arabs. Excerpts:

title: Babysitter Killed Examining Gun in Policeman's Home
description: YORKTOWN HEIGHTS, N. Y., Aug. 26 (AP)  A 19yearold woman babysitting here in the home of a Scarsdale policeman accidentally shot herself to death early today with the homeowner's semiautomatic pistol, the police said.

title: City's 7172 Expense Budget Balanced
description: New York City squeezed through its 197172 fiscal year with a balanced expense budget for the first time in three years without either borrowing on budget notes or dipping into the rainyday fund, Budget Director David A. Grossman said yesterday.

title: Take one from Column A, one from Column B...
description: Fall'srecipe for fashion? Take a two or three or four part costume. Add a generous amount of imagination, a dollop of fun, a spice of color and whatever else pleases you. Mix carefully and wear with confidence.

title: 8 Flee Prison in Vermont Through Window
description: WINDSOR, Vt., Aug. 26 (AP) Officials at Windsor State Prison said eight inmates escaped today by breaching the window on the street side.

title: Death Around the Clock
description: Ernest Holland, 36 years old, shot to death in a West Side hotel.. Manuel Marrero, shot to death in the Bronx after someone in a passing car shouted, Hey, you!... Two women in a Queens Village apartment, found bound hand and foot and beaten to death....

title: 6 Fire Fighters Die In Helicopter Crash At California Blaze

title: Child to Mrs. Slutsky

title: World News Briefs
description: SAINT NAZAIRE, France, Aug. 26Three persons were killed; three persons were missing and 32 were injured today after lightning struck a Greek oil tanker at the port of Donges near here.

title: West Coast Scout, at $5.40, Scores Easily at Liberty Bell
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 26The Oxford Stable's West Coast Scout beat Sigmund Sommer's entry of Hitchcock and Autobiography to win the $100,000 Hobson Handicap at Liberty race track today. It was the finale of the 76day summer season.

title: Pop
description: SANDY BULL: Demolition Derby (Vanguard VSD 6578). Sandy Bull is a space musician who just wants to be your oneman band. I was first drawn to him through his Inventions album (Vanguard VSD 79191), which includes Sandy's masterful treatment of Chuck Berry's Memphis, Tennessee.

title: Firemen Form National Unit To Support Nixon Campaign
description: Raymond W. Gimmler, president of the city's 2,700member Uniformed Fire Officers Association, announced yesterday the formation of a national committee of fire fighters for President Nixon.

title: Bridge
description: One of the basic concepts in bridgeo one of the hardest to define and to master: the finesse. The best definition is probably this: An attempt to win a trick with a card which is not a master by virtue of position.

title: Amy Swick Engaged
description: The engagement of Miss Amy Robyn Swick to Edward Allen Berro has been announced by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Joseph S. Swick of the Bronx. The future bridegroom, a graduate of New York University, is a son of Mr. and ,Mrs. Morris Berro of North Woodmere, L. I. Miss Swick is a senior at Barnard College.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I commend The Times for its editorial of Aug. 9 entitled Crossfire in the Senate. However, it is interesting that no mention is made of the names of those liberal Senators in the forefront of the outcry against killing in Vietnam, yet chose to close their eyes to the opportunities they are providing for equally senseless killing right at home.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: This is to take issue with your reviewer's belief that feminists have misinterpreted the ideology and philosophy of Women's Lib. Rather, accuse her of the same....

title: The New Movies
description: THE LAST OF THE RED HOT LOVERS, directed by Gene Saks, got 7 mixed reviews (Archer Winsten, Post; Allan Mottus, Women's Wear; Gene Shalit, NBCTV; Leonard Harris, CBSTV; Jeffrey Lyons, WPIXTV; Judith Grist, New York; Paul D. Zimmerman, Newsweek) and 11 negative reviews (Roger Greenspun, Times; Kathleen Carroll, News; William Wolf, Cue; Stanley Kauffmann, New Republic; John Simon, New Leader; Jay Cocks, Time; Arthur Knight, Saturday Review; Richard Schickel, Life; Rex Reed, News; Frances Taylor, Newhouse Newspapers; Bernard Drew, Gannett Newspapers).

title: Games
description: REYKJAVIKThe most bizarre episode in this most bizarre of chess matches was enacted last week with the Case of the Two Dead Flies.

title: Art
description: LAST May the Metropolitan Museum opened an exhibition called A King's Book of Kings, which was scheduled to close July 4. Since then the closing date of this sleeper has been extended and reextended until now the show is set to run through December. By that date the museum will probably need the gallery space, but it is a shame that a show so beautiful and so instructive can't be a permanent installation.

title: STUDY CRITICIZES MIGRANT CAMPS
description: TRENTON, Aug. 26  The Puerto Rican Congress of New Jersey has charged that more than half of the state's 1,400 migrant farmworker camp's are in violation of state laws and regulations.

title: Six Are Killed in California In CarGas Truck Collision
description: FOWLER, Calif., Aug. 26 (UPI) Six persons were killed today when they were trapped in the flaming wreckage of their car after it collided with a loaded propane gas truck.

title: Heavy Toll in Cambodia
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Aug. 26 (AP)The Cambodian command reported today that 117 of its soldiers had been killed, 107 wounded and 216 were missing and feared dead in eight days of fighting along Route 5, where Communist led forces have seized a 15mile stretch of road 60 miles north of Pnompenh, threatening the Cambodian capital's food supplies.

title: Travel Notes: Air Piracy
description: Nature lovers and poetry enthusiasts will spend a day remembering Robert Frost in Frost country this coming Saturday, assembling at 10 A.M. at the Robert Frost Wayside Recreational Area between Ripton and Bread Loaf, Vt., on Vermont Route 125. The program includes a guided walk over a trail designed to illustrate a number of Frost's poems, a trip by bus to the grounds of the Robert Frost cabin, dedication of the Robert Frost Memorial Drive (Route 125) at Middlebury Gap and Long Trail Crossing and the showing of two documentary films in which the poet, who died in 1963, reads some of his poems and comments on them. Participants are advised to bring a lunch.

title: Hockey Hall Gets Grant
description: The National Hockey League has approved a grant of $100000 to the United States Hockey Hall of Fame currently under construction in Eveleth Minn., Don Ruck, vice president of the league, said today The hall is scheduled to be dedicated next June.

title: Red Sox Rally Works
description: BOSTON, Aug. 26 (AP)Phil Gagliano, a pinchhitter, capped a fiverun rally in the last of the ninth inning with a tworun double that gave the Boston Red Sox a comeback 76 victory over the Texas Rangers today.

title: Vietnam Plane Crash Kills 8
description: PLEIKU, South Vietnam, Aug. 26 (UPI)A China Air lines C123 transport on charter to Air America, the United States Government contract airline in Southeast Asia, crashed today, killing all eight persons aboard, an Air America spokesman said. The cause of the crash six miles south of Pleiku was not known. Those aboard included a fourman Chinese crew, an American, a Filipino and two South Vietnamese, the spokesman said. The names of most of the dead were not immediately available, but the spokesman said that the pilot was Capt. T. F. Lee of Taipei, Taiwan.

title: Pickpocket in Chicago Takes a Legion Relic
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 26 (AP)When a pickpocket took John J. Wicker's wallet here this week, he got $100 in cash, a few traveler's checks and the first American Legion card ever issued.

title: A Weekend College Strictly for Adults
description: HACKENSACK  Mere mention of Saturday classes is enough to turn off most college students, but for 320 men and women enrolled at Saturday College in Hackensack, going to school on the weekend is the best possible way to a degree.

title: Jill R. Kiely Married
description: ELBERON, N.J., Aug. 26Miss Jill Russell Kiely,;daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Procter Kiely of Rumson, was married to William Locke McKenzie Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. McKenzie of Columbus, Ohio. The Rev. 011ie Megill, a Methodist minister, performed the ceremony in the Elberon Memorial Church. He was assisted by the Rev. Frank E. McKenzie, an Episcopal priest and uncle of the bridegroom.

title: First catch your trout
description: Everyone knows how to plan a picnic. Throw together cold chicken, potato salad, a cotton tablecloth and a Thermos bottle of cold drinks in a hamper. Head for the park or the beach, and then wait for the flies.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To THE EDITOR: In reference to readers letters about precautions against hijacking, I can assure them, on the basis of having traveled on many foreign and domestic airlines, in excess of 100,000 miles In the past few years, that the airlines are all probably about the same, that they do no more than they absolutely have to according to government regulations and economic considerations. A notable exception is El Al, simply because hijacking is a threat to Israel's economic lifeline. Most other airlines seem to take a statistical viewpoint; i.e., too few lives of the crew and passengers are at stake to justify extreme and costly security procedures. The frequent apologies for inconveniences caused by security measures that one hears expressed at airports are a specious and cynical ploy. No one in his right mind could possibly object to Inconveniences caused by even the most rigorous security measures, if it means that his insured.

title: Ottawa to Help Provinces Pay Cost of Legal Aid for Defendants
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 26  The Canadian Government announced plans this week to contribute part and perhaps most of the cost of providing Legal aid to those accused of crimes and compensation to victims of crime.

title: Seton Hall, Upsala Play Football Opener Sept. 15
description: Tickets will go on sale tomorrow at Upsala College and Seton Hall University for the first Oranges Bowl football game between the two schools on Friday, Sept. 15, at 8:30 P.M. at Upsala.

title: Juliana Fuerbringer Is Married To Daniel H. Nall in Greenwich
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Aug. 26In St. Barnabas Episcopal Church here this afternoon Miss Juliana Fuerbringer, daughter of Mr. and Mr. Otto Fuerbringer, was married to Daniel Hugh Nall, son of Mr. and Mrs. Daniel M. Nall of Savannah, Ga. The Rev. William Sydnor performed the ceremony, assisted by the Rev. Dr. Harold Bassage.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: Flocked fabrics, benefiting from new techniques, are emerging as an important factor in apparel and home furnishings. Sales to the sewing trades are rising rapidly and are expected to continue to grow as the goods are found adaptable to a wider range of textile and apparel items.

title: Everyone's Reading It, Billy's Filming It
description: IT'S the first shot of the first scene of the first day's shooting in New York on The Exorcist. The place is a hospital corridor on Welfare Island. Rubbertiled floor, green ceramic walls, sealedup windows, extras sitting on benches, lying on stretchers. A woman with swollen body in a weary cotton nightgown, an old grayhaired bathrobed man with a cane. Wheel chairs, oxygen tanks. It looks so real you can almost smell carbolic, feel that clutch of fear and sadness you get in a hospital, and you think of the Dostoevsky line about how the only thing the well can say to the sick is, Forgive us and let us pass.

title: Four novels: naive, meretricious, masterly, aimless
description: Irene Schram's meretricious first novel can function only if two axioms are allowed: (1) A narrative written by 11yearold children need have no writerly qualities whatever. (2) Any tract that jangles all the Pavlovian bells of fashion at onceEcology, Welfare, the War, more Ecology, Addictioncan borrow enough kneejerk significance on credit to make it important. Ashes, Ashes, We All Fall Down reads as though it has been cranked off, handout by handout, on the Great Underground Mimeograph Machine. Irene Schram writes with a sort of coruscating dullness.

title: Stamps
description: STANLEY B. ASHBROOK was one of stamp collecting's great scholarly researchers. Several studies attest his devotion to the science of philately. His monumental work was United States One Cent Stamp of 185157, two volumes about a blue Ben Franklin portrait stamp, the onecent. rate providing for the mailing of newspapers and circulars, or for drop lettersthose deposited at the post office for pick up there.

title: Secretariat Storms From Last Place, Captures $86,550 Hopeful Stakes
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 26Secretariat of the Meadow Stable won the $86,550 Hopeful with, in the parlance of the race track cognoscenti, contemptuous ease, today. Shooting from last place to first on the stretch turn, Secretariat went on to take the 6furlong sprint for 2yearolds by five lengths.

title: John D. Fairchild Weds Mrs. McNichols
description: MANHASSET, L. I., Aug. 26  Mrs. Mary M. McNichols, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Michael T. McNichols of Cedarhurst, and John Douglas Fairchild, son of Julian D. Fairchild of Glen Head and of Mrs. Ralph Crews of Locust Valley, were married here today. The ceremony was performed in the Manhasset Congregational Church by the Rev. Alexander Ferguson.

title: Miss Benson Wed To R. E. McKittrick
description: RYE N.Y., Aug. 26Miss Nancy Suzanne Benson daughter of Mr. and Mrs Nils E. Benson, was married here this afternoon to Ralph Edmund McKittrick, son of Ralph McKittrick of Haverford Pa. and the late Mrs. McKittrick. The Rev. James McGuire performed the ceremony in the Resurrection Roman Catholic Church.

title: Travel News and Notes
description: Travelers who like to wander among stalls of seafood, vegetables, flowers and specialty foods should welcome the news that the old city market has been restored at the city dock in Annapolis, Md.... Englishspeaking baby sitters are available at a number of Austrian hotels, among them the Kummer, Prinz Etigen, Parkhotel Schoenbrunn and Hotel de France in Vienna, the Daniel in Graz and the Victoria in Zell am See.... Discussions on How to Succeed in Business can be heard on one of the eight channels of recorded program material offered during flights lasting 90 minutes or more on Trans World Airlines 727's. Currency bearing bright blue labels reading Corpus Christi TouristConvention Dollars has been placed in circulation by the Texas city in hope of stimulating interest in Texas's Coastal Bend Country and demonstrating the economic impact of the travel dollar, according to the Corpus Christi Area Tourist Bureau. Persons who receive the bills are asked to contact the tourist bureau at Box 1147, Corpus Christi, Tex. 78403....Avensa Airlines of Venezuela has inaugurated a special $40 More for Your Money fare that permits foreigners to fly to a total of six cities in eastern Venezuela or five cities in the western part of the country during a sevenday stay. Tickets must be purchased outside Venezuela. Details from the airline at 7 West 57th Street, New York 10019.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: I was outraged by the article about Italy. I have lived in the United States for five years, having come from small town near Milan, and travel to Italy, for business or pleasure, a few times a year. Never, when checking in at any hotel, have I been looked down upon or questioned about my Italian ancestry. It has never occurred to me that Italian people envy Italian Americans; none of my friends in Italy are even considering coming here. They all have respectable jobs and have very good life.

title: Tell Us, Marjoe, Where Did JEEEEsus Go?
description: MARJOE of Marjoe is a bit like a singing nun who leaps over the wall to become a Singing Nun.

title: Li. Library Is Equipped To Assist Disabled
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I.New services for reaaers who are blind or physically handicapped are being introduced at the Huntington Public Library under a special grant from the Library of Congress.

title: The College Scene
description: After years of fussing and arguing about ways to slow the spiraling costs of majorcollege football competition, the best remedy the National Collegiate Association could come up with was to declare freshmen eligible for varsity play.

title: JOHN S. WILSON'S Music
description: EAST MEADOW, L. I.The annual Nassau County Jazz Festival, which will be held today at the Lakeside Theater in Eisenhower Park, is, in one way, very much like the Newport Jazz Festival.

title: FOX ALONE IN SUIT AGAINST FISCHER
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Aug. 26The Icelandic Chess Federation announced today that it would waive all shares in any law suit instituted against Bobby Fischer by the attorneys of Chester Fox. In return, the attorneys have promised that no action will be taken against Fischer in Iceland.

title: Trade Deficit in Perspective
description: WASHINGTON  United States foreign trade is heading this year for its largest deficit on record, with a surplus of imports over exports of $3.3billion already recorded in the first six months. Does anybody care?

title: CleanBurning Propane Moves Taxis
description: RED BANKResidents of this sailandspeedboat mecca on the Navesink River are involved in a pioneering project concerning their environment that few among the 13,000 people in the town seem to be aware of.

title: CITY FIGHT GAINS ON PORNOGRAPHY
description: In the delicately balanced legal battle between the pornographic film houses in the Times Square area and those who would drive them out, a decision in Manhattan Federal Court last week was another small plus for the cleanup forces.

title: Slip into
description: Stretchedout tennis sweater, with its own buttoned and pocketed cardigan, is in a woolangora blend. By Blassport. $180. Fifth floor, Bergdorf Goodman. Sdede sandals by Herbert Levine. Tortoisecolored beads by K.J.L.

title: Member of Audience Provides Fresh Harp
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26 (Reuters)A member of the audience at the Kennedly Center Concert Hall helped out last night when Rosemarte Bottalico's harp suddenly began playing the wrong notes.

title: New &Novel
description: A young writer named Slade has a curious problem: He finds himself in thrall to one woman after another, all of whom want to keep him while he writes his novel. In Las Vegas, he flees Arlene, a beautiful pit girl in a gambling hell but finally succumbs to Karen Munday, a lady who runs a miniYaddo in San Juan Capistrano. What Karen does is train writers with the same rigor once used to train fighters. Her methods work so well for Slade he finds himself caught in a symbiosis that yields two successful books and gives Karen a franchise on his soul.

title: MISS WADE TAKES FINAL BY 64, 61
description: HAVERFORD, Pa., Aug. 26Topseeded Virginia Wade of England won the $15,000 Pennsylvania lawntennis tournament today by defeating a 17yearold junior player from Florida, Laurie Fleming of Fort Lauderdale, 64, 61, in an absorbing 57minute final before 2,500 spectators in 92degree weather at the Merion Cricket Club.

title: Education
description: This will be the big effort, Joseph Monserrat, the president of the New York City Board of Education and its chief negotiator with the United Federation of Teachers, said last week. We'll sit down Monday and start talking and we won't stop until there is an agreement or a... He did not complete the sentence.

title: NETS WELL TRAIN AT KINGS POINT
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Aug. 26 The New York Nets arc returning to the training camp site from where they began; their most successful season a year ago.

title: Houk Ejected in 3d Inning After Wrangle Over Pitch
description: In a pregame clubhouse meeting yesterday, Ralph Houk stressed to his players the importance of being relaxed. Less than two hours later, Houk got himself so riled up that wasn't able to stay around and watch the last six innings of the Kansas City Royals 63 victory over the Yankees. The mental lava began bubbling in Houk in the third inning when Umpire Marty Springstead called a ball on a pitch to John Mayberry that Houk felt should have been strike three.

title: ASTROS TRIUMPH OVER EXPOS, 65
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 26 (UPI)Cesar Cedeno's tworun double in the ninth inning tonight gave the Houston Astros a 65 victory over the Montreal Expos.

title: U.S. FIVE RISKING 36YEAR STREAK
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 26 (AP)  One of the youngest but tallest United States teams in Olympic basketball history will take the floor against Czechoslovakia tomor ow to risk a 36year undefeated record.

title: Peking Strips Lin of SoldierImage
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 26The Communists won a major battle in the Chinese civil war after Mao Tsetung rejected proposals put forward by Lin Piao, the field commander, according to a new version of the engagement published in the current issue of Hung Chi, the Peking theoretical journal.

title: Barbara Lehan Becomes Bride
description: BELLE MEAD, N. J., Aug 26Dr. David E. Rogers, president of the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation. Princeton, and Miss Barbara Lehan a member of the foundation staff, were married here this afternoon at the home of Mr. and Mrs: John Summerskill The Rev. Carl D. Reimers of the Princeton Day School faculty performed the Presbyterian ceremony.

title: Creative Disobedience
description: CORNWALL BRIDGE, Conn.Some weeks ago, when I was briefly jailed during an antiwar demonstration, noticed this graffiti on a wall of my prison cell:

title: ADVOCATE OF BUSING QUITS POST ON COAST
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 26 (AP)Dr. Thomas A. Shaheen, an advocate of public school busing, has resigned under pressure as superintendent of schools.

title: Television
description: ACOUPLE of weeks ago, the Columbia Broadcasting System began a fivepart series on The Lib Leonardo da Vinci. I was on vacation, trying desperately to avoid the sight of a television screen, and a review of the series, or at least the first installment, was written by John Canaday, this newspaper's senior art critic.

title: Music: Ed McDermott, Irish Fiddler
description: KEYPORT  Things have been livelier than usual at the Water's Edge Rest Home since Ed McDermott moved in last December. Mr. McDermott is a 77yearold Irish fiddler from County Leitrim who retired from the moving business eight years ago and then, at the age of 73, launched a new career when he began playing traditional jigs, reels and hornpipes at festivals and concerts up and down the East Coast.

title: Mary Savage Attended by 6 At Her Bridal
description: CORNWALL, N. Y., Aug. 26 Miss Mary.Van Dusen Savage, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Richard Savage of St. Paul and Two Harbors, Minn., was married here this afternoon to Franklin D'Olier Stowell, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Esty Stowell of Basking Ridge, N. J., and Cornwall.

title: 20% of Cars in State Top Pollution Limit
description: TRENTONAlmost 20 per cent, or 600,000, of New Jersey's 3.3 million registered automobiles are polluting the air with carbon monoxide, hydrocarbons and visible smoke beyond the limits being imposed by the state.

title: Antiwar Group Aids Six in House Race
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26The Congressional Action Fund, an antiwar liberal group that distributes contributions to selected political candidates, announced today its second group of selections for this year.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: THE CHASE MANHATTAN led other banks by increasing the prime rate from 5 per cent to 5 per cent...
