description: St. Paul's Chapel at Columbia University was the setting here yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Miss Joan Marie Murtagh and Michael Ira Frankel, June graduates of the Columbia University School of Law. The bride is a daughter of Justice John M. Murtagh of the New York State Supreme Court, and Mrs. Murtagh of New York. The bridegroom's parents are Mr. and Mrs. Theodore J. Frankel of Paramus, N.J.

title: James Vineburgh Weds Nancy C. Taylor
description: HAMDEN, Conn., Aug. 27 Miss Nancy Cynthia Taylor was married here this afternoon to James Hollander Vineburgh. Rabbi Robert E. Goldburg performed the ceremony in Temple Mishkan Israel.

title: QUEENS POLICE HUNT FOR ROBBERRAPIST
description: A prowler was being sought by the police last night for invading the apartments of five women in the Sanford Avenue area of Flushing, Queens, robbing three of them and raping two others.

title: Fischer Nears Title With Draw Against Spassky in Game No. 19
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Aug. 27 For the sixth consecutive time in the world championship chess match, Boris Spassky and Bobby Fischer played to a draw..

title: Roundup: A's Beat Orioles, 2 1 , on Jackson's Hits
description: The Oakland Athletics needed a victory yesterday over Baltimore in a place they had found it the hardest to defeat the Orioles the A's ball parkand they got it, 2 to I.

title: Bubba Smith Injured, Likely to Miss Season
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 27Bubba Smith, allpro defensive end of the Baltimore Colts, who was injured in a freakish accident in the exhibition game with the Pittsburgh Steelers at Tampa, Fla., last night, underwent surgery on his right knee today and was expected to miss the entire season.

title: Seeley Will Meet Fernandez In Bout at Garden Tonight
description: Walter Seeley will seek to dethrone Jose Fernandez as the North American junior lightweight champion tonight in 12round bout at Madison Square Garden. It will be the third meeting between Seeley of Sayville, L. I., and Fernandez of the Dominican Republic.

title: Sister Attends Louise Miner At Her Bridal
description: ANDOVER, Mass., Aug. 27 The marriage of Miss Louise Matlack Miner to Michael Stanley Barnett took place here this afternoon at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Joshua Lewis Miner 3d, parents of the bride. The nondenominational ceremony was performed by the Rev. A. Graham Baldwin, chaplain emeritus at Phillips Academy, where Mr. Miner is director of admissions. The bridegroom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert Arnold Barnett of Havertown, Pa. Miss Phebe Miner was maid of honor for her sister. Clifford I. Barnett, brother of the bridegroom, served as best

title: Doctor Weds Enid Cardoso
description: RIDGEFIELD, Conn., Aug. 27  Miss Enid Cardozo, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin M. Cardozo of Westport and New York, was married here this afternoon to Dr. Edward Lamon,.son of Mr. and Mrs. Isaac Lamon of Larchmont, N. Y.

title: Senate Staff Report Asserts Railroads Ignore Need for Change
description: A Senate staff report on the state of the nation's railroads, issued yesterday attributed the industry's deepening troubles to the failure of Government regulators and railroad management to respond to economic and technological change.

title: Women's Unit Broke And Split on Future
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27The National Women's Politieal Caucus, after achieving some significant victories at both national political conventions, is broke and uncertain about its future course.

title: New Pacific Force Leader
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 27 (AP)Rear Adm. Mark W. Woods has taken command of the United States Pacific Fleet's cruiserdestroyer force, the Navy announced today. The force, which includes 124 ships and 40,000 men, has its headquarters in San Diego. About a third of its ships are in Vietnamese waters.

title: Chinese Government Plans To Buy a Third Concorde
description: PEKING, Aug. 27 (Reuters)The Chinese Government will sign a preliminary purchase agreement for a third Concorde airliner with officials of the British Aircraft Corporation tomorrow afternoon, reliable sources said here today.

title: Filly to Challenge Super Bowl at Du Quoin
description: DU QUOIN, Ill., Aug. 27Iere at the southwestern tip if Illinois, where the harvest of corn, soy beans and tomatoes las been the richest in years, he 47th edition of the Hambleonian, set for Wednesday afternoon at the Du Quoin state Fair, will offer its shortist field since 1932. The purse it stake also will be the small!st since 1964.

title: Civilian and Sergeant Killed in Northern Ireland
description: BELFAST, Aug. 27  Two mena civilian and an army sergeantwere shot dead in the continuing violence in Northern Ireland today, bringing the weekend death toll to nine.

title: MachineTool Orders Fell During July
description: Net new orders for machine tools in July totaled $104.7 million, down from $115.1 million in June, but well above the level of $78million in orders received in July of 1971.

title: FULMER IS FIRST IN CANAM RACING
description: ELKHART LAKE, Wis., Aug. 27CanAm races are getting shorter. They seem to finish within onefourth of the scheduled 200 miles, as George Follmer demonstrated today in winning the Road America CanAm.

title: Experts Urge More Training in Vascular Surgery
description: Many operations to correct diseased arteries and veins are performed poorly largely because of inadequate training and supervision of American surgeons, according to a national commission of specialists of heart and blood vessel disease.

title: Two Die in Fire in England
description: GREAT YARMOUTH, England, Aug. 27 (AP)Two men died in a fire at a Chinese restaurant here late last night, bringing to 10 the death toll in three major fires in Britain in two days.

title: COSIES SUCCESS A COACHING FEAT
description: Twenty individuals of different nationalities, languages and temperaments called the New York Cosmos achieved their highest ambition as a tightly knit team Saturday night.

title: Miss Black America Rejects Title
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 27 (AP)  Thank you, thank you, 22yearold Diane Jackson said as she accepted crown that symbolized her selection as Miss Black America.

title: Freeman Sees Ominous Trend To Protectionism in Australia
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Aug. 27 Orville L. Freeman, the Secretary, of Agriculture in the Kennedy and Johnson Administrations, warned Australian industrialists last week against an ominous trend toward economic protectionism here.

title: Michele Weinstein Wed
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L.I., Aug. 27Miss Michele Weinstein, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Arthur Weinstein of Brooklyn, was married here this evening to Reese Robert Michaels, son of Mr. and Mrs. David Michaels of West Hempstead. Rabbi David Seidman performed the ceremony in Beth Shalom Temple.

title: Credit Markets
description: The bond turned tail and ran last week from advancing shortterm interest rates, remaining in full retreat through Friday.

title: Festival's Cry: Theater to the People
description: Street theater is not presented in the streets, it comes from the streets. Generally, the performers are not professionals, and the plays are created from their own experiences. The audience could be the performers, and tomorrow it may be.

title: DR. GEORGE ANDERSON
description: Dr. George E. Anderson, a Brooklyn physician and president in 19445 of the New York Diabetes Association, died Saturday in Brooklyn Veterans Hospital. He was 74 years old and lived in Brooklyn.

title: Bridge : The Game Is Difficult Enough Without Technical Obstacles
Irate Commuter Who Refused to Pay Faces Court
description: A commuter arrested for refusing to pay his fare to protest deteriorating conditions on the Penn Central's Harlem dine faces arraignment in White Plains this morning on a charge he regards as ironictheft of service.

title: MAYOR PROPOSES STATEWIDE CHIEF TO BATTLE GRAFT
description: Mayor Lindsay, offering an alternative to a key Knapp Commission recommendation. proposed yesterday that Govfrnor Rockefeller appoint a statewide Commissioner for Criminal Justice to attack corruption and monitor efficiency among the police and in the courts.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Big Question for Tokyo: How Will Chinese Act?
description: SINGAPORE, Aug. 21One crucial question in Asia in this decade is the political influence China will exert on the region, and how it will mix with Japan's economic influence.

title: Kathy Paige Is Bride Of Ira Louis Zankel
description: OLD WESTBURY, L. I., Aug. 27  Miss Kathy Sue Paige, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Paige of Westbury and Quogue, was married here this afternoon to Ira Louis Zankel, son of Mr. and Mrs. Karl Zankel of Brooklyn. Rabbi Melvin Kieffer performed the ceremony at the Westbury Hebrew Congregation.

title: Barbara Pechter Has Nuptials Here
description: The marriage of Miss Barbara Ann Pechter, a former student at George Washington University, to John Lichtman, a 1972 graduate of the university, took place at the St. RegisSheraton Hotel last evening. Rabbi Louis Levitsky performed the ceremony.

title: Caroline Orzac Married on L.I.
description: LAWRENCE, L. I., Aug. 27 Miss Caroline Fleiss Orzac, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Edward S. Orzac of Hewlett Harbor, was married here at noon today to Joel Metter, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold Metter of New Hyde Park. The. ceremony was performed in Temple Israel, by Rabbis Harold Saperstein of Lynbrook and Joel Zion.

title: Broncos Win With 3 Passers
description: Charlie Johnson, starting his first game for Denver since he was obtained from Houston, helped lead the Broncos to a 2724 victory over the San Francisco 49ers in a preseason contest yesterday.

title: STANS DEMANDS G.A.O. FUND AUDIT FOR DEMOCRATS
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 27 The Committee to Reelect the President responded today to allegations of apparent and possible violations of the Federal election campaign act by demanding that the General Accounting Office begin immediately a full and comprehensive audit of Democratic fundraising records.

title: INSURERS FOUGHT BY MUTUAL FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 A controversy that has pitted two of the nation's financial giants against each otherthe insurance industry and the mutualfund industryhas come to the end of its first phase, and will soon reach the Securities and Exchange Commission for a decision.

title: Increase in Vipers In Italy Brings Plea To Hunters of Birds
description: ARSOLI, Italy. Aug. 27The hunting season started in most of Italy today and ecologists pleaded with hunters to spare birds that prey on poisonous snakes.

title: 2 PATROLMEN MAKE 8 ARRESTS IN NIGHT
description: Two Brooklyn patrolmen on a new anticrime detail made a total of eight arrests for burglary and pursesnatching in the East New York section last night.

title: School Deadline
description: The Board of Education and the United Federation Teachers, resuming their interrupted contract negotiations today, will have only two weeks of talking time left before the end of the contract and the start of the new school year. This timetable virtually insures another irksome cliffhanger, and the union may yet engage some more of the customary no contract, no work sabrerattling. But both sides have been careful not whip up the emotions of militant pessimism that have in the past so often been part of the destructive strategy of brinkmanship.

title: Nixon Asked to Aid Chicago In Wake of Torrential Rains
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 22 (AP)President Nixon was asked today to declare parts of Chicago and its suburbs disaster areas following a torrential rainstorm that drove thousands of persons from their homes and caused damage estimated in the imllions.

title: Handicapped Parley Awaited
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (UPI)Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr., Democrat of New Jersey, said today he was most optimistic that a White House conference on problems of the handicapped would be called in the near future. Senator Williams, chairman of the Senate Labor and Public Welfare Committee, was author of a resolution calling for such a conference that won unanimous Senate approval on Aug. 18, the day Congress recessed for a twoweek vacation.

title: Nixons Entertain Their Hollywood Backers
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Aug. 27A smiling Johnny Grant, Los Angeles television performer, stopped each car as it entered the gates of the Western White House. He pulled back the curtains, identified the people inside the chauffeured limousines, and then leaped in joy as each new star or starlet arrived today to join probably the largest single gathering of entertainment celebrities in any political year.

title: Mrs. Court Crushes Mrs. King
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug. 27The stately Australian star: Mrs. Margaret Court, soundly thrashed America's No. 1 player, Mrs. Billie Jean King, in the final of the $18,000 Virginia Slims tennis tournament here today, 64, 61.

title: FATTER DIVIDENDS CO UNCHALLENGED
description: A number of large dividend increases, some of them exceeding 20 per cent, have been announced in recent weeks, and have gone unchallenged by the Nixon Administration, which last year set a 4 per cent limit on such increases.

title: Levitt Attacks State on Road Financing
description: Too much of the state's highway program is being financed by longterm indebtedness, Controller Arthur Levitt said yesterday.

title: KAHANE IN HEBRON IN REFUGEE PROTEST
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 27Rabbi Meir Kahane and eight Jewish Defense League followers circumvented Israeli Army roadblocks this morning and entered Hebron, on the West Bank of the Jordan River, to dramatize their demand for the resettlement of Jews in the ancestral city.

title: Sharp Earthquake Is Felt In Sections of Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 27 (UPI)  A sharp earthquake struck various sections of the city early today, shaking buildings and rattling windows for as long as 20 seconds.

title: Troubled Grumman Sees F14 as Its Key Problem
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., Aug. 27The Grumman Corporation, one Of the nation's largest aerospace manufacturers. is confronted by problems similar in nature though not in magnitude to those of the Lockheed Corporation in the months before the giant California concern required Federal financial assistance to preserve it from bankruptcy.

title: SHOP TALK
description: The demand for bicycles, which has more than doubled since 1960, has generated a corresponding demand for cycling accessories: things such as chains, locks and carrying baskets. The popularity of the sport has had its impact on the publishing and fashion worlds, too. Books on the subject have been pouring off the presses and what is and what is not practical attire is a matter of concern to many cyclists.

title: Susan Bloomberg Becomes Bride
description: NORTH WOODMERE, L. I, Aug. 27At Temple Hillel here this evening Miss Susan Bloomberg, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Daniel Bloomberg of Manhasset Hills, was married to I. Arthur Landau, son of Mr. and Mrs. Sidney Landau of Laurelton, Queens. Rabbi Morris Friedman performed the ceremony.

title: Hotel in Times Square Closed in Cleanup Campaign
description: The entrance of the Peerless hotel at 116 West 45th Street as sealed with bricks yestertv and there was a huge sign igh on the wall proclaiming tat the hotel had been closed though joint efforts of the pore and Times Square business rid civic groups.

title: Stubborn Defense Curbs Spassky's Fierce Attack
description: The 19th game of the world chess championship match was exciting and nerveracking for both players. Boris Spassky attacked fiercely, but Bobby Fischer's cool and stubborn defense parried every threat successfully. After 26 moves, an even endgame was reached, and the players agreed on a draw after 40 moves.

title: 24 Are Reported Killed In Venezuela Air Crash
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Aug. 27 (Reuters)  Twentyfour persons were killed when a DC3 airliner of Venezuela's Aeropostal airline crashed tonight near Canaima, 190 miles southeast of here, local police reported.

title: ThreeDay Capital Drive Registers 4.000 Voters
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27Wearing such varied antra as tuxedoes, hard hats, hot pants and clogs, they came to register to vote in an untsual drive that added over 4,000 persons to the city's voting list.

title: Advertising:
description: Since the Middle Ages, denim has been an important fabric for apparel. These days, though, the materialwhose name is derived from the city of Nimes in France is enough in the public eye to be seen in dozens of ads for products from diamonds to telephones.

title: MISS HAYNIE'S 207 WINS DENVER GOLF
description: DENVER, Aug. 27 (AP)Sandra Haynie carded a 68 today to win the $25,000 National Jewish Hospital Ladies Professional Golf Association open.

title: Gruening Leaves Hospital
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 27 (AP) Former Senator Ernest Gruening of Alaska, taken ill during the Democratic National Convention, has been released from Mount Sinai Hospital. The 85 yearold Democrat said he would return to his home state.

title: PENNSY SEEKS CUT IN NUMBER OF AGENTS
description: ALBANY, Aug. 27 (AP)The Penn Central Railroad, which is undergoing reorganization under Federal bankruptcy laws, has asked the state Transportation Department for approval of a plan to reduce sharply the number of freight agents it has at its New York State stations.

title: U.S. Helps Convert 6 Bronx Tenements to Coops
description: The Federal Government is aiding a $4.6million project to transform six tenements in a rundown section of the South Bronx into cooperative apartments for 236 families with low and moderate incomes.

title: Reid Takes Tennis Title
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Aug. 27 (AP)Horace Reid of Atlanta, 17 years old, won the American Tennis Association national men's championship yesterday by defeating Arthur Carrington of Elizabeth, N. J., 67, 63, 76, 98. In the women's final Lorraine Braynt of Chicago routed Brenda Johnson of Philadelphia, 61, 60.

title: Forest Hills Compromise
description: Mayor Lindsay's belated acceptance of a compromise proposal scaling down by onehalf plans for the controversial lowincome housing project in the Forest Hills section of Queens should go a long way toward providing the foundation rock this project has needed.

title: Fighting in Cambodia
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Aug. 27 (UPI)  Heavy fighting erupted today along Route I near the recently recaptured market town of Kompong Trabek, Cambodian military spokesmen said.

title: Barbara Pechter Has Nuptials Here
description: The marriage of Miss Barbara Ann Pechter, a former student at George Washington University, to John Lichtman, a 1972 graduate of the university, took place at the St. RegisSheraton Hotel last evening. Rabbi Louis Levitsky performed the ceremony.

title: CLEARING OF CHECKS SET FOR L.I. BUREAU
description: The Federal Reserve Bank of New York announced yesterday that on Sept. 20 it would convert the Long Island Check Clearing Bureau in Freeport, L. I., into a regional checkprocessing center that it will operate.

title: Philadelphia Has Blackouts
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 27 (AP) Temporary blackouts occurred in some sections of Philadelphia yesterday as a 25day dry spell ended with heavy rains, high winds and lightning. A spokesman for the Philadelphia Electric Company said that power was restored to most areas by midnight. A spokesman for Public Service Electric & Gas Company in nearby Camden, N. J., said that about 50,000 customers were without power from one to 10 hours.

title: ExUnemployables Called Key to End of Job Freeze
description: A group of clerical workers, classified as unemployable a year ago, were so effective in the billing operation of the Health and Hospitals Corporation that they played a major role in lifting the yearlong hiring attrition policy, according to the corporation president, Dr. Joseph T. English.

title: Boy Born in Philippines To Cave Dwellers
description: MANILA, Aug. 27 (UPI) A boy was born today in a remote rain forest in the main Philippine island of Mindanao, Increasing the population of the Tasaday, the world's only known living cavemen, to 27.

title: Good News for the Boys
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 27 (AP)Of the 823 sex tests performed up to today at the Olympic Village, it was determined that all female athletes examined were females. Prince Alexandre de Merode, head of the medical committee of the International Olympic Committee, reported the good news.

title: New YorkPhiladelphia Flights For Commuters Called Success
description: The operator of a new seaplane commuter service between downtown Manhattan and downtown Philadelphia called the service a commercial success yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor.

title: Chichester to Be Buried In a Churchyard on Friday
description: PLYMOUTH, England, Aug. 27 (Reuters)Sir Francis Chichester, who died yesterday. will he buried next Friday in a! tiny parish churchyard near here.

title: Prince Philip at the Games
description: MUNICH, West Germany; Aug. 27 (AP)Prince Philip, the Duke of Edinburgh, arrived today to attend the Olympic Games. Philip's wife, Queen Elizabeth II, is expected to arrive here later.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: FEDERATION BACKS NEW VAULTING POLE
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 27 (AP)The International Amateur Athletic Federation reversed itself today and approved the Americanmade fiberglass catapole for pole vaulting in the Olympic Games.

title: A Kerry Town Rings to Pipes and Fiddles and Clinking Glasses
description: LISTOWEL, Ireland, Aug. 27Roaring in on a crest of fiddle, accordion and pipe music and copious quantities of Guinness and other favorite lubricants, the Fleadh Chocil na hEireann or National Festival of Folk Music, inundated this normally quiet western farming community this week. tourning it into a kind of Irish Woodstock. Some even brought guitars.

title: Aging Premier in British Columbia Facing Youthful Opponents
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Aug. 27This huge, rugged province is in the midst of an exuberant election campaign that is testing an old style of politics as well as the appeal of one of Canada's most durable leaders.

title: Soviet Journalist Privately Urges Jews Not to Pay New Exit Tax
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 27A Soviet. journalist today called for Soviet Jews to refuse to pay the new tax on educated emigrants, charging that it would doom thousands of Jews to years of waiting as unsold slaves until ransom money could be raised abroad.

title: 10 Food Concerns Cited for Violations Of City Health Code
description: The Health Department yesterday released the names of 10 restaurants and other food establishments charged with violations of the city's health code.

title: Mets Beat Braves, 136; 4 HomeRuns Help Seaver
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 27  The longsuffering New York Mets, who apparently like either the Atlanta stadium or the Atlanta pitching, rose from their frustration today and swatted out a 136 decision over the Braves.

title: VIKINGS 20, BROWNS 17
description: Minnesota came up with only one first down in the opening half but held a 63 lead on field goals of 45 and 41 yards by Fred Cox last Saturday night before a crowd of 70,583. The Vikings added two touchdowns in the third quarter. The former Giant ace, Fran Tarkenton, had a hand in the second, throwing a 17yarder to John Henderson. Mike Phipps led a Cleveland rally in the closing minutes, marching his club 66 yards in five plays and 89 in 11 for scores.

title: Yugoslays, Cubans Win
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 27 (AP)Kresimir Cosic scored 28 points, leading Yugoslavia to a 8578 triumph over Italy in a Group B Olympic basketball today.

title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY ROBBYN BERLIN LUV YA MUCH CHUCK ADVT
UGANDA MODIFIES EXPULSION ORDER
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Aug. 27 (AP)President Idi Amin said today that some Asians Who are not Uganda citizens Would he allowed to stay on in Uganda after all.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The West Side Airlines Terminal, which for 17 years served as a gateway to Newark Airport for millions passengers, closed at dawn today. There were no farewell ceremonies yesterday, no exhibitions of sadness by the nearly 50 maintenance workers and Carey Transportation employes who had held jobs there. These employes will be transferred to the East Side Airlines Terminal. Earlier this month the operations of 10 airlines using the terminal located at 42d Street and 10th Avenue, were discontinued. Passengers bound for Newark Airport will now have to travel to the East Side Airlines Terminal, at First Avenue and 39th Street, to board Carey buses, or wait in front of the Airlines Building near Pershing Square.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SAMUEL K. MARTIN 4TH
description: BEDMINSTER, N. J., Aug. 27  Samuel K. Martin 4th, horse breeder and chairman of the Bedminster Planning Board, died yesterday of a heart attack. His agF was 41.

title: Summer Jobs Opened New Worlds for These Young Women
description: Each summer, the affluent areas of the East are invaded by college girls mostly from the farm areas of the Midwest  who work as mother's helpers. Their aim is to save money and enjoy a new experience.

title: BLACK ELK LEADER RETAINS CONTROL
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 27Hobson R. Reynolds, the controversial leader of the Improved Benevolent and Protective Order of Elks of the World, has turned aside an attempt to challenge his reelection to another twoyear term as grand exalted ruler of the allblack lodge.

title: 7 KILLED ON COAST IN TRAFFIC PILEUP
description: BAKERSFIELD, Calif., Aug. 27 (UPI)Dust storms blanketed two freeways in the southern San Joaquin Valley today, causing massive traffic pileups that killed or injured dozens of persons.

title: Five Children Die in Iran
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Aug. 27 (AP) Five children were killed and five were badly hurt when a gasoline tank exploded in Mahshahr, near Iran's $260million petrochemical plant in the Persian Gulf yesterday, it was reported today.

title: U.S. Routs Czechoslovak Olympic Five, 6635
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 27The United States basketball team raced to its 56th straight Olympic victory today, crashing Czechoslovakia, 6635, as competition began in the 20th Games. Tom Henderson of New York City led the Americans With 16 points and played a strong defensive game.

title: Rep. Ford Attacks McGovern And Praises Nixon's Record
Taylor Captures Final
description: HAVERFORD, Pa., Aug. 27Roger Taylor of Britain, the 32yearold son of a Sheffield steel worker, today won the $15,000 Pennsylvania lawn tennis tournament by defeating Mal Anderson of Australia, the 1957 United States titleholder, 64, 60, 64, before a nearcapacity crowd of 2,500.

title: INDIAPAKISTANTALK SAID TO MAKE GAINS
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 27  The third day of talks between Indian and Pakistani officials to resolve differences over the peace pact signed on July 2 ended here on a note of optimism, according to officiall Indian sources.

title: Who Can Live With Shoulds and Oughts?
description: OLD GREENWICH, Conn.My head lies to me a lot of the time. My body never lies to me. When my head lies, my body tells me about it. I get headaches, or stiff necks, or pains in my stomach. My head is full of shoulds and oughts"; things I should or shouldn't do, words I ought.or oughtn't to say. Shoulds and oughts are expectations I lay on myself, or allow others to lay on me.

title: World Lifting Record Set
description: MUNICH, West Germany. Aug. 27 (AP)Charlie Depthios of Indonesia set a world record of 292.10 pounds today in the cleanandjerk in the Olympic flyweight weightlifting competition. Since he made the lift on his fourth attempt after three official tries, it will not be recognized as an Olympic record.

title: July Shipments Fell 10% For Noncellulose Fibers
description: Shipments of noncellulosic yarn and fibers, such as nylon, polyester and acrylics, totaled 205.9 million pounds the 229 million shipped in the previous months, the Textile Economics Bureau, Inc., reported over the weekend.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Angling Test
description: Dear Vic: I began thinking, after your threeday fishless visit with me on Martha's Vineyard, that you might have some doubts about my angling ability.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION FELL DURING WEEK
description: Steel production for the week ended Aug. 26 totaled 2,430,, 000 net tons, the American. Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: New Beckett Play, Not I, to Bow Here
description: The world premiere of a play by Samuel Beckett will be the highlight of a festival of the Irishborn playwright's works to be staged this season by the Repertory Theater of Lincoln Center at the Forum Theater.

title: Bridge: overbidding Mainly Traced To the Male of the Species Overbidding Mainly Traced
description: Overbidders are of many varieties. One man will bid wildly with a terrible hand because he'hopes to make his opponents misguess at a high level. Another will enter the bidding with a weak hand because he came to bid and hates passing.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: May I say a word for quiet? It would seem that this commodity which, with pure air and water, should be the natural basis of a comfortable life, has become a luxurythat no one can buy. I am a writer who was long ago driven to the use of ear plugs at night because of neighbors who refuse to comply with their leases and lay proper carpeting. Now I find that for some fifteen days my working hours are to be disturbed by the raucous presence of an open air festival in Lincoln Center Plaza sponsored apparently by The East River Players.

title: Thornpson's Future as Giant Dimming
description: Is Rocky Thompson, No. 1 draft choice of the New York Giants last year, about to be cut?

title: U.S. Judge Refuses to Bar Start of Waterway in South
description: ABERDEEN, Miss., Aug. 28A Federal judge refused today to enjoin construction of the Tennessee Tombigbee Water way while the Environmental Defense Fund and two Mississippi plaintiffs appeal his decision of Aug. 4 to allow the project to proceed.

title: THE 1972 CAMPIGN
description: SAVANNAH, Ga., Aug. 28 (AP)A 34yearold Atlantic City man carrying a.32caliber pistol has been arrested and charged with threatening the life of President Nixon, the Federal Bureau of Investigation said today.

title: Business Briefs
description: The Federal National Mortgage Association confirmed yesterday that it was seriously considering a new program to deal in conventional home mortgages (that 13, those not backed by the Government) with down payments as low as 5 per cent. Fanny May already has an existing program to deal in mortgages with 10 per cent down payments, but so far this program has evoked only a limited response.

title: Big U.S. Base at Longbinh To Be Turned Over to Saigon
description: SAIGON South Vietnam Aug. 28, ReutersThe sprawling United States military base at Long Binh near Saigon once the largest outside the United Stateswill be handed over to the South Vietnamese Government within two months, the Vietnam Press ;News Agency reported today.

title: New Pullout Scheduled
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Aug. 28 (Reuters)The Western White House said today that President Nixon would make another announcement on troop levels in Vietnam before flying on Wednesday to Honolulu for two days of talks with Premier Kakuei Tanaka of Japan.

title: Auto Buyer Finds DeadLetter Car; ExPostman Held
description: Mail that should have been delivered a year ago went into dead storage in the trunk of car once owned by a former postal employe, postal authorities charged yesterday.

title: Net Monetary Reserves Of West Germany Decline
description: FRANKFURT, Aug. 28 (Reuters)  West Germany's net monetary reserves fell about 300 million marks to 78.9 billion in the week ended Aug. 23, the Bundesbank said today.

title: ExPanther Aide Gets Life
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 28 (Reuters)A former deputy defense minister of the Black Panther party, Elmer Pratt, was sentenced today to life imprisonment for the 1968 robbery murder of a woman school teacher here. Pratt, 24 years old, who was convicted in July, already faces a prison term of one to five years on a conspiracy count stemming from a shootout with the police at Panther headquarters in Los Angeles in 1969.

title: Market Place: Perpetual Lure Of Push Money
description: There's an old term in retailing called Push Moneyor, in salesmen's shorthand, P.M.'s.

title: G.M. Promotes Top Executives
description: DETROIT, Aug. 28The General Motors Corporation today promoted seven of its top executives, putting two of them on the ladder leading to the presidency.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Suit Filed Against NoFault Plan

title: MRS. LOUIS FEIN
description: Mrs. Anna Checnok Fein, former manager of the women's fashion shop of Brown & Levine here, and the widow of Louis Fein, a Brooklyn automobile dealer, died Sunday in South Shore Hospital, Far Rockaway, Queens. She was 70 years old and lived at 320 Beach 59th Street, Arverne, Queens.

title: Executive Changes
description: The McDonnell Douglas Corporation has elected D. P. Murray as executive vice president and John F. McDonnell as corporate vice presidentfinance and planning.

title: MOSCOW ASSAILS EGYPTIAN EDITOR
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 28The Soviet Union today issued a stinging attack on an important Egyptian editor for having accused Moscow of failing to meet its obligations to Cairo under terms of the friendship treaty they signed last year.

title: Sexual Activity Stable Among Youths in Study
description: BATON ROUGE, Aug. 28 (UPI)The sexual revolution has not vet affected the behavior of middle America's teenagers, two researchers reported today.

title: Blaze in Tunnel Strands 50,000 at Grand Central
description: More than 50,000 commuters were stranded in sweltering Grand Central Terminal during the evening rush yesterday after a fire in the train tunnel under Park Avenue halted all service into and out of the station.

title: Independence Groups Pleased
description: SAN JUAN. P. R., Aug. 28Groups advocating independence for Puerto Rico reacted jubilantly today to news of the United Nations vote.

title: DR. SASCHA CHARLES, TEACHER, AUTHOR, 76
description: Dr. Sascha Charles, professor of languages at Yeshiva Uni, versity from 1930 until his retirement in 1967, died yesterday of cancer in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 76 years old and lived at 2020 Herring Avenue, the Bronx.

title: OCCIDENTAL SETS DEAL WITH SOVIET
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28 (UPI) The Occidental Petroleum Corporation announced today that it was negotiating a 1120million metalfinishing contract with the Soviet Union.

title: Cancer Specialist
description: Dr. Isidor Schwaner Ravdin advanced a strong family medical heritage to become one of the nation's leading surgeons and educators until recent years when failing health from the effects of arteriosclerosis forced him to retire to a nursing home.

title: Scott Pistons Scout
description: DETROIT, Aug. 28 (AP)Ray Scott, who was the Detroit Pistons No. 1 draft choice in 1961, has been appointed an assistant coach and chief scout of the National Basketball Association club. Scott retired as a player last year.

title: JERSEY CRIME RATE RISES 12% IN A YEAR
description: TRENTON, Aug. 28 (UPI)More than 3 per cent of New Jersey's residents were victims of major crimes during 1971, according to figures released by the state police today.

title: NEI, AIDE TO SPASSKY, TO LEAVE REYKJAVIK
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Aug. 25 Ivo Nei, who came here on June 21 as part of the threeman Soviet delegation accompanying Boris Spassky, the. world chess champion, is leaving tomorrow. Mr. Nei has no plans to return for the last games of the world champion ship match that Spassky is playing against Bobby Fischer of the United States.

title: Meany Affirms Neutrality In Presidential Campaign
Clam Broth House Shut For Day for Renovation
description: HOBOKEN, Aug. 28  Patrons were turned away at the door of the Clam Broth House today and told the famed waterfront restaurant and tavern was closed for alterations.

title: Rooting Out Corruption
description: The important element in appraising the seeming disagreement between Mayor Lindsay and the Knapp Commission is not to get lost in semantic or procedural differences but to concentrate on their point of total accord: The entire system of criminal justice is shot through with corruption and needs fundamental reform.

title: Business Briefs
description: The flow of new deposits into the nation's savings and loan associations increased sharply last month, the Federal Home Loan Bank reported yesterday.

title: Books of The Times
description: Sometime Daddy be drivin, he call people, names, says the typical black ghetto child, and English teachers everywhere wring their hands in despair. What on earth can he wrong with the child? Is it really just his African anatomy (his thick lips) that keeps him from learning proper English? Or is it his native dimwittedness? And where did he pick up his terrible habits? From the persisting tradition of the 19thcentury minstrel show? From some British regional dialect passed on to his forebears by slave masters? Or from the veneer his ancestors contrived for the white man boss? Why is it that this black child knows nothing and can learn nothing?

title: Nader Unit Assails Nixon Data On MiddleClass Tax Benefits
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28A tax reform group attacked today, with detailed figures, the recent assertion by the Nixon Administration that the middle class was the group that benefited most from what are commonly called tax loopholes.

title: 10 Years of Container Shipping Bring Major Changes in Port
description: Ten years ago this month, the New York port's first large marine terminal designed exclusively for container ships opened.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It seems unlikely that President Nixon will risk a facetoface debate with Senator McGovern.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: My husband and I have just returned from a Western vacation which included a white water river trip. Army surplus waterproof steel ammunition boxes were used as equipment on the river and were carried as hand luggage on three major airlines through Kennedy, O'Hare and Salt Lake International Airports. Labeled 620 Cal. 30 Cartridges... this extraordinary and sinister appearing baggage, to our profound dismay, neither aroused curios ity nor received even cursory inspect tion.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX AND OTC FALTER
description: Prices declined in moderate volume yesterday on the American Stock Exchange and in overthecounter trading.

title: Dr. Isidor S. Raudin, Surgeon For Eisenhower, Is Dead at 77
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 28 (UPI)Dr. Isidor S. Ravdin, an internationally known surgeon who was a member of the team that operated on President Dwight D. Eisenhower in 1956, died yesterday in a nursing home in suburban Wallingford. He was 77 years old.

title: Sidney Gans Dead; Operations Leader Of Stars and Stripes
description: Sidney Gans, director of op erations here for Stars and Stripes, the military newspaper, died yesterday of a heart ailment in St. Luke's Hospital. He was 60 years old and lived at 425 Riverside Drive.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Leading Indicators Index Continued to Rise in July
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28The Government's index of leading economic indicators, which is supposed to move up or down ahead of the economy generally, continued to rise in July, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: A Distraught Man Slays His Family And Then Himself
description: MIDDLETOWN, Conn., Aug. 28An airline mechanic shot and killed his wife and two children early this morning and then killed himself, according to the police.

title: EXCHANGE MISTAKEN ON MERRILL LYNCH
description: Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith said yesterday that a report in the Aug. 28 New York Stock Exchange Bulletin that the firm had closed 13 brokerage offices was so erroneous it's unbelievable, and the exchange quickly agreed that The Bulletin was in error.

title: Felt Has Some Answers To the Taxing Questions
description: To keep the Knicks and Rangers in New York, the city would not only have to lower Madison Square Garden's realestate tax, but would also have to assume a portion of the Garden's longterm debt and interest payments, Mayor Lindsay has been told.

title: POSTAL COST CUTS TO BAR RATE RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25 Postmaster General Elmer T Klassen said today that the early success of a stringent costcontrol program begun by the Postal Service in March had eliminated the need to seek a projected increase of one cent an ounce in firstclass mail rates next year.

title: Maine Acts Against Gaming
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Aug. 28 (AP) In a move aimed primarily at Maine's agricultural fairs, the attorney general's office said today that it had ordered the elimination of gambling games throughout the state, Letters mailed last Friday to all 16 county sheriffs by Deputy Attorney General Richard S. Cohen said, All gambling games wherein monies are awarded to the winners should be closed down immediately, as they are in violation of the gambling laws.

title: CONVICTIONS UPHELD BY BERRIGAN JUDGE
description: HARRISBURG, Pa. Aug. 28 (AP)A Federal judge upheld today the convictions of the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan and another antiwar activist, Sister Elizabeth McAlister, for smuggling letters in and out of a Federal prison.

title: Cutoff Jeans: A Short Route To Comfort
Mohegan Lake Residents Are Fighting Sewerless Development
Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28 (AP)United States scheduled airlines recorded net profits of $20.7tnillion in the first six months of 1972, the Air Transport Association said today.

title: Arthur Daley
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 28  Mark Spitz slammed into the end wall and he was suddenly within the grip of an exultation he had never known before. Three times he had tried to win a gold, medal in an individual event at the 1968 Olympics and three times he had failed: In the magnificent natatorium tonight the 22yearold swimming marvel began his date with destiny.

title: PRICE REVIEW SET ON PREPARED FOOD
description: WASHINGTON Aug. 28 (UPI) The Price Commission said today that it will review carefully any price increases on canned and frozen fruits and vegetables marketed by the nation's largest food packers.

title: A Parking Violation Sparks Jersey City RockThrowing
description: JERSEY CITY, Aug. 28 (UPI)  The Jersey City police said today a twohour rock and bottlethrowing spree apparently sparked by the arrest of a 29yearold man last night had been spontaneous.

title: Woman a Suicide by Fire
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Aug. 28 (UPI) Karen Jeanne McCormick, 41 recent anthropology graduate of the University of. Texas, douSed herself with gasoline yesterday arid set herself afire on a vacant lot. She died a few hours later. The police said the 23yearold woman. had left no suicide notes but that the act apparently had not been political.

title: Spaldeen Olympiad Is Proclaimedand Anyone Can Play
description: With the ceremonial lighting of an eternal garbage can by a 260pound torchbearer who ran all the way around the corner of City Hall yesterday, the city's Olympiad of street games was officially proclaimed.

title: Prince William Dies In Air Race Crash
description: LONDON, Aug. 28Prince William of Gloucester, a cousin of Queen Elizabeth II and ninth in line of succession to the throne, was killed today when his light aircraft crashed in an air race. He was 30 years old.

title: INTEREST RATES STILL INCREASING
description: Interest rates continued their rapid rise yesterday as underwriters gave up trying to get full price for two large corporate issues marketed earlier this month and several major banks joined in increasing their prime lending rates to 5 per cent.

title: SEELEY TRIUMPHS OVER FERNANDEZ
description: Walter Seeley, of Sayville, L. I., outpointed Jose Fernandez of the Dominican Republic in a bruising 12round feature at Madison Square Garden last night.

title: Distortion on Busing
description: Ever since Governor Wallace scored such spectacular successes in the Democratic primaries by exploiting the issue of school busing, it was obvious that demagogic distortion of this issue would be a staple of the Presidential campaign.

title: 3 Jersey Divers Found Dead; Were Exploring Florida Cave
description: LIVE OAK, Fla., Aug. 28 (AP) Three caveexploring divers from New Jersey died one with a deep knife wound in his stomachin the depths of a spring on the Suwannee River, the authorities reported today.

title: 2 Are Accused of Slaying And Robbing a Bronx Man
description: Two Bronx men were arrested yesterday on charges of killing and robbing a man who had held a bon voyage party for himself.

title: Lin Piao in Retrospect
description: PARISWhen I visited the city of Sian in July 1971, the political commissar of the province said to me: No revolutionary can be truly called revolutionary until he is safely dead.

title: Travelers Insurance Co. Ordered to Make Rebate
description: BOSTON, Aug. 28 (AP)The Travelers Insurance Company was ordered to refund to its policy holders more than $1.1million in excess premiums charged to some automobile owners in 1971.

title: At the Bell, Needham Comes Out Shaking Hands
description: James J. Needham, the 46yearold accountant who left a $38,000 job at the Securities and Exchange Commission, put in his first full day yesterday as chairman of the New York Stock Exchange, a post that pays considerably more and is said to provide a limousine as well.

title: Everything's Under Control
description: WASHINGTONAn assessment of the New Economic Policy is appropriate at this time, for it was a year ago Aug. 15 that President Nixon announced the program and the onset of the freeze. It's a popular period for the press and other judges of the policy to announce their verdicts. Inevitably most of the judgments are based on the way wages and prices have behaved during the period of controls. But those critics who make their assessments only on the basis of the monthly march of the Cost of Living Index across the chart are missing an important point.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I do not agree with the statement by the honorable Julian Bond (news story Aug. 3) labeling blacks for Nixon political prostitutes.

title: Ecuador Bus Plunge Kills 19
description: UITO, Ecuador, Aug. 28 (Reuters)  Nineteen people were killed and five seriously injured when a crowded bus plunged down a 150foot ravine in northern Ecuador last night, the police said today. The dead, they said, included an American couple, identified as Thomas and Elsy O'Kelly.

title: U.S. TO BEGIN TESTING OF AIRCUSHION CARS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28 (AP) The first testing under real driving conditions of the controversial auto safety air cushion system was given a goahead today by Secretary of Transportation John A. Volpe.

title: Black Woman Jockey First in Jersey Race
description: ATLANTIC CITY, N. J., Aug. 28Cheryl White, the first black woman jockey in the nation, rode Heliamber to victory in the second running of the Boots and Bows Handicap at Atlantic City race track. In the 1mile test in grass, Bett's Mandy, ridden by Donna Hillman, finished second, 2 lengths back. Whistlers Aunt, handled by Lois Meals, was third.

title: FITTIPALDI WINS AT BRANDS HATCH
description: BRANDS HATCH, England, Aug. 28Emerson Fittipaldi, who said he wasn't bored driving 312.7 miles, won the Rothinan's 50,000 today. It was billed as Europe's richest motor race, and probably was.

title: Model Interest Sold
description: The First Washington Securities Corporation, an affiliate of the Banca Commerciale Italiana Group, has purchased a 20 per cent equity in Model, Roland & Co., Inc., a New York investment firm.

title: Controller of Currency Descries No Wrongdoing in Bank Case
Median Income Rose $10,000 in 3 Fairfield Towns
description: More than half of the families in the wealthier communities of Connecticut's Fairfield Countyhome of many Manhattan executives  saw their annual income increase by at least $10,000 during the nineteensixties.

title: 2 MORE SOLDIERS SLAIN IN BELFAST
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland Aug. 28Two British soldiers were shot to death today in Belfast and a civilian was killed by a mine elsewhere in incidents attributed to terrorists.

title: State Conservation Chief Urges Environmental Aid
description: LAKE PLACID, N. Y. Aug. 28 (UPI)  Conservation Commissioner Henry L. Diamond today challenged the state's voters to back up their environmental rhetoric with their money.

title: APOLLO 17 ROLLED TO LAUNCHING PAD
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Aug 28When they rolled the Apollo 17 moonship out to the launching pad here today, it was the slow beginning of the end of a spaceage era, the time of man's reconnaissance of the moon.

title: Chinese Computers in 3d Generation
description: Mainland China has developed her computer technology to a point that makes it selfsufficient and not dependent on foreign help, Prof. Thomas E. Cheatham, Jr., of Harvard University said yesterday.

title: Chou Croute, at $21.60, Triumphs by Two Lengths
description: A filly proved the best in the Fall. Hightweight Handicap, the race that featured the opening the Belmont Park fall meeting yesterday. Chou Croute, owned by.E. V. Benjamin and ridden by John Rotz, took the six furlong sprint, under a burden of 131 pounds.

title: Group Formed in U.S. to Protest Soviet Treatment of Solzhenitsyn
description: A number of American writers, artists, trade union leaders and civil rights spokesmen have formed a committee to protest Soviet treatment of Aleksandr Solzhenitzyn, the 1970 Nobel Prizewinning writer whose books are banned in his homeland.

title: G.M. Will Produce The Wankel Engine In Limited Quantity
description: DETROIT Aug 25The Ceneral Motors Corporation announced today it would produce the rotary engine in limited quantities and that it might be offered as an option on the small Vega in about two years.

title: 139,000 More Americans
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28 (UPI) The United States grew by an estimated 139,000 persons in July, bringing the population to about 208,837,000, the Census Bureau reported today.

title: Rainbow Racism
description: The specter of racism raised by Uganda's abrupt expulsion of Asians is by no means confined to that African country.

title: For the Asians Now Living in England, It's a Good Life Marred by Some Bias
description: LEICESTER, England, Aug. 25  Ramniklal M. Kamani came to this English Midlands city from Uganda 15 months ago with no money and no prospects.

title: Hanoi Honors 5 Chinese It Says Died in U.S. Raid
description: TOKYO, Aug. 28 (AP)The North Vietnamese Government held a memorial ceremony Sunday in Hanoi to pay last respects to the five Chinese seamen killed in the United States bombing of a Chinese merchant ship Aug. 22 a Peking broadcast reported today.

title: INDIA AND PAKISTAN EXTEND THEIR TALKS
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 28Talks between India and Pakistan on the differences that have devel oped over their peace agreement of July 2 were extended today for another day after four days of discussions.

title: NuclearFuel Plant Planned
description: The Gulf Oil Corporation said yesterday that its Gulf General Atomic Company division would build a nuclearfuel plant near Raleigh, N. C., at an initial cost of more than $20million. The plant, which is to be constructed over several years, will employ about 1,200 workers and will have a payroll of some $16million a year by 1980.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Allende's Economics Runs Afoul of Household Budget
L.I. Man Held as Embezzle
description: A Long Beach, L. I., executive was arrested yesterday and charged with embezzling $64,500 from the Sunnyside Savings and Loan Association at 4225 Queens Boulevard, Long Island City, Queens, where he had formerly been an assistant vice president The Federal Bureau of Investigation announced the arrest of the man, Thomas Anthony Seabury, 29 years old, of 457 West Walnut Street, on charges of violating the Federal Reserve Act.

title: FRAUDS ADMITTED BY HARLEM STORE
description: One of Harlem's largest and oldest furniture stores pleaded guilty yesterday to defrauding numerous lowincome customers with deceptive methods of advertising, selling and collecting.

title: Lerner Offer Expires
description: The Lerner Stores Corporation, New York, announced yesterday that about 59,000 shares of its common stock had been tendered and accepted in response to its offer of $42 in cash per share for a maximum of 100,000 shares. Made Aug. 8, the offer expired yesterday at 5 P.M. During the day, the company's common stock, listed on the American Stock Exchange, closed at 42, up .

title: Daughter of Jersey. Executive Found Strangled
description: The 24yearold daughter of a New Jersey meat company executive was found dead in park in Union yesterday, nearly two weeks after she disappeared.

title: Miller Takes His Comedy Seriously
description: For 25 years now theatrical audiences have hired, so to speak, Arthur Miller to do their brooding for themabout the millstones of commerce that grind a man to dust, about political hysteria, incipient fascism, antiSemitism, the tug and pull of family strife.

title: Trial Marriages Grow in Popularity, for Better or for Worse
description: It is described in many waystrial marriage, companionate marriage, experimental living and premarital living. Some go so far as to call it the new mode of marriage. Whatever the name, an everincreasing number of young men and women apparently favor the arrangement.

title: State Audit Scores Westchester as Lax on Finances
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 28A state audit of Westchester County's bookkeeping procedures has criticized a number of practices, including what it described as failure to collect several million dollars in overdue bills and to follow up on claims of stolen welfare checks.

title: To Ban Chemical Arms
description: A recent British proposal for a twostage approach the elimination of chemical weapons provides a pragmatic initiative that could breathe some new life into the faltering 25nation Geneva disarmament conference.

title: $250 Fine in Weapons Case
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 28 (AP) Alvin Turner, an Alabama schoolteacher, was fined $250 and placed on a year's probation today by a United States magistrate on a charge of attempting to carry weapons aboard a plane. Turner was arrested at Philadelphia International Airport Aug. 12 after a search of his flight bag turned up a seveninch hunting knife, an 11inch butcher knife, a kitchen knife and a pair of scissors.

title: The Duchess de Richelieu Is Dead in France at 86
description: PARIS, Aug. 28 (Reuters)The Duchess de Richelieu died last Tuesday at the age of 86,1 it was announced today.

title: Nixon Vote Drive Here To Focus on Democrats
Dell'Acqua Funeral Mass Will Be Offered by Pope!
description: ROME, Aug. 23Pope Paul VI will officiate Thursday at the solemn funeral rites for Angelo Cardinal Dell'Acqua, his vicar general, who died near the French shrine at Lourdes yesterday at the age of 68.

title: AMVETS Oppose Amnesty
description: NEW ORLEANS, Aug. 28 (AP) The American Veterans of World War II, Korea and Vietnam have backed President Nixon in his opposition to amnesty for anyone fleeing the country to avoid military service. The resolution passed as the group's 28th annual convention ended here yesterday.

title: The New Serfdom
description: In the midnineteenth century, the buying and selling of human beings was a normal phenomenon in Czarist Russia. Like slaves in the United States in that same benighted era, Russian serfs were considered commodities, the property of their owners. The price varied, depending on the serf's abilities and education, so that one expert enough in arithmetic to do his master's accounts or with sufficient knowledge of French to give gracious service to foreign guests was considered much more valuable than an illiterate field hand.

title: Puerto Rican Sovereignty Backed in U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Aug. 28A United Nations committee approved a resoluion today recognizing the inalienable right of the people of Puerto Rico to selfdetermina tion and independence.

title: Owner of Long Shot Optimistic About Hambletonian Chances
description: DU QUOIN, III., Aug., 28 Anderson who? In a few thousand carefully chosen words, the man who will drive Axystar, the 100to1 outsider in Wednesday's 47th annual Hambletonian for 3yearold trotters, today identified himself, his experiences, his political philosophy and hopes for a creditable showing in the showcase event of harness racing.

title: REFINANCING IS SET BY FOOD COMPANY
description: The Universal Container Corporation, a diversified food concern that has had heavy losses in recent years, announced yesterday a refinancing program that would involve the repayment of $4.8million in loans, chiefly from the Franklin National Bank, and their replacement with credit lines from group of lenders headed by the A. J. Armstrong Company, commercial finance company.

title: Spitz Leads U S. to World Marks
description: MUNICH, West. Germany, Aug. 28Mark Spitz and Shane Gould set world records en route to Olympic gold medals tonight, but it might have been only a preview of grander greatness from competitive swimming's two magic names in the coming days.

title: Big Splash at Munich Mark Andrew Spitz
description: When he was 8 years old, Mark Spitz went into the water, and soon was swimming 75 minutes a day.

title: Whyte Takes Laser Series With Four Victories in Row
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Aug. 281 Skip Whyte. a Narragansettj Bay (R. I.) sailor who represented the SeawanhakaCorinthian Yacht Club, won they Jesse A. B. Smith Trophy today with a perfect score off Larchmont Y. C.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: As I read James T. Wooten's Aug. 23 account of the Republican convention, I began to, chuckle; soon my laughter gave way to embarrassment for the Presidency; I ended with waves of profound outrage that such a vast body of human beings could allow itself to be turned into a bunch of robots.

title: URBAN LEAGUES GET HALF OF JAZZ PROFIT
description: George Wein, producer of last month's Newport Jazz FestivalNew York, yesterday presented a check for $5.924.28 to the New York and National Urban Leagues.

title: Personalities: Aid for Islanders
description: Eddie Westfall and Gerry Desjardins, two of the more recognizable names on a New York Islander roster that is composed primarily of castoffs and rookies each signed threeyear contracts yesterday with the new National Hockey League team. Both acquired last June in the expansion draft.

title: McGovern Seeks Jewish Votes With a Booklet on His Record
KNAPP UNIT COOL TO MAYOR'S PLAN
description: The Knapp Commission disagreed yesterday with Mayor Lindsay's dayold proposal for a statewide commissioner appointed by the Governor to investigate and monitor all aspects of the criminal justice system.

title: Notes on People
description: Angela Davis, the avowed Communist who was acquitted of a murder conspiracy charge in California recently, arrived in Moscow from Paris and said at the airport that she owed her liberty to a campaign started in her behalf in the Soviet Union. Without it, she said, I would not be free.

title: Willis Reed Cleared Of Criminal Charge Of Impersonation
description: The miniature honorary policeman's shield that the basketball star Willis Reed flashed during an argument with an offduty patrolman was too small to have been mistaken for real, a judge ruled yesterday.

title: Some Rome Markets Close In Protest of Price Freeze
description: ROME, Aug 28  Outdoor markets and many butcher and grocery stores here remained closed today in a protest against a Government order freezing food prices in Rome.

title: For the Gifted of China, Schools Called Palaces
description: SHANGHAIAny visitor to China will regale you with tales of its children, and their manifold charms and talents. But how is this talent harnessed and developed?

title: Minority Center, at 40, Looks to a New Era
description: NEW MARKET, Tenn., Aug. 22Rosa Parks could not attend, and Stokely Carmichael did not attend and the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. will not be back again.

title: Gilmore Leads Sailing
description: MARINA DEL REY. Calif., Aug. 28 (AP)John Gilmore of San Francisco, the only yachtsman in the field familiar with the course, won two races today and took the lead in the Mallory Cup North American sailing championships.

title: P. R. Mallory &
description: A battery manufacturer sued another maker of highperformance batteries yesterday, asking for $150million damages.

title: JAPAN WILL IMPORT EXTRA GOODS OF U.S.
description: TOKYO, Aug. 28 (AP)Japan will import $750million in United States goods this fiscal year on an emergency basis in an effort to reduce Japan's trade surplus with the United States, informed sources said today.

title: Memorial Dedicated To 11 in Attica Revolt
description: ATTICA, N. Y., Aug. 28 (AP)A memorial honoring 11 prison employes killed in the Attica riot last September was dedicated yesterday in a private, unpublicized ceremony.

title: Miss Goolagong Winner on First Visit Here
description: An hour after the interviews began, Evonne Goolagong allowed herself the trace of a yawn.

title: Approvals Needed
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation reached an agreement yesterday under which the Pennsylvania Life Company will acquire for $21.3million in cash all of the capital stock of the ITT Hamilton Life Insurance Company and its subsidiary, they ITT Life Insurance Company of New York. Pennsylvania Life, through subsidiaries, is engaged primarily in the underwriting and direct marketing of accident. health and life insurance, and through its Penn General Agencies subsidiary, in the mar keting of casualty insurance written by nonaffiliated companies.

title: Rise in Crime Rate For Nation Slows
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28The Federal Bureau of Investigation said today that reported crime rose more slowly last year than it has at any time since 1965. But its statistics showed that the slowdown had resulted from decreased growth rates for crimes against property, not crimes of violence.

title: Four Concerns Plan Financing of Ships For $270Million
description: Citicorp Leasing, Inc., First National City Bank, the General American Transportation Corporation and Kuhn, Loeb & Co. announced yesterday they are arranging for the financing of three United States flagships in an estimated amount of $270million before construction subsidy.

title: Business Briefs
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 28 (AP)Kuwait has agreed to help finance a search for commercial oil deposits in North Yemen and plans to bring in international oil companies to do the drilling, Iraq's state news agency said today.

title: One Small Life
description: MAPLEWOOD, N. J.After a period of sweltering weather, a bright cool August day dawned over Concord, Mass., in 1853, and Henry Thoreau, who had planned to sit and write in the house all day, decided that it was wiser to spend such a day outdoors. He went for a sail on the Sudbury River with his friend, William Ellery Charming. He later memorialized this glorious day in his journal.

title: U.S., Seeking a Cut in Its Payments to U.N., Calls Excessive Support by One Member Unhealthy
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 28The United States has begun an intensive drive here to have its share of the United Nations budget lowered from 31.52 per cent to 25 per cent.

title: ReliefOffice Guard Accused of Slaying A Fellow Employe
description: A welfarecenter guard with a history of treatment for emotional disturbances yesterday stabbed to death his former girl friend, also an employe of the Social Services Department, in the offices of the Gramercy Welfare Service Center at 110 East 28th Street, the police said.

title: 5 IN SLOOP REPORT ATTACK BY CUBANS
description: KEY WEST, Fla., Aug. 28Five Americans reported today that their sloop was attacked and fired upon Friday night in the Yucatan Channel by two large coastal craft from Cuba.

title: Port of New York in 71 Collected Third of Nation's Customs Duties
description: The Port of New York accounted for close to onethird of the nation's customs collections in the fiscal year ended last June 30.

title: Advertising:
description: There's a brouhaha brewing in the area of advertising awards that could significantly change the patterns of the past and result in one widely recognized competition with broad participation.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I am an independent Democrat in the sense that I am free from party commitments in voting. Senator Humphrey, at the conclusion of the Democratic convention, during the nomination of a VicePresidential candidate, eloquently asked his fellow Democrats to come home.

title: White Rhinoceros Born
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Aug. 28 (UPI)A rare white rhinoceros, believed to be the first conceived and born In captivity in the United States, was born today at the city zoo.

title: BERNARD G. DAVIS, PUBLISHER, DEAD
description: Bernard G. Davis, chairman of the board of Davis Publications, Inc., magazine publishers, died of a heart attack Sunday while on a business trip to Seoul, South Korea. He was 66 years old.

title: BENGALS WIN, 3420, AS DEFENSE EXCELS,
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 28 (AP)The Cincinnati Bengals, with Ken Anderson directing a balanced attack and an alert defense intercepting two passes and recovering a fumble, defeated the Philadelphia Eagles, 3420, tonight in an exhibition game.

title: Stage: Black Companies
description: Theater West of Dayton, Ohio, has much in common with the Everyman Street Theater of Washington. The shows presented at the Lincoln Center Community Street Theater Festival by these two black companies provided essential street theater.

title: TRADING DELAYED IN SOME FUTURES
description: Trading on the Commodity Exchange here was delayed yesterday to permit the exchange to catch up on paper work resulting from record activity last week.

title: Paraguay Court Rejects Bid By Ricord to Bar Extradition
description: ASUNCION, Paraguay, Aug. 28 (Reuters)The Paraguayan Supreme Court today rejected a lastditch attempt by the alleged head of a heroinsmuggling ring, Joseph Ricord, to avoid extradition to the United States.

title: Advertising:
description: Time Inc.'s forthcoming new magazine called Money has closed out advertising for its initial issue in October with the sale of 47 pages. To the corporation that means about $140,000 in ad revenues, but to Richard B. Thomas, Money's advertising sales director, it means a few more things.

title: DICK NASH
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Aug. 28 (UPI)Dick Nash, publicity director for Santa Anita Racetrack, died Saturday night of a heart ailment. He was 58 years old.

title: Iran Buses Collide. 39 Die
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Aug. 28 (AMThirtynine people were killed and about 40 seriously injured early today when two buses collided near Behshahr in northern Iran, officials reported.

title: Smith's First Foe In U.S. Open Is 15
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., Aug. 28In a matchup with David and Goliath. overtones, Stan Smith, the defending Unitad States Open tennis ch pion, has drawn 15yearold Billy Maitin, of Palos Verdes Estates, Calif.,,as his firstround opponent in the tournament, which starts Wednesday.

title: Drought May Force China To Import Wheat From U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28 (UPI) Government analysis said today that a drought in northern China may force Peking to seek wheat purchases from the United States, where domestic prices are already 33 per cent higher because of recent sales to the Soviet Union.

title: MARKET DECLINES IN SLOW TRADING
description: The stock market incurred its third consecutive loss yesterday as declines outnumbered advances by about an eighttofive ratio in the slowest trading in eight weeks.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28More and more, life declines into a struggle to ?? inducements to terror, and those ?? us who do not go mad in the battle become better and better all the time at not panicking.

title: Rockefeller Appoints Aide
description: ALBANY, Aug. 28 (AP) Governor Rockefeller has appointed Richard C. Marron of Loudonville to a $39,000ayear post as deputy secretary to the Governor, his office announced today.

title: Thomas Lynch, Banker, Dead; Headed Bronx Board of Trade
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., Aug. 28Thomas P. Lynch, a banker and Bronx civic leader, died here today at the home of his daughter, Mrs. Patricia Benza. He was 68 years old and lived, in Pelham Manor.

title: 2 Are Accused of Hiding Identities to Buy 3 Rifles
description: Two young men, one of whom had been arrested previously in connection with the lethal firebombing of the Sol Hurok office, were indicted yesterday on charges of falsifying their identities in the purchase of three highpowered rifles in Woodbourne, N.Y.

title: The Lockheed Loan Revisited
description: WASHINGTONA year ago President Nixon signed into law the $250million Lockheed bailout loan. Since then Lockheed has convincingly demonstrated over and over that transforming this giant corporation into the world's most opulent welfare recipient was a very sad mistake.

title: SYLVESTER DEL BELLO
description: Sylvester W. Del Bello, father of Alfred Del Bello, Mayor of Yonkers, died yesterday of heart attack at St. Vincent's Hospital. He was 78 years old.

title: State Democrats Set Up a Unity Panel
JOHN J. WYLE
description: HASTINGS ON HUDSON, N. Y., Aug. 28John J. Wyle, a member of the New York Stock Exchange from 1920 to 1948, died today here. He was 69 years old and lived at 765 Broadway.

title: AMELIA E. WHITE, 93, INDIAN ART EXPERT
description: Amelia Elizabeth White died yesterday at her home in Santa Fe, N.M., where for half a century she had been a leader in calling attention to the artistic achievement of American Indians. She was 93 years old and formerly lived in New York.

title: Roundup: It's Long Year For Marichal (15th Loss)
description: This may be the longest year in: the.baseball life of Juan Marichal. The onetime pitching hero of the San Francisco Giants lost his 15th game of the campaign last night, bolding to the St. Louis Cardinals, 42, in Busch Stadium. He has won only five times.

title: Twain Letters on Married Life Are Donated to U. of California
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Aug. 28Livy drinks ale now for tonic, Mark Twain observed about his wife in a letter to his sisterinlaw, Susan Langdon Crane, in 1871.

title: Asarco Cuts Lead Prices Because of Inventory Rise
description: The American Smelting and Refining Company said yesterday that it was reducing the price of refined lead to 15 cents a pound, from 15.5 cents a pound, because of rising invcntories.

title: Solid Show Caps 3Day Folk Festival
description: UPPER SALFORD TOWNSHIP, Pa., Aug. 28With the help of Mother Scott, an 80yearold singer and guitarist from Washington who once sang and played with Leadbelly, the legendary singer, the Philadelphia Folk Festival managed to escape the threat of rain that hung ominously in the leaden skies over the Old Pool Farm last night.

title: Talcum Suspected in Deaths of 21 French Babies
description: PARIS, Aug. 28 (UPI)Policemen searched shop supermarkets and grocery stores, throughout France today for cans of a talcum powder, Bat:, suspected of having caused the deaths of 21 babies in the northeastern part of the country.

title: Carl Anderson, Lawyer, Dies; Merck Aide, Lutheran Leader
description: Carl Magnus Anderson, lawlyer, Lutheran layman and I retired executive of Merck & Co., Inc., pharmaceutical and health products concern, died Saturday at his home, 97 Blackburn Road, Summit, N. J. He was 67 years old.

title: Treasury Takes Down Aaron Burr Plaque
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28 (AP)Aaron Burr, the Vice President who killed Alexander Hamilton, the first Secretary of the Treasury, in a historic duel, is still persona non grata at the Treasury Department 168 years later. His name, put on a press room door, drew the ire of citizens, so off it came.

title: M'GOVERN AIDE GIVES WITHDRAWAL STAND
description: PARIS, Aug. 28 (Reuters)Abram Chayes, chief foreign policy adviser to Senator George McGovern, said today that if Mr. McGovern were elected President in November, any United States troop withdrawals from Europe would be subject to constant review depending on Soviet reaction.

title: Capsules: N. Korean Wins, Errs
description: Ho Jun Li, a soldier in the North Korean Army, won the gold medal in the smallbore, rifle shooting prone position yesterday at the Olympic Games in Munich, West Germany, and then stirred up controversy by attempting to explain his victory at a press conference.

title: 80 Evacuate Airliner
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Aug. 28 (AP)Eighty passengers on an Eastern Air Lines DC9 used chutes at the Charlotte airport shortly after dawn today when a fire warning light came on. No one was injured. Eastern spokesmen said the light had come on because of a short circuit in a small motor and that there had been no fire.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The United States Senate has demonstrated a totally irresponsible and shocking stand in defeating the Kennedy and Hart legislation banning all hand guns and the licensing and registration of all other guns. The subsequent legislation banning the manufacturing and sale of hand guns that followed was only a compromise action aimed at placating those advocates of strict gun control, and, once again, heeding the dictates of a strong gun lobby.[Editorial Aug. 9.]

title: Reds Beat Mets, 52, On Homer by Tolan
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 28Gary Nolan, the Reds righthander who started this season with a rush and then suffered a siege of spasms around the shoulders and neck that put him out of action for more than three weeks, showed tonight that he must be in top health again.

title: Kenya's Asians, in Growing Anxiety, Watch Uganda Developments
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Aug. 27 At nine each evening, the Asian families in the Pangani and Eastleigh sections of Nairobi sit in silence and listen to the nightly Government news, the Voice of Kenya.

title: Antinoise Bill Held Infeasible By Construction Industry Leader
description: A spokesman for the construction industry attacked yesterday as unworkable a proposed city noisecontrol law, saying it would strangle construction in the city and drive up costs, among other adverse effects, if it was passed as drafted.

title: Eagles'
description: PHILADELPHNA, Aug. 29 (AP)Ike Kelley, a middle linebacker for the Philadelphia Eagles, injured his left knee on the opening kickoff of a 3420 exhibition game loss last night to the Cincinnati Bengals and will be sidelined at least 10 weeks. An Eagle spokesMan said Kelley was taken to Graduate Hospital, where surgery was performed.

title: Bandit Caught in Ink Blast
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 29 (UPI)A bandit robbed a bank in Chicago's Loop area today of almost $5,000 but was captured minutes later after a device placed between the cash bundles exploded and sprayed him with red ink. Kelly Andrews, who told the police he had been in Chicago for only three days, was arrested in a parking garage adjacent to the Amalgamated Trust and Savings Bank. A bank teller, Patricia Dutko, said she had placed the inky device among the bills and handed them to the bandit, who stuffed the loot into his pockets and fled.

title: 4 Illinois Killings Unsolved
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 29 (UPI)A suburban police chief said today that investigators had checked out at least 200 leads without uncovering a clue to the murder of four persons Aug. 5. Chief Ralph Hummel of Barrington Hills testified at coroner's inquest into the deaths of Paul Corbett, 67 years old; his wife, Marian, 57; Mrs. Dorothy Derry, 60, his wife's sister; and Miss Barbara Boand, 22, Mrs. Corbett's daughter from a previous marriage.

title: CITY BLAMES U.S. FOR DIRTY WATER
description: New York City charged yesterday that the Federal Government was largely responsible for delays in cleaning up polluted waters here.

title: Advertising:
description: How do you top the successful, widely imitated and highly controversial National Airlines Fly Me advertising campaign?

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: WHEAT FUTURES SCORE ADVANCES
description: Wheat futures prices advanced sharply yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade, chiefly because of interest by commercial concerns.

title: But Will New York Get Its Share?
description: WASHINGTONThe concept of general revenue sharing is marvelously appealingthe prospect of large infusions of nostringsattached money from Washington with which to rescue our states, counties and municipalities from the brink of fiscal disaster at no cost to their taxpayers. But every ointment has its flies and I think New Yorkers should be aware of some of those in the State and Local Assistance Act now before the Congress before deciding whether or not its passage is in their longterm interest.

title: Kansas Firm Is Penalized For Violating S.E.C. Rules
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission today said it has suspended the brokerdealer registration of the Mick, Stack & Smartt Investment Co., Inc., of Wichita, Kan., for 21 days.

title: State Fair in Syracuse Opens With TieUps and Balloon Trip
description: SYRACUSE, Aug. 29The 131st New York State Fair got off to a soaring start today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Networks Planning Quality Specials
description: An unusual number of special programsmusicals. quality dramas, historical documentaries, biographies and sports eventswill highlight the new television season, which the commercial networks will start the week of Sept. 10.

title: Massachusetts U. Budget
description: BOSTON, Aug. 29 (AP)The board of trustees of the University of Massachusetts approved today the university's maintenance budget request of $98million for the fiscal year 1974, a 10.3 per cent increase over the previous year's request.

title: Chess Play Adjourned
description: Bobby Fischer and Boris Spassky adjourned the 20th game of their world championship chess match in Iceland. Play is to resume today. Details are on Page 26.

title: Full Pocket Chicago Victor
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 29 (AP)Full Pocket raced by Irish Faberge in midstretch to win the $10,000 Inaugural Handicap today at Sportsman's Park. The winner, ridden by Jeff Anderson, was timed in 1:10 2.5 for six furlongs and paid $4.

title: Susan Thom Married Here
description: Miss Susan Maria Thom, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Paul G. Thom of Medina, Ohio, was married last evening to Jeffrey Winston Loubet, son of Mr. and Mrs. Nathaniel R.
