Loubet of Scarsdale, N.Y., and Atlantic Beach, L.I. Only members of the immediate families attended the ceremony, which was performed at the home of the bride's sister, Miss Mary Thom, by Judge Joseph Morrow of Civil Court.

title: Spitz Passes Drug Test
description: A United States Olympic team doctor said the use of drugs among athletes in the Games this year was less than in previous Games.

title: GOLD OFF IN LONDON BUT ON RISE IN ZURICH
description: LONDON, Aug. 29 (AP)The price of free gold dropped more than 30 cents an ounce in London's bullion market today after the long British holiday weekend, but it edged up 121/2 cents in Zurich. The United States dollar eased slightly in most European foreign exchanges.

title: Gurney Helps Grant in His Comeback
description: ONTARIO, Calif., Aug. 29 For more years than he cares to remember, Jerry Grant had the unenviable reputation of a car breaker, an amiable giant who was hard on equipment. Whenever a car owner was looking for a driver, Grant's name would come up. Yeah, I know

title: MURDER INQUIRY STALLS IN JERSEY
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., Aug. 29The investigation into the murder of Joan Kramer, found dead in a ditch in Union Township yesterday, appeared stalled today as several police departments combined their separate investigations into one case.

title: Kin Are Notified of 2 Deaths For the Same Man in Miami
description: MIAMI, Aug. 29 (UPI)J. P. Mullins's family will remember him as the man who died twice.

title: Hearing on Times Request To Bar Strike Is Put Off
description: A hearing on a request by The New York Times for court order barring the New York Mailers Union from calling a strike at The Times was postponed yesterday with the consent of both sides until next Tuesday.

title: Engrossed in the East
description: Kenneth Todd Young was an exuberant, dynamic diplomat who had been engrossed in the problems of Asia since his undergraduate days.

title: 17 Arrested in Drug Raids
description: DOVER, N. J., Aug. 29 (UPI)Twenty Dover Township policemen arrested 17 persons, including four women and three juveniles, in a series of drug raids early this morning. A police spokesman said warrants were issued after undercover agents purchased drugs from suspects. They raided six homes and two apartment complexes, seizing marijuana, smoking pines and other narcotics paraphernalia, he said.

title: Prepared Baby Food Is Convenient, but Is It Best for the Child?
description: Those little jars of baby food on the supermarket shelf can be extremely tempting to the new mother: Just twist open the lid, heat if desired and pop the spoon into baby's mouth.

title: Vietnam Withdrawal?
description: President Nixon's announcement of a further 12,000man reduction in American troops in Vietnam by Dec. marks essential accomplishment of his primary objective: withdrawal of the halfmillion American troops President Johnson sent therewithout bringing down the Saigon Government. But the removal of combat units from South Vietnam itself unfortunately does not terminate American combat participation in the Indochina war. Norfor that very reasondoes it remove Vietnam as a major campaign issue, despite Mr. Nixon's conviction that it would do so.

title: DRAMA BY BERGMAN TO BE SEEN ON C.B.S.
description: Ingmar Bergman, the Swedish film director and writer, has sold his first original drama for television to the Columbia Broadcasting System, for showing this season.

title: Personalities: Thomas in Trouble
description: Duane Thomas, the moody, talented pro football problem child, was in trouble again yesterday, this time with the San Diego Chargers. The Chargers suspended Tho mas and imposed a daily $150 fine on the running back after he failed to meetCoach Harland Svare's deadline to report to training camp by 6 o'clock Monday night. Thomas was acquired by San Diego from the Dallas Cowboys on July 31 in a trade for Billy Park, a wide receiver, and Mike Montgomery, a running back.

title: Quiet Play Turns Intense in End Game
description: The opening and the middle game of the 20th game of the world championship match were relatively insignificant, but an intense struggle developed in the endgame. Boris Spassky, the champion, stands slightly better in the adjourned position after white's 41st move.

title: An Olympian Burglary: Boston's Medals Taken
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Aug. 29 (AP)Ralph Boston, winner of three Olympic medals in the long jump, lost them and other valuables today in a breakin at his house, police said.

title: BARRY REFUSES TO PLAY IN WEST
description: Rick Barry, the star forward of the New York Nets, said last night he would not return to the Golden State Warriors of the National Basketball Association even if a Federal court ruled against him in pending litigation.

title: Behind the Facade
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 29  When first started writing about Massachusetts politics. I interviewed Louis Lyons, then the head of the Nieman Foundation for newspapermen at Harvard.

title: 2 Newark Bridges Over Passaic Face Closing as Perils
description: NEWARK, Aug. 29 (AP) Two of the three bridges linking Newark with western Hudson County will be closed to all vehicles soon unless the state agrees to finance their repair, Hudson County Freeholder Angelo Cifelli warned today.

title: U.S. TURNS BACK CUBA FIVE, 6748
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 29  The United States won its 58th straight Olympic basketball game tonight with a 6748 victory over Cuba.

title: U.S. MARSHALS SENT TO BIG HORSE SHOW
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 (UPI)  The Department of Agriculture said today it had called in three United States marshals to protect personnel who are enforcing a ban on pain training at the nation's biggest Tennessee walking horse show.

title: Canada Ties U.S., 22 In World Cup Soccer Play
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 29 (AP)John Douglass booted a goal with 9 minutes 10 seconds to play to give Canada a 22 tie with the United States in Group 1 World Cup soccer tonight.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 29 (AP)Sam Nunn, a state lawmaker who was endorsed by Lieut. Gov. Lester G. Maddox and by black leaders, upset Senator David H. Gambrell today in runoff for the Democratic senatorial nomination.

title: Two Found Dead in East Harlem Among 7 Homicide Victims in 24 Hours
description: An unidentified man and woman were found shot to death early yesterday morning on an East Harlem street corner Autoposies performed at the Bellevue Hospital morgue indicated that they were narcotics addicts.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 Representative Wilbur D. Mills said today that he would think about becoming Secretary of the Treasury if Senator George McGovern was elected President and offered. him that Cabinet post, as he said today that he would do.

title: Rep. Ford Sees a Chance For NonpublicSchool Aid
description: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich., Aug. 29 (UPI)The House Republican leader, Gerald R. Ford of Michigan, said last night that Federal aid to nonpublic schools had a better chance of Congressional enactment now than at any other time in the 24 years he has been in the House.

title: 3 Navy Fliers From Jersey Die in Helicopter Off Spain
description: LAKEHURST, N. J., Aug. 29 (AP)Three Navy Fliers were lost at sea when their helicopter exploded on approach to an aircraft carrier, the Navy announced today.

title: ABORTIONS BACK FOR L.I. INDIGENT
description: The Nassau County Medical Center said yesterday that it had set today for resumption of elective abortions for Medicaid patients, in response to a Federal Court ruling last week.

title: GRAHAM STERLING, 68, LED COAST BAR UNIT
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 29Graham L. Sterling, a member of the law firm of O'Melveny & Myers and a past president of the State Bar of California, died yesterday after a stroke in Good Samaritan Hospital. He was 68 years old.

title: M'GOVERN OFFERS NEW TAX PROGRAM IN WALL ST. TALK
description: Senator George McGovern outlined a new program of tax reforms and moderated his approach to welfare reform yesterday, imploring the nation's investors to accept both out of economic selfinterest and in a spirit of social responsibility.'

title: TV MUSICIANS RATIFY NEW 21MONTH PACT
description: A new 21month labor contract covering the employment of television musicians has been ratified by affected members of the American Federation of Musicians. The contract is retroactive to Aug 1 and will expire April 30, 1974.

title: Snipers Linked to I. R. A. Attack Army Post at a Belfast Hospital
description: BELFAST. Norunern Ireland, Aug. 29 (AP)Sporadic shooting arid a heavy explosion interrupted the uneasy lull here today after a night of gun battles between British troops and guerrillas.

title: Yanks Rally to Win, 76; Then Bow, 74, to Rangers
THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Aug. 29Following is the official White House transcript of President Nixon's news conference here today:

title: Excerpts From Senator McGovern's Address Explaining His Economic Program
Britain Freezes $24.5Million Loan as Warning to Uganda's Leader
description: LONDON, Aug. 29  The British Government today froze a $24.5million loan to Uganda in a major financial move against the East African nation, which has ordered the expulsion of most of its Asian citizens.

title: Spassky Given Slight Edge As Chess Play Is Adjourned
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Aug. 29  Boris Spassky and Bobby Fischer ??ourned the 20th game of the world championship chess match here tonight.

title: Status of Legislation
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 The House of Representatives approved legislation two weeks ago that would prohibit courts from ordering desegregation plans that require students to attend schools other than the ones closest or next closest to their homes.

title: Women Are Unhappy
description: MUNICH, Germany, Aug. 29 (UPI)  Currents of dissatisfaction run high among women in the Olympic Village, especially among the Americans, who claim that discrimination against women athletes is not the exception but the rule.

title: Beridg: At Least One of Ace Team Will Not Be Back in 1973
description: Changes in the Aces team, which is scheduled to defend its Bermuda Bowl world championship title next year in South America, were reported during the recent Summer Nationals in Denver when two Aces, Jim Jacoby of Dallas and Paul Soloway of Los Angeles, divorced themselves from their teammates for the Spingold event.

title: Carol Channing to Do Lorelei Lee Again
description: Lorelei Lee is coining back. She will be a little older and perhaps a little wiser, but still an innocent holding tightly to those diamonds that are a girl's best friend.

title: GMC Signs Truck Deal
description: The General Motors Corporation said yesterday that it had signed an agreement under which the TAW International Leasing Corporation will purchase, over a period of five years, United Statesmanufactured heavyduty GMC trucks valued at $80million. TAW will use the trucks for leasing in Africa.

title: McGovern Sees Peril In Troop Cutback Plan
description: Senator George McGovern, campaigning here yesterday, said President Nixon's plan to cut United States troop strength in South Vietnam by 12,000 men endangered American servicemen remaining in the Southeast Asia country.

title: Heavy Rainstorm Hits Rome
description: ROME, Aug. 29A twohour violent rainstorm hit Rome today, flooding buildings and streets, cutting power lines and trapping thousands of foreign tourists inside churches and ruins.

title: Police Use Recorders to Catch Givers of Bribes in Construction
description: Police Department investigators, wearing hidden recording devices, have begun fanning out to construction sites across the city in a drive to gather evidence against contractors who pay bribes, Bronx District Attorney Burton B. Roberts disclosed yesterday.

title: North and South Koreans Open Full Red Cross Talks
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Wednesday, Aug. 30  The North KoreanSouth Korean Red Cross talks opened today in Pyongyang, the North Korean capital, opening a new chapter in the history of Korea, divided for 27 years.

title: Volunteer Programs Gain
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 (UPI) Applications for the Peace Corps and VISTA have increased 22 per cent since President Nixon's decision last year to combine the two volunteer programs into a citizens service corps called Action, recruiting officials reported today.

title: Belgrade Cautious in Trial of 4 Croats
description: ZAGREB, Yugoslavia, Aug. 29In a dingy courtroom on the second floor of the old Zagreb district court building, four Croatian student leaders are in the fourth week of a trial dealing gingerly with the most potentially explosive challenge to Yugoslavia: nationalist rivalries among the country's Balkan potpourri of peoples.

title: EIS BEAT REDS ON HOME RUNS, 30
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 29  Superb pitching by Jim McAndrew, combined with a homerun geared attack by his teammates, gave the New York Mets a 30 triumph over the Cincinnati Reds tonight.

title: Baron Magnus von Braun Dies; ExMinister, Father of Scientist
description: BONN, Aug. 29Baron Magnus von Braun, a Cabinet member in the Weimar Republic and father of Wernher von Braun, the rocket pioneer, died in his home at Oberaudorf, Upper Bavaria, today. He was 94 years old.

title: 2 BONN MINISTERS RESIGN OVER FEES
description: BONN. Aug. 29 (Reuters)Chancellor Willy Brandt accepted today the resignations of two junior ministers in his coalition Government after disclosures that they had received sums of money from a rightwing publishing house that retained them as advisers.

title: Spitz Wins 3d Gold Medal With 3d World Mark
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 29Mark Spitz won his third Olympic gold medal with another worldrecord performance tonight.

title: Florida Stater Operated Ord
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Aug. 29 (AP)Clint Parker, a Florida State linebacker and its defensive signalcaller, underwent surgery for a knee injury today and will probably be out for the season. He suffered torn ligaments during practice yesterday.

title: SCHOOLS REVIEW HEALTH CONTROLS
description: The executive directOr of the Board of Education's office of school buildings, Hugh McLaren Jr said yesterday his office was reexamining its extermination problems to overcome mounting unsanitary conditions in the city's schools.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 (UPI)A cozy private club atmosphere in which officials shuttle between high government posts and big grain export concerns has helped some companies reap windfall profits from deals like the recent big wheat sales to the Soviet Union, a farm leader charged today.

title: Daniel Ellsberg's Closest Friend': His Wife, Patricia
description: She was a rich girl from Scarsdalean heiress with a trust fundand she had a cum laude degree from Radcliffe, an apartment on Sutton Place, and glamorous radiotelevision job in which she traveled all over the world interviewing famous people.

title: Business Briefs
description: MANILA, Aug. 29 (AP)An American lawyer, William H. Quasha, against whom the Philippine Supreme Court ruled on the parity rights issue, said today he had asked for a 15day extension from Sept. 4 in which to file appeal.

title: E. E.C. Starts Its First Action To Recover Competition Fine:
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 29The, European Executive Commission has started legal proceedings against a Dutch chemical company to recover a $200,000 fine imposed for contravening the E.E.C.'s competition rules.

title: Hurricane Loses Strength
description: MIAMI, Aug. 29 (UPI)Hurricane Betty lost strength over the Atlantic today, lessening the threat that it had posed to the Azores. The National Hurricane Center said that the storm. was small, and that there was little chance that it would hit any of the Azores Islands directly.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: Stock and bond prices, the most accurate gauge of Wall Street's real views, showed little response yesterday to Senator George McGovern's speech on tax reform and income insurance at the New York Society of Security Analysts.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Soft, Sexy Voice
description: Americans will probably always identify Lilli Marlene with Marlene Dietrich, but for the weary German and British soldiers who contested the desert wastes outside El Alamein nearly 30 years ago, it was the soft, sexy voice of Lale Andersen that conjured up for them visions of lovely Lilli by the barrack gate.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Truth And Consequences
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa. Truth took an awful beating during the recent Presidential primary campaign, and we're likely to see more of the same in the long Presidential campaign ahead. I'm referring to the careless rhetoric being thrown around these days with the business community the main target.

title: PRICE INCREASES SET BY REVERE COPPER
description: Revere Copper and Brass, Inc., said yesterday that it would increase base prices on a number of products, except copper water tube and related items, by 1.25 cents to 2.50 cents a pound, beginning with shipments Sept. 5. Involved in the increases are copper and alloy sheets, rolls, strips and plates, including standard roofing sizes, extruded shapes, alloy wire and copper rods and bars. The Revere Copper move was similar to one initiated earlier by the Anaconda Company and followed by the Cerro Corporation.

title: Kristin Erickson Wed in Scarsdale
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., Aug. 29  Miss Kristin Natalie Erickson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Russell F. Erickson of Scarsdale and Stockbridge, Mass., was married here this afternoon to John Hilary Cummings Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Cummings of San Mateo, Calif.

title: CANADA SEEKS END OF STRIKE ON PIERS
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 29  Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau today called a special session of Parliament for Thursday to legislate emergency measures to end a strike of west coast dock workers that has blocked overseas shipments of prairie wheat. The legislators are in their home districts, planning for election campaigns.

title: Japanese Cadets Are Now Professional and Apolitical
description: YOKOSUKA, Japan, Aug. 27Norio Iguchi is a husky, squareshouldered senior cadet here at Japan's Defense Academy, the combined equivalent of West Point, Annapolis and the United States Air Force Academy.

title: Court Dismisses Celler's Suit To Nullify Democratic Primary
description: State Supreme Court Justice Dominic S. Rinaldi dismissed Yesterday a petition by Representative Emanuel Celler to nullify the result of the Demoratie primary, which he lost co Elizabeth Holtzman by 609 votes.

title: Wrestler Runs Amok; Is Locked in His Room
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 29 (AP)A frenzied Turkish, super heavyweight wrestler, bleeding and weeping after being disqualified in an Olympic freestyle match, raced after his huge Bulgarian opponent following their bout today.

title: Spitz Takes 3d Olympic Gold Medal
description: Mark Spitz, the 22yearold Californian who is attempting to win an unparalleled seven gold medals at the Olympics, captured his third gold medal of the Games at Munich, West Germany, yesterday with his third world record. He overtook Steve Genter, a teammate, to win the 200meter freestyle in 1 minute 52.78 seconds. Spitz earlier had won the 200meter butterfly and had anchored the victorious American 400meter freestyle relay team.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Housing Roller Coaster Several Reforms Aimed at Steadying Residential Building Appear Stalled
description: Of all the roller coaster sectors of the American economy, housing is without question the most visible and the most important. At the present time, with signs proliferating that the 18month upsurge in residendial construction may be topping out, and worries widespread that tight er money in 1973 could presage a slower pace in building next year, thoughtful analysts are once again asking some basic questions about the stability of the nation's largest industry.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: CHARLESTON, S.C., Aug. 29 (UPI)State Senate Eugene N. Zeigler defeated John Bolt Culbertson, a longtime liberal, today in a race for the Democratic Senate nomination. He will face Senator Strom Thurmond, a Republican, in November.

title: COFFEE MEETING FAR FROM ACCORD
description: LONDON. Aug. 29With only two days left before their annual quotasetting meeting is to adjourn, the 62 members41 producer nations and 21 consumer nationsof the International Coffee Organization are far from an accord that would insure a price acceptable to both sides.

title: Shriver, in Detroit, Declines to Take a Stand on Busing Issue
description: DETROIT, Aug. 29Sargent Shriver, the Democratic VicePresidential candidate, declined today to take a stand on the merits of school busing across district lines for integration purposes on the ground that it might be inflammatory to discuss an issue that was before the courts.

title: NIXON SEES LAXITY BY BOTH PARTIES ON SPENDING LAW
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Aug. 29President Nixon said today at a news conference that both the Democratic and the Republican parties had apparently committed technical violations of the new campaign spending and reporting law.

title: Power Shortage in Florida
description: MIAMI, Aug. 29 (UPI)Florida Power & Light Co. pleaded today with Floridians to reduce their use of electricity because of a critical power shortage that could dim the lights for 3.5 million resident. The utility said that a breakdown of the plant at Riviera Beach, Fla., had dropped the company's maximum capability to 6.3 million kilowatts.

title: A Man Failure Is Blamed For Grand Central TieUp
description: Human error apparently was responsible for the massive commuter tieups at Grand Central Terminal on Monday.

title: When Knives Were Not Concealed
description: When I was growing up in Washington every young boy had a knife, and a pocket to keep it in. It was called a pocket knife.

title: Endowment Makes $500,000 in Grants For Museum Staffs
description: Grants totaling nearly $500,000 directed toward increasing the range and caliber of the professional staffs of American museums have been announced by Nancy Hanks, chairman of the National Endowment for the Arts.

title: U. S. to Speed Visa Work
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 (UPI) The State Department said today that the United States would speed up the processing of visa applications by Asians who are being expelled from Uganda, but is not planning an emergency program to admit thousands of refugees.

title: Labor Council Urges F.C.C. To Restrict Reruns on TV
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 29 (UPI)The A.F.L.C.I.O. executive council said yesterday that excessive reruns were reducing job opportunities in the film, television producion and entertainment industries and were grossly unfair to viewers.

title: Death in Newark
description: Undaunted by the necessity for operating in the shadow of the nation's communications capital, The Newark Evening News enjoyed for many years merited recognition as a newspaper of distinction and responsibility. Today, victim of the ruthless cost squeeze that afflicts all newspapers, aggravated by a senseless tenmonth strike and the special problems that make Newark a crucible of the urban crisis, it becomes another tombstone. in the overfull journalistic graveyard.

title: The Malaise of Paris
description: PARIS, Aug. 28Paris is resort town now. It is beautiful and bright, even though the weather has been stubbornly nasty for most of the summer.

title: Haughton Sets His Sights On Elusive Hambletonian
description: DU QUOIN, Ill., Aug. 29Through more than three decades of driving standardbreds, Billy Haughton has brought home more than 3,000 winners and his horses have earned $17million. The man from Oyster Bay Cove, L. I., by way of Gloversville, N. Y., has driven trotters and pacers to more than 100 separate 2minute miles.

title: McGovern's Tax Plan
description: Money made by money should be taxed at the same rate as money made by men.

title: Agenda: Whales
description: The steady destruction of the world's whalesmostly by those enterprising capitalists, the Japanese, and those profitminded socialists, the Russiansis one of the tragedies of this small planet. The few surviving species of whales, fascinating, complex and largest of mammals, deserve man's protection and not the continuing violence of his insensate greed.

title: McGovern Aide Explains Policies to Paris Officials
description: PARIS, Aug. 29 (Reuters)Abram Chayes, chief foreign policy adviser to Senator George McGovern, discussed today the Democratic Presidential candidate's views on monetary policy and reduction of United States forces in Europe with Government officials here.

title: Argentine Weekly Seized for Prison Death Report
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 29Argentine security policemen raided the offices of a news weekly here last night as heated controversy continued over the killing of 16 guerrilla suspects in a jail a week ago.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today Aug. 30, 1972
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY Special Committee on Colonialism3 P.M.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Aug. 29 (UPI)Gov. George C. Wallace will be released from a hospital tomorrow or Thursday after doctors review his recovery from abdominal surgery, Billy Joe Camp, the Governor's press secretary, said today.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: A secondary offering of 400,000 Class A common shares of the A. T. Cross Company at $59.50 per share was announced yesterday by Goldman, Sachs & Co. and New York Hanseatic Corp. as joint managers of an underwriting group. The company's stock closed unchanged at 59 on the American Stock Exchange.

title: President Accepts Resignation Of Watson as Envoy to France
description: SANCLEMENTE, Calif., Aug. 29 (AP)  Arthur K. Watson has resigned as. United States Ambassador to France, citing reasons of health, the Western White House announced today.

title: TEACHERS GIVEN NEW WAGE OFFER
description: The Board of Education yesterday offered pay increases ranging from $1,200 to $2,100 to the city's teachers over threeyear period, according to sources close to the contract talks.

title: A.F.L.C.I.O. PREDICTS PROLABOR CONGRESS
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 29The Executive Council of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations ended a twoday meetingthere today with an expression of confidence that it could save Congress from turning conservative and antilabor.

title: JEWISH AGENCY BARS EXIT FEE FOR SOVIET
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 29World Jewish fund raisers assembled in Jerusalem today decided against paying the large fees imposed by the Soviet Government on educated Jews wishing to emigrate to Israel.

title: McGovern's Assumptions
description: George McGovern is finally tidying up his economic proposals and trying to reassure the more moderate elements of the Democratic party, but in the campaign propaganda battle with President Nixon he's still working tinder severe handicaps.

title: 2 AIRLINES SPUR HIJACKING CURBS
description: American Airlines and Trans World Airlines announced yesterday that they would soon begin inspecting the hand luggage of all boarding passengers in a new effort to deter hijacking. They will become the nation's first airlines, other than shuttle airlines, to search the purses, briefcases and packages of every passenger.

title: Bowerman Fires Salvos All Around at the Games
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 28 (AP)"You ask me if I'm happy, a disgruntled Bill Bowerman, head coach of the United States track and field team, said today. The answer is no. This is a lousy job.

title: McGovern's Supporters Rally at Kennedy Estate
description: McLEAN, Va., Aug. 29 (AP) Several thousands friends of Senator George McGovern turned out tonight for a picnicconcert at the Hickory Hill estate of Mrs. Robert F. Kennedy. Despite the absence of the Presidential nominee, they held a threhour political party.

title: ExWhite House Aide Testifies On Democratic Office BreakIn
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29E. Howard Hunt, a former White House consultant whose name has been mentioned in the investigation of the June 17 breakin at the Democratic national headquarters here, appeared in public today for the first time since the incident when he showed up to make a deposition.

title: 3 Times Square Theaters Raided in Obscenity Drive
description: A crackdown on Times Square Mollie houses that specialize in films that authorities consider obscene was begun yesterday by the police as the latest phase of Mayor Lindsay's campaign to drive undesirable persons out of the theater district.

title: MSGR. FITZPATRICK, PASTOR IN LIBERTY
description: Msgr. Francis X. Fitzpatrick, pastor emeritus of St. Peter's Roman Catholic Church in Liberty, N.Y., died Monday after long illness in a Bronx nursing home. His age was 73.

title: MRS. ADAM WALSH
description: BRUNSWICK, Me., Aug. 29 (AP)  Mrs. Dorothy Fisher Walsh, wife of Adam Walsh, captain of the University of Notre Dame football team in the 1920's, died Sunday at the age of 69.

title: Bomb Damages Basement Of U.S. Embassy in Athens
description: ATHEN, Aug. 29  A time bomb exploded in the basement of the United States Embassy in Athens today.

title: Indians Protest Sentences
description: ALLIANCE, Neb., Aug. 29 (Reuters)More than 50 American Indians are camped here to protest what they charge are excessively light sentences to two white men convicted of killing an Oglala Sioux Indian last February. They want Gov. J. James Exon to reverse the sixyear and twoyear sentences given to Leslie and Melvin Hare in the death of Raymond Yellow Thunder.

title: Sammy Davis Buys Share of Tropicana in Las Vegas
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Aug. 29 (Reuters)Sammy Davis Jr. announced today that he had bought a share of the Tropicana Hotel.

title: First Air Force Ace In Indochina Is Cited
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 29 (UPI)Capt. Richard S. Ritchie of Reidsville, N.C., shot down a North Vietnamese MIG21 defending Hanoi yesterday to become the first United States Air Force ace of the Indochina war, the United Staes command said today.

title: GOVERNOR TO GIVE PORT POST TO AIDE
description: Governor Rockefeller will soon appoint Robert R. Douglass, one of his closest associates, as a commissioner of the Port Authority, of New York and New Jersey it was learned yesterday.

title: Brush Fire Is Contained In Coast National Forest
description: SULPHUR SPRINGS, Calif., Aug. 29 (UPI)California's most devastating brush fire of the season was contained today after eight days of overrunning 17,100 acres at a cost of six lives and more than $2million.

title: HARVARD'S PRESS GETS NEW CHIEF
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Aug. 29 Arthur J. Rosenthal, a 52yearold New York publisher who has made a financial success of printing scholarly books, was named today to head the troubled Harvard University Press.

title: Cindy III and Injured
description: Cindy Potter, the Indiana University diver who finished seventh in the threemeter springboard Monday night, was hampered by nearpneumonia and a foot injury that almost put her out of the Olympic event.

title: RENE LEIBOWITZ, 59, COMPOSER, IS DEAD
description: PARIS, Aug. 29 (Reuters)Rene Leibowitz, a composer and critic, died yesterday after a heart attack, it was reported today. He was 59 years old.

title: Machine Export Cleared
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 (UPI) The Commerce Department today authorized United States manufacturers of grinding machines used in making ball bearings to export $6million worth of their equipment to the Soviet Union.

title: SENATE INQUIRY SET INTO THE AIR FORCE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29The Senate Armed Services Committee, after a series of delays, has decided to proceed next month with an extensive and critical look at the command and control structure of the Air Force.

title: LOTTERY FOR DRAFT EXPECTED TO GO ON
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 (AP)I Selective Service said today that it planned to hold annual) draft lotteries in the years ahead whether or not President Nixon's authority to conscript men is. permitted to expire next July. 1.

title: Two Indicted Here In GunSale Cases; One Tied to I.R.A.
description: A Yonkers gun dealer whose name surfaced in the course of a Texas grand jury investigation of alleged gunrunning by American partisans of the Irish Republican Army was one of two men indicted here yesterday on charges of illegal gun sales.

title: Volpe Asks $750Million For Rail Grade Crossings
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Aug. 29 (UPI)Secretary of Transportation John A. Volpe said today that he had asked Congress to approve a $750million, 10year program for protection at 30,000 railroadhighway grade crossings where primitive kinds of accidents occur.

title: Lev Yashin, ExGoalie, Back as Dynamo Coach
description: Somehow it seemed unfitting that he was not dressed in the black uniform he wore for 24 years on soccer fields from Moscow to Santiago to Stockholm and for which he was known as the Black Octopus to most soccer fans around the world.

title: Shooters Are No. 1?
description: Lieut. Col. Bill McMillan got a taste for gold in the 1960 Olympics in Rome when he won the rapidfire pistol shooting. He is now in his fifth Games.

title: Stocks Show Declines on Amex And OvertheCounter Market
THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 (AP) President Nixon's chief economic adviser said today that Senator McGovern's new welfare and tax reform proposals did not dispel the threat of an enormous tax increase.

title: Hanoi Is Critical
description: PARIS, Aug. 29 (UPI) North Vietnam today criticized as insignificant President Nixon's announcement of further troop withdrawals from Vietnam.

title: 150 GOLFERS PLAY IN AMATEUR TODAY
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Aug. 29 (UPI)Ben Crenshaw, the blond Texan with a list of impressive titles already under his belt this year, leads a field of 150 golfers into tomorrow's opening round of the United States Amateur championship.

title: REDD L. EVANS DIES; SONGWRITER WAS 60
description: Redd L. Evans, songwriter and publisher, died yesterday in New Rochelle (N. Y.) Hospital. He was 60 years old and lived at 112 Penn Road in Scarsdale, N. Y.

title: Lassiter's Bail Is Set
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 29 (AP)  Olbert F. Lassiter, retired Air Force general accused of illegally diverting more than $21million from the now bankrupt Penn Central Railroad, came here from California today to answer the charges.

title: RENTS SAID TO RISE 90% IN DECONTROL
description: The city's Commissioner of Rent and Housing Maintenance said yesterday that the state's 14month old vacancy decontrol law had had a devastating impact on rentals here, with an average 90 per cent increase being charged to new tenants in 80,000 apartments.

title: COMPROMISE SEEN IN NIXON ELECTORS
description: With one roadblock out of the way, the state Republican and Conservative parties moved closer yesterday to an agreement designed to give. President Nixon a second line the Conservative oneon the Nov. 7 ballot.

title: Newark News Shuts Tomorrow After 88 Years of Publication
description: NEWARK, Aug. 29The Evening News, once New Jersey's largest and most important newspaper, announced today that mounting financial losses in the aftermath of a recent, long strike were forcing it to close permanently after Thursday's editions.

title: Appellate Justice Stays a Court Order Authorizing the City to Grant 7.5% Rent Increases
description: An Appellate Division justice temporarily stayed yesterday State Supreme Court order authorizing the city to grant rent increases amounting to 7.5 per cent this year for about 400,000 rentcontrolled apartments.

title: Business Briefs
description: TOKYO, Aug. 29 (Reuters)Japan had a balance payments surplus of $402million in July the Finance Ministry announced today.

title: Pocono Hanover Triumphs
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Aug. 29 (AP)Pocono Hanover, driven by Les Pullen, won the $3,000 Collingswood Pace today at Freehold Raceway. The winner, pacing the mile in 2:0425, returned $8.20 for 2.

title: Dayan's Peace Feeler
description: Israeli Defense Minister Moshe Dayan's suggestion for a new interim truce line across the Sinai Peninsula represents a timely bid to utilize for peace the new situation created by Soviet withdrawal from Egypt. It adds modicum of needed substance to Premier Golda Meir's earlier appeal to President Sadat to negotiate as equals by offering the Egyptian leader something enticingly new to negotiate about.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Advertising:
description: Take a retailer who sells only via the closed door method. Add a commercial written by and starring the client. And mix on television stations during the late movie programs.

title: SPEED OF STORM AID PRAISED BY ROMNEY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 (UPI)  George Romney, Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, who has been under criticism in recent weeks for slow Federal reaction to the damage caused by the tropical storm Agnes, said yesterday that never before have homeless families been rehoused so rapidly.

title: Interest Has Kicker
description: A subsidiary of a Penn Central subsidiary announced yesterday it had obtained a $50million first mortgage, 15year loan, which will pay interest only for the first three years.

title: ARMY IS CRITICIZED ON CIVILIAN SPYING
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29A Senate subcommittee reported today that Army spying on civilians in the late nineteensixties was far more extensive than we had imagined and suggested that all the military dossiers and computer files might not have been destroyed, despite Pentagon promises that they would be.

title: A Reported Dividend On G.I. Policies Denied
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 (AP)The Veterans Administration said today that a cruelly deceptive and false leaflet was being circulated saying that veterans with World War II G.I. insurance would get a special dividend.

title: U.S. OPEN BEGINS 12DAY RUN TODAY
description: The realization of what tennis fans have been dreaming for year takes place today in Forest Hills, Queens, with the start of the United States Open tennis championships.

title: Red Smith
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 29For practice, they bilked a kid from Uganda early in the program but it was petit larceny, like lifting a piece, of costume jewelry Woolworth's. The bright and airy cockpit called the Boxhalle wasn't more than twothirds filled when Degratias (Thank God) Musoke, a Ugandan featherweight, punched Finland's lefthanded. Jouko Lindberg around the ring and lost a unanimous decision.

title: Travel Agency Says It Can't Fly Over 100 Stranded Americans Home
description: LONDON, Aug 29 (Reuters)A travel agency involved in the plight of more than 100 American passengers stranded at London's Gatwick Airport since Sunday said tonight that it could not fly them home.

title: FOREST HILLS COST PER UNIT $59 702
description: The latest cost estimates on the compromise proposed in the controversial Forest Hills lowincome housing project have gone up to $59,702 for each apartment  almost half again as much as the next costliest project put up by the City Housing Authority.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Aug. 29 (UPI)Dr. Paul Samuelson, Nobel Prizewinning economist and adviser to Presidents Kennedy and Johnson, said today he believed that Senator George McGovern had stolen thunder from President Nixon with his tremendous tax sim. plification program.

title: Auto Makers Reaction
description: DETROIT, Aug. 29  The General Motors Corporation and the Ford Motor Company continued today to insist that they were entitled to a price increase under the Government's guidelines.

title: 5 GIANT PLAYERS PUT ON WAIVERS
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, N. J., Aug. 29The New York Giants put five players on waivers today, but refused to make known their names, even to the players, to pursue trade possibilities.

title: Weather Is a Factor
description: In sharp contrast to a strong July, six of the city's largest department stores had mixed sales results for August through last Saturday compared with the yearearlier month.

title: Price Unit Bars Increases For G.M. and Ford Autos
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29The Price Commission denied today requests by the General Motors Corporation and the Ford Motor Company for price increases on 1973 model automobiles.

title: Two Board Members Named By Freedom National Bank
description: Clarence C. Finley, execuive vice president in charge of the homeproducts group at Burlington Industries, Inc., and Ned Feldman, an investment banker, were named yesterday to the board of the Freedom National Bank.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Mr. John, the selfstyled Emperor of Fashion, has long believed in coordinates and now that everyone else in fashion has caught up with his views, he has no intention of heading in other directions.

title: Jiminez Scores a Triple At Atlantic City Track
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Aug. 29 Jockey Carlos Jiminez, who led all meetings in Maryland and Delaware this year, continued his winning ways at Atlantic City and took both ends of the $171.20 daily double and the feature today.

title: A Fast Continues
description: CLIFTON, N.J.On Sunday, August Gth, eleven prisoners in the Federal Correctional Institution at Danbury, Conn., began a water fast to the death to protest American atrocities in Indochinaour electronic battlefield, our mining of ports and rivers, our bombing of dikes and dams. In a statement to the prison authorities and to the press they said, We will end this fast when it becomes clear that the American people, the peace movement, and our servicemen have undertaken mature and responsible action to end genocide in Vietnam. Literally, we place our lives in the hands of our countrymen.

title: Jones &
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 29 (UPI) The Jones & Laughlin Steel Corporation said today it would expand its Mesta No. 5 coal mining complex at Vestaburg, Pa. The $11million expansion will double the mine's output by next year. Included in the expansion will be construction of a new portal, some surface facilities, and a 2milelong conveyor.

title: MRS. G. E. WIEDENMAYER
description: NEWARK, Aug. 29  Mrs. Margaret Morse Wiedenmayer of Short Hills, wife of Gustave E. Wiedenmayer, chairman of the board of MidAtlantic Banks, Inc., died yesterday after a long illness at St. Barnabas Medical Center, Livingston. Her age was 60.

title: Teacher With 2 Ph.D.'s Is Unable to Find a Job
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Aug. 29 (AP)Giorgio Lena, an Italian immigrant who holds two doctorates and speaks five languages, came to the United States to move minds but wound up moving furniture.

title: Navy Says a Task Force Raided the Haiphong Area
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 29A fourship American task forcewith Vice Adm. J. L. Holloway 3d, the commander of the Seventh Fleet alongconducted a raid on the Haiphong port area after dark on Sunday, shelling targets within two miles of the Haiphong city limits, the Navy command announced here today.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Aug. 29 (UPI)President Nixon conferred today with Secretary Romney on aid to flood victims in the areas of the Northeast struck by the tropical storm Agnes.

title: McGovernomics
description: Much as John F. Kennedy went before the Methodist ministers in Texas to reassure them about his religious philosophy during the 1960 Presidential campaign, Senator George McGovern has gone to Wall Street to reassure the security analystsand the nationthat he is no radical who would wreck the American economy.

title: Executive Changes
description: The American Can Company announced yesterday that its hoard of directors had elected Harry S. Howard Jr. to the post of president. The 54 year old Mr. Howard assumes the post vacated by William F. May, who will remain chairman and chief executive officer. Mr. Howard has been executive vice president since January, 1971, and a director of the company since May of last year. He joined the Butterick Company, a fashion marketing concern, in 1945, and became its president in 1962. American Can acquired Butterick in January, 1968. Mr. Howard continued to head the Butterick division until he was named executive vice president American Can.

title: Kenneth T. Young, Asia Expert And ExEnvoy to Bangkok, Dies
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 Kenneth T. Young, a former United States Ambassador to Thailand and former president of the Asia Society, died of heart attack here today. He was 56 years old and lived in Larchmont, N.Y.

title: INDIA TALKS END, PACT IS AFFIRMED
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 29After five days of talks, India and Pakistan reached agreement today to carry out the provisions of their eightweekold peace accord that official sources here had said was threatened by collapse.

title: Newark Paper Once One of Bes
MOSCOW PRESSES TO FILL ITS PANTRY
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 29The Soviet press disclosed today crash program to insure adequate food supplies for the Moscow region this winter because of damage to local crops from the summer heat and drought.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: If YOU'RE NOT DRINKING WILLIAM LAWSON'S SCOTCH, DRINK DEWAR'S William Lawson's 86.8 Proof Blended Scotch Whiskles. Imported by Paimer & Lord, Ltd., Syosset, N.Y.Advt.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A slim man wearing jeans and a denim jacket approached a young woman teller in the branch of the First National City Bank at First Avenue at 15th Street at 2:40 P.M. yesterday and said, May I ask you a question?

title: Turner and Brian Teacher Qualify for Open Tennis
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., Aug. 29Steve Turner of New York and Brian Teacher of San Diego became the last two players to qualify for the United States Open tennis championships today by advancing to the quarterfinals of a qualifying tournament at the Port Washington Tennis Academy.

title: Notes on People
description: Ending a threeday visit to Brussels for the observance of Hungarian religious holidays, Jozsef Cardinal Mindszenty said talks between the Communist government of Hungary and the Vatican on the state of the Roman Catholic Church in Hungary were no proof the situation is any better.

title: RAYMOND SHANNON JR.
description: Raymond F. Shannon Jr., a former European general manager of World Directories for the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, died Sunday of a heart attack at his home, 27 West 96th Street. His age was 51.

title: 500 at Ossining Prison Tested for SickleCell Anemia, and All but 10 Pass
description: OSSINING. N. Y., Aug. 29 Five hundred inmates and several dozen guards at the Ossining Correctional Facility walked through a converted blue school bus parked in lower prison yard today to be tested for sicklecell anemia.

title: Business Briefs
description: Unit labor costs in United States manufacturing industries last year rose by less than onethird the rates of increase in Canada, Japan and most European countries, the Labor Department's Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today.

title: Books of The Times
description: Phyllis and Fred Feldkamp, an American husband and wife team of journalists, lived in France for 12 years, from the late 1950's to the late 1960's. Their period of residence coincided with Charles de Gaulle's tenure, and their impressions as recorded in The Good Life... Or What's Left of It come together as a portrait of one side of Gaullist France.

title: CRISIS IN FINLAND APPEARS NEAR END
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Aug. 29 (UPI)  Finland's fiveweekold Government crisis over links to the European Common Market and other issues appeared near an end today as President Urho Kekkonen asked Kaleyi Sorsa, a Social Democrat, to form coalition Cabinet.

title: U.S. Appeals Court Upholds Busing Order to Memphis
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 29 (UPI) The United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit ordered today the busing of 14,000 students in Memphis to achieve racial balance in a school system where 87 per cent of the black students attend predominantly black schools.

title: Relief Clients Train to Help the Retarded
description: Thirty children lay on mats in Building 12, taking advantage of the coolness of the floor. Most, unable to move, were on their backs looking at nothing. A few were asleep, curled up with their knees to their chests.

title: Stage: Ossining Players
description: Among the many companies participating in the Lincoln Center Community/ Street Theater Festival, The Street Theater, Inc., of Ossining, N. Y., is something of an exception in that much of its material is downtoearth and realistic, the sort of plays that should stage better in a theater. In the hands of this estimable company the plays work just as well outdoors.

title: Pennsylvania Life Merger Set With National General
description: The National General Corporation, a diversified insurance and movie company with assets exceeding $1billion, has reached tentative agreement to (merge with the Pennsylvania

title: TV: Olympic Games Make a Spectacular Show
description: At a cost of more than $13million, covering special rights and production expenses, the American Broadcasting Company is televising the Olympic Games from Munich. Apart from frequent spurts of announcer excess, a disease that infects most areas of televised sports, the electronic marathon is providing superb, often spectacular, television.

title: PRESIDENT PLANS A 12,000MAN CUT IN VIETNAM FORCE
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Aug. 29  The White House announced today that the American force in Vietnam would be reduced by 12,000 more men over the next three months.

title: Mrs. Alice Albright Hoge Bride Of Michael Arlen of New Yorker
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 29Mrs. Alice Albright Hoge, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ivan Albright of Woodstock, Vt., was married in City Hall here today to Michael J. Arlen, son of the late Michael Arlen, the novelist and playwright, and the late Mrs. Arlen.

title: Fighting Near Queson
description: SAIGON, Wednesday, Aug. 30 (AP)North Vietnamese troops reportedly counterattacked last night and drove Government units off a 300foot hill commanding the eastern approaches to the embattled northern district capital of Queson.

title: Market Place: Memorex Ways Pose Questions
description: The Memorex Corporation one of those companies that tags along producing disc drives and assorted peripheral equipment for users of I.B.M. equipmenthas been in the doldrums for some time.

title: Rematch Plan Denied
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Wednesday, Aug. 30 (UPI)An aide to Fischer denied this morning that he had offered to play (rematch against Spassky within a year.

title: Nantucket and the Vineyard Stirred by a Kennedy Bill
description: EDGARTOWN, Mass. Look out for squalls when the Kennedy bill comes up for discussion here on Martha's Vineyard and on neighboring Nantucket.

title: 31 on Penn Central Get Home EarlyNext Day
description: The last of the stranded Grand Central commuters finally caught a train early yesterdaythe 4:40 A.M. to Larchmont, Greenwich and New Haven.

title: Cautious Optimism Marks Mideast Oil Negotiations
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 29Negotiations between the international oil companies and five PersianGulf nations on the issue of government participation in the companies ownership are proceeding in an atmosphere of cautious optimism.

title: LACE ANDERSEN, WARTIME SINGER
description: VIENNA. Aug. 29 (UPI) Lale Andersen, the German singer who became famous by singing Lilli Marlene in World War II, died today of heart trouble in a Vienna hospital. She was 59 years old.

title: Kelly Enjoying Best Season of 22 Years as Trainer
School Board Chief Jailed
description: BUFFALO, Aug. 29 (AP)Ralph J. Fiore, 47yearold former president of the Lackawana school board, was sentenced today to four years in prison for accepting a bribe. He was convicted by a State Supreme Court jury Anne 30 of receiving a bribe and of a charge of receiving a reward for misconduct, both felonies, and two misdemeanor charges of official misconduct.

title: Backer of Peking Ties Gets High Post in Japan
description: TOKYO, Aug. 29 (UPI)Takeo Miki, 65 years bid, strong advocate of diplomatic recognition of China, was named as deputy premier today by Premier Kakuei Tanaka.

title: Mittleman to Head Atlantic Following Stock Acquisition
description: The Mittleman Holding Corporation has acquired from Heck's, Inc., 1 million shares of the common stock of the Atlantic Department Stores, Inc..; representing twothirds. of Atlantic's outstanding common, according to an announcement yesterday by Atlantic. The purchasearrangement proposal was announced last week.

title: Galigher Rated No. 1 Jet Rookie
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Aug. 29In room 1109, Ed Galigher, a 6foot5inch, 253pound defensive lineman, had the same fears most rookies have in training camp. He wondered how much longer he would be wearing a Jet football uniform.

title: Roundup: Tiant Gets 3d Shutout in Row
description: Four years ago Luis Tiant joined the ranks of the top pitchers by winning 21 games for the Cleveland Indians. In the next three seasons the Cubanborn righthander won a total of 17, and the bright promise of 1968 seemed in jeopardy.

title: Air Shipments Banned
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Aug. 29 (Reuters) The thousands of Asians ordered out of this East African nation that has been their home for generations faced new troubles today as President Idi Amin's Government banned air shipments of their possessions.

title: SkinDiver's Death a Mishap
description: DOVER TOWNSHIP, N. J., Aug. 30  The Ocean County Prosecutor's office today ruled accidental the asphyxiation of skindiver Saturday who died trying to surface by sharing his companion's air tank. County detectives announced the decision after interviewing Dr. Susan McDonough of Lower Gweynedd Township, Pa., the survivor. They said the victim, Ronald Wallace, of Wilmington, Del., was able to take only a few breaths from Dr. McDonough's tank.

title: Cerro Sets Price Rise
description: The Cerro Copper Products division of the Cerro Corporation said yesterday that its prices for industrial copper tube would be raised by 2.5 cents pound beginning Sept. 5. The company added that copper water tube prices would be increased selectively.

title: Paris Opens Fight Against Inflation; To Appeal to E.E.C.
description: PARIS, Aug. 30The French Government opened a campaign against inflation today with a series of domestic measures and plans to seek a coordinated European effort.

title: STOCK GAINS END 4 DAYS OF LOSSES
description: The stock market broke its foursession losing streak yesteiday by registering a small advance in continued dull trading.

title: Advertising
description: A new research report from a brokerage house has just been published that recommends publicly awned advertising agencies in general and a few of them in particular.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 30 (UPI) Martin J. Hughes, executive vice president of the Communication workers of America, said today that he had called a meeting of the leadership of Ohio unions to form a labor committee to support the McGovernShriver ticket. Hughes said he was issuing invitations for meeting tomorrow in Columbus.

title: 3 in Jersey Accused of Seeking To Bribe Official in Zoning Case
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Aug. 30The Monroe Township planner and two former top Woodbridge officials were arraigned here today in Middlesex County Court on charges of attempting to bribe the township's council president.

title: Personalities: Star Goalie Shaky Awaiting Russians
description: After yielding six goals in an intrasquad game, Tony Esposito should be ready for anything Saturday night when Team Canada, the National Hockey League stars, opens its series against the Russians at Montreal. Esposito is to start in goal for the team, whose 35man roster will be cut to 19 players tomorrow. He looked shaky early in the third and final warmup game between the Whites and Reds Tuesday night in Toronto. But Harry Sinden. the team's coach, refused to fault him. Esposito had no chance on any of the goals that beat him, especially the first four, said Sinden. Ken Dryden, in goal for the Whites, who won, 62, was replaced by Ed Johnston with the 60.

title: OS DOWN METS ON 3RUN 7TH, 42
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 30  Jon Matlack, the young Met southpaw who has posted more victories than any other rookie pitcher in the National League but hasn't won since Aug. 12, failed again tonight in his quest for No. 12.

title: NIXON AND TANAKA ARRIVE IN HAWAII FOR 2DAY TALKS
description: HONOLULU, Aug. 30President Nixon arrived here this afternoon for two days of delicate economic and diplomatic talks with Premier Kakuei Tanaka of Japan.

title: Screen: 'Salzburg Connection' Opens:MacInnes Spy Thriller Furnishes the Plot Nazi War Documents Sought by Agents
description: With twice too many characters and three times too much plot, the Oscar Millard screenplay of "The Salzburg Connection" might have defeated the best of directors. Against Lee H. Katzin ("Le Mans," "Heaven With a Gun") it isn't even a contest. I'm told that the Helen MacInnes spy thrillers have had an uncommonly unfortunate history on the screen, and "The Salzburg Connection," which opened yesterday at neighborhood theaters, does nothing to discredit the record.I shall not attempt to detail the plot, but readers of the novel will remember that it has to do with a chest full of incriminating Nazi war documents long buried in an Austrian mountain lake, recovered by a free-lance photographer who is immediately murdered for his pains and whose widow (Anna Karina) is next in line to be eliminated. But an American lawyer (Barry Newman), virtually an innocent bystander, enters the case, and he befriends her and protects her and ultimately makes the chest safe for democracyor, at least for the Western democracies.Among those interested in hiding or unearthing or preserving or destroying the chest are agents of Great Britain, Israel, Austria, Russia, Czechoslovakia (I think), Rumania (I guess), the United States, and some unspecified band of neo-Nazis. In addition, there are double agents and would-be agentsand before the film is into its second half hour, virtually the only interest left lies in figuring out what great power each new inexplicable character is working for, or hoping he might work for, or wishing he could go home and forget.Katzin's direction responds to all this with a program of cross-cutting at times so extensive that you have to strain to remember that every new and disorienting crisis really does connect with part of the actionlast visited maybe 10 minutes of film time before. This does not build excitement; it merely eliminates continuity. But this seems reasonable from a director who in a major sequence can place two men riding toward each other on a mountainside chair lift, one an assassin, the other his intended victim; and by the time they meet, can dissolve all the situation's inherent tension merely by the ineptness of his photography and editing.There seems no point in blaming anything or anybody elseeither Salzburg for its un-picturesqueness or the performers for their general helplessness. The appearance of Anna Karina, the only talent visibly involved, sadly takes me back to the better days of "Vivre Sa Vie," "Alphaville" and "A Woman Is a Woman."

title: Chinese Communist and Nationalist Ships Sail Into Manila With Aid
description: MANILA, Aug. 30Shipment of relief goods for victims of the devastating floods that inundated central Luzon last month brought a Chinese Communist and a Chinese Nationalist ship into the port of Manila today at roughly the same time. Chinese Nationalist ships are regular callers here, but the Communist vessel was the first to call at Manila since the Communists took over the China mainland 22 years ago. Relief cargoes aboard the two ships! were roughly the same in amount and value.

title: School Board Overturns Dismissal of 20 Teachers by Local Unit in Bronx
description: The central Board of Education yesterday overturned, by vote.of 4 to 1, the, recent dismissal of 20 teachers by the Community School Board of District 9 in the Bronx.

title: Rise in Month to Aug. 15 Leads to a RecordBeef Cattle Drop
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 (AP) Beef cattle prices dropped for the first time in four months, but increases for hogs and other products helped to send overall farm prices up 1 per cent to another record in the month ended Aug. 15, the Agriculture Department reported today.

title: BronxBank Robbed of $7,000
description: A gunman wearing red sneakers, gray pants and a blue shirt, robbed the Kingsbridge branch of the First National City Bank in the Bronx. of $7,000 yesterday. The police reported the robber, described as a 6foot2inch tall, 215pound man, entered the bank at 5660 Broadway at West 233d Street at 9:50 A.M. and pushed a revolver into the face of a male teller and demanded his money.

title: Free Flight Hometo U.S. For Stranded Tourists
description: GATWICK, England, Aug. 30 (AP)A group of 137 American tourists, stranded at the airport here since their charter flight home was canceled Sunday, were told today that they would be flown to New York free of charge on Friday via an arrangement between an international hamburger corporation and an airline.

title: PFEIL, STUHLER TIE AT 69 IN AMATEUR
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C., Aug. 30 (AP)Mark Pfeil of Palos Verdes, Calif., and Greg Stuhler of Atlanta carded twounderpar 69's to lead a parade of lesser known players and share the firstround lead of the United States Amateur golf championship today.

title: ARMY AWARDS PACTS TO DEVELOP COPTER
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 (UPI)The Army awarded contracts totaling $153.2million today to the Boeing Company and Sikorsky Aircraft for development of a new, larger and more reliable troopcarrying helicopter to replace the Huey troop carrier used in Vietnam.

title: News of Dogs
description: Mrs. Joseph Gregory, better known among the show set as Mamie, has had a variety of dogs over the years, of which many have been champions. I was brought up in a doggy family, she said. My father [the late Robert Rice Reynolds, Senator from North Carolina] had Doberman pinschers and when we were in Washington bought me a cocker spaniel. I started to handle when I was 8 years old. By the time I was 10 I had shown my cocker, Renn of Reynolds Mountain, to a championship.

title: HAROLD CRESSINGHAM
description: Harold E. Cressingham, an advertising consultant since his retirement in 1959 as an art director with the Benton & Bowles advertising agency, died Tuesday in Mountainside Hospital, Montclair, N. J. He was 78 years old and lived at 47 Jacobus Avenue, Great Notch, N. J.

title: Piper Loan Is Approved
description: The Piper Aircraft Corporation's longterm loan application has been approved by the Small Business Administration. The commitment calls for a maximum of $12million at 5per cent annual interest, repayable over 20 years with a shorter term possible depending on Piper's future earnings.

title: G.M. Is Accused of Hiding Dangerous Cadillac Flaw
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 1The Center for Auto Safety accused the General Motors Corporation today of concealing what it termed a lifeanddeath safety defect in more than 280,000 Cadillacs of the 1959 and 1960 model years.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., Aug. 30  State Senator Eugene N. Zeigler launched today his campaign as the Democratic nominee seeking to unseat Senator. Strom Thurmond, a Republican, by pledging to unify the South Carolina Democratic party.

title: Use of Land Questioned Under Railroad Grants
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 (UPI)  Interior Secretary Rogers C: B. Morton was asked today to determine whether Western railroads were living up to the conditions under which they were given huge land grants in the 19th century.

title: Genter Says Spitz Tried To Get Him Out of Race
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 30 (UPI)Steve Genter, who won a swimming silver medal for the United States just one week after undergoing minor surgery for a partly collapsed lung, today accused Mark Spitz, the glamor boy of the Olympics, of trying to talk him out of the competition.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Business Briefs
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 30 (UPI)Further progress was reported today in the oil participation talks between Western companies and five Persian Gulf states.

title: Jail Officials Urge Code on Prisoners
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 The Association of State Correctional Administrators proposed today uniform prison guidelines that detail procedures for handling disciplinary problems and racial strife and that would give inmates increasing visiting and mail privileges and more access to the news media.

title: 400 Pounds of Marijuana Seized in Car in Queens
description: The police seized about 400 pounds of marijuana, estimated to be worth $250,000, in Bayside Queens, last night and arrested two Queens residents on charges of possessing narcotics.

title: Hanoi Scorns Nixon's TroopCut Plans
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. Jo i North Vietnam leveled scorn today at President Nixon's latest troopwithdrawal announcement and declared once again that a Vietnam settlement was impossible until the United States ended both its support of the Saigon Government and its military actions against the north.

title: PATERNITY RULE ON RELIEF VOIDED
description: A state law depriving unwed mothers of welfare aid if they refuse to name the missing fathers of their children has been declared invalid by Judge Murray L Gurfein in Federal Court here.

title: Advertising
description: C. Schmidt & Sons, the nation's 13th largest beer company, is moving its account to Rosenfeld, Sirowitz & Lawson from Ted Bates & Co. Its billings were less than $3million last year, but there's talk of an increase to about $3.7million for 1973.

title: Marshall Oreck Weds Mrs. Sandra Shagrin
description: KINGS POINT, L. L. Aug. 30  The marriage of Mrs. Sandra Zahn Shagrin of East Hills to Marshall Oreck or Stamford, Conn., and Amagansett, took place here this afternoon at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard Zahn, parents of the bride. State Supreme Court Justice Sol Warhtler performed the ceremony.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30There is about their modest suite of offices a heretoday, gonetomorrow quality, a Spartan air of transience that suggests pragmatism rather than passion.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30If the Presidential election of 1972 is to have a turning point, Senator George McGovern may have reached it this week. With the conventions over and the traditional Labor Day campaign inaugural at hand, the South Dakota Democrat has given evidence in the last two days that he is ready to begin an affirmative effort to close the long gap between himself and President Nixon. In the seven weeks since the Democratic convention which he was nominated, Mr. McGovern has seemed, friend and foe, like a man trying to run on ice. Not only the Eagleton episode, but such lesser developments the confusion over his indirect contacts with the North Vietnamese and his statement that the Saigon Government would have to flee if he won, he has given the impression, as a staff member put it, of a guy who'd have a hard time running Peoria.

title: SUPER BOWL SETS TWO TROT MARKS
description: DU QUOIN, Ill., Aug. 30Super Bowl, under no pressure from his six rivals, managed to produce two records today as the 3yearold trotter impressively captured. the 47th annual Hambletonian in straight halltS at the Du Quoin State Fairgrounds.

title: GUARD SEES PERIL IF THE DRAFT ENDS
description: The future of the National Guard and the Army Reserves is threatened by the proposed end of the draft next July, leaders of the reserve forces believe, unless Congress approves new enlistment and reenlistment bonuses and incentives.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: Leaders of Hispanic extraction across the nation were reported last night to have raised $244,900 so far for President Nixon's reelection, including $50,000 from $1,000acouple tickets for a dinner here.

title: Executive Changes
description: The United States Steel Corporation has appointed J. D. McCall Jr., to the new post of group vice president, with responsibility for the management of five general operating divisions.

title: BILL ON PEDDLING SCORED BY POLICE
description: Spokesmen for the Police Department and for major retail stores cautioned yesterday that unduly harsh antipeddling laws would do little to discourage the thousands of peddlers who have recently taken to hawking their wares illegally on the streets.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: BONDS DEPOSITED IN SREBURG DEAL
description: The Commonwealth United Corporation, a conglomerate that earlier this year got its stockholders approval to change the name to Iota Industries, Inc., announced yesterday that $32million, or about 40 per cent, of its outstanding debentures had been deposited in exchange for securities of Seeburg Industries, Inc.

title: Florida Arrests Glenn Turner
description: CLEARWATER, Fla. Aug. 30 (AP)  Glenn W. Turner, who parlayed $5,000 and a bottle of mink oil into a 70company empire, pleaded not guilty today to charges of violating Florida's securities law.

title: The Great Escape: Alias Garden, Alias Sundeck, Alias...
description: Ugly yet ornamental in its fashion, the New York fire escape traditionally is all things to all people, depending on their age and inclination: a sleeping porch, a dining terrace, a sunning deck, a play area.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE POLITICS OF HEROIN IN SOUTHEAST ASIA. By Alfred W. McCoy with Cathleen B. Reed and Leonard P. Adams 2d. 464 pages. Harper & Row. $10.95. ,

title: Out of Politics
description: In refusing to appoint a special prosecutor to investigate the Watergate breakin and other alleged Republican irregularities in campaign financing, President Nixon has noted that the F.B.I., the Justice Department, the House Banking Committee and the General Accounting Office are already conducting various investigations as are the White House itself, Clark MacGregor, chairman of the Nixon campaign, and Maurice Stans, the Nixon finance chairman.

title: Appropriations Rise By HERBERT KOSHETZ
description: Capital appropriations for new plant and equipment by the nation's 1,000 largest manufacturers in the second quarter of this year were 4.4 per cent above those for the first quarter and 24.8 per cent above the 1971 level, the Conference Board said yesterday.

title: Westchester's Test
description: Both the principle of scattersite housing and the proper institutions for urban and suburban development are undergoing a test in Westchester County. Both issues are posed in relatively pure terms which should not be submerged by the pressures to demagoguery of an election campaign.

title: Bridge Knickerbocker Play Opens At New York Hilton Tonight
description: One of the most popular tournaments in the annual calendar, the Greater New York Bridge Association's Knickerbocker championships, begin tonight at the New York Hilton. The opening event at 7:30 is the knockout team championship, which continues through the weekend.

title: 34 Kentucky Pickets Seized
description: OWENSBORO, Ky. Aug. 30 (UPI)The police arrested to day 34 persons, mostly blacks,I who refused to stop picketing outside a drivein restaurnt here that was the scene of a disturbance last night, The pickets contended that James P. Hale.! 33yearold white proprietor of Jim's Little Dairy Bar, fired al shotgun into a group of blacks outside the restaurant last night.

title: Blood on the Water
description: Yugolslavia's water polo team, the defending champion, rallied to beat the scrappy Cubans, 75, in thebloodiest and most violent encounter of the Olympics: The water in the pool was tinted with blood.

title: Issues of 3 Saigon Newspapers Critical of Regime Are Seized
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 30  The South Vietnamese Government announced today that issues of three more daily newspapers had been seized for criticizing the Government and that a court had sentenced the alleged perpetrators of 60 other press violations.

title: LYLE SAVES 29TH AS YANKS WIN, 31
description: Sparky Lyle tied a Yanke club record last night by saving his 29th.game of the season as a relief pitcher while the Yankees were checking the Texas Rangers, 31, at Yankee Stadium.

title: FOE AT QUANGTRI IS SAID TO STEP UP ARTILLERY ATTACK
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam. Thursday, Aug. 31North Vietnamese gunners poured about 2,000 heavycaliber shells into South Vietnamese marine positions around the city of Quangtri in the last two days, and intense fighting was reported elsewhere in the northern province, the South Vietnamese command reported tcday.

title: Cattlemen See Meddling
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 (UPI)Cattlemen, upset at the recent. drop in cattle prices, today attributed their troubles in large part to Government meddling.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Iron bars do not a home make, or something like that, is a concept that inspired Leonard Gruen, a sculptor (who also works as a steamfitter), to create attractive window pieces that keep out intruders.

title: G.A.O. IS AUDITING KGOVERN'S BOOKS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 The General Accounting Office, which last week reported finding several apparent violations of Federal campaign finance laws by the Committee for the Reelection of the President, said today that it had begun an investigation of Senator George McGovern's campaign finance records.

title: 8 Men Plead Not Guilty
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Aug. 30 (AP)Eight men arrested when a shrimp boat docked in an isolated Flagler County area last May pleaded not guilty today to charges of marijuana smuggling. United States Magistrate Joseph Hatchett let them remain free on existing bonds and bound them over to United States District Court. A trial date will be set later.

title: Miguel Henriquez Guzman, Sought to Govern Mexico
description: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 30 (AP) Miguel Henriquez Guzman, an Army general who was the candidate of the Federation of Parties of the People for the Mexican presidency in 1952, died yesterday. He was 76 years old.

title: Park Festival Lends Hand to the Retarded
description: Thousands of retarded children and adults strolled hand in hand with volunteer companions in what was called One to One Festival on the Sheep Meadow in Central Park yesterday.

title: SKYLAB PEDESTAL FACES NASA TESTS
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Aug. 30A 127foothigh steel pedestal will be tested here this week as space engineers prepare launching facilities for Skylab, the nation's first space station and the next manned space project after Apollo.

title: L. I. Man Pinned Under Car Wreck for 30 Hours
description: A 45yearold Long Island man lay trapped and unseen for 30 hours Tuesday and yesterday in a car wreck off a highway interchange on the QueensNassau County border, the body of the car's dead driver pinned beneath his own.

title: Crackdown Set on Drivers Who Block Intersections
description: Midtown motorists guilty of spillback blocking intersections and crosswalks  will get feedback from the police in the form of summonses in a new traffic campaign starting Sept. 12. Each summons could result in a $15 fine.

title: Notes on People
description: Clifford Irving was hardly settled at the Federal prison farm in Lewisburg, Pa., when Howard R. Hughes, the billionaire recluse, made one of his rare private appearances. Mr. Irving began a twoandonehalf year sentence Monday for his hoax autobiography of Mr. Hughes. By Tuesday, Mr. Hughes had flown by private plane from his hotel aerie in Vancouver, British Columbia, to ManaNicaragua.

title: PRICE OF FREE GOLD INCREASES IN EUROPE
description: LONDON, Aug. 30 (AP)The price of free gold rose 10 cents an ounce in Europe's two main bullion markets today but the United States dollar weakened in foreign exchanges.

title: JOHN W. BURHOP, 48, NEWARK BANK AIDE
description: NEWARK, Aug. 30John W. Burhop, executive, vice president of the First National State Bank of New Jersey, died early today at his home, 50 Thackeray Drive, Short Hills. He was 48 years old.

title: TAPES SUBMITTED IN KRAMER CASE
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., Aug. 30Tape recordings reputed to contain the voice of a man who extorted money from the family of Joan Kramer have been turned over to the Essex County Prosecutor's office by the slain girl's brother, a police official confirmed today.

title: The Talk of Will Rogers Beach
description: PACIFIC PALISADES, Aug. 30Ernie Holtby is usually out early, dragging his metal strainer across the beach, sifting the sand for the treasures left buried by yesterday's crowds. In the mists of morning, dressed all in gray, he looks like some giant sea bird, pecking away in counterpoint to the rhythms of the surf. It's something to do, and I like the challenge, Ernie said one morn ing recently. You never know when you'll find all that gold, or diamond rings, or watches. I know a guy who's a beachcomber and he found a ring with 18 diamonds in it.

title: Many Eat Out in City's Parks
description: With Labor Day nearing and reminding them of the capricious weather to come, they stream out of the Manhattan skyscrapers  thirsting for a final draught of the late , summer sun, carrying their lunch in brown paper bags.

title: American Party Candidat Says Aim Is to Build Group
description: CHATTANOOGA, Aug. 30 (AP)Thomas J. Anderson, the American party's, VicePresidential nominee, said today that win or lose, the main object this year is to build the party.

title: Sports of The Times
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 30Why does an ordinarily sane man subject his body to the tortures of longdistance running?

title: Price Changes
description: The GeorgiaPacific Corporation announced yesterday that it would roll back prices on several basic building materials, beginning Sept. 1. The company said that most construction grades and thicknesses of softwood sheathing plywood would be reduced from $2 to $5 per 1,000 square feet, and twobyfour fir and pine lumber studs by $5 per thousand board feet.

title: Smith Victor in 4 Sets; Connors, Gonzales Lose
Metropolitan Briefs
description: A statewide citizens' group to provide familyplanning services was organized here yesterday at a meeting the United Charities Building, 105 East 22d Street, where the group will have its offices.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30Imagine for ninety seconds what the world would be like if everybody everywhere behaved just as we great Americans do. Everybody. Everywhereabsolutely everywhere .

title: PAUL RYAN, OFFICER IN OIL INDUSTRY, 72
