description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Aug. 30 Paul Ryan, an executive in the petroleum industry and founder of the Sales Executives Club of New York, died yesterday of a heart attack in New Rochelle Hospital. He was 72 years old and lived at 14 Bonnie Briar Lane.

title: Pilots'
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 (AP) The Air Line Pilots Association has asked the Civil Aeronautics Board for an immediate order barring all payments to Northwest Airlines under the airline industry's mutual aid agreement.

title: Lee Bum Suk
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 30The chief South Korean delegate to the Red Cross talks with North Korea, Which opened in Pyongyang today, is a former career diplomat with 10 years of experience as a Red Cross worker.

title: Music: Maria Stuarda Opens City Opera Season
description: In this particular time, when the women are shouldering their way onto the stage we call real life, what better opera to open a season than Maria Stuarda"? Donizetti's dark and rather lugubrious but ultimately gripping work, second in trilogy of his Tudor queen operas that the New York City Opera is staging for its prima donna assoluta, Beverly Sills, launched the company's fall season last night at the State Theater.

title: Food Places Cited By Health Agency As Violating Code
description: Eleven more restaurants and other food establishments were cited by the Health Department yesterday for serious violations of the city Health Code.

title: 2 CHILDREN KILLED IN QUEENS BLAZE
description: Two children were killed in a fire in Queens late last night, and a man died in a second fire on the Lower East Side.

title: Ewbank ,Names Seven Waived Jets and Keeps Dealing
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Aug. 30 Still playing his cards close to the chest, Weeb Ewbank, the Jets coach and general manager, announced today the names of the seven players he had cut Monday in order to get down to the league requirement of 49 by yesterday.

title: Business Briefs
description: The volume of helpwanted advertising rose sharply in July, according to data gathered by The Conference Board. The index on such advertising, as measured by the board, rose last month to 103 per cent of the 1967 base period, a gain of 7 index points over the June level, and 18 points over the level of July, 1971.

title: A Ship Carrying Youngsters On a Voyage Toward Health
description: The early morning haze was so heavy that the tall buildings could barely be seen from Pier 70, at 22d Street on the East River. Not a breath stirred aboard the S.S. Lloyd I. Seaman, as she awaited some of the 600 mothers and children who would soon arrive in busloads from the steaming, slums of Manhattan and Brooklyn.

title: Country Dining on Holiday Weekend: Seek and Ye Shall Find
description: Labor Day Weekend is a dry run for a nuclear attack. Millions of New Yorkers evacuate the city and attempt to live by their wits in the boondocks. Once they have survived the maniacal traffic, the, biggest problem they face is finding a decent place to eat.

title: MRS. COWPERTHWAITE
description: Mrs. Emily Henderson Cowperthwaite, widow of Walter B. Cowperthwaite, died after long illness yesterday at her home. 610 Park Avenue. She was 96 years old. Her husband had been president of Cowperthwaite & Sons, a retail furniture business.

title: City Is Sued to Stop Giving Unpaid WorkRelief Jobs
description: Parallel suits have been filed in State Supreme Court to stop the use of homerelief recipients in unpaid city jobs to work off their welfare checks. The suits were announced yesterday by the municipal employes union and the New York Civil Liberties Union.placed from a job. The city, he said, has now obtained state permission to start a Work Relief Employment Program that will use welfare funds to put homerelief eligibles into regular paid halftime city jobs later this year.

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders
description: The American Stock Exchange yesterday issued reports of changes in share ownership of major stockholders, officers and directors.

title: CHAVEZ PROTESTS LETTUCE LISTING
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30An Agriculture Department promoAwn of lettuce as one of this month's plentiful foods has sparked a protest from Cesar Chavez. leader of the United Farm Workers Union that is trying to enforce a boycott against iceberg lettuce not picked by members of his union.

title: State Atomic Post Filled
description: Dr. John J. Herbst, an adjunct professor of nuclear engineering at New York University, has assumed the post of director of nuclear technology with the State Atomic and Space Development Authority, the authority announced yesterday.

title: FIRMS SHUNNING AGENCY BUSINESS
description: A move toward more nonsecurities business and away from public agency activity has been disclosed in a recent survey of brokerage firms, the American Stock Exchange reported yesterday.

title: MRS. IRVING STRAUSS
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L. I., Aug. 30Mrs. Etta Strauss, who formerly operated three photography studios in Brooklyn with her late husband, Irving, died yesterday of pneumonia. She was 84 years old,

title: FIRM IS CHARGED ON DELAYING STOCK
description: State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz charged a securities firm and its president yesterday with failing to make timely delivery of stock and failing to remit dividends promptly to customers.

title: British Resentment Rises Over Coming Asian Influx
description: LONDON, Aug.. 30Public resentment against the expected influx of Asians expelled from Uganda is building in Britain, creating political hazards for Prime Minister Heath and endangering the progress made here toward racial harmony.

title: ExGov. Harold Handley Dies; Indianan Lost 1958 Senate Bid
description: RAWLINS, Wyo., Aug. 30 (AP)Harold W. Handley, former Republican governor of Indiana, died today at a hospital here, to which he had been taken after suffering a heart attack at a resort in nearby Saratoga., He was 62. years old.

title: Window Washer Killed
description: A 46yearold window washer feel to his death yesterday while cleaning windows on the eighth story of the Warrington Hotel at 161 Madison Avenue near 32d Street. The man was identified as George Seinece, of 20229 44th Road, Bayside, Queens.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Japan's Coming of Age
description: Premier Kakuei Tanaka's meeting with President Nixon in Hawaii in preparation for his visit to Peking next month marks a major turning point in the Postwar history of Japan. After a quartercentury of American tutelage and miraculous economic growth, Japan is moving out on the world stage as an independent power.

title: Boxing Referee Expelled
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 30 (UPI)One referee was dropped today and 16, judges received warnings! they would suffer a similarc. fate if their erratic officiating,. continued during the Olym, pic boxing tournament, an official of the International Amateur Boxing Association_ disclosed. No names were re, vealed.

title: Court Gives Lawyer Time In Philippine Land Case
description: MANILA, Aug. 30 (AP)The Supreme Court today gave an American lawyer,  William H. Quasha, against whom the court decided a parity rights issue Aug. 17, until Sept. 18 to file a motion for reconsideration of the decision.

title: Spassky Thwarted by a Good Defense
Mrs. Jerome K. Doolan. Dies; Led Garden Club of America
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., Aug. 30Mrs. Elvira Broome Doolan, president of the Garden Club of America from 1968 to 1971 and since then a director, died yesterday in the nearby Cottage Hospital, Montecito. She was 62 years old.

title: Ginny May Plans Auction Of Mortgages on Sept. 13
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 (Reuters)  The Government National Mortgage Association announced today it would hold its second auction of subsidized home mortgages on Sept. 13.

title: The Ethics of the Home
description: Today, we are being cut adrift from the type of humanizing authority which in the past shaped the character of our people. I am thinking not of governmental authority but rather the more personal forms we have known in the home, church, school and community.. These personal authorities once gave direction to our lives; they were our reference points, the institutions and relationships which molded our characters.

title: Numbered Account Takes Maskette and Pays $3
description: Numbered. Account gave a splendid account of herself in the $27,700 Maskette Handicap at Belmont Park yesterday. Almost falling forward shortly after. a fine start, the handsome filly owned by Ogden Phipps steadied herself and went on to win the onemile race for older fillies and mares.

title: Personal Finance: CreditCard Shift?
description: Companies that issue credit cards to their key employes for business use have been cautioned that although Federal law limits the liability for unauthorized use of personal cards to $50, that limit does not apply to cards used for business.

title: RUSSIAN CHAMPIONS DEFEAT COSMOS, 2.1
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I. Aug. 30Moscow Dynamo, the 10time soccer champion of the Soviet Union, toyed with the New York Cosmos in the second half here tonight and defeated the North American Soccer League champions, 21.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 5 Hostages Rescued As Chicago Officers Kill 2 of 3 Gunmen
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 30 (AP)Five women taken hostage during a restaurant holdup were rescued when two of their three abductors were shot to death by the police today after a 120mileanhour chase.

title: 3 AREAS QUALIFY FOR FEDERAL AID
description: The way has been opened for extensive Federal loans and grants for public and private redevelopment projects in Manhattan, Brooklyn and the Bronx as a result of action yesterday by the Economic Development Administration in designating the three boroughs as qualified for such assistance.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON  Fifteen years ago, George McGovern arrived in Washington to take his seat as a freshman Representative from South Dakota. Like many of the young politicians who came to office after World War II, the onetime minister and onetime college professor depended almost entirely on his Government salary to support his growing family.

title: U.S. LOSES DIVE TO SOVIET STAR
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 30 (AP)Vladimir Vasin of the Soviet Union won the Olympic gold medal in springboard diving as the United States lost the event for the first time since 1912.

title: Brazil Cracks Down on Paper Defying Censorship
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 30The Brazilian Government has cracked down hard on the single major newspaper in the country that has been consistently defying vague and largely unspecified censorship rules.

title: SILVER FUTURES POST SHARP RISE
description: Silver futures prices rose markedly yesterday in steppedup trading on the Commodity Exchange here.

title: BLAST AT AMCHITKA SET OFF 22 QUAKES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 UPI) The fivemegaton nUclear test at Amchitka Island last November caused 22 small earthquakes and hundreds of blast aftershocks, a Government scientist reported today.

title: Sears and J. C. Penney Co. Show Sharp Gains in Sales
description: Sears, Roebuck & Co. of Chicago, and the J. C. Penney Company of New York, the nation's two largest departmentstore and catalogue chains, reported yesterday large advances in sales for the four weeks ended last Saturday over the corresponding 1971 period. Sears said its sales in the month rose 11 per cent to a record of $927,433,770 from $835,745,995 the year before. But, when asked for comment on the results, a company spokesman said that they would have been better except for heavy rains in the Midwest last week, which affected retail business in the area.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 (Reuters)The Administration today dropped its demand that Justice Department lawyers be allowed to represent White House aides subpoenaed to testify about the alleged bugging of the Democratic National Committee headquarters.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30Mr. Colson appeared today at the office of Edward Bennett Williams, the Washington lawyer, to make a deposition in connection with the Democrats suit. Mr. Colson, who testified for two hours behind closed doors, is the man who recommended the hiring last year of E. Howard Hunt, a key figure in alleged bugging incident, as a White House consultant. Mr. Colson told reporters that he had nothing to do with the affair.

title: BANK DATA SOUGHT IN EXTORTION CASE
description: NEWARK, Aug. 30The United States Attorney's offices is trying to pry open a secret bank account in Switzerland by way of Chicago.

title: Nuns Leaving Prison Revealed as 2 inmates
description: ATMORE, Ala., Aug. 30 (AP)A guard at the exit gate of the Holman maximumsecurity unity thought he was preparing to let two nuns out of the prison today when he noticed inmate shoes underneath their relihabits.

title: Safer Flights
description: The major airlines are finally facing up to the need for much tighter airport security to eradicate the hijacking menace. Travelers on American Airlines and Trans World Airlines will surely not begrudge the minor delays in departure time likely to accompany the decision of these two carriers to inspect all hand baggage.

title: Monticello Meet Extended
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., Aug. 30 (AP)The meet at Monticello Raceway will be extended at least two weeks starting Sept. IS, Leon Greenberg, the track president, said today.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 30  State Representative Sam Nunn Jr., the 33yearold Democrat who upset the incumbent David H. Gambrell in Georgia's runoff primary for his party's nomination for United States Senator, received new support today as he sought to unify his party against a highly. regarded Republican in the general election.

title: Roundup: Wood Is Denied 23d Victory by Red Sox
description: Wilbur Wood, the lefthanded knuckleball pitcher for the Chicago White Sox, was too good yesterday for his own good. His knuckleball was dancing so much it was moving out of the strike zone, said Manager Chuck Tanner.

title: BookofMonth Selects Wilfrid Sheed
description: Wilfrid Sheed, the writer and critic, has been named to the board of judges that selects the BookoftheMonth Club's main offerings, it was announced yesterday.

title: McGovern Calls on Jews To Judge Him by His Acts
description: Acknowledging that he has a Jewish problem in New York. Senator George McGovern yesterday urged an enthusiastic audience of rabbis and their families to judge me today and in the weeks ahead on the basis of all my actions and not on the basis of what the opposition says, or prints, or whispers.

title: Pennsylvania Fire Kills 3.
description: HERSHEY, Pa. Aug. 30 (AP) A mother and two of her children were killed when fire swept a home in this eastern Pennsylvania town early today, the police said. Mrs. Ronald Memmi, 22 years old, was pronounced dead at the Hershey Medical Center. Her children Melisa, 3, and Joseph, 7, were pronounced dead at the scene, the Derry Township police said. Two other children and a house guest were hospitalized.

title: REALTY MEN DENY ANY RENT GOUGING
description: Representatives of the realestate industry here denied yesterday that the state's 14monthold vacancy decontrol law had resulted in unreasonable rent increases or harassment of tenants by landlords.

title: Cosmos No. 517
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 30 (UPI) The Soviet Union today launched No. 517 in its Cosmos program of unmanned earth satellites, the Soviet news agency, Tass, said. It said the satellite was carrying a radio transmitter operating on the frequency of 19.995 megahertz and a radio system for measuring orbital elements.

title: 2 Youths Shot by a Gang Of TeenAgers in Bronx
description: Two 18yearolds were shot by a gang of 30 youths roaming through the Morrisania section of the Bronx last night, the police reported. One victime, Stanley Mills, 1984 Washington Avenue, was in satisfactory condition at Morrisania Hospital after surgery for bullet wounds in his stomach.

title: Feeding the People, Not Food Producers
description: WASHINGTONSecretary of Agriculture Earl Butz has said that if the organic farming advocates had their way, fifty million Americans would starve. Henry J. Heinz 2d, chairman of H. J. Heinz Company, recently wrote: We are a nation of nutritional illiterates. Food faddism advocates are persuading thousands to adopt foolish and costly eating habits.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Inspired by its great success in introducing Pacific salmon, notably the coho, into Lakes Michigan, Superior and Huron, the Michigan Department of Natural Re sources has planted 20,000 Atlantic salmon smolt in the Boyne and Au Sable Rivers.

title: Giants to Test Thompson on Saturday
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, N. J., Aug. 30After completing an intricate set of roster maneuvers that brought them within the 49man limit. the Giants declared today that Rocky Thompson would get an allout test as a running back Saturday against the Philadelphia Eagles at Princeton.

title: Germans and Americans Join in Celebrating Linking of a Hamlet With Berlin
description: BERLIN, Aug. 30In a joyful mood of accomplishment, Germans and Americans today Celebrated the opening of a new highway formally linking Berlin's tiny exclave of Steinstilcken for the first time with the city's American sector.

title: Korean Sides Sign First Agreement
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 30Red Cross delegates from North and South Korea agreed today to make every effort to dissolve the agonies of the families dispersed in the North and the South and thus lay a stepping,b stone for unification of the fatherland.

title: 3 Mississippi Men Freed After Terms in 3 Killings
description: JACKSON, Miss, Aug. 30 (UPI)Three men from Meridian, Miss., who were convicted in the 1964 slaying of three civil rights workers, two of them from New York, have been freed from Federal prison after serving about 25 months of threeyear sentences.

title: Abortion Clinic in Nassau, Shut Since March, Reopens
description: The controversial abortion clinic at the Nassau County Medical Center opened its doors yesterday for the first time since last March. Two young women were examined and scheduled for abortions this morning at the East Meadows, L. I., clinic.

title: Soviet Reports Advance in Leukemia Research
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 (AP) A Government cancer expert said today that a seeming Soviet advance in leukemia research had raised new hope for developing ways to prevent, or improve treatment of, leukemia and certain other malignancies.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: July Traffic Toll 329
description: ALBANY, Aug. 30 (UPI)A traffic death toll of 329 during July was the highest monthly total recorded in New York State in nearly 35 years, Motor Vehicle Commissioner Vincent L. Toffany reported today. The tally was 35 more than the 294 deaths reported in the same month last year and only nine less than the 338 in October 1937.

title: Harvard Professor Sought In Wooded Vermont Area
description: STRAFFORD, Vt., Aug. 30 systematic search of a 1,000acre wooded area here has failed to find a trace of a retired Harvard professor of surgery who disappeared Monday evening, the state police reported tonight.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: DO YOU KNOW ANY IMPORTANT MAN IN BUSINESS WHO DOES NOT READ FORBES MAGAZINE?ADVT

title: Business Briefs
description: The New York State Banking Board is expected to announce today its reversal of three previous denials of acquisitions of small banks upstate by major New York Citybased bank holding companies, informed bankers said yesterday.

title: Business Briefs
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 30 (UPI)David Rockefeller, introduced as the number one representative of the American business world, told a Soviet national television audience today prospects were never brighter for trade between the two nations.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: A registered secondary. offering of 1,150.000 common shares of the Whirlpool Corporation at 331/8 a share was announced yesterday by Goldman Sachs & Co. The company's stock was up 7/8 at 331/8 on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Swarms of Onlookers Gape at Bees on 5th Ave. Light
description: A swarm of 7,000 to 10,000 honey bees alighted on a traffic light on the northeast corner of 17th Street and Fifth Avenue yesterday morning, and swarms of usually blas citizens watched spellbound for four and onehalf hours.

title: GEORGE S. HANSOM
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., Aug. 30George S. Hansom, former general counsel for the National Association of Insurance Agents, died today in Veterans Hospital, Northport. He was 52 years old and lived at 44 Beacon Hill Road.

title: Jet Forced to Land
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Aug. 30 (AP)A United Air Lines Boeing 737 with 57 persons aboard made an emergency landing on one engine here to; day after unexplained trouble; ripped a large hole in one of its two jet engines. No injuries were reported.

title: Straw in the Wind
description: Winter's winds have convinced me of the need to wear a hat. Summer is something else again. But hats are habitforming; soon, being without one is akin to being naked. So early this summer I visited a hat store to survey the scene. Out I walked with a glorious white straw boater. Mistily perceived memories of Sunday strollers in Seurat scenes picnicking on a river bank attracted me to the boater.

title: Jersey Relief Head to Retire
description: TRENTON, Aug. 30 (AP) The Department of Institutions and Agencies announced today that Irving J. Engelman would retire next Jan. 31 after 12 years as director of OIL, State Division of Public Welfare.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Winthrop Rockefeller Asks $105,115 U.S. Tax Refund
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Aug. 30 (AP)A suit was filed in United States District Court here yesterday by former Gov. Winthrop Rockefeller of Arkansas for a $105,115 refund in Federal excise taxes paid by Petit Jean Air Service.

title: Chief Justice George Boney Of Alaska Supreme Court
description: ANCHORAGE, Alaska, Aug. 30Chief Justice George F. Boney of the State Supreme Court drowned in a sailing accident today at Cheri Lake, 50 miles north of here. He was 42 years old.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: MILWAUKEE, Aug. 30 (AP) Sargent Shriver picked up the endorsement of Mayor Henry W. Maier tonight and told a cheering crowd that ordinary income earned in ordinary ways by ordinary people is already taxed enough.

title: Market Place: Chase Officer On Portfolios
description: When Democratic Presidential candidate George McGovern agreed to address the Tuesday luncheon session of the New York Society of Security Analysts, he bumped F. Martin Koenig, second vice president of the Chase Manhattan Bank who heads the bank's external research evaluation.

title: Fed Rebuffs Bids to Raise Discount Rate
description: Several regional Federal Reserve banks have applied to the Federal Reserve Board in Wash ington to increase their discount rates, wellplaced bankers said yesterday, but so far they have been rebuffed by the board.

title: RAIDED THEATERS BACK IN BUSINESS
description: The operators of the three Times Square theaters raided on Tuesday for allegedly promoting obscenity defied the police yesterday and were back in action with live and filmed sex shows, just as if nothing had happened.

title: Reversal Is Reversed: Seagren's Pole Banned
description: MUNICH. West Germany, Aug. 30 (AP)The International Amateur Athletic Federation, in another turnabout, banned the Catapole from Olympic pole vault coinpetilion today following an official protest by East Germany.

title: McGrawEdison Expansion
description: ELGIN, Ill., Aug. 30 (AP)The McGrawEdison Company announced today plans for the construction of a 150,000squarefoot facility in Greenwood, S.C. The plant will manufacture capacitors and metalhoused devices for the nation's major electric utilities. The plant will cost an estimated S3million and will be designed for further expansion.

title: JULY INVENTORIES OF FACTORIES UP
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 Manufacturers inventories continued to climb strongly in July, thus adding to the upward rd push in the economy.

title: WILLIAM S. HILL, 86, EXCONGRESSMAN
description: FORT COLLINS, Colo., Aug. 30 (UPI)  William S. Hill, who represented Colorado for nine terms in the House of Representatives from 1940 to 1958, died Monday In a nursing home here. He was 86 years old.

title: Street Fete: Irish and Black Groups in Spotlight
description: Let's fervently hope that next year the Lincoln Center Community/Street Festival requires diligent rehearsing by every unit in the use of stage microphonesnot herculean featfor simple, outdoor projection.

title: STOCK PRICES DIP IN AMEX TRADING
A Sniper in Belfast Kills British Soldier In Catholic District
President Signs Bill For Loans to Spur Rural Development
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Aug. 30. (UPI)  President Nixon signed today the Rural Development Act of 1972 but said he regretted that Congress had not passed his special revenuesharing program instead.

title: Copley Newspapers Expand
description: SAN DIEGO, Aug. 30 (UPI)An unprecedented $40million, fiveyear capital expenditure program for Copley Newspapers was announced today by James S. Copley, chairman of the corporation publishing Copley Newspapers. This investment in Copley Newspapers future is considerably larger than the total of all capital expenditures by our entire group for the past 10 years, Mr. Copley said.

title: Kansas'
description: OLATHE, Kan., Aug. 30 (AP) Kansas' system of financing elementary and high school education is unconstitutional, Judge Phillip L. Woodworth of the Johnson County District ruled today.

title: BLACK ELKS'
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 28  As about 5,000 delegates to the 73d convention of the allblack Improved Benevolent and Protective Order of Elks of the World moved quietly this week through their closed meetings here, charges of misconduct were being directed against their leader.

title: U.S. Five Beats Brazil, 6154, On Rally
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 30 (AP)The United States, surviving one of its toughest tests in 36 years of Olympic basketball, turned on the power in the closing minutes tonight to subdue Brazil, 6154, and remtan undefeated in four games here.

title: SERVICE RESTORED, SAYS PENN CENTRAL
description: The Penn Central Transportation Company reported yesterday that all service was normal during the evening rush hour.

title: chess Display Captures Ancient Art
description: The Staunton type of chess set, which Bobby Fischer and Boris Spassky are. pondering over as the world championship match in Iceland nears its conclusion, is just one of the myrriads of sets created through the centuries. In fact, there seems to be almost as many variations in the kinds of chess pieces as there are variations in the game itself.

title: Sympathy for Reggie
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 30 (AP)Reggie Jones, a lightmiddleweight boxer from Newark, received scores of telegrams and telephone calls expressing sympathy and consternation about his disputed defeat yesterday by Valery Tregubov of the Soviet. Union. Many messages were from Germans who heel watched the bout on television and wanted to expresa their disgust at the decision.

title: The 8Cent Stamp Stays
description: The longsuffering consumer has become conditioned to paying more and getting less. That entitles Postmaster General E. T. Klassen to some sort of distinguished service medal for his announcement that the Postal Service's sixmonthold costcontrol program has eliminated the need for a onecent increase in firstclass mail that had been scheduled to go into effect next year.

title: Merger News
description: Utilities and Industries Corporation disclosed here last night that it would seek control of Fifth Avenue Coach Lines, Inc., an investment company no longer in the bus business.

title: India Again Presses Pakistan's Officials To Recognize Dacca
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 20 (AP)India has told Pakistan again that the 91,000 Pakistanis shel is holding as prisoners of war will be returned only with the direct participation and consent of Bangladesh, Swaran Singh, External Affairs Minister, said today.

title: Times Sq. Billboard Depicts Parks Events
description: A huge mural publicizing events in New York City parks was dedicated yesterday in Times Square. The mural, designed by the artist Romare Bearden. covers three sides of a 60foot tower and a 102foot by 40foot billboard on the west side of Seventh Avenue near 42d Street.

title: Swede Scores by.002 Second
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 30In possibly the closest goldmedal finish in Olympic swimming history, Gunnar Larsson of Sweden beat Tim McKee of the United States by twothousands of a second tonight in the 400meter individual medley.

title: EXCHANGE EXPELS FUNDOWNED FIRM
description: The New York Stock Exchange, again yesterday, stuck to its rule that its member firms may own mutual funds but that mutual funds may not own member firms.

title: 41 Private DayCare Units Here Face Fund Cutoff for Violations
description: Fortyone interim daycare centers in poverty areas of the city have been warned that they face a temporary cutoff of financing if they do not correct health and fire code violations on their premises, the city's Agency for Child Development announced yesterday.

title: 7th Straight Draw Puts Fischer A Point Away From World Title
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Aug. 30As the experts had predicted, Bobby Fischer of the United States and Boris Spassky of the Soviet Union drew the 20th game of the world championship chess match today. it was a playoff of yesterday's adjournment, and the seventh draw in a row. The score is now 111/2 to 81/2 in Fischer's favor, and his magic number is one.

title: For Arab Villagers in Israel, an Intense Sense of Loss
description: BEREM, Israel, Aug. 26The, distance between this hilltop and GushHalav is a mile or two, down through the valley and up the next hill. But for the people who used to live here, the gap is measured in time, not space, and in the intensity of their sense of loss.

title: 2 Grateful Dead Concerts Canceled on Security Issue
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 30 (AP)A scheduledtwoday performance here by The Grateful Dead, the rock music group, has been canceled because of a shortage of security personnel, a spokesman for the Saratoga Performing Arts Center reported today.

title: Lennons Elan Infuses One to One Garden Concert
description: Visions of the nowclassic Concert for Bangladesh danced in the heads of the lessthancapacity audiences at the One to One concerts in Madison Square Garden yesterday afternoon and evening. But the realities of the two sluggish, sometimesgood, sometimesbad programs soon drove away any expectations of a truly memorable event.

title: CHARLES L. SCHULTZ
description: Charles L. Schultz, a retired advertising executive and artist, died Tuesday in Columbus Hospital. He was 68 years old and a longtime resident of Manhattan.

title: $100,000 ON PLANE FOR EXTORTIONIST
description: MILWAUKEE, Aug. 30 (UPI)  An extortionist demanded $100,000 and threatened to blow up the terminal at Gen. Billy Mitchell Field today if the money was not paid. Either pay up or blow up, the extortionist said in a note attached to a device found at the terminal.

title: DEMOCRAT APPEALS ON. PARLEY SEATING
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30The Supreme Court was urged today to decide later this year the dispute between two Democratic factions over which delegates should have represented California at the party's national convention in July.

title: Japan Launches Rocket
description: TOKYO, Aug. 30 (UPI)A weather observation rocket was successfully launched today by the National Space Development Agency after another rocket sent up earlier in the day ended in failure. The Japanese agency said that the launchings had been made from the Tanegashima space center in Kagoshima Prefecture on the southeastern tip of Kyushu Island.

title: A Bit of Hostel Splendor Is Fading in New London
description: NEW LONDON, Aug. 30Tomorrow will be the last day of its life, and then the Crocker House will be ready for the wreckers or for the credulous who imagine that an old hotel in the heart of an old town can live again.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:
